reviews.review: Great vibe, great coffee. The Eastside bomb is great. We love this place.

reviews.name: Cassie R.
reviews.review: I have been to the one at 5 Points (they have a delicious tomato cream cheese there) AND the one in Hillsboro Village a few times. Coffee is great, service is great, and I always enjoy myself :)

reviews.name: leslie a.
reviews.review: The range of reviews for Bonga Java is interesting, and I think it's either your kind of place, or it's not. For me, it is. But then again, I guess I'm one of those tattooed hipsters myself, so I blend in. Or maybe it's because I don't really expect too much friendliness at the coffee counter, after all, some of us are there trying to wake up in the first place.  But I don't think I've ever encountered anyone working there who was in a grumpier mood than me, and that's a good thing.And the coffee is good. And it's organic and fair trade, too -- a real rarity. Makes you feel good about drinking it.The space is a big old garage that they converted into part coffee roastery, and part coffee hangout. The tables and chairs are mostly funky and mismatched, and sometimes I think I might find my initials carved into some old table that maybe came from my old school (which of course, it wouldn't have since I just moved to Nashville, but hey, it's like old school furniture).I can't really attest to their fancy drinks, since I'm sort of a purist. I learned long ago that it's waaaaay cheaper to just order a regular cup of coffee and put your own danged milk in it, and I don't like sweet drinks, so you won't catch me drinking some kind of frothy mocha thingie with whipped cream on it and an extra shot.What I want is quality fresh strong coffee, and that's what they have. They also have some simple sandwich-and-muffin-type food, and I always order the Fishy Bomb, which is your basic bagel and lox, which is the perfect food to eat with a cup of hot strong coffee.  It's not that cheap, but it's plenty good.There is free wireless and always lots of people making use of it. And the art on the walls changes often. And I find the people who work there are just fine. In fact, they're friendly and efficient, though yeah, it's a hipster kind of place, that's the nature of the neighborhood. It would be awesome to have more outdoor space than a couple of benches out front where the cars park. Maybe they could give up their private parking and build a nice patio out front for the good-weather days? Hmmm?

reviews.name: Lalie K.
reviews.review: all I care about are 2 things....They have Vegi sausage and house made jalapeno cream cheese.put those two little items on a bagel and your whole day will head in a better direction.

reviews.name: Sarah G.
reviews.review: Stopped in for an iced tea. Good herbal tea, nice industrial organic atmosphere. They were working away roasting coffee (which smelled super strong) right before our eyes. Also they carry an assortment of baked goods and sandwiches from what I can tell. I love the eclectic mix of furniture.

reviews.name: Amie S.
reviews.review: Fair trade organic coffee AND Las Paletas popsicles? Yes, please! You occasionally have to be on the lookout for sullen hipster baristas, but it's easy enough to ignore the attitude when you're sipping on your delicious and socially conscious beverage of choice. There are plenty of juice and tea options here for the non-coffee-drinker, and plenty of baked goods to choose from if you're in a snacky mood. They serve smoothies, too, in case you're craving a thick, fruity liquid breakfast instead of a jolt of caffeine. The atmosphere has that large, edgy, garage-turned-coffee shop vibe, with concrete floors and high ceilings with exposed ducting. There's plenty of seating inside and out, but don't be surprised if it's still hard to find somewhere to sit - this place can be pretty packed!

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: This is the location where bongo roasts their coffee beans for their 3 or 4 Nashville affiliates, so it smells strong and warm. It also has a bit of a factory / warehouse feel to it. Free wifi, a small place to sit outside, decent location, good staff, and yeah--great coffee.  They also have a great menu throughout the day, and it's apparently made from food sourced locally.  That's a win.  They sell their coffee in whole bean form, they've got some kids toys out, they sell their own merch, and there are some limited, pre-packaged food/drink offerings.  They always feature new art from a local artist.  My favorite coffee shop in Nashville...and the universe...so far.

reviews.name: Theron C.
reviews.review: I've been going to Bongo off an on for years and I'm just not sure what people are talking about concerning rude service (and I'm definitely not a tattooed hipster). Maybe I just don't expect the server to be my personal friend? Anyway, the place is fine, and it's a good place to meet the locals, but avoid it on Saturday and Sunday morning - it's not worth standing in line for. I usually head to one of the two coffee houses near Eastland and Chapel when there's a long line.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Although this Bongo Java is different from its sister store by Belmont, its still a great place to get coffee and a quick breakfast.  It's located in the 5 points area in East Nashville and is significantly smaller than the other location.  They actually serve different kinds of coffee and tea drinks than at the other location which I think is pretty cool.  If you have a particular favorite though, they'll make it for you if you ask.  The coffee and food are of the same quality as the other location, the main difference being the atmosphere.  The vibe here isn't as upbeat and lively and can border on the edge of pretension. I'm not sure if this is due to the darker color decorating scheme or the hipper location but its definitely noticeable.  Also its lacking the wonderful front porch that I love so at the other Bongo Java.  An added bonus is that this location is where they actually do all their coffee bean roasting.  If you come in at the right time of day, you can see and smell them in action.  I like that it's all open and if you're curious you could even strike up a conversation about it with your barista. They are also the only place that I know of in Nashville where you can find the un-roasted, or green, coffee beans.

reviews.name: Kimberly N.
reviews.review: Not the best tasting coffee in town, but I love this location near 5 points.  Its a great place to relax alone, chat with friends, or gather with a team for a meeting.  Good selection of food and snacks, too.

reviews.name: Melissa A.
reviews.review: Iced tea was delicious on a super hot July day, however the customer service SUCKED. The cashier barely looked at me when I placed my order and was more concerned about catching up with her friend than being at all pleasant to me. Not sure if I wasn't tattooed enough or obviously a coffee-house-bum, but I was very disappointed at the interaction by both cashier and barista. I'll probably be going anywhere else next time I need my caffeine fix... like Fiddle Cakes. They're nothing but sweet over there. :)

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: Great coffee, good breakfast sandwiches, friendly service.  This is a nice place to go if you want to work outside the office and the 5 Points location is great.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I never realized there was another Bongo location until we had our foray at five points last weekend and did a double take. I knew I wasn't on Belmont...or was I?The place is a little different than the Belmont location with it's smaller size, but it has one heck of an industrial look with all of the roasting materials behind the baristas work station. Personally I thought the staff here were a lot more customer involved, and not so aloof and 'I'm sooooo trendy, I'm a bariiista'. This alone makes me want to come to this shop more than the other one.They also serve Fido water bottles, which kind of threw me for a loop because I didn't even realize they had bottled water. I still can't understand how the Fido people arn't sued by the Disney company. That dog is Pluto, he's just blue!

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: I'm not a coffee aficionado, but I thought the coffee here was great. I have tried a regular latte and several of their speciality coffees and they were all really good. The baristas are very friendly and they have free wifi. I haven't tried the food, but it is a very pleasant place to spend an afternoon. The location is very convenient as it is so close to 5 Points across the road from Beyond the Edge. I will be returning regularly.

reviews.name: Sarah M.
reviews.review: I will admit I am not a huge coffee drinker, but I met friends here and I was very pleased.  I didn't mind the lack of outside seating...we sat very comfortable inside.  It has a really neat ambiance and was clean.  I got one of their Milky Way espresso drinks and it was delicious!  Perfect blend of coffee and sweet.  I didn't eat the food, but my friends each had a different bagel sandwich and said they were both very good (egg bomb and peanut butter/banana).  The staff behind the counter was friendly and patient about answering questions.  I would suggest they improve their sign on the outside of the building - it looks a bit rundown and could easily be passed by without even knowing they are  coffee shop!  I would definintely go back.

reviews.name: Sharon K.
reviews.review: This shop is a little pretentious and a little indie, but Bongo Java does serve good coffee. Just don't expect them to laugh at your cute jokes, or make any kind of friendly chit chat with you, they have important work to do.  But when they are roasting a batch of coffee you can smell their delicious aroma of coffee all over the neighborhood you can't help but get happy, ah, the smell of progress and industry, it is intoxicating.The Bongo Java on the East Side is the one I always visit.  It is right near the five points intersection, so I find myself always meeting people for afternoon coffee there.  The selection of brewed coffee is really good on a day to day basis.  They usually have five or so brews to choose from.  They have some desert and bread offerings, but really the only thing worth ordering here is the coffee. The room is spacious with lots of natural light, and small tables.  The other day I was there meeting with someone, and they had the music on really really loud.  Now I'm a rock and roller, but Bongo Java is no disco, so we had to ask them to turn it down, we couldn't even hear ourselves talk.  But they obliged, and then everything was cozy.  So don't be afraid to talk to these Bongo Java employees, they will help you out if you ask, but they may roll their eyes at you as well.

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: I usually run into Bongo Java in 5Points to get their Peruvian Coffee Beans to grind and brew at home. I have never experienced the food here but I do recommend that you at least try the beans.

reviews.name: Declan G.
reviews.review: BJRC isn't as cozy as the Belmont location, but it has the same good coffee and menu.  Unfortunately, the limited outdoor seating at BJRC doesn't come anywhere close to matching the expansive deck at the Belmont Bongo Java.  The only outdoor options here are a few rustic wooden chairs and benches, which are fine for smoking a cigarette or hanging out with a friend, but aren't conducive to studying or eating a meal.  Also, if the parking lot is full, you'll have someone's SUV or mini van right in your face.  The inside of BJRC is very open and clean, with rotating art exhibits by local artists and lots of big tables.  Best of all, you can look at the giant coffee roaster and burlap sacks of coffee, and pretend that you're in a college student's version of "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory."  (Next stop: the brewery...)  BJRC is much quieter during the week than the Belmont location, which I appreciate.  Too bad it closes at 7pm.  The service was quick and pleasant.  I got a day-old organic chocolate chip muffin for $1, which seemed like a good idea until I bit into it - you could definitely taste the difference.  Oh well.

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: Downgrade:  From 4 to 2 stars.  A few weeks ago I stopped going to Bongo Java because the service had become so atrocious (you know who you are Mr. Thursday morning I'm in a band and I always wear black so I won't even adress you when you're ordering guy).  It takes forever to order, no one is nice, no one smiles, and the coffee began tasting burned and bitter.  It's too bad too, because I used to really enjoy spending time there working and drinking coffee. Here are my previous thoughts:  Bongo Java is cooler than you, and if you don't know that, the staff will gladly fill you in.  But, their coffee is excellent - it's free trade and is roasted in house.  It's better quality than you'll find other places in town, and the prices are reasonable.  They have free internet and plenty of places to work or relax, including some seating out front.  These are the reasons why I keep going back, day after day.  But, I really don't like their service, which prides itself on being slow - even when the line is growing out the door - and more than a little cold.

reviews.name: Janin O.
reviews.review: I don't care what anyone here says the coffee at Bongo is not worth the treatment they dish out. There is nothing hip or cool about the people behind the counter they are just rude. I assume that the only way the place stays in business is because there isn't another reasonbly priced espresso joint in East Nashville. Everyone here who has given them a good review except for their staff....just reflect on how great the place would be if they had NICE people making your latte! Whoever runs and/or owns this place should really get involved because I have been thrice burned by attitudes there...but never again.

reviews.name: Emily Kate B.
reviews.review: Great tour stop for the travelling musician. Great local coffee spot, fast WiFi and an above average number of attractive people. I didn't eat them, but I was told by a trustworthy source that  the "bagels are tasty". Enjoy!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: While I enjoy Bongo Java as a whole and am consistently impressed by their ability to get their tasty, human and environmentally friendly beans into many local businesses, I'm just not too jazzed about this location in particular.  The decor isn't very special or cozy and the "outdoor seating" is practically non-existent.  Otherwise, the content is the same as the Bongo Java by Belmont.  Good beans, standard pricing, and a a generally friendly staff make this place a good one to go for a cup if you're in the 5 Points area.  Personally, I prefer Portland Brew's Eastland location which is just a couple streets away.

reviews.name: Donny W.
reviews.review: IMHO, the only place to get coffee in East Nashville.  Quite enough to talk with friends, not so quite you hear what everybody else is talking about.  My non-coffee drinking friends will still join me because the tea & juice selection is good.  Why would you get coffee anywhere else, the the coffee of Bongo Java East is fantastic and organic and real "fair trade."

reviews.name: Erin M.
reviews.review: If you like good coffee, don't bother with this place. Burnt coffee smell, combined with burnt coffee taste is probably not even the worst of it. I was in East Nashville for the month of November 2008, staying not to far from this joint... My usual drink that I order anywhere, is a strong americano. In a new place, I'll usually say "extra room" (for cream) so I know I'll get a strong cup. Well it irritated me when I would say this to the cashier, and it was not repeated to the barista, but when I got into the habit of saying (loudly) "extra, EXTRA room please", and every time getting an overflowing cup. The very last chance I gave them for my business was when I went in there about 20 minutes before they were closing (there was about 10 people sitting drinking coffee etc...), staff was mopping the floor in front of the cash machine, I was about to utter the words "Americano, EXTRA EXTRA ROOM" and when I caught a glimpse of the terrified look on the cashier's face, I realized that they had already cleaned all their espresso machines for the night, and this would be a real pain in the V for him. SO, I said "oh, you've cleaned all the machines?" without him having to say it, and I said "can I just get a regular coffee then?" He said "yeah, that'd be a lot easier". I paid, got a cup, and helped myself to some lukewarm, burnt coffee. After this fifth time of giving extreme mediocrity a chance, and paying for terrible coffee and nonchalant service, I discovered a delicious coffee place about a 5 minute drive away, Crema. If you like good coffee, look em up and go there. I don't want this bad review to become an advertisement for another place, but they REALLY have their shiz together there! And a better vibe. Or check out Portland Brew. Or Starbucks - at least the staff has a better attitude!

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: Bongo Java moved it's roasting company to the East side a couple of years ago and sometimes I just drive by in the mornings to smell the coffee roasting.  It's kind of like burnt toast but in a good way.  Of course, invariably, I think to myself maybe I should get a little coffee.  After I wait in the long line (there is almost always a line) I think to myself for all this effort, I should probably get a real drink, so I go with my standby the warm and fuzzy. This involves vanilla, honey, coffee, and whipped cream.  Ok, well I know this sounds weird but it really is delightful.   If you are a cash kind of a person and you just need a coffee, my suggestion is to walk up to the front of the line, put your $2 down in front of the cashier, pick up a cup and go get your coffee from the self serve station.   In order to pull off this feat, you must look like you do this every day.  Fake it till you make it if you want your coffee quick otherwise "no soup for you!!"

reviews.name: Rebecca J.
reviews.review: i'm a huge fan of fido's but i will have to tell you, after moving down the street from bongo java east, i'm going to switch my fan fav on over to the parent company. coffee gets and A+! however, the only downfall of the place is that it closes early. bummer... i guess that's what fido's is for.

reviews.name: Sean B.
reviews.review: Not much more you can ask for in a coffee shop - great cuppa joe and a spacious cafe. Clientele and staff can get a little hipster and attitude-y at times, but if so, grab your joe and go...

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: This is a great place to meet all sorts of people and also dogs from East Nashville.  Unique coffees and satisfying bagel sandwiches -- for hangovers, try the Eastside Bomb.edit: downgraded to 4 stars.  getting tired of the slow service, even when there is not a line out the door.edit #2: after 2 years since my first review here my experiences at Bongo Java --which are now few and far between-- have steadily gone down hill.  They could not be less interested in interacting with me.  When the cash register breaks down, they get annoyed with the people in line, who actually take it in stride.  Janin O. hit the nail on the head and inspired this revision.  Also, only one person making the sandwiches on Sunday morning?  Really?  Still good sandwiches and unique atmosphere, people watching, although the attitude is making this less of a focal point for the neighborhood.  3 stars.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Best place to hang out and have coffee east of the river.  Great coffe, good bagel sandwiches, and excellent hummus if you are just in the mood for a snack.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: I give this place 5 stars because it's SO much better than 99% of Mexican restaurants in Tennessee. The food actually has flavor and tastes fresh. The salsa clearly has real onion, cilantro and tomatoes; none of that canned stuff most places serve. Good start to things.The top shelf margarita was fabulous. I frequently can't drink margaritas at restaurants because they overload them with sour mix. This margarita tasted like it had good quality tequila, and wasn't overly sweet or sour. I loved the chicken tortilla soup. The broth was delicious and wasn't greasy. The chicken was moist, and there were vegetables to balance out the taste. They had chunks of avocado, which I love. The portion was generous, I actually didn't finish it. My husband had the tamales, and really enjoyed them. I was too focused on my food to try it. If you live in the Bellevue area or west, this is a great option. The prices were great as well.

reviews.name: Kristina W.
reviews.review: Bellevue has quite a few Mexican restaurants. Rank this one on the bottom. You're welcome.After seeing good reviews, I decided to try it for take out. Thinking back now the good reviews were for margaritas, so maybe that's why I won't be back. I called and the person on the phone didn't understand me at all. I was told 10-15 minutes. I gave it 15 and headed in. Yah, I called from Publix across the street as it was a last minute dinner decision. There was plenty of parking which is great. Naturally the register is by the door so that's where I told the employee I was picking up a to go order. There's nothing to separate that area from the restaurant, so I stood there. And stood there. Might just be me but I felt like everyone was watching me. And I stood some more. Another 15 minutes to be exact. So 10-15 minutes means 30. Good to know for the next time I won't be back. The bill was high. I'm not a Mexican take out in Bellevue newbie and the bill was twice the price of Cancun. Say what? I paid and headed home. We didn't find the food impressive at all. It wasn't inedible it just didn't have any flavor. We had tacos, enchiladas, and rice. Oh, that rice. That rice. That rice was like someone found it on Pinterest. It was literally rice, tomato sauce, and frozen veggies. Y'all, Spanish rice isn't the place for a bag of peas/carrots/corn/green beans. Yuck.

reviews.name: Jessica B.
reviews.review: Good standard mexican fare. Huge portions. Very good salsa. Chili relleno was very good. Service was quick. I think they give more guac, tomatoes and cheese, than any other restaurant

reviews.name: DeAnna D.
reviews.review: We eat here once a week. The fajitas are to die for, the tortilla soup is HUGE and delicious and the salsa is always on point! Staff is super friendly and they offer a rewards card food for a free meal after so many purchases.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: The fact this place doesn't have a line out the door while there's a line at all the drive thrus says a lot about the area. Although it's probably best for Luis, the manager (I know only because he introduced himself), that they aren't because his waiter couldn't come in and this guy is running the place by himself, flawlessly. The food is awesome, that's been said. There's obviously a lot of pride in this restaurant. Fill it up and give these people your money.

reviews.name: Ellen F.
reviews.review: Yes! I love Mexican,  and El Agavero always hits the spot. They have great fried jalapenos (they are fried on the flattop, not like poppers) so I'd recommend getting some and putting them in your cheese dip. The chimichangas are great, and I love the bean dip. They also have fantastic carnitas. All in all, this is the best Mexican in Bellevue, U.S. Border, Las Palmas, and Cancun aren't even close. Make sure you get a punch card, where you get a punch for every $5 you spend and eventually you get a free dinner!

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: Easily our favorite place in the area for Mexican food.  Everyone who works at El Agavero is very friendly and eager to make our dining experience a pleasant one.  The food is always hot, fresh and delicious.  The chips and salsa here are easily my favorite in all of Nashville - the chips are always warm and I love the visible leaves of cilantro, chunks of tomato and onion.  The staff is also more than willing to accommodate our dietary requests, always using cooking spray instead of lots of oil to cook our fajitas to help us save a few calories (why waste calories on oily fajitas when you could eat more chips and salsa?) :)  A couple of our favorites:-Fajitas (obviously).  We've never had a bad fajita, no matter which kind we order.  I am partial to the shrimp and chicken.-Enchiladas verdes.  I crave the tomatillo sauce atop these generously-portioned chicken enchiladas.  Like, wake-up-in-the-middle-of-the-night-craving this sauce.  I love it's tang and velvety texture.  The chicken is always tender and the toppings are perfectly portioned - not too much or too little.There's a reason why we're sometimes here 2-3 times a WEEK when we need a good meal.  Great food, more than reasonable prices, and friendly waitstaff.  What more could you ask for?

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Boy, this place gets crowded on a Saturday evening.Lots of families with lots of kids.I ordered the mixed fajita plate and friend ordered some meat and cheese without chips.. she crushed up a few and sprinkled on top.  Trouble was, her plate was lukewarm.  Mine was very hot.  She asked for hers to be heated more.  I had to blow on mine.  Some of the meat on my plate seemed old- dried out.  The heated her plate and brought it back. It was still lukewarm.  Mine was good, except for the pieces of meat that were more like shoe leather.. dried out.. We at what was on our plate, but we weren't thrilled with the quality.Portions are large.Have to request the green salsa.They do keep water glasses filled.Staff is friendly.Prices are about par with the rest of the city.Like I said in my first review.. I wouldn't make a special trip here, but ate here only because we were doing something in that neighborhood.

reviews.name: Mary E.
reviews.review: Based on the reviews, if I didn't know better I'd say I went to a totally different restaurant. Everyone raving about the delicious and fresh food and great service had a very different experience than we did.To summarize: bland.The waiter had literally zero suggestions for what I should eat. He had no dishes to recommend at all. That should have been a sign right there that nothing is good. He was not outwardly rude, but he was far from friendly and didn't really check on us at all after someone else brought us our food. I had one of the many combination platters and had I been blindfolded would not have been able to tell you the difference between any of the food. all of it was a flavorless bland mushy mess. The beans were runny and the rice tasted like it had been sitting around for hours. It was too pricey to be that bad.Overall it was a very disappointing experience. I really wanted to love this place, but it fell so, so far short of the raving reviews it made it that much worse. So far we haven't found a single "great" Mexican place in Nashville, and now it seems we're struggling to find one that's even "good."

reviews.name: Sarah P.
reviews.review: There should be a zero star option, or after tonight's experience, negative stars. My boyfriend and I used to come here at least once a week....that is until tonight. I ordered my usual quesadilla rellena. Half way through my meal, my boyfriend discovers not 1, but THREE dirty fingernails on my tomatoes and rice. THREE. DIRTY. FINGERNAILS!!!!!!!!!!! That is not apart of my special!We presented this to the waiter and the waiter responded with "eh.okay. I'll bring you your check" which proceeds with a long wait.Unless you want fingernail clippings in your food, go somewhere else. Mexican food will now consist of driving out of the vue to go to Sopapillas, where I have yet to discover fingernail clippings.Freaking. disgusting.

reviews.name: Candie D.
reviews.review: Fresh chips, hot tasty salsa and great service! We ordered Fajita Nachos and they were amazing! The guacamole is fresh, mostly avocado and tomatoes-yum!

reviews.name: Lidia J.
reviews.review: Legit! Authentic Mexican foodWe had the Agavero fajita mix. Excellent mix. Tender and seasoned. Rice and beans are yummyGuacamole has chunks of savory jalapenoChicken with green sauce was deliciousQuick excellent serviceAnd the music-true Nortenas.

reviews.name: Kc K.
reviews.review: This is a solid place for Mexican. I'm not looking for a fine dining experience when eating Mexican, I want to be rolled out the door in a good coma. This is the place to go in Bellevue.Reasonable prices, great chips and salsa and strong margaritas. Perfect.

reviews.name: Becky P.
reviews.review: Best cheap Mexican in Nashville, and we've tried them all!! Do yourself a favor and try the carnitas or the rellenos. You won't be disappointed!

reviews.name: Nikki B.
reviews.review: Queso is fantastic. I always get the chori pollo because it never disappoints. They are polite, fast, and in all the times we've been there I'm not sure we've ever had a bad experience.

reviews.name: Justin W.
reviews.review: I live right down the road, so I try to come here a few times a month. Each time I've gone, the service has been excellent, the food has been tasty, and the prices have been good. There are good drink specials (2-for-1 margaritas on Thursdays) as well. I have tried a lot of things on the menu, and I haven't had anything I wouldn't order again.

reviews.name: Susan H.
reviews.review: After reading the reviews I was expecting to be in for a treat... Wrong!  Husband and I went on a Friday night and got seated quickly.  When I opened my menu it had salsa from the last person holding it smashed inside!  Yuck!  We both ordered and the food came out quickly... A little too quickly.  It was mediocre at best and a small portion at that.  I usually only eat half of a meal anyway but if I leave still hungry something is wrong!  Won't be back.

reviews.name: R M.
reviews.review: Best Mexican in Bellevue. Hands down. Pretty standard fare but all of it tastes fresh and has good flavor. The restaurant is impeccably clean (huge for me) and service was prompt and friendly. Decor is nice and bright, not weathered and dim like some other locations. Sangria and margaritas were a hit.

reviews.name: AL B.
reviews.review: Prices high   Nothing special. Don't know what everyone else talking about.  Went for reviews  no linch special. Don't make a special trip

reviews.name: Paul B.
reviews.review: Great food, really nice staff.  I recommend the shrimp in just about anything - theirs is always fresh and juicy.  The burritos (I've tried the carnitas burritos and one or two others) are a bit smaller than I expected, based on other Mexican places, but I can't say enough about the rest.  I really liked the 4-ways chimichangas - beef, steak, shrimp, and chicken.  This is a new favorite - best Mexican in Bellevue!

reviews.name: Richard N.
reviews.review: Best Mexican food in Bellevue by far. Nice hidden gem!

reviews.name: Becky W.
reviews.review: I was impressed. The food was very good and the service was quick. There was a big menu to pick from and it was seasoned well.  We will be return customers.

reviews.name: Scotty T.
reviews.review: This is a small, non-pretentious restaurant in a shopping center. It was immediately my wife's favorite Mexican restaurant. Josue was the only one serving customers and hosting yet we got some of the best service we have ever received. My wife got the Nacho fajitas - very good! I got the vegetarian fajitas and added steak. I don't prefer rice, beans, guacamole, so this hybrid combination worked great for me.

reviews.name: Michael C.
reviews.review: Been to lots of local Mexican restaurants and this little place is the best.  It's in the shopping center near Bed Bath and Beyond, across from Jonathan's Grille.  Try anything, but I especially like the dishes with grilled shrimp!

reviews.name: B. S.
reviews.review: This is the best Mexican food in Bellevue. The service is excellent.  We highly suggest this hidden gem. We love where people appreciate your business.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: Delicious, fresh food! We will be back. Salsa was perfect and the chips hot. Crazy good service. The waiter even checked on my child's drink, which rarely happens. Not busy at all, we were seated right away. I'd hate for it to get crowded, but it was awesome.

reviews.name: Kenneth K.
reviews.review: Excellent fresh food.  Excellent service.  This might just be my new favorite tex mex in Bellevue. Try it.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: Best Mexican in Bellevue by far. It used to be called El Rodeo and was terrible yuck. But now the new ownership has this place hoppin. We are regulars here now and they treat us well every time. The food is better than all of the Mexican restaurants in Bellevue. They have plenty of flat screens with football to watch and wonderful service. Make this your go-to place and taste fresh food rather than Mexican slop at the other places.

reviews.name: James M.
reviews.review: Awesome food and great service!

reviews.name: A. D.
reviews.review: This restaurant is always good.  Nice waitstaff, great decor, the BEST salsa around for the quick service Mexican restaurants (seriously, fresh cilantro- no one else has that- gives it a very distinctive flavor).Food is fresh and much tastier than other places.  Prices are great.And no, I have not been put up to this.  I decided to come home and write this immediately after dining there because I really want to help them get more traffic.  They are tucked away in the strip mall and do not get nearly the business that they should considering the high quality of all their products and service.  I'd keep it to myself, but want them to stay in business- so GO TRY THEM! You'll be glad you did!

reviews.name: doug d.
reviews.review: This location used to be El Rodeo. A place we have sorely missed (not that it was that great, but reliable, -and- had two offerings of mexican style soup).We tried it once after the El Rodeo people mysteriously disappeared and found it lacking, but have tried it again recently and was pleasantly surprised.There is a soup on the menu (why is it so hard to find soup at mexican restuarants?), but we have not tried it yet, but will soon when the weather cools.We did try spinach enchiladas, which were very nicely done, with fresh spinach. A tamale, again nicely done, nothing super spectacular, but very good. Guac dip was pretty good, and seemed to mostly be real avacado's. Pollo Loco was good, but perhaps a bit salty for me.Worse thing was the salsa. Very strange and chock full of salt, might have been a bad day for the salsa.Anyway, if you live in Bellevue, you know the choices are not that great, and El Agavero is worth a try.

reviews.name: Jaree H.
reviews.review: Great little Mexican restaurant! Pico de gallo was fabulous. Highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: Anna G.
reviews.review: It's unfortunate that this restaurant is located next to a cigar lounge where a bunch of stodgy old farts sit around hotboxing carcinogens all day/night. The smoke from that place has penetrated the entire ventilation system of neighboring establishments, like Opa, where it's hard to enjoy a meal as a result. That's really unfortunate because Opa has a lot to offer otherwise. Great food, great service and, outside of its un-neighborly neighbor, great location. The falafel wrap in particular is a personal favorite.

reviews.name: Dez S.
reviews.review: Pretty yummy gyros...soft pita and decent meat with very good sauce...fries are great

reviews.name: Collin K.
reviews.review: Grabbed lunch her on a weekday, and they move through the customers rather quickly. However, I thought my order took a little longer than it should. I got the gyro sandwich and grapes leaves. Both of which were pre-cooked/prepped. So I'm not sure what was holding the order up. I'm no expert on Greek cuisine, but it satisfied my taste buds, and was a nice change up from typical sandwich fare. One big downer was that the tables are covered in cheap, plastic skirts. The table I was sitting was sticky and torn.

reviews.name: Erica D.
reviews.review: Great gyro sandwich. Lots of meat & your choice of toppings.

reviews.name: Chris F.
reviews.review: Really decent meats, generous portions and very reasonable prices. Great service too. I get the mixed plate. Not the best but certainly my favorite in the area.

reviews.name: Ann M.
reviews.review: For what it is, I give it four stars.  It's a fast-food place in a strip mall, but it has many choices in addition to the regular burger-and-fries fare, mostly Greek and middle eastern, providing some welcomed variety.I tried the gyros sandwich, which isn't the same as the carved-off-the-roast gyros meat I was used to growing up in Chicago, but for what I call "prefab" gyros meat, it was tasty and plentiful.  Similar to a Subway, they offered me my choice of toppings.  I added traditional tzatziki (cucumber) sauce, lettuce, feta cheese, and black olives (the regular variety,, not kalamata, but I prefer these anyway) on the soft-but-not-too-chewy pita.  For fast-food-strip-mall gyros, they were quite good.My daughter the pickier eater had a burger with cheddar on a wheat bun, and said it was very good, too.The two guys behind the counter were young and polite, and our food was ready quickly.  There was a sign in the window indicating they had beer, but on the sign inside the store, both beer and milkshakes were marked as "coming soon."  We didn't try to order these, so don't know whether they're actually available now or not.We didn't try the many other selections (falafel, hummus, kabobs, etc.) but from what we did try, if you're a Greek fan and willing to accept that it's not Greek Town caliber, give it a try.

reviews.name: Teresa B.
reviews.review: I dropped in for a week day lunch.  I ordered the gyro plate which was very good and generous portions.  The restaurant is clean and the service is good.  Nothing special but certainly worth the visit if you're craving a gyro.

reviews.name: Chad E.
reviews.review: Made our first visit to Opa's this past weekend, after seeing it numerous times when shopping at the Kroger's in the same plaza. My wife and I came in after the lunch hour, about 2 PM. I ordered the gyros platter and my wife got a plain cheeseburger. The gyros were quite good, seasoned well and with a healthy portion of meat inside the pita. The tzatziki sauce was about average, but gave that fresh zing that one wants when biting into gyros. I've eaten gyros in places with well-established Greek communities (Chicago, New York City, Tampa) so my bar is set pretty high and Opa's more than passes.My wife's cheeseburger seemed to be decent, based on the bite I took, but admittedly due to her accidentally putting barbecue sauce instead of ketchup on it, it was hard to say for sure. It wasn't dry, but it also didn't seem very juicy. What she and I both agree on is that the best part of our meal was the hand-cut French fries - crispy on the outside, melt-in-your mouth soft on the inside, and salted with some coarse sea salt. They were delicious!The only part of our visit we did not enjoy was the very loud country music station being piped in, both in the restaurant and to the outside seating. It actually doesn't matter what kind of music it was, because it made it impossible for us to have a conversation over our lunch. Even worse from a service perspective, it made it really difficult to hear the sole staff member behind the counter. I won't make any assumptions about his ability to speak English, but he was certainly soft-spoken enough that the blaring music made me have to ask him to repeat everything he said.

reviews.name: Cameron S.
reviews.review: Tasty and friendly new restaurant in Belle Meade.  Loved both the chicken and gyro. Best hummus!!!

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Next to Starbucks. This is just another fast food gyro place. Their falafel with dressing and tomato wrapped in pita bread wasn't to bad but I've had much better. Hummus from hell! Tabbouleh salad was a decent portion but not a decent taste. This is no opa! for me and not worthy of Belle Meade where I don't go to much anyway!

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Virginia's is a Music Row institution. You're not anybody on the row until you've been here. It's right on the corner of 18th and Division, and some ppl use their lot to cross between the two. It's usually fairly busy, but not too packed. It's a convenient store/meat-n-three. I've only ever got the cheeseburger from the meat-n-three in the back, and I remember it being pretty good. The menu back there changes regularly and there isn't any seating on the premises. Up front they have homemade sandwiches (the turkey is pretty good) and desserts (I'm a fan of the cookies). As for the convenient store part, you've got all the regular stuff, Coke and Pepsi products, Sweat tea, fountain drinks, chips (baked, regular and sun). They ask that you not pay with credit card for purchases under $10 though, which I totally understand.

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: I popped in here today to grab a plate lunch to go. I was hoping for some good home-cooked veggies, but the options were limited to barbecue type stuff (pork, smoked chicken, burgers). I was very pleased with barbecue, baked beans and potato salad. The lady serving up the goods was awesome. She asked if wanted big girl sauce or little girl sauce, hee. While it wasn't very spicy, the big girl sauce was tasty.

reviews.name: Kristina W.
reviews.review: I hadn't been here since it was something else and that something else didn't last long at all. Three Stones has been here far longer, so they must be doing something right. It's a decent sized restaurant with bar located in Ricer Plantation. There were a few game machines inside and they regularly have trivia and poker. I also asked if they had NFL Sunday Ticket and was told they do. They don't have a lot of TVs and the TVs they have aren't big, but there are enough TVs to watch every NFL game that would be on at one time which is good enough for me. The menu is typical bar food. Chips and salsa, wings, tenders, sandwiches, and burgers. They had casseroles which stood out to me. They also had fry options which is always good in my book. I was asked if I wanted sweet potato fries or curly fries, which is always a no brainer. I ordered the fried egg burger and curly fries which were delivered pretty quickly. The portions are huge!!! The burger is a pretty good size and the plate was overflowing with fries. The burger wasn't anything special and sadly the egg didn't save it. The egg was overlooked so the yolk wasn't runny, which I like on burgers. The service was great. Our server was very attentive and on top of things without being overbearing. My sweet tea was always filled when it was halfway empty. She also let me know they have Pepsi products, which I always want to be made aware of because it's just not the same as Coke. I would be back, mostly because the location is great for me and I love bar food. I also like playing games and watching games in bars. I like that there was a pile of board games to the side. I also like that it's nonsmoking. I like that the owner was just hanging out at the bar. I like that everyone else that was there when we were walked home. I like that the bartender said they closed whenever the last drinker left, whenever that is.just a lot to like about this place.

reviews.name: Catherine R.
reviews.review: If you want fried food and friendliness, there's really no better place."Alright already!" I wanted to say when the bartender raved for the third time about the hand breading on the fried pickles---but then i tried them. I would have told me at least four times.The tater tots are obnoxiously crunchy and delicious. The buffalo chicken tenders are stupid tender. The beer flows and flows, but don't expect taps fancier than Lagunitas IPA. This is not the place for a fine rye Manhattan.We'd have gone back just to hang out more with Brian, the bartender, but I was worried I'd eat another 650 tater tots.

reviews.name: Kenney M.
reviews.review: Great neighborhood hang out! Even though families are welcome, it's STILL a neighborhood bar...language and cocktails fly freely.

reviews.name: Joni H.
reviews.review: Great local pub!  Awesome service, knowledgeable and friendly staff.  Everyone that works here really takes pride in the food and the atmosphere.  They have yummy daily specials and great happy hour prices!  The Pizza Burger was amazing, and the wings can't be beat.  It's my favorite place, and totally worth the drive if you live outside of the Bellevue area.

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: I discovered three stones a few weeks ago when I was living the frustration of a transplanted football team. I had called a couple of bars and no one seemed to have the Eagles game on any of their TVA. Finally I remembered passing three stones pub not fair from my apartment. I called and he said that TVA were first come first serve and they had a couple open at the moment. Score!! Since I only live a few minutes away I knew I had it made. Made my way to three stones. The first Sunday the Titans were also playing the earlier game so there was a nice crowd of regulars rooting for the home team. Bill the bartender, who is a great bartender despite his unfortunate taste in football teams, he's a Giants fan, set me up at a little table directly across from a TV set to my Birds. I have since been back every weekend I'm in town and we play Sunday afternoon. And every time has been a great experience, three stones totally reminds me of the neighborhood bars I grew up in in suburban Philadelphia. Plus they have both Cider on tap and Yuengling. When the birds are struggling I switch to the home state beer hoping that turns it around. You've seen the commercial.. It's only weird if it doesn't work. The food is typical bar food but pretty yummy. The burger was a little dry but their wings are exceptional. Personal preference here; but I get annoyed when people don't have regular fries. They have seasoned curly fries( not a fan), tater tots, and sweet potato fries. Overall everything I've had has been decent.

reviews.name: Barry M.
reviews.review: This is a nice pub for locals. Great burgers, patty melts, philly cheese stesks, etc. Ten beers on draft.  Many characters at the bar.  Ntn trivia every night.  Live trivia on Thursdays.  It is worth a drive to Bellevue. They survived the flood and came back to survive.

reviews.name: Abbey H.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere and people! Happy hour is everyday, food is beyond amazing and fresh, and there is a wide menu selection. Definitely rate this place 5 stars! Great great place that everyone should bring the family to!

reviews.name: Jennifer H.
reviews.review: This is a great place!!! Service was excellent!!! I had a Swiss mushroom burger and the sweet potatoes fries were awesome!!! My companion had the grouper sandwich with tots and it was tasty!!! Appetizer was pickle chips---they were "slap yo momma!" good!!!! 10 beers on tap!! Awesome awesome awesome!!!!

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: So me and my 17 month old son.  Decided to go in.   Place was dead.  But wings were on sale.So I got him some tater tots to GNAW on and throw at the people that were there and also half stab me with my keys he was playing with.Tots were what you expect them to be.  Fried potatoes.  So...draw from that what you will...it's sustenance...but not the best food in the world by any means...though one patron did say "I never get tired of eating here!!"...while I was thinking..why would ANYONE be excited to be eating at a place that tastes like 8 billiion other places in America?  But whatever, some people are stupid so lets not blame them (blame their parents for being stupid and not broadening their minds or their taste buds...it's always the Parents fault)..So I got some wings...5 hot...5 buffalo.  Honestly couldn't tell the difference between either, but at the least they were huge wings...so there's that right?  I ate some of them.  Pretended to like them or so that's what I told the bartender who was serving me.I definitely had more fun chatting with my 17 month old in a near silent pub than I did the food that's for sure.Would I go back?  Maybe.  Because I mean.  They do sell beer there.   So there is always that.

reviews.name: Tracy M.
reviews.review: Great food but really slow service.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: Overall: Little neighborhood bar and grill. Nothing more, nothing less.Food/Drinks: The food is nothing special, typical pub food but it's not bad. Then again, I don't set the bar too high when it comes to places like this. There are drink specials almost every night so that's a plus. Atmosphere/Service: Everyone that works there is nice and attentive, can't beat that! It's in a little strip mall in the middle of the Bellevue neighborhood called "River Plantation." It flooded back in May of 2010 so I'm happy to support businesses on the rebound!

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: I have tried. I really have. I have graced their bar stools a number of times but I have yet to shake the disapointment that inevitably  discends upon me on each visit. The draft is always flat and the bottled beer warn. (sin!) The parade of "food" I have received on each visit is all seasoned with a liberal helping of bland with a side of "if I wasn't drunk I wouldn't eat this" I realize that this review is a tad harsh but it will not effect the loyal neighbourhood regulars. They love this dive and will fill its register with cash and their guts with buckets of bland until the culinary gods see fit to smite it from it's corner of the burbs.

reviews.name: Gregory B.
reviews.review: There is something nice about a restaurant where you feel more like family than a customer and that is what the Three Stones is for me. While I do not get in nearly as often as I like, it is a fun place to sit, have a beer, and maybe even grab a small bite to eat.The menu is a bit limited and you won't find much in the way of health food on the menu. I have had a two stone burger (2 patties) and the fried grouper and both were nice. I personally like it with the potato salad although the sweet potator fries are nice as well.My favorite is just sitting down and trying the varietals they bring in on tap. While the tap selection is not anything like I have seen in Austin, there is enough variety to have a choice in beer consumption. I also like when the owner's husband is there and recommends a bottle he has acquired.

reviews.name: Kenneth M.
reviews.review: Great service every night.  Fun place to go and always something happening.  Could use a bigger beer selection, but I hear they are working on it!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Brought out-of-towners here last weekend because we wanted to try a friendly neighborhood place. Service was fine, but it took about.. 45 minutes or so for our food to arrive. We had a diabetic guy at our table asking for like crackers or something to eat because it was taking so long.Our table had a bunch of items, that I can remember there were pork BBQ potato skins, which were good but just a LOT of food. Black bean burger was pretty good. Service was ok, but with only about a dozen customers in the restaurant, I'm not sure why it took almost an hour to get our food. Might go back since it's really close to my neighborhood, but there wasn't anything remarkable to make me really WANT to go back.

reviews.name: Aubrey D.
reviews.review: My toddler son and I came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. I felt a little hesitant about the deserted parking lot but forged ahead.Besides 2 employees, we were the only ones there. It's a small, dark sports pub which isn't really my thing. It is clean with concrete floors, dark walls, sports memorabilia, and several TV's.I felt like I'd walked into a man cave while the man was recovering from a hangover!I'd researched the menu on their website and was looking forward to some fried green tomatoes! When the waiter / bartender handed me the menu, they weren't listed. He said they didn't have them anymore. Boo!The prices seemed a bit high for a sports pub with burgers and sandwiches in the $8-$10 department.  The prices on their on-line menu are lower than what you encounter when you go!I opted for a cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. The guy told me they were out of sweet potato fries! Double boo! I ordered it with tater tots.The burger was quite tasty! It was well-cooked, quality meat with a good bun. The tater tots were alright, and the toppings were decent. They did serve it with 2 pieces of romaine lettuce with thick rinds in the middle! I had to tear the lettuce off around the rinds to make it burger friendly.Our server checked on us a couple of times (no one else came in while we were there!) He was friendly and my son liked him which is always a good sign.They need to update their on-line menu! Still we may give it another try...

reviews.name: Joel L.
reviews.review: Three Stones was a perfect stopping spot for the whole family. Our kids had chicken tenders and a cheeseburger and the chicken was real with a good breading and healthy portion of fries. My daughter who had the cheeseburger said it was "great" and my other daughter kept stealing bites. I had the pulled pork which was exceptional and my wife had a chicken wrap and loved it. We indulged in cheesecake and it was better, and 1/2 the price, than The Cheesecake Factory. The bakery is excellent. Highly recommend for everyone. Very good menu and specials.

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Such a fun spot!

reviews.name: L. G.
reviews.review: Good food! I had the grilled chicken wrap and my husband had the cheeseburger! Both were very good.  They also have really good sweet potato fries.  The cheesecake was topnotch!!!  I've also had the grouper before and it was really good too.  Friendly staff.  We will be back!

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: Boringly average. Don't bother.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Family friendly grill and Bellevue neighborhood pub describes John's place. Open starting lunchtime with fair prices. Sandwiches, desserts, appetizers and simple entrees are affordable with sides under $2. Free wifi.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: Great place with incredibly delicious baked goods to boot! Very hospitable staff, would definitely make this a regular spot if I lived in the area.

reviews.name: Bethany M.
reviews.review: A diamond in the rough!!! Really cool coffee shop that appeals to everyone from the working professional and study groups to families and casual gatherings. Lots of space inside and really clean everywhere inside with a kids corner, TV, and even had a changing station in the bathroom (not even Starbucks has that!). I had an excellent Mocha and can't wait to return!Details on the Drip Coffee (especially for my coffee-snob lil bro! ):Flat Rock Coffee Tea & More is on Nolensville Rd next to Music City Pawn with 2 diff blends specific to them: - Flatrock and Roll is a tad bit darker.- Flatrock Buzz has more octane & caffeine. - Both are medium blends and they switch off which one they serve daily. - Beans are from Nashville Roast which are a blend, owners Karen and Steve selected personally.- 100% Arabica Coffee Beans- Ground in-store

reviews.name: Andreas H.
reviews.review: I was looking for an alternate to a chain and saw this had decent Yelp reviews, so stopped in on the way to my client's office.The Great: The staff. The lady working today was very nice!The Average: The coffee tasted good, but the foam on my latte was very thin/weak and visually was pretty haphazard. I also had a muffin (wrapped in plastic) that was A-OK.The atmosphere was a little funky, but coming from Seattle I like an odd coffee house as much as the next guy. Overall it was probably a 3.5, but I just couldn't bring myself to bump it up to 4 stars.In the end, A-OK summed up my experience perfectly.

reviews.name: Dan H.
reviews.review: A very nice neighborhood coffee shop. I came here for a few hours for a cup of joe and to do some work. It had a really homey feel to it. The barista was very nice and helpful. She made me feel really welcome.The internet clocked in at about 6 Mbps, adequate for an online meeting I needed to attend. Great spot, will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Wes J.
reviews.review: Friendly and helpful service, good strong coffee, and great pumpkin streusel muffin. Pretty sweet place!

reviews.name: Gary A.
reviews.review: Was passing through Nashville and decided to get my morning coffee here. So glad I did! The coffee is excellent, and they have a breakfast empanada that is to die for (be sure to get the spicy green chili sauce with it). Awesome atmosphere. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Nashville.

reviews.name: Lynn P.
reviews.review: This could easily be my new fav coffee shop in town! Run by a wonderful, friendly couple, it's one of those local businesses you instantly want to support the minute you walk in. I had a good latte macchiato while my friend really enjoyed her hazelnut iced coffee. Probably more flavor options than many cafés. They also host social events like storytelling and soon-to-start monthly bluegrass jams.

reviews.name: Laura B.
reviews.review: Great coffee, great people, great conversation. Always room to work & interesting people visiting. Favorite coffee shop in Nashville.

reviews.name: Madison T.
reviews.review: We live in the crieve hall area and are always looking for a nearby coffee shop. This weekend we found this one and will definitely be frequenting it! It's cozy, quiet, great artwork and has live music! This is a hidden gem. I had a peach empanada that was delicious, as well as a specialty espresso with honey and almond milk that was amazing.

reviews.name: Latanya C.
reviews.review: Great chai! Excellent bacon grill cheese sandwich. Even bought lotion, candle, room spray from a local small buz...reluminate. nice lovely owner!

reviews.name: Cory G.
reviews.review: Coffee, espresso, tea, and BEER. Not just any beer. It's from our friends over at Black Abbey Brewery just a couple miles away. This shop is spacious, with a variety of tables, chairs, and bench seating. As far as coffee goes they have two blends made for them by a roaster in town. A lighter roast, a medium roast, and a bean for espresso. I'm looking forward to them using different ways to brew the coffees and possibly experimenting with single origin beans. They serve sandwiches and they are solid. They serve vegan/gluten free desserts that will make you smack your momma. And I'm a meat eater so that that should say something.  This place is not your typical hipster joint with reclaimed wood and vinyl records playing. It's a nice homey space with simple decor. My favorite thing about the place are the owners and their staff. Friendly as can be with the passion to learn more about coffee and willing to try new things. I think that the coffee will get better as time goes by, but this place is awesome and will continue to be awesome.

reviews.name: Isa F.
reviews.review: Four stars for their classy cubano  5 stars for the peaceful and cozy cafe which is large enough for you to really enjoy your time and space!

reviews.name: Ricki V.
reviews.review: This place has one of the best lattes in Nashville. Friendly service, just very slow at times (that's the only reason I didn't give five stars). Tons of tables inside. I haven't had the food but the pastries they get are incredible. The lemon poppyseed muffin, I could eat every day.

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: I'm a student in professional school and I get flat rock coffee every day. I love to study there on the weekends. Plenty of room to spread out, great food, great coffee, great tea... It's just quiet and friendly. Perfect.

reviews.name: Shaun S.
reviews.review: Five star service.  Four star cappuccino.  Three star scone and biscuit (and very affordable).  Roomy and airy atmosphere (I was the only customer on a Wed morning).  I'll go back.

reviews.name: Joshua L.
reviews.review: Cool spot! Would have given it a five but the treats were limited. I really wanted a muffin but were completely out. Other than that, I had no problems. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was calm.

reviews.name: Jack C.
reviews.review: My coworkers and I buy coffee here everyday. We work a block away. It is always perfect, exactly what we ordered. Yesterday It was my turn to go get the coffee, so I rounded up orders and money. As I headed out I thought its only a block ill just walk and enjoy the fresh air. Well theres a pawnshop between us lol needless to say I got distracted. I had to look at everything and ended up buying an older macbook because they offered a 6 month protection plan lol and a tackle box. So it took a minute. By the time I made it to Flatrock the skies were black. Yikes. So I order the coffee. The young lady taking the orders was very patient and through. While I waited they had music playing. I thought to myself are the lyrics to this song are ? "soundcheck we are doing a sound check ". I was spaced out (not having any coffee yet ) I chuckled. Then look up and realize the amazing voice was coming from the other side of the coffeshop ! They were amazing, but I had to get back to work so I got our drinks and started to head out, and BAM its pouring rain. Without hesitation the owner insisted on driving me back to work !!! OMG what a lifesaver. I would have had to leave work. She saved the day with amazing coffee and a ride to work. They will be seeing alot of all of us. I definitely would recommend the shop. Im looking forward to trying some food and local beers on my day off. Six thumbs up.

reviews.name: Renee S.
reviews.review: Great coffee, friendly service, and the menu looks pretty good too! Def worth stopping at if you're in the area.

reviews.name: Jairo R.
reviews.review: Service is always friendly and upbeat, the owner is super nice and involved with the community. Overall a great place to stop by and get some work done or just meet with friends.

reviews.name: Jackie B.
reviews.review: Flatrock is friendly, comfortable, and yummy. Their Cuban sandwich is simply delicious and the coffee does the trick. Perfect for working with their large tables and accessible outlets.

reviews.name: Meghan B.
reviews.review: Decided to try out a new local coffee spot today. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in. Excellent coffee and even better service. Karen was so friendly and inviting! I definitely will be recommending to all my fellow coffee, tea and even beer drinkers :) great prices to boot!!

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Beer is projected to be coming to this nice cafe in the near future. But for now I just enjoyed a very hot cup of fresh roasted coffee here before their official opening. After I let it cool down it was a smooth drink, without that charbucks bite. Inside it is mellow compared to the busy street outside. The pleasant seating is cafe style.

reviews.name: Jana C.
reviews.review: Went here while visiting a friend in Antioch. Staff was very friendly and the place was clean, comfy, and quiet. Great selection of coffees and teas! We had some bagels for breakfast and they were great! Great place to stop in during our stay.

reviews.name: Linz W.
reviews.review: Just ok.  Open later than stated and service was slow.  Limited food options in the morning and latte was nothing special (watery).  Maybe a bad day?

reviews.name: Steve D.
reviews.review: Not a ma'am food kind of person but stopped here for a bite before a movie and I'm glad we did. The jalapeno chicken and blackened chicken was awesome!

reviews.name: Tsz-Cheong C.
reviews.review: "Free sample, free sample, try free sample!" The battle cry at any food court. Well, I took the bait!The food is Ok. Typical "Americanized" Chinese food. The portion sizes were very generous.I had the bourbon chicken,  but It was a little overly sweet. The mixed vegetables and lo mein were a little on the greasy side.In a nutshell,  you get copious amounts of food for a good price. So if you're real hungry you come to the right place!

reviews.name: Robert U.
reviews.review: Good mall food!  Bourbon chicken is sweet. Blackened is salty and spicy, but I would not call it hot at all. Cajun Chicken is pretty spicy, and leaves a bit of a burn (in a good way, if you like spicy food). I get mine on white rice, which you won't see at the counter. You have to ask for it. They've got a steamer full of it right behind the counter. Overall, it's very good, and a nice change from typical fast food.

reviews.name: Dana T.
reviews.review: Great food!But if they don't stop saying TRY SAMPLE, I might have to stop going there.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Cajun...there was no cajun today, staffed by a nice Chinese lady, we landed at 10.45am and had orange chicken, stir fried cabbage and spicy chicken.  It was awesome, way better than panda express and for $5.99 each I am still stuffed 7 hours later.  Etoufee was on the menu but no where to be seen.

reviews.name: Cara S.
reviews.review: OK OK OK!!!Who doesn't love the free testers they offer ???? I have ALWAYS gone with the bourbon chicken....why not? It's always yummy....BUT FOLKS....TODAY they offer a new tester with a new one called Lemon Chicken....taste buds scream in enjoyment....they say HELLO LEMON CHICKEN, goodbye bourbon chicken!!They call it Lemon Chicken but it has more of a pineapple flavor sauce to it. Its like sweet & sour chicken met the new chief in town. IT IS FREAKIN AWESOME.My sides....rice (which was kind of dry but good) and the Cajun potatoes which were outstanding. They give you PLENTY OF FOOD, FYI!! Plenty...This has to be the largest food court I have every witnessed!!! Beautiful seating area. Super clean!!

reviews.name: Dom O.
reviews.review: One of the best locations Nashville has to offer with great food, service, and atmosphere!  Moving from DC a few years ago, I didn't think I'd find a place to call my usual or be able to find the friendliest people of Nashville. Giving this place a chance to hold a party here 6 months ago, I trusted Chef Kristian to take care of my family and friends with his skill. We were not disappointed! In fact, I haven't left since! So, about the restaurant: despite the most awesome shows and events that share the property,  don't mind the wine shop or the distillery across the parking lot,  and forget about the convenient location from the highway not far off the beaten path....the food is consistently delicious and specials never cease to amaze. I particularly love the happy hours with excellent specials and friendly bartenders. They all keep me coming back. Ignore the naysayers.  Prime time this place is busy for a reason. It's busy and the professionals here do their best to get you seated and served ASAP! Come see for yourself. I wish I could stay and become a local to see what Chef has next up his sleeve. Unfortunately, I must move and only hope to visit again soon. No, I don't work there (wish I did). Thank you Holly, Ashley, Ryan, Blake, and of course Chef Kristian. See ya later!

reviews.name: Hanna L.
reviews.review: Lovely location, terrific food and friendly staff; that's how I would like to start off this review! Me and my company ended up here on accident; we were really looking for a cool place to eat in Nashville, but everything was crowded due to concerts and exhibitions. However, we couldn't have been more lucky! We loved Cafe Fontanella with the friendly staff, nice interior and delicious food! I had the special of the evening, a Pesto Fettucine Alfredo with grilled shrimp, and I can honestly say that it was the best pasta I've had in years. Delighted, full and happy was the overall grade; we were more than happy!

reviews.name: Dave J.
reviews.review: If I had written this a year ago and I would have given 5 stars, but things have changed.the last 4 experiences I have had have been mediocre at best.  from 2 different meals on 2 separate nights that we both so salty that they could not be eaten, to burned food on another night. on all accounts the staff replaced the food, but  every time it resulted in an even longer wait for the second round of food, to the point the the rest of the party was done eating and ready to leave before I was served.Now there has been what seems to be a sizable price jump in the food without any attempt to change the quality.  a salad with chicken will run you 16-18 dollars and it will be a pretty basic salad.The last straw was showing up to eat, be told there was a 20 minute wait, and being told that again a half hour later, and again a half hour after that.  after waiting for over an hour we left to seek out something else.

reviews.name: Kathi B.
reviews.review: Was really looking forward to lunch here today but I am pretty un impressed & would safely say I would not go back. Service was slow & our food was barely even warm, I brought half of mine home because it was cold by the time I had a few bites. Nothing like a 20.00 plate of barely warm food. Also, a pet peeve I have is dirty plates left on the table, our waiter picked up his tab & tip quick & in a hurry but left all our dirty plates.

reviews.name: Samuel E.
reviews.review: We had been wanting to come here for a while after hearing such great things about it in the past from numerous people. We got kind of scared seeing the barrage of negative reviews checking yelp the day before we decided to go and almost cancelled on going. I'm SO GLAD WE DIDN'T CANCEL.The service was very friendly, from the hostess to the waiters. They all seemed genuinely excited to serve us and were very knowledgeable about the menu. I ordered the Orecchiette Bolognese and My wife ordered the Beef Filet. I was very impressed with how this Italian was cooked in a truly authentic way and not "Americanized". My Orecchiette Bolognese was one of the best Italian dishes (maybe the best) I've had in my life. My wife's filet was absolutely amazing along with the amazing potatoes that came with.All in all, the food was amazing, the service was great, the ambiance perfect and the prices were lower than what they should be. Will definitely be going back regularly.

reviews.name: heather k.
reviews.review: They are remodeling and closed for 3 weeks. Even though their take out/eat in sign was open. We walked in to a full crew taking out the floor. So much for our dinner out tonight. Guess we will try back in a month.

reviews.name: Dustin B.
reviews.review: Bad and good. Bad first. Food took 24 minutes to get. Table of five. Breakfast. Restaurant only 1/3 full. Seriously? Meal was $13 for only 2 biscuits and gravy. Hardly an appetizer. No espresso available at this 'Italian' restaurant. Music playing did notator atmosphere. Felt more like a biker/sports bar. Now the good. Beautiful location and peaceful area. Restaurant and grounds are clean and live music is available. Choose carefully. Thanks :)

reviews.name: Marissa F.
reviews.review: New menu is different. I just paid 15.00 for an underwhelming house salad and dried chicken breast. Customer service w 2go's is sub par. I would say that Holly I'd always great. They have a new menu but no 2go menus. Interesting.I waited 30 minutes for the salad too. Bartender Ryan not very attentive or approachable. He tossed our food on the table and said ok that's it. Nice right?

reviews.name: Robert A.
reviews.review: Stopped in for a drink and munchies before we toured the Mandrell mansion. They had some interesting beer options and some examples from the Pritchard distillery which was just down the road. Friendly bartender and patrons made the wait very pleasant. We'd return for a full meal, the food was that good.The bartender said that they had outstanding Italian food. We would have returned but the fact that we were staying in Hendersonville made it a long trek for a return meal.

reviews.name: Engineer A.
reviews.review: Liked the outdoor seating. The food was good, and the portions were good as well. Nice restaurant to visit after zip lining next door.

reviews.name: Ed H.
reviews.review: Nice place! Good pizza and pasta dishes.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: Might sound crazy for an Italian restaurant but I love their wings! (Medium). Bruschetta is off the hook!  Pizza is good. Garlic bread is good. We have gone with groups and everything our friends order they have enjoyed. Sometimes service is challenge but overall we keep coming back.  Good out ways the occasional slow service etc.

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: The chicken was good in the chicken Parmesan. The pizza was a four star but the sauce on it and the Parmesan would give you diabetes. The spaghetti / pizza sauce had way too much sugar. If you like your sauce sweet this is the place but it messed up otherwise quality ingredients for me.  The beer cheese soup was also good.

reviews.name: Viva S.
reviews.review: I have only eaten here once and so WANTED TO LOVE IT as the running trail or "the Trails" at Fontanel have been a cool discovery and it is a beautiful setting. We ate after running one hot humid afternoon (we eyed the patron traffic going in and coming out to get sense of whether we would be offending dress code in sportswear, no problem there as many were clothed similarly (though truly by looking at place I would have dressed better if planning to go there during busier hours--place was on emptied side when we went)  I am not into pasta and bread so much and that was focus of menu so I ended up ordering mussels appetizer for meal. I did try the bread served at table w/herbs and oil dip and it was fresh and very good. My friend had fetucinni alfredo and was primarily impressed by amount they charged for small addition of chicken to pasta I tried bite of pasta and felt it was a little bland and excessively buttery (though I am no connoisseur of fettucini alfredo) Overall the atmosphere was very nice, the service was good, the food LOOKED promising on brunch menu so I may try that in future. The food as sampled was probably worth 2.5 star review but I still really WANT to like this place... I think in general it is questionable form to offer so many salads and pasta dishes that only add protein for cost  almost equivalent to base price of entree... This part has stuck in my mind, restaurants that are awesome rely on repeat business and happy lingering guests to turn profit, here it felt like they were looking to grab your $20 and not care so much if you stuck around for drinks or dessert or even came back for that matter...IMHO...hoping better if there's a next time.

reviews.name: Vaughn E.
reviews.review: This is a nice little place in Whites Creek, located between the entrance to the Fontanel Mansion and Prichard's Distillery. The service was good, as was the brunch. Our large party of 7 ordered a variety of food and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals. Some of us ordered off the brunch menu, and a couple ordered off the regular menu. One meal wasn't prepared as requested, and the staff was happy to remake it quickly. The staff was very pleasant, quite friendly.I hear that Thursday nights are pretty fun with love music.

reviews.name: Durwood E.
reviews.review: Food was just not very good. Not necessarily bad, but totally unremarkable. Baked ziti was under-seasoned and definitely  not baked. Rolls sat in pool of garlic oil that could be swirled around the bottom of the basket about 1/16 inch deep.The portion was enough to feed four regular humans. This could have been a good thing if the left over food had been good enough to take home, The music was very loud and as undistinguished as the food.  It was impossible to carry on a conversation; we couldn't even hear the waitress.I cannot see myself ever going back. It was a miserable night

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I dined here for lunch 2 weeks ago.  I ordered my entrée off the specials menu...papaya-glazed tilapia over risotto with mushrooms and artichokes.  Sounds delicious, right?  When the meal arrived at our table, I took a bite and immediately noticed that there was some spiciness to the dish.  I am very sensitive to spice, but thought that maybe I could tough it out and continue eating.  The more I ate, the more my mouth burned.  After a few bites, I was in such discomfort that I knew I had to send the meal back (only the 2nd meal I've ever sent back in my lifetime!)When the waitress came to check on us, I explained the problem and asked her to talk to the kitchen and find out what they put in there that was so spicy.  The menu indicated NOTHING about the dish being spicy at all!  When she returned to our table, she told us that there were HABANEROS in there!!!!!!  How could you fail to put that on your menu???  She then said "actually, I had this meal this morning, and you're right...there is a little kick to it!!!"  Umm...I'd say it was more than a little!  Also, if she was aware that it was spicy from her own personal experience...why would she not warn me about it at the time I placed the order?????The waitress took back the first meal and allowed me to choose another dish...however, we were charged for the replacement meal.  My meal was NOT comped even though the restaurant was clearly at fault for our poor experience.  They failed to disclose their ingredients and accurately represent their dish to their customer.  I am not sure how this is an acceptable practice, and I would be especially concerned about dining here if I were someone with food allergies.

reviews.name: Jackson T.
reviews.review: My wife and I have worked hard to get where we are in this world and don't mind spending money on food worthy our families money. This being said save your money with this one.  Last year 2014 it was known as the Fontenel and the food and pizzas where amazing. This year they have changed everything even their staples on the  menus from last year. Fontanelles bruschetta was not bruschetta at all. It was a heated hoagie roll with hamburger tomatoes instead of Roma tomatoes and good mozzarella which was screwed up by melting the cheese in the oven.  I'm sorry I've never eaten a bruschetta that came out of the oven with the exception of the bread itself. The pork chop at the Fontenel used to come out with mashed potatoes and was a big beautiful chop covered in a Marsala sauce. Now it's mashed potatoes with a big beautiful chop with sautéed spinach and a knock off marsala sauce. It would be okay if we stopped here, it may be tolerable, but now they hide the beautiful chop with a hefty baked layer of gorgonzola cheese and garnished with fried onions. Why would you do this and hide the chop. Granted they say in the menu gorgonzola  crumbles but not layered.    Let's move on to the service. Anyone reading this that may know me knows I worked at the same Italian restaurant for 19 years from 15-34 so I know a hard working server vs a server that has given up. Our server gave up granted she had a very pleasant personality of her own.  So I blame leadership. Finally to sum it up: $200 in alcoholic beverages $450 in food I wouldn't feed my family dogs.$150 in tips from ex servers at our table(pity)PRICELESS

reviews.name: Dominic T.
