reviews.review: Healthy quick cheap fresh vegetarian lunch... sold!The decor is pretty worn out and the food bins could definitely use some sanitizing but whatever is in there gets killed off on the grill anyway. I made the mistake of only adding enough sauce for the veggies and totally forgot they were going to add noodles so mine was a little dry, but some soy sauce solved that problem. Overall, definitely somewhere I'd return.

reviews.name: Elizabeth E.
reviews.review: Khan's Mongolian BBQ is one of my favorite quick joints downtown - mainly because I love Asian stir-fry and they do it best.LOCATION: Great for downtown workers - at the end of The Arcade (4th, I think?)ENVIRONMENT: Not much to the interior of the place, but not totally grungy or anything. I'm a germ-a-phobe and I often stay and eat there. I haven't ever run into a long line or anything, but watch out for Hume Fogg's "eat out" day when the high school students overrun downtown during the lunch hour.FOOD: AWESOME stir-fry bar (similar to Genghis Grill, I hear) . You basically fill a bowl up with whatever meat, veggies and sauces you want in your stir-fry. There are signs to instruct you to create the sauce combination you want. I like my Asian spicy and it's definitely possible to attain the right balance at Khan's. You will notice that "regulars" know how to do it right - build a wall with the snow peas, put your meat on the bottom and then pile with veggies (which are always fresh). Then, add your sauce over the top. When you bring your bowl to the counter, you can add rice or noodles and they cook it up right behind the counter. In the end, for less than $8.50 or so, you get a pretty large stir-fry. Male co-workers are always full upon departure.DRINKS: Pretty similar to other Arcade eateries - soda or water.OVERALL: A total WIN in my book - if I could only convince my co-workers to hit it up more often!

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: Khan's is a lot like Genghis grill, but not as good or upscale.  You load your own bowl small or large with raw meat (frozen strips of chicken, beef, pork), vegetables, and spices.  Then you hand it to the cook for him to cook on a big cook top.  You get to pick rice or noodles.  I think the noodles are the best but that is just me.

reviews.name: Skip S.
reviews.review: Great breakfast!!! Lots of choices, delicious and cheap!!!

reviews.name: Aaron S.
reviews.review: I ate at Kahn's day before yesterday... It wasn't terrible, however the ingredients weren't fresh and tasted like it. Also, when I pointed out to the owner that their ice machine was out of ice he left our food on the griddle while he went off to get ice and refill the machine. Our food was a little burnt.

reviews.name: M. M.
reviews.review: This place is real low rent looking but has great stir fry.I assume this is the ethnic hole in the wall for the downtown workerbees, but I do agree with others that whatever this stuff is - it sure ain't Mongolian.Watch your tummy with this stuff cause it don't matter what you call it - it sure is rich.

reviews.name: Sharon K.
reviews.review: Kahn's Mongolian BBQ is a DIY lunch place where you can pick your meats, veggies, and sauces to create a delicious stir fry for yourself.   Kahn's has a good selection of fresh ingredients.  If you want all snow peas with mustard sauce and rice, its yours.  If you want beef with beef, your can get it served up with white rice, brown rice, or noodles. You only have yourself to blame if you don't like how it tastes.  They have cheat sheets that give suggestions for which sauces to mix with which meats.  And if it is entirely too overwhelming for you to make those kinds of decisions at lunch you can just step up to the counter and order Chicken teriyaki and be done with it. They have their own tasty teriyaki recipe. The food is really tasty here, and its fun to be able to pick your own ingredients.  The helpings are as big as you make them, you can pile your bowl as high as you want without Kahn's saying  a word.  Oh, and its all pretty cheap well under $10 for a meal. If you stop by in the morning you can also get a traditional egg breakfast with sausage and biscuit.

reviews.name: T. C.
reviews.review: I always call this place by the wrong name (Mongol's) because there was a place just like this right off the UCLA campus.  Anyhoo...it's all about the art of squishing things into the bowl.  This place doesn't help that much 'cuz the meat is always mostly frozen in lumps.  The best is if the meat is relatively flat.  Then you can lay it against the bowl and not take up that much room with it.  In college, my guy friends would use each other's bowls and almost stack them to squish down the items in there so they could fit more.  Fast.  Yummy.  Filling.  And if you're a pro at filling your bowl, you can end up with enough for two meals.

reviews.name: Nate C.
reviews.review: I've walked by this place numerous times before I actually went there for lunch today. It's a bit different from what I'm used to from LA, but it's still good. For those that have never experienced mongolian bbq, then here's the breakdown:You first walk up the and pick up a bowl of your choice (here, there are two choices, small and large, but it's more like small and bigger small) lol, you load up the bowl with the choice your meat, veggies, and the sauce. Mind you that this is a self gathering joint. Once you have added all the goodies, you go up to the counter to pay. Then you have the choice to add rice or noodles (it's like thick chow-mein noodles, or a thick spaghetti). Then the cooks behind the counter starts cooking your order on a huge round metal where they stirfry your order. It's a unique experience for those that have not tried this. Basically the food is either gourmet fried rice or chow-mein. There's a variety of sauces and you'll have to go there several times before you know how you like it. My stomach is throbbing b/c i put too much chili sauce on mine, and I hope you don't do this to yourself.enjoy~! =]

reviews.name: Susan K.
reviews.review: I went here today with a friend and I wasn't really in the mood for Asian food. Well, I was pleasantly surprised! As I piled my bowl full of raw beef and chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, cabbage, onions, mini corns, peppers, sesame oil, vinegar, BBQ sauce, garlic, and chili powder, I had no idea that it would come out tasting so good. They put mine over rice and it was hot, fresh, and exactly how I wanted it. Didn't take very long, so a great spot to go for lunch during my busy work day. It was filling without being greasy, and I felt like I'd gotten a good dose of veggies. As another reviewer said, this place would be great for vegetarians. They have tofu in addition to lots of vegetables.

reviews.name: Al C.
reviews.review: Yum! Was on a visit while in TN, visiting from NYC. If I lived closer, I'd be in serious trouble bc I'd probably gain 100+ lbs. here. The rolls are fancy, tasty, and flavorful. The service is fantastic and personable. My toddler had her fill of her favorite miso soup with tofu, stir fried noodles, and avocado rolls. The rest of us splurged on Kohana rolls, drain rolls, and a few other specialty rolls I can't remember the names of (but I took photos!). Whichever roll had crawfish in it was amazing, wish I could remember the name of it. If you're in the Nashville burbs, make sure you stop by. It's worth the trip.

reviews.name: mary b.
reviews.review: Don't do it! Dine elsewhere! Several friends and I had lunch here. Service was competent and lunch specials were moderately priced. But all the tastes were wrong. Ginger dressing tasted like corn syrup. Vegetable roll tasted like frozen spinach. Salmon roll wasn't awful but portion was minuscule. Very disappointing.

reviews.name: Sasser M.
reviews.review: Seriously guys, what is with the over-priced oddly flavored food at this place.  We were one of three tables in the place and it was very hard to get service.  In fact, my miso soup never showed up.  There were four employees out in front and nobody could help?  Really?

reviews.name: Nina M.
reviews.review: I have been here several times in the past and although the prices were outrageous, food was good. The past two times, however, it has been just horrible. Four of us ate there today for Sunday lunch, bill was 85 (no alcohol) and although the sushi was passable, the other items were things I would have thrown in the trash if I had made it at home. Fried rice was unbearably salty and had little rock hard crunchy pieces of something in it, with steak that was so tough I could not chew it. Edamame was over cooked (who can do that to edamame? How hard can it be?) and my husband's teriyaki ribeye was fatty and overloaded with sticky sauce... No vegetables on plate. I will not return. It is a shame that this attractive restaurant in a great location cannot get its act together to make decent food.

reviews.name: Jackie P.
reviews.review: I like it here.  Nice decor. Good service and reasonably priced food. It fresh and taste

reviews.name: Rachael L.
reviews.review: I ordered teriyaki chicken and fried rice and was very angry when I was given a piece of plain grilled chicken and white rice. Any other japanese restaurant I've ever been to and ordered teriyaki chicken, I've gotten a mix of rice, veggies, and chicken with teriyaki sauce. When I called to complain (we ordered our dinner to-go) I was told, "Well, that's just how ours is. Sorry." The manager could've cared less. I am angry (and hungry after paying $15 for plain grilled chicken) and we will not be back.

reviews.name: Lauren R.
reviews.review: Came with friends on a Friday night, and it was surprisingly empty.  As in the four of us and maybe two other couples.  We ordered a ton of rolls to share (maybe 5-6?).  They were good, and the service was good.  Nothing stellar, nothing super memorable or creative, but solid.It has a modern, minimalist feel with long rows of tables, booths on one side and chairs on the other, so it definitely lacked the atmosphere of some of the other sushi places in town.

reviews.name: Sarah F.
reviews.review: Stumbled in here after leaving the mall. Amazing sushi and very sweet owner. Sat at the bar and had a glass of wine waiting for my take out order. Chatted with the owner/sushi chef for a bit. Very modern and classy inside. Will definitely go back. Yum!!

reviews.name: Renae B.
reviews.review: Great sushi! Great service! My personal favorite, house salad with creamy dressing and Kohana roll :)

reviews.name: Liz V.
reviews.review: This used to be my favorite Sushi spot hands down. Keywords: "used-to-be." After having bad experiences with the food multiple times in a row, it was no longer on my list of favs and I stopped going there for a while. Well, today, I decided to give them another chance and went back for lunch. Today's experience made me remember all of the reasons why I stopped going there in the first place. I went for lunch, and just as I used to, I got the same sushi rolls I always get: Philly & crunchy shrimp. Well, both rolls were cold. I'm no sushi connoisseur by any means, but I've eaten it long enough to know its not supposed to be cold. Who wants to eat cold, raw fish and rice? On top of that, they just did not taste well. I've had those same two rolls many times over at many different places and would say those were the worse I've ever had from anywhere else. I didn't even eat half of my order, not because I wasn't hungry but because it wasn't good.  On top of that, I was also on my lunch break from work and the waittress seemed to take her sweet time & pay no mind to that fact. I'm glad I paid lunch menu prices because I would have really been upset had it been dinner and full price! Anyway, I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but will definitely be staying away for good this time.

reviews.name: Kenneth M.
reviews.review: Incredibly good sushi.  The rolls are large and well worth the money.  There is a great fish to rice ratio and the sauces are very flavorful.

reviews.name: Lisa M.
reviews.review: If I could give it no stars I would. I got food poisoning but that's not all. Husband ordered crispy tofu with broccoli. It wasn't crispy and it had no broccoli. I got chicken teryaki. After one bite I stopped eating it. After one bite of his tofu husband stopped eating it.  The waitress never asked how everything was she just went straight to the check like she knew the food was bad so why bother asking right? 12 hours later I am puking out my brains. I knew ythe chicken tasted like it was left out for too long and should have demanded to not pay but we are too nice.

reviews.name: Hannie K.
reviews.review: This is where I bring my females on dates. Very relaxed atmosphere, best sushi, and polite attractive employees. I definitely recommend the Phoenix or Volcano roll

reviews.name: Sue M.
reviews.review: Love the sushi here! I definitely prefer some rolls over others, but all are good size - plenty of filler and topping (not mostly rice like some places). My favorites: 101st roll, and love the mango roll! Rolls with raw - new orleans, Phoenix, sexy lady, spicy girl, mardi gras.  This place is worth a try.  You won't have a wait, and service is always friendly.

reviews.name: Jacob S.
reviews.review: Sushi comparable to Virago with lower prices. Every time I've come, the service has been excellent and we got a table immediately. Cool, airy interior. Plenty of parking. I have no plans to go to any other Japanese restaurant in Nashville any time soon.Specifically, I've had their dragon roll, California roll, and philly roll, plus their albacore and egg custard nigiri. They were all solid by my California standards, which are pretty high when it comes to sushi. The spring rolls were also perfectly cooked. I tried my girlfriends chicken katsu, and that was probably the best katsu I've had (though I've mainly only had it in crappy Hawaiian BBQ places). Just great. No complaints.

reviews.name: Gloria G.
reviews.review: Great food great service. Low key but very nice. Airy location w many options outside sushi.

reviews.name: Rachel L.
reviews.review: Kohana is my favorite restaurant in Nashville. The sushi menu is amazing, you should venture out and try one of their unique rolls, you won't find combinations like this anywhere! They also have much, much more than sushi- the noodle dishes are amazing and the cocktail list is impressive! My favorite roll is The Kohana roll, its absolutely delicious and so unique- you have to order it when you go. The presentation of the food is gorgeous and the restaurant is as chic and beautiful as the food. The outdoor patio is huge, with gorgeous lighting and is the perfect spot for a summer night date or party. It's the perfect, romantic late-night spot for dinner and drinks. And in the 5:00-7:00 p.m. or lunchtime hours it's also a great spot for a family dinner, it's a kid-friendly restaurant and the staff is always kind and happy to extend suggestions for a little sushi lover! Kohana is located in Hillsboro Plaza, the shopping center also has a children's book store, a yoga studio, and really great coffee spot as well, perfect for a day of multi-tasking with kids, a night out with friends, or just treating yourself! I highly recommend Kohana!

reviews.name: Brant S.
reviews.review: Not really impressed at all.  The rolls I have had have all been bland and underwhelming.  Not necessarily bad sushi, but just not good sushi.  I typically order the same rolls at other places so I have a good benchmark of what they should taste like.   I've tried it twice, both times at lunch and simply haven't been impressed.

reviews.name: Rosalind V.
reviews.review: I had the Golf Course. It had spicy tuna, cream cheese, scallions, crunch, and kiwi with mango sauce on top. I have had this role from the Clarksville restaurant and it seemed better and bigger. This one was a good size for me however. I enjoyed it and would come back but it does seem pricey for one roll. That is probably about right for a specialty roll. They have 1/2 off on sushi on Weds nights.

reviews.name: Alisha V.
reviews.review: This is a solid place for sushi and other dishes. What's really cool is that they will customize any sushi roll for you. Literally, you can make one up and they'll do it for you. A friend of mine likes his whole sushi roll deep fried (don't ask me why!) and they'll do it, no questions asked. Not sure if this happens at any other places but this is the only place I've ever seen them do something like that. I enjoy Kohana but my only complaint is that the atmosphere is very quiet and stuffy.

reviews.name: Krissy R.
reviews.review: I really liked the sushi here. The fish tasted fresh & the cucumber fizz cocktail was really fresh & had huge pieces of cucumber in it. Our waitress, Kim, was the sweetest & made the experience even better. I will definitely be coming back to Kohana.

reviews.name: Jamee C.
reviews.review: Kohana is never a bad experience, especially if you are a family. I had been to the Clarksville location previously and knowing that, I knew I'd enjoy the one in Green Hills as well. But then that being said, while Kohana would be the first place I'd go for sushi in Clarskville, it isn't here in Nashville but it is in my top 5 list. Great variety of dishes with all delicious flavors, their noodle and rice dishes are great. I definitely enjoy going to Kohana with my son because their kids' menu is just great. Really, I mean with a child, it's difficult to feed them something decent because fine dining usually won't have a kids' menu and going to a typical American chain restaurant will get your child served up with disgusting hot dogs, cheese burgers, mac and cheese sorts but Kohana's kids' menu offers variety with fresh ingredients and great taste. Personally being a parent raising a partially Asian kid, I love love their kids' menu.

reviews.name: The Yelp-inator W.
reviews.review: So good...possibly the best sushi in Nashville.I don't understand the low ratings some give...this place is so awesome.  Nice decore, excellent service....incredible sushi.

reviews.name: Julie S.
reviews.review: I am sorry to say that the sushi was positively horrible. I seriously can't recall ever feeling that way about sushi---period! The fish was unappealingly warm, the rolls were ridiculously small and not presented in and artful manner at all. My husband ordered one of the more expensive, specialty rolls and it was as small as my plain old salmon roll! Not impressive at all. To Kohana's credit, they did not charge us for the rolls since I did tell them it was not good. Sadly, though, we have no desire to eat sushi here...ever.

reviews.name: Ben F.
reviews.review: Signs of a bad sushi restaurant - when they use lemon in their chirashi. It's used to hide the mediocre quality of the fish. Looking at the slices of sashimi tuna, I could already tell that they get their fish from the same places asian groceries store get it. It has the pinkish color to it, rather than the deeper red that fresh tuna is supposed to be. The tamago wasn't even sweet. It tasted like a regular omelet. The octopus had a vinegar base to it, another bad sign. The snapper tasted like it was defrosted from a grocery store. Yuck. For $20, this was one of the worse chirashi bowls ever. If you want real sushi/sashimi, go to Ninki instead. If you want dressed up specialty rolls, then I guess this place maybe for you. As a purist sushi lover, I was disappointed. They could not even get the sushi rice right, which is very important. Signs that it's really a quasi-Japanese place - when they are playing Chinese music, thinking that their customers can't tell the difference. (I'm Chinese so I could tell the lyrics were in Chinese).If you're looking for real Japanese ramen, I'd avoid this place as well. There's only one broth and it tasted like soy sauce. I know this because I used soy sauce to put some flavor in it because it was very very bland. No tonkotsu ramen here. It's their own recipe broth I was told, which tasted like water with a hint of beef broth. Sadly, I'm serious. Aside from the horrible food, the service here was friendly. We were seated promptly and our waitress was attentive, hence the additional star, otherwise, this place really deserves a 1. So come here if you don't care if your fish is that fresh. Places that serve a lot of specialty rolls typically don't use fresh fish or high quality fish, because the flavor of the fish is masked with all the other seasonings and sauces.

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple of times and will be going back. Tried a few of the specialty rolls - Alfredo and the 101st and really liked them both. Service was very attentive and the atmosphere was nice.  Prices were a little high - helps to have a coupon. I'm no sushi expert. If you are then maybe this is not the place for you. If you are like me and just looking for something yummy and different in Green Hills then give Kohana a try.  You might like it!

reviews.name: Terry V.
reviews.review: I went here for a farewell dinner and the service was great. We went for an early dinner so it wasn't too crowded. The sushi here is decent depending on what you order. If you are looking for authentic Japanese cuisine, this is not the place to go. If you want a fusion type of sushi, then this will be more of a place for you. I've lived in Japan for three years so I know that it will not be the same as it was in Japan. It's fun to try out various creations though which I like. I ordered the fried bananas for dessert and really liked that. I had a great experience.

reviews.name: Kirk H.
reviews.review: Wednesday night dinner with wife.  We read some poor reviews of this restaurant but went anyway.  Atmosphere and decor are trendy - very clean and we found it quite comfortable.  Several groups enjoying dinner.  Wait service was inexperienced but friendly and trying to please.  Ordered two sushi rolls - one fairly pedestrian and the other a house specialty, plus fried rice with extra shrimp.  Drinks delivered quickly.  Slight delay on the sushi, but we were apprised by the waiter.  Sushi showed up more quickly than we were expecting.  Fine presentation.  Fresh taste, and the specialty sushi was freshly hot.  Quick follow-up service - we asked for a couple extra items like teriyaki sauce and some lemon wedges.  Finish-up service was perfect.  Good timing and quick payment.We noticed that one of the sushi chefs was new and receiving training from two others.  Waiter was new, seemingly to the business, but his service was just fine.Honestly, we'll go back again.

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: A welcome addition to Green Hills Just a few blocks from the theatre, we dropped in after a late show, and were pleasantly surprised!I have to start with the staff. Everyone from our waiter to the random employee we chatted with behind the bar were very friendly and knowledgeable. The sushi rolls were large, flavorful and will keep me coming back. We had the 101st and Alfredo rolls. They had similar ingredients but still had a very delightful and distinctive taste. The menu was full of wonderful sounding items that I hope to sample on my next visit. We found a nice selection of wines and a fully stocked bar to keep us smiling.The layout is open and modern with a nice outdoor dining area.If you love well crafted specialty rolls and a good glass of wine you'll love Kohana.

reviews.name: Candice R.
reviews.review: I might comeback in a year when they get real sushi chefs. Everything seemed like it would be okay when I walked in the door. The host was all smiles. I sat at the bar so I could watch the Olympics. Business was slow so the staff was crowded around that area doing the same. After I settled into my seat I looked to my right and that's where I began to worry. I was expecting your traditional sushi chef but I was so wrong! There was a white guy and a man of Hispanic decent (not trying to sound racist, he'll I'm black!) dressed is uncoordinated T-shirts and jeans. They each were struggling like they were just thrown into it because the real chef did not show! I gave the sushi a try anyway because I had bough a living social deal soon did not have much to lose. I ordered the futomaki, scallops,  and the kohana. Futomaki was my safe pick along with scallops. I sat there and watched one of the chefs make my scallop sushi TWICE! He had it right the first time: scallop, wasabi, sushi rice, mayor some nori. Then he decided that was wrong and disassembled my sushi proceeded too mince my scallops and add mayo and some roe! WTF! I tried it and of course it was horrible! My futomaki was good but it was not pretty or cut thick... I expected that with the skill level I saw. The waitress told me the kohana was a good choice; I should have changed my order right then. She was still in training and probably had been trained to say that; too new to have a real opinion. The kohana was supposed to have crawfish, crab, yellowtail, all the good stuff and then it's fried and has yum yum and eel sauce on top. It was fried so hard I had a hard time chewing it! I tasted nothing but sauce and avocado. My waitress did not check on me after I started eating even though she was a few stools down from me. She finally noticed I was watching the Olympics and not eating. She asked if I needed anything else or a to-go box. I told her no that I didn't like the food. She took my food and said "I'm sorry about that" and proceeded to walk away. I said it was okay to be nice but no one really seemed to care. The manager/ owner/ whoever was back there with me the whole time! If I did not have that living social deal I would have been more pissed. I wish I could have gotten my money back! Be forewarned do not font this place anytime soon. If you have to try it for yourself I suggest you wait 6 months or longer. Hopefully they will have their act together by then!

reviews.name: Chad D.
reviews.review: I recently moved to Green Hills (as in 2 weeks ago) and had noticed that soon there would be Sushi literally out my front door.  So every day for 2 weeks I've watched and waited on Kohana to open.  Yesterday, to my complete surprise, as I'm driving with no intention whatsoever of eating Sushi I see the hanging the "NOW OPEN" banner on the front.  I almost wrecked as I swerved into the parking lot (which was completely full already, they'd been open an hour) seemingly unable to satisfy this curiosity fast enough.When I entered I found an extremely polite and friendly staff (I don't use extremely polite very often, I've worked in the service industry and I'm on the road a lot performing and encounter numerous bars and restaurants all the time, these people were EXTREMELY polite).  The decor in this joint has just the right modern feel you'd expect out of a high-end Sushi spot without being over the top.  It was a very comfortable setting.I sat at the Sushi bar, where I was greeted by 3, yes 3 Sisters, all of whom couldn't have been sweeter.  One of the sisters was running the show while the other two cranked out some of the best and most unique sushi I've experienced.  My server, Alex, more than compensated for my dehydration from a night of drinking.  I simply told her just that as I sat down and she never let my glass get even close to empty.  It's the little things that count.The Phoenix Roll ($16) is worth every penny.  It is 12-14 pieces (I got so full I lost count) and it may be the tastiest roll to ever cross your pallet.  Prior to eating it, of course I had to try my go to, the spicy tuna roll ($5) just to make sure that this dream of 30 steps to sushi was for real.  It was also delicious, nothing crazy, nothing wild, just what you want to get the job done.  There are many items priced under $10 that are extremely yummy.  You will realize this once you pick up their "Hardcover Magazine Style Photo Album" of their dishes.I've never written a single Yelp review and may never write another.  As I was browsing Yelp for bars around me I've yet to experience I noticed that Kohana wasn't on the list yet and after the experience I had yesterday, from the food, the Sisters, Alex, the comfy orange chairs, and on and on, made me realize that if I didn't make an account and tell people how good this place is I would be a poor excuse of a human.  Do yourself a favor and check them out.  It will change your (sushi) life.~Chad

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: First I only rating this on my take out order and I did not venture into the menu!! So once again they also did not include sauce for part of my order. The shrimp and veggie tempura had a nice coating but the shrimp need to be a little fresher. Also my rice dish had absolutely no seasoning!!

reviews.name: Sarah H.
reviews.review: Food- I ordered the chicken teriyaki because I wasn't in the mood for sushi and it was anything but what I expected- ickk! It came with miso soup (which was delicious, better than any I've ever had) and a salad, which was okay. BUT the chicken teriyaki was pretty bad. I was served two long, thin chicken breasts with teriyaki sauce dumped in the middle with a scoop of white rice, an apple piece, an orange piece, a seaweed cucumber mix and two spears of broccoli. This IS NOT ANYTHING like hibachi, so don't order it expecting hibachi. My chicken wasn't even cut into strips. It looked like a plain, bland chicken breast with teryiaki sauce dumped on top, and it tasted even worse. Not to mention, my second chicken breast had a medium sized dark spot in the middle, so I didn't touch it. In their defense, the portions were HUGE. For $9, I got enough food to feed two people. My friend ordered two sushi rolls, and the fish looked very fresh. Granted, it wasn't the best sushi I've ever tasted, but it certainly was fresh. On a side note, if you're a sashimi fan, I bet they have great sashimi. Price- One reason I didn't order a specialty roll is because most of them are $15. If I recall correctly, they're all in the $14-$18 range, which is pretty steep for a lunch roll. You might as well go to Virago and sit on their cool patio and eat for that price. There are SEVERAL rolls that are in the $6-$12 range, they just are the blander, simpler rolls that I personally don't care for. But, if you like these types of rolls, you'd probably be pretty impressed. Service- was spotty and awkward. It took several minutes (even though the restaurant was nearly empty) for our server to introduce himself and take our drink order. Our server was polite, but our interactions were somewhat uncomfortable. However, I did notice that the owner of the restaurant was very interactive with her customers. And, when the hostess sat us, she gave us hot towels for our hands, which was a nice touch. Cleanliness- The restaurant was very clean, and still has that new smell! Parking- They have a private lot and a valet. You won't have a problem finding parking. I doubt I will eat here again. The food and service just didn't stand out to me enough. The specialty rolls look good, but they're overpriced. Our experience was okay but not great.

reviews.name: Mr Mrs J.
reviews.review: Had lunch here a few weekends ago.  Love the decor.  The deep violets, black trimming, chandeliers - so chic.Great sushi, great service, great price. Best Udon Soup I've had in town I think. Nothing much to say except it had a great selection of sushi and soups on the menu. Go try it.  You'll love it!

reviews.name: Travis B.
reviews.review: My friend and I went there on a Tuesday night at about 7 and it was almost empty. Perfect. Our waitress was very good and gave us suggestions. Since this was out first time there, we looked at the entire menu (they have a picture book of the rolls)  before choosing the Phoenix and Dancing Eel rolls. Absolutely spectacular sushi. Probably the best I have had so far in Nashville. We also had the Moonplum saki which was very tasty. The evening was about 70 bucks. I recommend it highly.

reviews.name: Corey L.
reviews.review: Great sake list! They cater to gluten free as well!

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: You know when sushi rolls are promoted "as big as hockey pucks" and the house special is a deep friend roll that if you are in search of a great Japanese meal this place will let you down.

reviews.name: Byron K.
reviews.review: Kohana is the best sushi restaurant in Nashville that I have eaten at since I came to Nashville 5 years ago. The sashimi portions were generous, and the dynamite and little mermaid sushi were an interesting twists on classic sushi dishes.  Service was outstanding!

reviews.name: Jennifer M.
reviews.review: Being a huge fan of Kohana's Hendersonville location, I was abolutely pumped when this location opened up in the much-more-convenient-for-me Green Hills.  Too bad for me, the experience just isn't the same.  The ambiance is very nice and the service is fine.  Unfortunately, everything on the menu costs at least a dollar more than it does at the Hendersonville location.  Despite the higher price, the drink pours are less generous and the rolls are quite smaller, and just not as good.  Basically, if I had never been to Kohana in Hendersonville, I might think this place is great, but since I know how good it could be, I'm just not impressed.  Looks like we'll keep driving to Sumner county to get our sushi on!

reviews.name: Glenn F.
reviews.review: We went to Kohana for lunch.  It is new in our neighborhood and we wanted to give it a try.  The ambiance is splendid, the service is great, the food was good and the price was not so great.  The portions and food were good, but the price was too much. We each had a special sushi roll and a salad and it was $60 with tip. I might go back, but I will more carefully order.

reviews.name: Karen P.
reviews.review: It was amazing.  The choices were staggering, one of the best sushi restaurants in town.  I was a Peter's and Sushime fan, and this tops both.  Service was great, the decor so elegant.  I will be back many times

reviews.name: Austin E.
reviews.review: Sushi was good but the service was terrible. The staff was nice but was not helpful at all. It took way too long to get basic items like napkins and a check. I'd try it again but it wouldn't be my first choice for sushi in the area.

reviews.name: Sue L.
reviews.review: Went for dinner and though the restaurant appeared nice and romantically dimly lit for the night, the food was utterly disappointing. Quality of the fish: pretty bad, especially for the price.-I almost wonder if they keep the lighting so low in order to prevent us from having a good look at all the raw fish being served. It almost felt as if the sashimi pieces have been frozen and thawed; the texture was gone missing, and the surface was very dry for some reason.-Also you will notice that they are heavy on condiments/sauces even on sashimi; I am almost convinced that they do so to hide the sub par quality of their fish.-Lastly, for sashimi at the price they ask, the size is laughably small. Those were the smallest sashimi pieces I've ever had in my life!This place doesn't have decent sashimi/sushi period. I'd much rather go to Wild Wasabi for their excellent and fresh sushi lunch buffet (12 bucks) or their dinner service.

reviews.name: Matt R.
reviews.review: Came for dinner on a Tuesday night with hardly anyone there.  Third time trying restaurant and will be the last time. They still cannot get the tempura right  - half of the items were so greasy, they were indelible.    My martini was about two shots and didn't even fill half the glass.  The one roll with fried crab sounded awesome, but they must have used day or 2 day old as nothing was crunchy.  Behind the black curtain was a huge trash can that I saw the entire dining time.   Didn't make the evening appetizing at all. What a bummer.

reviews.name: kimbe m.
reviews.review: I've spent about a third of my life in Japan, so when I get a "jones" for sushi I really want sushi. I was extremely excited to see a new sushi restaurant opening near my business office, particularly after checking the reviews for Kohana in Hendersonville and Clarksville. My wife and I went with great expectations.Let me start by saying that the restaurant's only been open a little while. Still, our waiter told us the owners had "imported" staff and chefs from the other restaurants, so the recent opening is no excuse.We arrived the first time just after dinner hour opening, were greeted and seated by a friendly hostess. When we got up to look at the sushi bar, the sushi chef behind it couldn't be bothered to look up and greet us - not even make eye contact. We stood there awkwardly for a minute, then returned to the table.We ordered age dashi tofu, which arrived in a huge mound of slightly-warm tofu with a dash - really, just a dash - of sauce. Nothing else on it. When we asked the waiter where the grated daikon the menu promised was, he checked with the chef, then came back to say "Chef says they've never, ever made it that way, he doesn't understand why it says that on the menu." The tofu was mealy, the sauce was forgettable, and without the grated vegetables, disappointing.We ordered the gyoza, which were actually quite good - not fried to death like so many other restaurants. Reminiscent of the old Shintomi when it was still the best in this area. However, the gyoza sauce tasted like someone had thrown a batch of vinegar into a bowl, splashed a teaspoon of soy sauce, and forgotten any other ingredients.(As an aside, until it went fervently downill my wife and daughters and I ate at Shintomi at least twice a week for years. They had the best gyoza sauce I've ever eaten, including in Tokyo!)We loved the beautiful picture menu of sushi rolls. My wife adores crab, and was excited to see that certain rolls specified "crabstick" (surimi - imitation crab), while another specified "snow crab." Since she is allergic to imitation crab, she happily ordered the roll made with "snow crab." Ordinarily, if a restaurant lists the two differently, we don't double check, but the prior two dishes made me nervous, so I asked the waiter whether it was in fact real snow crab. "Oh, no. ALL our crab is imitation crabstick." What? Really?! With snow crab cheap enough that Denny's features it, you're substituting surimi? Yes. Fake crab. In a restaurant charging $14-$18 a roll!Well, we cancelled the roll and moved on. I ordered ikura sushi, one of my personal tests of a good Japanese restaurant, along with seaweed salad. The salad was delicious. The ikura was embarrassingly bad. I would expect to see it at an all-you-can-eat sushi buffet.Thinking perhaps a non-Japanese item would fare better, we ordered the calimari. Delicious.I went back for lunch a few days later, and again asked about the crab, and was told the same thing. When I asked why the three menus at dinner and lunch differentiated between "snow crab" "crab stick" and "imitation crab", the waiter just shrugged.If you want good Japanese food in Nashville, without the health complications of a corporate entity that cheaps out where it counts (and don't think the imitation crab rolls are inexpensive!), go to Midori. It's a bit of a hike, but the sushi's always good, and their Korean food is excellent. Or go to Koto, sometimes hit or miss but usually very good. Or try Miyako. Or even Hanabi, which has begun to slide but is still way more than decent. But don't expect anything except LA-style atmosphere out of Kohana Green Hills.

reviews.name: Ines N.
reviews.review: Stayed at the springhill suites and walked over to eat dinner. Portions are big enough for kids to share and prices are fair. The only downside was that it seemed they mixed fresh and older stale chips in the nachos.

reviews.name: James H.
reviews.review: Extremely average. The "Chef" was walking around fist bumping everyone but doesn't apparently know the difference between medium and well done. 2 stars for having an IPA on draft. Everything else (turbo nachos & burger) was highly unimpressive.

reviews.name: Ray A.
reviews.review: Nice tasting wings. You get 10 descent size wings with good flavor. The staff is very friendly and attentive to your every need. I look forward to my next visit. It's good hotel food considering what's around the area.

reviews.name: Jim W.
reviews.review: This place was under duress when airport closed. Way under staffed because all flight crews and passengers but staff was great. Chef came out to talk to guests comped us two pieces of the best lemon berry cake.

reviews.name: Eddie M.
reviews.review: Food is good, but any mixed drink is very small for the price. Salad was a very good size portion.

reviews.name: Super D.
reviews.review: Staying in the hotel and didn't want to go out to eat. A very nice 1/2 lb burger, cooked just right. A larger than normal side salad. An ice tea that tasted fresh, unsweet. They had sweet too. If you don't feel like walking around, and are hungry you can't go wrong with my choices.

reviews.name: Leia A.
reviews.review: The four stars is mostly for their amazing hazelnut coffee. So, so good.As for the bagels: We had the 'everything bagel' and the jalapeno cheese bagel, both with cream cheese. Both were good and satisfying, but nothing special. I think this place is worth another shot to see what else they have.But mostly, their hazelnut coffee is where it's at!

reviews.name: Kristie A.
reviews.review: I am so sad I'm giving this place 3 stars because it's so close to my work.The five years I've worked next to this place, today was my first time during lunch. I got there around 11:45 and it was already busy. The line was pretty slow.I ordered tomato bisque with half chicken salad sandwich. I hate to say it but it's mediocre. It's good but nothing crazy. It didn't make me say wow.Will I come back again? Yes. I'd like to try their other menu items. Maybe I didn't order the right foods.

reviews.name: Erin Y.
reviews.review: I had an everything bagel with hummus on the side and a Chai tea. The bagel was good and it surprisingly went well with hummus. I felt a lot healthier too having this combination instead of the usual cream cheese.The Chai tea was bad. It was too sweet. It was pre-made, probably from a package. But it was loaded with sugar, kinda disguating. I definitely would stay away from this drink. Maybe I will give their coffee a try next time.

reviews.name: Lauren B.
reviews.review: Halfway through my Multi-grain bagel and sorry but this is barely worth 2 stars. Firstly my multi-grain bagel is extremely salty and I realize that when dealing with dough you have to add salt. It's part of the chemistry but a multi-grain bagel shouldn't be so salty its only appropriate for a savory experience. I got strawberry cream cheese and the combination is borderline inedible. Secondly its also a turn off that this particular bagel was obviously stored next to the onion bagels or any of the bagels with onion in them. Again, inedible with strawberry cream cheese. Onions and strawberries don't mix.

reviews.name: Ricki V.
reviews.review: The service here isn't terrible but the employees are like robots and most refuse to smile. The bagels aren't that great. If you want Brueggers, take the short trip to the store on Harding Pike, that place is the best.

reviews.name: Shaina G.
reviews.review: I'm a HUGE Einstein Brothers' Bagel fan and this place was very similar so I was one happy girl! Got my toasted sesame seed bagel with strawberry cream cheese and a mocha latte to start off my day in Nashville. The location was conveniently located downtown and right across from Vanderbilt So the place was hopping all morning. My client enjoyed an egg and cheese sandwich on a bagel and we both enjoyed our breakfast here at Brueggers.

reviews.name: Angela H.
reviews.review: Brueggers has the best breakfast bagel sandwiches. The bagels themselves are delicious and they always cook the bacon so that it is crispy, which I really like. For lunch, the grilled cheese with Muenster and cheddar cheese is fantastic! I also really love the broccoli cheddar soup that they have, but they don't seem to have a set soup menu schedule, so I never know when they're going to have it. Also, they used to have a trio option for lunch where you could get a sandwich, soup or salad, and a drinks or a great price. Please bring this back! This was such a great deal for lunch!

reviews.name: Kimberly S.
reviews.review: I went in to Bruegger's today for a quick lunch. I ordered the smoked salmon bagel sandwich (I'm on a bizarre smoked salmon kick), and it was a little disappointing. The lady taking my order didn't speak loudly enough for me to hear her...at all. The assembly of the sandwich was ridiculous-- I'm a fan of cream cheese, but there was about three times the amount that need to be on the sandwich so that the bagel hole was actually completely filled with cream cheese. The capers were squirted onto the sandwich so that they were really dense in one area and no where to be found on the rest of the sandwich. The red onion on it was from the outer, coarse layer of an onion that I usually throw away because of the texture. The sandwich also took about 6 minutes to construct-- it shouldn't be that challenging. After paying for my sandwich and a bottle of water, it cost about $10.00, which is a little steep for a bagel sandwich. To top it off, after I returned to my car parked in the designated parking garage, I had a $40.00 ticket. I was only parked there for about 10 minutes total so I have no idea what this was for. The parking sitch further frustrated my already negative lunch experience. All in all, if you can walk there, it's a decent option for a quick bagel. Don't try to branch out into their other menu offerings.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: I don't know why I've never been here but today was my first visit to a Bruegger's Bagel. ever!  This was actually kind of exciting for me.  For one thing, the experience was super easy- parking garage connected- its free, not really busy, and when I walked in, there wasn't much of a line and the staff were attentive and fast and there was seating when I know everywhere else is bursting at the seams with people.  Anyway, they have chai lattes, which are my favorite plus fresh squeezed orange juice, which is also another weakness of mine.  There were so many sandwiches that I wanted to try, but I wound up getting a smoked salmon sandwich, which was really tasty plus the fresh squeezed orange juice.  I haven't had that in bit so that made me super happy!  Anyway, I'm definitely coming back.  The table booths/ seating were comfy and cozy.  It felt like a warm, friendly atmosphere.  I felt at home.  And I definitely need to come back to try their other sandwiches like the pastrami sandwich.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I love there bagels for breakfast and brunch ....but I have never tried anything else ...they have soups and sandwiches ...give them a try I highly recommend them ...located near Vanderbilt university!!!Whenever I go here, I have to park on the street with my flashers on...and I worry while I am in there, but I am always getting something to go and they are delightfully fast...so far...NO Problem..I am definitely going to go back and try this restaurant for lunch. They have so many bagel choices..my personal favorites are ONION, EVERYTHING and Originial...but there are other varieties as well to enjoy...Check them out...grab a bagel, coffee or tea and ENJOY!!!

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: Ugh. Not delicious. I ordered their new Thai chicken bagel which was a total mistake. I was the only person in there except for a guy with coffee and a laptop, but my bagel still came out totally burnt from the toaster and missing a key topping (cucumbers). The chicken was processed, too. Not a fan. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but it was not tasty. And it was $7.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: A bagel is a sometimes food for me.  I am not really a bread guy, but I've get a craving for a bagel, probably because my mother ate them.  There's not really any good local places, but there are some decent chains that can handle them.  Until Einstein Brothers gets up to  Nashvillle from Franklin, Breugger's is about the best in town.Their prices are reasonable, nothing great, but they pay attention to your order, and I know that when I order something, it will come out right.  And, as far as Vandy-centric establishments go, it's right there with Chipotle as your safest bet.

reviews.name: Todd H.
reviews.review: I agree with the majority of the commenters here... the staff here is HORRIBLE, starting with the Asst. Manager who lets them be as rude as they want.  You wonder why all of the restaurants nearby are packed and this one is empty.  Don't go.

reviews.name: Marlin M.
reviews.review: The breakfast bagels (specifically the Sriracha Egg Sandwich and the Western) are, as my girlfriend and I would say, mediocre at best (3 stars). Onto the problems:Their espresso machine was "broken" and the bathroom was disgusting. It looked like it hadn't been cleaned or tended to in a few weeks. No paper towels, stopped up toilet filled to the brim with poo water, and other things you want to see at a restaurant you just ate breakfast at. Would not visit again.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: "It's Brueggers....how bad can it be?" you might ask.  While you may be thinking it in your head, their staff is busy taking this as a personal challenge to make you the most disgusting sloppy sandwiches and wilty salads that swim in goopy dressing.  The cookies and other baked goods are cement stale, the place is like a zillion degrees and if you are looking for some sort of soup/salad combination, just get a salad because they drowned it in so much dressing it becomes a liquid any how. The only imaginable upside to this place should be the price, but they are tricky here as well.  You are pretty much going to pay the same price as you would at Panera.  On the plus side, apparently folks have caught on that this place is skeazy, so you won't have a problem finding a seat and the WiFi is free so you can sit and find a new restaurant nearby based on positive Yelp reviews.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: 2013/016Disclaimer: I have made my own bagels in the past, only to have native New Yorkers tell me that real bagels are made with New York water. I stopped making them because you really do need the time to boil the bagels before baking them. And I was not about to import NY water, either, just to satisfy the palate of a few transplants.So, I rarely order bagels. Plus, they are "heavy" bread to me and make me full far longer than I want them to.I came into Bruegger's expecting them to be an Einstein's or other bagel place back home. And they certainly seemed like it. They offer both sweet and savory bagels, and sweet or savory cream cheese. They offer breakfast and lunch sandwiches made with bagels (of course). They offer coffee.I made the mistake of ordering a savory bagel (everything) with a sweet cream cheese (Vermont maple). I realized my error when I took a bite with onion bits mixed in with a sweet cream cheese. It was not very good together. That was my mistake. I'm sure separately or with matching cheese, they would be delicious. The place had plenty of seating. And free wifi. Lots of students studying here, since it's right across from campus. The cheap bagels make for a cheap lunch or breakfast, perfect for a student budget. It got busy really quickly during lunch time.

reviews.name: Ruth L.
reviews.review: great quality food. staff sometimes leave something to be desired. they have 1 hour parking behind them in the garage. sometimes the lines can be huge so don't go if you are in a hurry but if you have time they are awesome

reviews.name: Cory S.
reviews.review: The wife and I met a friend in town for a convention for an early breakfast this morning... We don't get downtown much (shame on us), but easily found the place and parked.. They have a good amount of street parking nearby, making parking relatively easy... It was early on a saturday morning, so I'm sure that worked to our advantage. This was our first time at a Bruegger's, the attentive and friendly staff helped describe their favorites and what they thought we may like.  We ended up keeping it relatively light with a couple sausage and cheese bagel sandwiches.  I had it on a wheat bagel; the bagel was pretty good... I'm not a fan of the large piece of the wheat and other grains in my bagel; but this one was done well, not too much and it had a good texture.  The sausage was good, had a little spice to keep it from being bland.  The service was great, we sat and chatted for about an hour without interruption and were able to enjoy ourselves as they place was pretty quiet.  Next time we see one, we will swing by as there are some other bagels i'd like to try.

reviews.name: Ruben M.
reviews.review: Great nice place near vandy.. once again they accept vandy cards!Great food and nice staff

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: A decent place for a quickie breakfast and coffee in the morning but otherwise a standard bagel chain for lunch or snacks. Located across from Vanderbilt's campus makes Bruegger's a hot commodity. I learned today that in effort to minimize caloric intake, Bruegger's offers a "skinny" bagel. For 200 calories, any bagel is basically cut in thirds where you, the customer get the top and bottom while the middle is thrown away or given to you to share with a friend. Overall I applaud the option. Further, on Wednesday they have a running special of a dozen bagels for six bucks! Can't beat that deal.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: I love Brueggers. They are my favorite bagels. This location was packed on a Sunday morning with college students hung-over from the night before. The staff kept the line moving quickly though. The everything bagel and veggie cream cheese were perfect!

reviews.name: Tamesha D.
reviews.review: Great option for a quick, simple breakfast or lunch. As a student I've eaten here many times over the years and the service is always friendly. It's right next to campus so a lot busier during the school year than in the summer. My faves are the chicken spaetzle soup and cinnamon raisin bagels. Muffins are good, too.

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: Apparently, Bruegger's is a national chain.  This is a fact of which (until recently) I was not aware.  However, due to a lack of complete saturation by Bruegger's and the fact that I (and several of my friends) had never heard of the place before, I figure a brief review couldn't hurt.This place is pretty tasty.  Their soups are delicious and their sandwiches are unique and typically great.  Last time I stopped in, I ordered an "Herby Turkey" and was swiftly informed that they were out of turkey breast.  This was a little disappointing, but my meal was still good.  They make your food for you while you wait, and the staff seems to be mostly nice.  It's very clean and service is quick; it's a bit like a smaller Panera Bread.It's in a prime location, though it's likely you'll find yourself amidst a swarm of WASPy Vandy students.  Regardless, it's relatively inexpensive and a good spot for a quick lunch.  I recommend it.

reviews.name: Ellis V.
reviews.review: I visit every time Im looking for a good bagel(at least twice a week) and have NEVER had a bad meal there. I've always been treated quite nice and the staff, when asked, have always provided excellent advice on what to do with "home baking". I definitely recommend a visit.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: My favorite thing about this place is that you can park in the garage for the building. I've never had a problem in there and unlike all the other restaurants in this area. I'm also in love with their Sun Dried Tomato bagels. They. Are. So. Yummy. Their bagels are different than, say Panera. They aren't greasy, but they kind of look it. They're savory as well. I like.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Bruegger's Bagels is a great spot to grab a quick snack between classes. Located directly behind the Vanderbilt library it has saved me from going into a lack of food coma many a times. I don't think there is anything particularly unique about this bagel shop, but I can say that all of their bagels and spreads are always fresh and quite tasty. The do have a great variety of cream cheese options that taste just fantastic on a toasted bagel. If you aren't parked on campus already, however, trying to head to Bruegger's can be annoying since your only options are to either park on the street that never has any open spots of in the parking garage that has very few public non pay spots. Bruegger's is also a great spot to do some studying and people watch!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: I must say, the bagels at Bruegger's are something I look forward to in the mornings when I am up early enough to grab breakfast before work.  They do a great job of making a bagel that is chewy, but not too doughy.  Of course no bagel is complete without crème cheese and Bruegger's has around ten different types to choose from.  I recommend the bacon scallion because it both delicious and satisfying when your starving and in a hurry.  You must plan accordingly if you desire a bagel before work because it is located right next to Vanderbilt, thus it is usually over run by college kids in the mornings, so there can be a bit of a wait.

reviews.name: Lauren A.
reviews.review: I was torn between giving 3 and 4 stars.  I give them 4 because I like their bagels, and the amount of options... and during the fall, you get to have pumpkin cream cheese, pumpkin spice coffee, and baked apple bagels..  and they also sell day old bagels for $2.50 a pack (which has around 6 bagels in a pack).  I want to give them 3 because the service - well, lets just say they tend to have high school students or people who generally don't care about their job running the counter... And this goes for all the locations, not just the one on 21st.  I also noticed, and maybe this was just a fluke, but their basket of day old bagels - well, 3 or 4 of the bags were ripped open and falling out into the basket, so I could only grab one of the bags that wasn't torn.  And I've also had better coffee (granted I can't expect amazing coffee from a chain)So yeah I guess I'm a little picky, but hey I did outweigh the options and go for 4 stars, so at least I was nice.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Bruegger's Bagels are the biggest bagel bakers in Nashville.  Across from Vanderbilt, this location serves both the Vandy community and also regular midtown folk who crave a fresh no-preservative bagel sandwich.

reviews.name: Brett B.
reviews.review: Good spot stopped in unplanned was surprised on entry has a nicer set up inside better than expected they also have a lot of grill and seafood options had the Milanesa thin fried beef 1st time trying it and was impressed, they also passed the chips and salsa test   Which is important not great salsa but good enough

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: Las Cazuelas is great for its 2-for-1 margarita specials on Tuesdays, and the margaritas are pretty cheap to begin with ($5 each). Also, Las Cazuelas is great for large groups, especially in its more private annex towards the back. You can also see a bunch of regulars at the bar watching the fútbol games, so this is a great place to watch FIFA.I definitely recommend the tacos auténticos here, and I rank their tacos higher than the more hipster Local Taco. Their tacos are just as  tacos auténticos should be: simple, flavorful, and only sparsely dressed-up to highlight the taste of its ingredients.Otherwise, I am not a huge fan of their food. The quality is pretty mediocre even on the scale of cheap Mexican food, which is said because Las Cazuelas honestly tries to be authentic in its offerings. I don't think I would ever dare to eat anything seafood in this place, especially not the oysters on the menu. Also, the taco salad is more of a taco soup with its watered down dressing. If you must have dessert, go for the churros which are a pretty good deal, but stay away from the underwhelming flan and sopapillas.All-in-all, come for the cheap margaritas and the cheap food. If you know even a little bit of Spanish, you would be better off since the waitstaff seems to have a revolving door.

reviews.name: Carly B.
reviews.review: Moving from the land of tacos (San Diego) to Nashville was like loosing a piece of my soul. For the first time in my young life I realized that not everyone has a delicious taco shop within walking distance of their home, work, school, salon, dentist, grocery store, gas station, hardware store... Finding Las Cazuelas was like stealing a small piece of my sad, lost soul back. Great guacamole, flavorful salsa, giant margaritas and bomb tacos all complete with slow service in a sketch strip mall. Why hello heaven, I sure did miss you.The place is much larger than it looks from the outside. Tacos authenticos, guacamole, taquitos & the mixed meat quesadilla are my favorites. Order a margarita and have a DD at the ready as they do not skimp on booze.

reviews.name: Tom J.
reviews.review: I've eaten here 3 times. It's an OK chips & salsa type Mexican restaurant for most people's tastes, a slight cut above the local chains (El Ranchero, La Hacienda, Las Palmas). They do have some breakfast items such as Huevos Rancheros and Huevos Divorciados. Food is on the bland side, but I think that's considered a good thing in Nashville.

reviews.name: Matt S.
reviews.review: I love this place. The vibe feels authentic, and the food is a breath of fresh air compared to a lot of the more "American-ized" Mexican restaurants in town. The staff was courteous and timely, the wait was short and my meal was genuinely very good. I got a burrito, it was a very large portion but I didn't feel sick after eating every last bite! Only four stars because it hasn't quite blown me away yet, but it's a very good, reasonably priced place to eat.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: The food is quite good. The best caldo de res (my husband swears) and the best flan (I swear) in town. They have horchata. I have to mention that because many Mexican restaurants don't have it (weird, I know). The only bad thing in here is service. And they don't have hot tea. They also have mexican ranchera music playing and karaoke on week end nights. I hate that, so I avoid coming at that time. By the way, caldo de res is on week ends only.Also, it's a place to go if you want to watch a soccer game in a crowd. They have a projector tv for that.

reviews.name: Tricia S.
reviews.review: I just left this place! Had ceviche. Was horrible and I found a bug in my food. My waitress was too busy flirting with all the men at the bar. Had to wait 15 minutes for her to bring my drink that was warming at  the bar. Even caught the bar tender drinking out of one of the patrons drinks. My waitress brought my check and never return for payment. Worse service I've ever received. I'll never return to this hell!

reviews.name: Chris F.
reviews.review: This place was very good. We got the carnitas "tacos autenticos" and the meat was tender and it was generous portions. The prices were very reasonable. They also had a free salsa bar. (We went on a Saturday for lunch) We will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Joseph P.
reviews.review: This place is pretty authentic. Complete with sunday live music. I am typically the only white guy in the place- how can you not love that. The pitcher's of margarita are strong and tall.

reviews.name: Becky R.
reviews.review: Awesome Mexican food and the Sangria is delish... We had the tacos al carbon and pollo loco, guacamole was fresh. Prices are reasonable.

reviews.name: Adam V.
reviews.review: Las Cazuelas is right by the park where I play softball.  It's a quick, affordable spot to grab a bite when coming home after my games.From the outside, it is a bit sketchy.  The lot is busted up and there are random people just milling around everywhere.  I'd recommend the buddy system.  Still, the inside is not bad.  They have a decent sized bar area and there is a ton of seating.  It's quite nice.I've been here three times and the food is weak.  It's hard to mess up tortillas with meat, cheese, and beans, but they get close.  On my last visit, my wife ordered a cheese burrito with red sauce.  She basically got a tortilla that was covered in cheese dip.  I had the nachos and they were pretty good.  One item did make me a bit nervous.  We found part of a chip in the salsa.  Are they reusing salsa from other tables?  Don't think about it.People watching here is interesting.  Nolensville Road has quite a culture and it it is on display in full effect at the little Mexican joint.  Las Cazuelas is ok.  It's not the greatest Mexican spot around, but it will do the job in a pinch.  I generally like all non-chain Mexican restaurants about the same, but this one is a notch below most.

reviews.name: Nicole P.
reviews.review: With all of the choices for Mexican food along Nolensville Road, and basing this off of the ridiculous amount of Mexican restaurants I frequent in order to fulfill my south-of-the-border cravings, I'm led to knock two stars off of my Laz Cazuelas experience due to things I should be able to expect:-1 star: Above average prices. One of the best things about Mexican food is how affordable it is. If you're going to charge more, you better be making something special that sets you apart. While your steak with verde salsa dish ($13) was delicious, canned refried beans and bland rice do not justify the cost.-2 stars: Terrible service. Not friendly, not attentive, and apparently not fond of giving refills or delivering the check less than 10 minutes after the meal is finished. There were at least 4 servers working and only about 10 tables filled in the whole restaurant, so I don't think I'm being unreasonable with my expectation of something resembling courtesy.BUT I'll give one on those stars back for having above average salsa and a diverse menu including more traditional dishes.Would I go back? Maybe, but probably only for lunch.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: First time here. I enjoyed the food.I ordered 2 crispy taco with beans and rice on the sidevery good, it also had chips and salsa, the order was to go..so with tips and taxes spent $8

reviews.name: Doris C.
reviews.review: The food excellent fast,hot and more than enough to eat for lunch.  I recommend trying it out.

reviews.name: Briana P.
reviews.review: We tried this place on a whim - we were hungry and stuck in traffic on Nolensville.  My wife used her phone to find nearby places, and this one mentioned oysters/seafood on the Google entry so we went in (she doesn't like Americanized Mexican).  So glad we did!  There were a number of people there on a Thursday around 6:00 - probably 10 other tables.  The outside definitely looks run-down and sketchy, but it's much nicer inside, and bigger than you'd expect.  Food was delicious.  I had one of the specials, a seafood platter - a ton of food and all of it perfectly cooked.  My wife had sopa de mariscos, which was outstanding.  Different types of whitefish, oysters, imitation crab and a crab leg in a flavorful broth.  Standard chips and salsa come with the meal.  They did have oysters on the half shell, but we didn't get them - this time.  Will definitely go back.

reviews.name: Denese B.
reviews.review: In town from California due my father being in hospital across the street from this place. The absolute worst Mexican food and margarita I have ever digested. My drink came from a lemonade fountain looking machine. The beans were spoiled. Margaritas have no liquor and if you want liquor pay extra 7 dollars. The burrito was ok. The chips and salsa were good. The service stunk. I am on a airplane twice a week and always eat Mexican food. After 27 years of flying I have found the absolute worst Mexican food.

reviews.name: Jigna S.
reviews.review: 2 stars for the poor customer service. Waiter forgot to bring us utensils and we waited for about 10 minutes before she came by again. And they only brought one of the dishes out so we had to wait for another 15 minutes before we could eat. To top it off, who asks if we want more chips and salsa, but then only brings the chips and leaves the salsa bowl empty?? Did we have to clarify that? At a Mexican restaurant?! Food was standard Mexican fare. Plenty of other Mexican restaurants in the area so consider another option.

reviews.name: Brigitte E.
reviews.review: I've only eaten here a handful of times. The food has always been good, though the service can be pretty slow. The biggest problem is that this restaurant is just WAY TOO LOUD. Like unbearably loud. It might not be like that during the day, but at night they have live singers. I don't mind live music, but I wish they would turn it down to a reasonable level. It shouldn't be so loud that your ears are in pain, and you are unable to communicate with the waitress and your company.

reviews.name: McCray D.
reviews.review: Meh. The food here is very bland, the service is terrible, and the music is too loud.

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Good service and it's a place to get your Fiesta on! The server was was great because she was kind, prompt, had a 2 minute touch back after the food drop, and appropriately followed up with bottomless refills of drinks and chips. The salsa served at the table was much more than just canned stewed tomatoes. The free dip was teeming with onions, cilantro, and heat. The potent kick of heat that made me slap my dining companion was in hopes of relieving some of the ecstatic joy of having good salsa! The American style Mexican food is typical to most of the other Mexican restaurants in the area. But, their more authentic dishes are wonderful and deserve exploration. My Californian palate seems to think the beans in the area are lacking the flavor and consistency that I am used to. But, alas, I am not in Cali anymore. The Taquitos de Mexicana de Pollo (American Style) is fancy chicken taco rolled and fried served with beans, rice, and salad. It's comfort food and very good. The dining room is clean and reflects the pride the staff has in their place and is ready for a fiesta! The chairs are covered with nice leather and the frame is comprised of twigs and bent wood. The rustic style chairs match the terra cotta tiled floors and accented with similar accessories. The walls are covered in vibrant paintings. The stage in the corner is made of pine rails and is big enough to hold a good sized band. With a shove a table here and there, the dance floor could be ready for some action. The ambience of this place is great.

reviews.name: Ozro D.
reviews.review: Las Cazuelas is one of many, many Mexican restaurants on Nolensville Rd. I've been to about a dozen of them - most of which are hole in the walls - and this is the one I find myself returning to... every week. We come here every Friday night and we haven't found a reason yet to break tradition.The food is outstanding - probably the best Mexican I've found in town. One member of our group claims it's the best he's ever had, but - as a Texan - I can't endorse that opinion. By this point, I've tried most of the menu. Nothing has disappointed yet.For the hungry - I recommend the fajita quesadilla. It's a huge, well stuffed quesadilla that always satisfies. Or for the timid, feel free to split it into two meals.For the budget conscious - go for the chicken tacos. Though it's an appetizer, I've had this as my meal several times. $5 for a huge plate of chicken nachos that is never easy to finish.And fulfilling a major requirement of Mexican restaurants, the margaritas are great too. A few pitchers around the table works every time.If there's a downside, it's the service. They're not terribly fast, and they get orders wrong with surprising frequency; though, they're pretty quick with chips and salsa refills, which helps alleviate the long wait for food. And now that we've become regulars, they always seem to enjoy us.Others might see the noise level as a drawback, but I love it. It is always loud here, as there are typically several large groups seated around the restaurant. And starting at 9:00 on Friday nights, they've got karaoke, which is LOUD.For a great group place and good mexican in general, Las Cazuelas does exactly what it needs to. The quality of food and group accessibility more than makes up for any shortcomings it may have.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: I'm not big on Mexican food so this may or may not be a big help..;(The Good:  From the outside appearance you can't tell how big or small this establishment is, its a pretty good size equipped with a karaoke stage, and two bars with other TVs scattered throughout the joint. Plenty of room to seat any size party you have. Now as for the food I must say i enjoyed it! I had fajitas(chicken) which came on a very hot plate like it should with rice & beans. Sweet tea was made just like most black folks like it..sweet as hell!!  and that is right up my alley!;) Waiter was prompt, and gave descriptions of what each item on the menu we asked about.  The Bad: Not much to say about bad, its one of those diamond in the rough places that you don't want everyone to know about because its so good!

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Las Cazuelas is located on Nolensville Road in the same strip mall as the post office which is very close to Southern Hills Hospital.  This is not the typical run-of-the-mill Nashville Mexican restaurant.  They feature a lot of items I have never seen on any of the menus as most other local Mexican joints.  Sure they have fajitas, tacos, burritos, etc. but they have a whole lot more to choose from.  I have been there twice and totally love it.  The food is delicious and flavorful.   The servers really hustle and are attentive to your needs.  The restaurant is much larger inside than it looks from the outside and there is a nice bar and a large party room in the back.  On Saturday nights, they have a band that plays traditional Mexican music.   If you want to be serenaded, the band will play at your table for a price.  Las Cazuelas is now my favorite Mexican restaurant here in Nashville.

reviews.name: C. N.
reviews.review: This place is awesome!!!!  We came in on a Sunday, during a World Cup game.  It was awesome! They had a huge projector right in the front of the restaurant.  The guacamole was delicious and original.  It was served in a real Mexican Molcajete, it was a huge portion. I had a fish soup which was wonderful. It came with bread or tortillas. I got bread and it was a huge portion. Enough for me my husband and son.  My husband had a veggie burrito which was good. The chips and salsa were good and the service was great. We never had to ask for refills.  This is a great place that I will definitely come back to.

reviews.name: Joshua B.
reviews.review: Ok, I'll admit - I was scared to try this place.  It looks SKETCHY from the outside.  I wanted to turn around and go - and almost did.  My friends convinced me to give it a try.  I did and - I have to say - I'm fairly impressed.The service was great, the food was excellent and the salsa had just the right amount of heat and chunkiness (I hate overly chunky or too smooth - it was just right).  When we arrived they put together a table for us (there were 6 of us) very quickly and brought us Chips and Salsa, Pistachios and Peanuts.  I thought the pistachios and peanuts were odd to bring out - but, we ate them up!  I ended up getting the beef chimichanga with rice and refried beans.  It was very good - one of the better chimi's I've had in a while, actually.  The Margaritas were also very good!  I mean, if you are going to have Mexican food - you have to have a margarita with the meal, right?  All in all - I was pleasantly surprised that the inside didn't match the outside and the food was very, very good.  I guess the old saying 'Don't judge a Mexican restaurant by the parking lot" really held up this time.  What?  What do you mean that isn't how the saying goes?!  Well, maybe it should!

reviews.name: Ashley M.
reviews.review: I came in craving just cheese dip, salsa, & chips. I have came here a few times before & it was decent. Nothing that great or special & I had the same waitress both times. She barely ever came to check on us or the food. It took forever for my boyfriend to get 4 tacos. I had my plate & ate it all before he even got his. That's ridiculous. Back to the cheese dip & salsa. Well I came in wanting to get a carry out order for cheese dip & salsa. I told them at the counter what I wanted & they handed me a ticket. It said 8.50. I asked the lady what it was & she said chips supreme, or something like that. I told her that all I wanted was a cheese dip & salsa. She then stared at me with a rude look on her face & rang it up again. It still came out to be 5.95 or something including the "carry-out fee" of like 75 cents! It was ridiculous. It took like 20 minutes just for the woman to bring out my order & when it finally arrived I had the chips & salsa along with one very small half-filled bag of chips. I looked at her & asked politely if I could have one more bag of chips. Come on! Everyone who eats at mexican restaurants knows that if you get a cheese dip you go through at LEAST 3 baskets of chips. Well, she glared at me & said no you cannot. I looked at her & then at the manager next to her. I pulled out the half filled bag of chips & said " I paid almost 6 dollars for a cheese dip & I'm not leaving until I get another bag of flipping chips " well the manager then said to her, in Spanish, " give her another bag " & I guess he assumed since I'm American I don't speak Spanish. "Errrrr, wrong!" I speak fluent Spanish. She stared at me, yet again, & then went to grab me another bag of chips. She came back out & literally slung the chips at me. It was extremely rude & I will not go back there anytime soon.

reviews.name: Kate S.
reviews.review: Big fan of this place. I get the Grilled Gringa Quesadilla (al pastor) just about every time. Large portion, great flavor. Boyfriend loves the Nachos Jaliscos. Everyone always raves about Mexican joints but this is the real deal. Great prices, very fast service. I've probably been here ten times since moving to the area and never had a bad experience with the food or service.Only reason they get 4/5 is because the music on stage can be very loud and I have no idea which nights they have a live band. Sometimes it catches me off guard when I go in expecting to have a regular meal and it's a Mexican dance party with accordions and sombreros. (Sunday night? Weird.)

reviews.name: Whitney P.
reviews.review: Great food and atmosphere! Such a find!

reviews.name: Darien K.
reviews.review: Went here on a recommendation from a friend. Chips and salsa were bland. Cheese enchiladas were standard Nashville crap. Fajitas were tasteless. Beans came from a can and they used cheap ingredients.  Oh well.  This is just another example of poor Nashville Mexican food.

reviews.name: Christopher W.
reviews.review: I live in the "little Mexico" part of town that Las Cazuelas is located and it's by far the best spot.
