We were given bottled waters - which we didn't realize we would get charged for, because who pays for water at a restaurant? We thought the bottles were just a friendly touch for festival attendees to be able to carry out with them, but our check let us know they were an unspoken up-charge. About halfway in to our first mimosa, we decided we actually just wanted the one drink each and asked our waitress to change our order in the system from bottomless to just one. She checked with her manager and told us that it wasn't possible to change the order. Having worked at restaurants, I know it is definitely possible to make a change like that to an order. The egg sandwich tasted good and was the only saving grace from the experience - until I went to the restroom and along the way saw the chef in the kitchen flipping fried eggs with his bare hands. When we were about to leave, it started pouring outside, and the manager was standing on the covered patio barking at pedestrians who wanted shelter from the 10-minute storm that they couldn't come in if they weren't paying customers. Amid that, my sister and I stood there waiting out the rain and I took out our water bottles that had been in my purse. The manager saw me and immediately started yelling at me that outside beverages were strictly not allowed in the restaurant because we might be carrying vodka or gin in the bottles. Thumbs up, guy; it's always a good idea to yell at your customers who just overpaid for watered down mimosas and had a below mediocre experience accusing them of sneaking in booze. Overall, worst restaurant I've been to in a very long time.

reviews.name: Brad H.
reviews.review: This place kicked me out tonight. The "owner" came up to me and said I was a "homosexual" and that they don't allow that at the bar. I had done nothing that portrayed a homosexual manner. I went up to the bartender and asked if he was really the "owner" like he claimed to be and she said "no, just ignore him." Then he came up to me and again told me to get out, and the bar tender was like "yeah, you need to leave." The guy continued to harass me and yell at me to get out of "his" bar. I've never been in this situation before and don't plan on ignoring it. Gavin Degraw, who I love, is apparently the actual owner and did NOTHING about it.

reviews.name: Bruno V.
reviews.review: This was the worst service I've ever had. We had items on our bill that never arrived, and when we asked the waiter to remove the items from the bill and that he "Didn't give a sh**." I've never been cussed out at a restaurant, I almost couldn't believe it. Beyond this, food took forever and it was almost impossible to get the attention of the waiter (they were definitely overworked, but why not add a waiter or remove seats if they can't deal with the amount of customers?). When we asked where are food was, he snapped that "everyone here orders food", instead of just telling us an estimate or asking us to wait.I hope this review makes people think twice about going here, it was a terrible experience.

reviews.name: Melissa E.
reviews.review: The waiter was so rude it just ruined our entire experience. As three girls from NYC, we have a pretty high tolerance for rude but having just stepped off the plane, hungry and tired, we were hoping to be welcomed with a little southern hospitality. My one friend forgot her ID. After I and my friend showed our IDs, my friend, desperate for a beer, asked if she could show him a photo of her passport. He said no and I told him she was 25. He still refused (which is fine, I respect that), but what really pissed me off was he patronizingly said "yep, it's the law in the United States. You have to be 21 to drink." Thanks, asshole. I had no clue. He nickel and dimed us for everything. We ordered water and he came back with BOTTLED -- what?! My friend ordered a burger and he charged her for fries (who serves a burger with chips) and asked her what kind of cheese she wanted -- charged for that too. My friend and I split BBQ wings and a veggie burger. Both mediocre. Total tourist trap, rude rude waiter and mediocre food. Bye.

reviews.name: Kristie T.
reviews.review: Strolled in this place on a warmer than usual winter Sunday and ordered some of their chicken nachos.  I was very pleased with them.  There were way more than I could eat and lots of gooey cheese.  I wanted just straight queso, but they didn't carry it so this was the next best choice for me.  My friend ordered chicken and waffles and gave me a few bites.  That chicken was to die for.  Very tender and moist.  I was impressed since I don't normally appreciate white meat pieces.  There were two folks on the stage playing some bluegrassy-country music and they were a joy to watch and listen to.  The wait wasn't too long for the food, but couldn't even get in the place the night before.

reviews.name: JR C.
reviews.review: It seems like there are a lot of very varied experiences and reviews of this place, but I thought it was solid, and as my first Nashville culinary experience, set a high bar.  We ordered the nachos, and I had their burger, which was advertised as being voted the best burger in Nashville.  It did not disappoint.  It was cooked rare, the way I asked, was well seasoned, and was just a damn good burger.  The nachos were pretty solid, albeit small.  I wish we'd have been there for some live music, but it was noon on a Friday, so it wasn't really prime time for bands with day jobs.Prices weren't bad for drinks, service was prompt, and they have a nice beer selection.  I'll come back!

reviews.name: James T.
reviews.review: Wow. I'll add to the punchlines. Please don't waste your money or time here. "We only serve bottled water." I guess the sink doesn't work here. These guys are up-charge champions. The only reason to go here is if every other restaurant around it is closed (which is how we got stuck here.) Mediocre is the kindest description of this food I can come up with. I can't imagine this place will stay open long.

reviews.name: Lee K.
reviews.review: Should've read the reviews!! Everything others say is true. From the mediocre food to the rude service. Seriously....$2 water and up charge for fries when it's already almost $12. BTW-Not "The Best Burger" despite what they write on their chalk board. And while we were there, we watched "management" physically confront and block the way for people that wanted to use the bathroom...even questioning PAYING CUSTOMERS!! What a HORRIBLE place. There a TON of other options downtown...even on either side (Acme/Rock Bottom) and across the street (Hard Rock) of this atrocity...go with those restaurants or ANY other nearby for a better experience.

reviews.name: Thomas B.
reviews.review: Jim hit the nail on the head with the first sentence of his review. "If I could give this place 0 stars I would."The bartender was a really nice guy but the owner or manager is a total jerk. The first annoying thing was they wouldn't serve me a water because its free. I got over it and just ordered a bottle. I was there drinking with two of my friends on a Saturday night around 11 pm. I spent almost $100, which I wouldn't complain about except that the vodka red bull was $11.  When I got a little drunk the owner asked me to leave, which was also fine. I stepped outside to get some air and he followed me and began harassing me. My wife and our friend were pretty sober and assured him I wouldn't throw up or anything and he didn't have to worry. He procceded to call my wife names and was trying his best to pick a fight with me. Glad I had a good night or I would have let the guy have it. Definitely won't be going back. It's dumb that this guy has lost hundreds of dollars amongst my friends. Hope the nice bartender finds a new job.

reviews.name: Karen W.
reviews.review: We just had the best time here! We're from out of state so they let us sample the local beers they had. We also had a great conversation with the bartender and Will. It was a fantastic time and the burgers were amazing! Definitely recommend!

reviews.name: Adam P.
reviews.review: How this place got 2 1/2 stars is beyond me. One of our party received half their order. There was no silverware because it was all in the "dishwasher". What?  We were here in the morning before a Titans game and noticed a huge line outside this place. Turns out it was for a different restaurant. Wish we were that smart. Stay away from here.

reviews.name: Houston A.
reviews.review: I've never written a review before but felt compelled if not even obligated to write this one. STAY AWAY!!! We got here at opening before going to a Titan's game. Our group ordered breakfast which arrived incrementally if at all. As the food arrived we were told to hold on because there was no clean silverware. No Clean Silverware?!?! They just opened! Anyway, do yourself a favor and skip this spot...

reviews.name: Charles R.
reviews.review: Um. The doorman lets me in. I head to the restroom. He grabs me and stops me 1 step from the door to tell me I have to buy things. I don't know if he wanted a credit check, but there's literally 20 Bars I could've stopped in. Meanwhile probably 10 people underage snuck in. This inspired me to drink one beer, average busy bar service nothing more, no personality. And leave. Disappointed.... Was getting my $7 one time ever more important than no extra flushes?

reviews.name: Shaker C.
reviews.review: I have eaten here at least 3 times in past year or so. I always get the same thing, their signature underground burger. Last night was no different. It was just ok. Not good. Not great like it was almost a year ago. Nickel and dimed for fries, cheese, water and get this, the table too! Beer wasn't good and is overpriced. To top it all off, they didn't let us go back inside to use the rest room after spending almost $100 bucks on dinner. Adios. Not more trips to this joint.

reviews.name: Jerry D.
reviews.review: The food is fantastic!  Wonderful selection of wing sauces!  Most important, our server Will who appears to run the place is THE MAN!  Cool patio!  Great music!  I hear they are expanding!Go there NOW and tell Will I sent you!  You're welcome!

reviews.name: Amy B.
reviews.review: I am only giving one star because otherwise Yelp won't let me write a review. Awful. I don't even have articulate words to describe our experience. Just read all of the other awful reviews. They sum it all up. Lesson learned- read the Yelp reviews BEFORE you try a new place.

reviews.name: Jim M.
reviews.review: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. This week marked my second time eating there, and will absolutely be the last.Food:Had the chicken and waffles on my first visit. Chicken was really good, waffles were obviously frozen, bought in bulk from Sysco. This visit I decided to try their burger (which they claim was voted best in Nashville by a local publication. Unfortunately, there is no evidence online that supports that claim. So, liars?)The burger patty itself was good. Quality meat, cooked to order, and decently seasoned. However, there was way way too much arugula, so everything just tasted peppery. Oh, and like onions. Probably because they put 3 rings of raw, red onion cut at least 3/4" thick. Now, I love onions, in any form, on or in pretty much everything. This was overkill and would have rendered the burger inedible if I hadn't removed it.The fries were awful. Limp, soggy, hand cut wayyyyy too thick. The seasoning blend on them were delicious, but I was only able to force myself to eat 2 or 3. I guess that's okay, because I only got seven (7!!!!!) fries in my side order, which I substituted for chips.Which brings me to one of the biggest issues I have with the food: the price. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, with fries. The burger, which is normally $12, became over $18 by the time my bill came. $2 for bacon (that was not good bacon, too thin), $1 for one slice of American Cheese, and $2 extra for the horrendous fries described above.Bar/Booze:The bartender on duty both trips had NO idea what she was doing. Although she was sweet, we caught her consulting her phone and recipes behind the bar to make drinks that, quite frankly, any beginning barkeep should know. I stuck with beer this last time, and while I appreciate their variety of quality beers, $6 for a bottle of local Hefeweizen or $7 for a local Stout? Seriously?Prices:Even for the tourist trap that is Broadway, as touched on above, their prices are ridiculously out of line for the quality, decor, and service. $25+ for a burger, fries, and a (low-gravity) draft beer is robbery.Decor/Interior:Standard dive bar. Decent patio area. Non-smoking inside. Nice sized stage, but no one was playing either time we were there. TVs throughout, most on either sports or soap operas. Restrooms were small but clean. No soap in the men's room. And no paper towels, only a hand drier. Also, the lock doesn't work, apparently.Management/Service:First visit it was slow inside. Us (party of 3) and 2, maybe 3, other tables. Manager(?)/cook and bartender both sitting at the end of the bar, both eating and watching TV. The manager guy was smoking an e-cig and never once washed his hands before going in to the kitchen to (I assume) cook.This second visit I was with 3 other people, all women. The bar was much busier, but we still got our drinks and food withing a decent amount of time. Ended up chatting with the owner and the door guy for a bit. He's the less famous brother of a C-list musician, and boy, is he something else. Alternating between rude and creepy/sexist. I won't delve into details, but suffice to say, this guy should stick to anything other than owning bars.Overall:Food: 3/5Decor/Interior: 2/5Service: 3/5Prices: 0/5Bar/Booze: 2/5AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.Update: After talking with one of my female friends about this place and the review I posted, she told me that Joey, the owner, kept telling her about the expansion they're doing and asked her if she wanted to see the "upstairs". Like I said, creep.Also, this dude mentioned his bar in New York more than once, so I decided to check them out on Yelp. Not only are they closed, but the reviews are pretty comparable to the ones on here. One even mentions their weird door guy, Sasha, by name. He's the guy who stands out front and catcalls women trying to entice people into the venue. I also just noticed this guy is featured on these Yelp reviews for NU. No surprise that they have to have employees leave positive reviews...

reviews.name: Earl B.
reviews.review: We had a great time at National Underground.  The music was good and not too loud.  We sat at the bar and we served right away.  We enjoyed it so much we came back the next day for brunch.  My wife had biscuits and gravy and I had the hamburger.  Both we very good.  We will go back when we are in Nashville.

reviews.name: Sab S.
reviews.review: Weird place with strange vibes BUT had to give them a solid review for great customer service.  My friend lost her Louis Vuitton purse and they found it and returned it! Everything is in was saved! And then my husband forgot his credit card and never closed his tab.. but when we went back the next day, they waited to charge us and were cool.  Nice nice staff!

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: National Underground Club still not paying© craigslist - Map data © OpenStreetMap(google map) (yahoo map)I went by to talk to the new manager about some money that the club, on Broadway, stiffed our band,over a year ago.He wouldn't come talk, nor would he call meThis club is owned by rich artist Gavin McGrawand has a sister club in NYC which is also known for cheating musicianswho worked for themBewareDo not patronize clubs that take advantage of our music people

reviews.name: Jenni D.
reviews.review: Zero stars. You get kicked out by the owner for dancing. If you're I the pedal tavern or sprocket AVOID!!!! No fun, lame entertainment, and the OWNER SUCKS!!!!!! We took 12 people in there during our sprocket rocket bar stop and the OWNER told us to stop dancing because the old people were getting upset. Acme is next door, go there.

reviews.name: Daniella A.
reviews.review: I've never been treated so badly in my life. We ordered a sandwich with bacon and French toast. the sandwich came with no bacon and we told the waiter and after waiting 30 mins for the bacon,  we ate it without the bacon.  The French toast never came,  even after an hour that we were waiting there...  When the check came, it was charging me for the French toast and the additional $2 for the bacon we never ate and waited forever for.  When I asked the waiter to take these two items off my check since they never came,  he laughed at my face and said it was only $10 (and that I was being ridiculous for asking for this...) it wasn't only this,  I can't even put it in writing how awfully disrespected I felt.

reviews.name: Tom B.
reviews.review: Horrible Staff. Horrible Service. Horrible Selection. Horrible music. I would recommend to skip this place. Hopefully it's gone soon

reviews.name: Lauren P.
reviews.review: We were downtown for my best friend's bachelorette party and were headed to another restaurant but the wait was a little long so this place told us we could be seated immediately so we went in.. Needless to say by the score I gave the experience was the worst I have ever had!!First off, it took about 15-20 minutes before someone came to get our drink order. I will say on the menu it tells you it may take awhile to get your food so I am glad it gave a warning. We had a group of 10 and we were there 2 hours before getting our food but we were prepared to wait. Fast forward to the end of the meal. The girl that buses tables came to pick up some plates while we wait to pay the check. I had my arm on the chair beside me and apparently she said "excuse me" a couple of times for me to move it and I didn't hear her. She proceeds to grab my arm and throw it off of the chair. I have never been treated like that in my life in a place of service... When our waiter comes to give the check he tells us our bill is $250 and he can't split checks. Granted we did have 10 people and I understand that BUT they should have told us up front instead of herding us in there and giving us a table. The manager was not willing to work with us and demanding we pay all at once. The food was less than impressive. I ordered a BLT.. pretty hard to mess up but my bread was completely burnt. 2 hours waiting on food for a burnt piece of bread.Looking back we should have waited the hour for the other resturant.

reviews.name: Kate W.
reviews.review: As other reviewers mentioned, the man that I am guessing is the manager  really does spend his time running around harassing customers and yelling at staff. At first we did not realize he worked there as he was wearing an oversized baseball hat, oversized graffiti T-shirt and chains (he looked like he stepped straight out of a rap music video) and when he was not picking fights with customers or staff he was lurking in a corner smoking behind the bar We were waiting in line for acme and saw this place didn't have a line or a cover so we decided to give it a try. We were a group of 4       professionals and their spouses and we spent quite a lot of money ordering drinks before we sat down in a corner of the bar to quietly mind our own business and listen to the music. The place is nothing special but our drinks were only watered down the normal about for broadway and the band was decent. Not 15 minutes into our visit this manager physically grabbed me by the arm as I was walking to the restroom and proceeded to yell at me, refusing to let go of my arm. Since he was dressed like a gangster rather than an employee and I couldn't hear what he was shouting I just broke free and ran away from him ... but he followed me back to my group and started physically assaulting other members of my group and yelling at them. It turns out that one of us had a small water bottle with them and he was trying to take it away because, as other reviewers mentioned, this place charges for water, even if you just spent a ton of money buying top shelf liquor. When he was done berating and assaulting us he grabbed the water bottle from the table and wandered outside with it. While we awkwardly finished our drinks we watched him yell at other customers and his bartenders. We left as quickly as possible and will never ever return. I hope someone sues him for assault.

reviews.name: S B.
reviews.review: Don't do it. One star because our server was lovely.   Otherwise do not come here.  Overpriced.  Had to ask manager if I could have cheese on the side - good news he decided he'd allow it tonight.  I cook better than this place.

reviews.name: Jill S.
reviews.review: Hopped in here on a 2nd trip to Nashville. Was harassed by a worker about using the bathroom first before buying a drink. I thought it was odd. He continued until my friend gave her credit card up to buy a drink. He still continued and lectured me after I got out of the bathroom. I find the place rude and won't be coming back.

reviews.name: Laura V.
reviews.review: We stopped into National Underground as an option on the Nashville Pedal Tour.  As I was ordering a beer - I was told by one of my girl friends that we needed to go because the manager came over to them and said in an extremely rude tone "come on girls, get out of line for the bathroom and get a beer."  Being that my family has been in the hospitality industry for over 25 years, I kindly went up to the man, asked him his role and let him know that he now lost 8 patrons of the restaurant who were going to be spending a lot of money.  He backed up what he said by saying "we were at a tourist spot on a Friday night" (mind you, the place was empty and it was 8:30 p.m. We left and went to Bootleggers next door, which was awesome! We later walked past, the bouncer said "best live music in Nashville" I looked inside, there were about 10 people inside - and I notion to the manager and said - "Worst GM in Nashville right there."needless to say, I would NEVER recommend going there to anyone I know.  Best part is, this is owned by Gavin Degraw.... who really should take a look at the people who are representing him.

reviews.name: Jen W.
reviews.review: The only reason this place gets one star is because our waitress was great. The food, however, is terrible. My sister ordered their veggie burger, and after waiting well over 45 minutes, it came out cold. She sent it back, and 10 minutes later it came out rock heard. Literally, you would chip a tooth if you bit into it. Sent it back for a second time, meanwhile, the rest of the party still hadn't received their food! We waited an additional 15-20 minutes , and my "grilled" chicken was overly blackened and dry. They messed up 3 of the 4 side dishes (chips instead of fries). When you order ice water, you get bottled water that they charge $2 for without telling you. After all of the hassle, they did comp our bill $18, but it's not worth the long wait, terrible food, or expensive water. I will never come back and I wouldn't record this place to anyone looking for good food on Nashville.

reviews.name: W H.
reviews.review: Decent spot for drinks before a Saturday football game. Sydney is a great bartender and delivered prompt, polite service. Cocktails were $6 a piece, and the band wasn't bad. Good spot for a quick stop.

reviews.name: Laura G.
reviews.review: This place was disappointing all around. As a local on a Saturday night, we were looking to end the night away from the typical bars and have a couple drinks. As we walked in, we were told from the door guy that we had to buy something and couldn't just use their restroom. The line to Acme was long so I understand that that probably happens a lot. A waitress came up to us on our way to the bar to sit down to make sure that we were also buying something. It was over kill on their part and the service was poor from that point on. Being harassed to pay for something and then having to wait 10 minutes to order an over priced  $7 regular domestic draft beer is too much. Needless to say, I won't return and I'll be sure to pass this experience along.

reviews.name: Denise B.
reviews.review: What a shit show. Waited an hour for food that never came. In the middle of a lovely city this looked cool. What a mistake. Didn't even comp us the iced tea.

reviews.name: Lucy and Hank M.
reviews.review: The Underground burger is the best burger in town!!  Cheese fries are fabulous.  Great service.  Place is a little small but totally worth it for the food and hospitality.

reviews.name: William G.
reviews.review: Extremely slow service, poorly prepared food and over priced. This is what happens when someone wants to play music for a living opens up a restaurant.

reviews.name: Nathan F.
reviews.review: Growing up in the Nashville area, there was one thing that anyone from the area rarely did: go hang out on Broadway.  It's just where the annoying tourists went to buy overpriced cowboy boots and butcher the classic standards at karaoke.  Even though the city has changed a lot since then, it's one thing that remains: there remain very few good reasons to go to Broadway unless you just want to play tourist.  National Underground is one of those reasons, because it's so unlike any other bar on the street.  It's never crowded, it's very 'low-key'.  The bands are very good (the band there when I was last in, Brian Wain's Hushpuppy's Daddy, was phenomenal), I've never had to pay a cover, the beers are reasonably priced, the staff are always exceptionally nice, and it just has a really good non-pretentious vibe that is missing from its neighbors.  I've never had the food, but I am anxious to try it.The reason it's docked a star, then? When you ask for a water, they charge you $2 and give you a 16oz bottle. No bueno, guys.  Fix that, and you'll get five stars.

reviews.name: Gary D.
reviews.review: I loved this place. It's quieter than most other SoBro bars and they have a great burger. Staff was super friendly and the music wasn't country. After honky tonking for two days, a change of pace and style was welcomed. We watched the Hissy Fits play 50's swing rock for over an hour. Definitely going back.

reviews.name: Rachel R.
reviews.review: Living in the Nashville area I've been to my share of eating establishments, from fine dining the the amazing food trucks the area has to offer. With that being said The National Underground has some of the best food I've tasted. From their brunch menu to their chicken nachos and of course the burger! One of the best in town. As for the bartenders and wait staff, can't say anything bad about them from the past three times I've been in. Great live music too. Plenty of variety. Give 'em a try!!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: OK, I've got to downgrade my score a bit after my second experience. Came in with a decent sized group after attending wine on the river, so I must admit that parts of this meal are slightly hazy. However, after doing a bit of detective work, I have pieced together my experience. What I remember: -Ordering a turkey burger and the famous potatoes on the side-Having one well liquor drink-The potatoes being extremely soggy and floppyFast forward to two days later. This is me checking my credit card statement:"Holy $*&^ I spent $50 at National Underground?? How did that happen?"Then the pieces started falling into place. -I picked up the tab for my BF (still. TWO burgers and two drinks- a beer and well vodka should not be $50)-We had to buy BOTTLED water. That cost $2 extra per bottle. -There was an up charge for the potatoes that were floppy and not goodYikes. That's a lot for a drunken meal that I half remember. I had a good experience the first time when I was a bit more coherent, so I'm definitely going to try and be a lot more careful when eating here. If it's late night, I'm choosing Broadway Brewhouse, and next year I think Mexican food is more appropriate for post wine on the river food.

reviews.name: Suzanne K.
reviews.review: Best hamburger ever.  The menu warns that service might be slow, but that was not our experience.  Waitress was attentive and knowledgable, and the entertainment was fantastic.  One of the highlights of our trip into the city!

reviews.name: Dr. Michael C.
reviews.review: Ok, Hot Chicken BUT no tap ice water AND two dollars for a bottle!!  Nuts .. AND we left.. Would not AND will not recommend to anyone.. Go anywhere else for better service . RIPOFF... And I asked twice for tap ice water. Band wasn't a band.. Again go someplace else.

reviews.name: Amanda G.
reviews.review: Stopped in for lunch today! Per Friendly! Good service and the best hamburger I've ever had!

reviews.name: Amber E.
reviews.review: I will never eat here again... let me explain why...I got a hamburger, which was good BUT it certainly wasn't 11 bucks worth. While eating my burger I noticed a funny taste, but it wasn't until my friends pointed out that the ketchup tasted sour. After I finished my burger and my friends talked to the employee, it was decided that the ketchup was indeed EXPIRED. They acted like it was nothing, which worried me to the core. I began to think about the burger I had just ate. If they're not keeping an eye on their ketchup, what else is not up to code?The bartenders overall were a little too relaxed as they tended bar while they ate food on the 'customer side' of the counter. We having to get up and approach the bartender/server for more drinks.The only thing good was the talent. They had a great band playing, but that wont be enough to bring me back.

reviews.name: Krista K.
reviews.review: Worst Moscow mule ever. The "ginger beer" tasted like flat 7-Up. The server just gave us more lime juice to make it "better". Try again...

reviews.name: Buddy P.
reviews.review: Saw some old reviews on here that weren't so great but heard it was redone and much better so I decided to try it. THIS PLACE IS GREAT. It's right on broadway and has a great unique vibe. I had a burger and it was delicious. Can't recommend this place enough. Great beer selection too!

reviews.name: Kathleen S.
reviews.review: We Loved this place. Nice staff, great food and dog friendly patio. Get the Mac and cheese, and the hot chicken sando, Nashville Gem!

reviews.name: Cynthia E.
reviews.review: The most authentic and non-touristy places we visited in this neighborhood. Loved the Hot Chicken and great craft beer selection. Great vibe to the place, awesome band, and friendly door staff. Robert the bartender gave us great suggestions for where else to go (East Nashville, who knew?). Loved this place.

reviews.name: Rhiannon R.
reviews.review: Its a shame that one bachelorette party had a bad experience and the whole group posted one star. The food is so surprisingly good. My friend ordered the grilled romaine salad and I reluctantly tried a bite. It was amazing! I came back the same day and ordered it again. Its simple and amazing.The burgers are great, and the buffalo wings were amazing. They werent friend, they were grilled with lots of meat on them.The service was a little slow - but considering it was a busy Sunday with the Titans/Cowboys game - worth the wait.

reviews.name: Brad M.
reviews.review: I registered just to post this review. This was the single worst restaurant experience I've ever had. I ordered the chili and it came out cold. When I say cold I mean out of the refrigerator cold. Waitress sent it back and it came back scalding hot. On the third bite I was rewarded with a piece of the plastic bag the chili came in. My friend ordered biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were so stale it took effort to cut through it with a knife. One waitress was visibly crying and shaking from being yelled at by an old man whom we later found out was the "manager". That same manager came over and sprayed our table with bleach water immediately after we ordered and said "you're leaving right?" When we said we just ordered he left and didn't wipe up the chemical he sprayed the table with. As other posters have said. No tap water here only bottles water. I very bazaar and disappointing experience. I will never go back and would advise anyone to avoid this place.

reviews.name: Erik Y.
reviews.review: Bad food. Sad service. Only bottled water ( no tap water).Seriously, just walk to ANY other restaurant and you'll be better off.That's all.

reviews.name: Kelly M.
reviews.review: Great drinks, amazing staff, and unbeatable food! The hot chicken sandwich was to die for... Plus they treated my dog like a king!

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: Where to go after the Yelp Helps event? Well, my firend's wife suggested this palce, describing it as an NYC import with  burgers that were simply incredible. I've been to New York, I've had burgers I'll decide if it's got true burger and New York city credentials. After having spent a good time and a decent amount of money there I have to say that burger wise it's a great place for a burger but I have no idea how 'New York' they are. The menu here is simple and uncomplicated, burger, cheeseburger, chicken sandwich. I didn't know about the lack of items and the burger comes with grilled potatoes not fries-which I thought might also be weird and a flop. I was wrong on both counts.The cheeseburger comes with grilled onions and mushrooms no extra charges for anything like that, just added in without a word of it on the menu. Awesome. The burger itself was juicy, flavorful and just making me think about it now makes me want another one. The grilled potatoes were also a winner and were oh so good. I still want to know how a grilled starch can be so moist and tasty and the only complaint I had was that there weren't enough of them, literally like 6 fries (I'm still using the term fries because saying 'grills' just sounds silly.)They also have a menu of Monster mixed drinks, with a variety of different flavored Monster cocktails. I settled on the KAOS Monster (a pineapple/orange variety) with vodka. I also tried the KAOS and rum cocktail-which is an interesting mix on the vodka/pineapple, rum/pineapple. Lastly, our server Kelsey was really awesome and fun and made an already good experience a great one. I'm definitely going to be burgering up here again.

reviews.name: E Bone C.
reviews.review: HORRIBLE SERVICE!! This place has a lot of great things.  Live music, decent food, but the servers are awful.  Situation: brought out everyone's food but one person and didn't even notice.  Took orders for two others that came by later and then claimed their printer paper for receipts was out so the cook never got the order.. Yah right.  I get that it's a bar... But really? Cool place.. Just go for a drink, and then sit at the bar.

reviews.name: Brittney M.
reviews.review: Slow service!!! My whole table ordered waters and were given (and charged for)  bottled water instead of ice water in a glass.  It was only 90 degrees out so we were are all fine w being limited to 16oz of water.  Got the burger every one on here was talking about.  Idk if the waitress asked us for a burger temp as a joke bc everyone at the table received a full cooked, well done burger (I ordered mine medium rare). Wasn't impressed w the whole experience.   Will not return.

reviews.name: Tamera C.
reviews.review: My office is downtown and I am lucky enough to only visit once a week. On that day as many of my team try to go out for lunch together as possible. So there are usually 3-6 people. This past week we decided to try this place out as many of us had not been there. 6 of us in this group and we went a tick early (11:30).Service: Slow, I think the girl working was the only one working the front of the house.The menu is only in chalk on the wall, great if you are facing the wall when you sit down. Seriously get more menus or make it easier to see. It is $2, that is right TWO DOLLARS for water. They won't bring you tap water you have to buy a bottle. Mixed drinks at lunch are $8, EIGHT FREAKING DOLLARS for a drink at lunch on a Tuesday. Tea, coke products and the like are $2 and you get refills. I ordered a cheese burger, medium rare no bun. I got a fairly decently cooked burger with what looked like an American cheese slice on it. I don't mind paying $11 for a burger but seriously this one wasn't worth it. ALL sandwiches come with a small handful of kettle chips (potato chips out of bag). There wasn't a cheese selection, or bread choice etc. There was a stack that contained lettuce, tomato slice, onion and 2 pickles. One person order a side of grilled potatoes and there were maybe 4 slices but she didn't receive her chips with the sandwich. The potatoes are signed as an appetizer so it wasn't fair to not deliver both. Others at the table felt the food was MEH. A lot of folks don't like to spend a bunch of money on lunch, which is why they don't like to eat on that block. But let's compare. National Underground burger $11 + water $2 = $13 plus tip. On the same block burger (bourbon glaze, onion straws and Gorgonzola with fries) $10.95 + water $0  = $10.95 plus tip. Hmm better values can be had elsewhere. I am sad that more places don't give a hoot about folks that are stuck downtown because they work there. This place is catering/charging for the tourist crowd because they can. But here is  the problem, I won't go back and I won't recommend it to anyone. When I schedule an event for Nashville my blog post will reflect my feelings of how places treat the weekday lunch crowd. Maybe they have a killer happy hour, guess I won't know.

reviews.name: Meaghan C.
reviews.review: So they advertise the best burger in Nashville. When it arrived, it looked really pretty but was literally cold and like raw inside. We sent it back and they forgot to make a new one and we had to chase our waiter down, he'd forgotten about us at the table. Never, ever, ever again.

reviews.name: Mele M.
reviews.review: Very inviting from the sidewalk with patio space for us ladies and our pup. The white whiskey moonshine was a good starter on a hot day especially on vaca. The service and food are also worth the trip.

reviews.name: Shauna S.
reviews.review: Terrible Management (Angie)and services was horrible. After 2 hours, and at least 4 conversations with the server, the manager, and other staff, 2 people from our party, never got their food. The manager first told us they would take care of it, 15 minutes later, we asked again and we were told the order had just been put in. Fifteen minute after that, we were told that food takes time and it says that on their menu. Thirty minutes later, we still did not have Nachos and a burger we ordered, while the rest of our party had finished eating. The manager finally said she would take off the burger and nachos from our check, yes, the ones we never got. Then when the server brought us a check, it was the wrong check and when we tried to pay it she all but accused us of trying to pay someone else's check that was less than ours. When we did get the correct check, the burger and nachos were still on their as well as several other things we did not order. We spoke with the manager and she said she would take care of it and when we got another "corrected" check, it still had items on their that were not ours. In the end we wrote on the check and figured it out ourselves, because I don't think the staff would have ever got it correct. Throughout this whole situation, the manager kept saying "I am sorry you feel that way". It was never about how we felt, the hard fact is we did not get our food, the check was incorrect, and the entire time no one apologized for their mistakes. We won't be back.

reviews.name: Erica S.
reviews.review: Eating, I'm sorry, let me rephrase that, "trying to eat" at National Underground was possibly the worst restaurant experience of my life. And apparently I am not the only one who thinks this, as they are lacking income from the public. I know they are lacking income because they have stopped printing menus. You have to get out of your seat to read what it says on the back wall. Further, they are scamming their costumers by not offering water and making you buy a $3 bottle of water to wash down your $12 cocktail-- is that even legal? The servers are dismissive and seem to hate their lives. I don't blame them when they have to come to your table and tell your party, "I'm sorry, it'll be an hour before we can put your food order in the computer, our kitchen is small and can only take 8 orders at a time." And let me finish this off by saying I came here on the night of my bachelorette party. I was looking for a good time, not a terrible time. We had to leave because we did not want to wait an hour for our food order to be put in, among the other annoyances already set in motion. If you are visiting Nashville, please do not eat at this place. Nashville is a great city and I don't want your view of our town tarnished by this disgrace of a place!

reviews.name: Sarah G.
reviews.review: I love beer, food, and music, so this should have been a no brainer. Came here for dinner last Saturday because it was the only place that could accommodate a party of 8.  That should have been our sign.  The guy who waited on us was easily the most surly man I have ever met.  I ordered my burger medium rare with a sunny-side egg.  It came out as charcoal and did not have an egg.  I informed the (equally angry) server who brought our food that I was missing my egg. They brought one out a few minutes later that was so slimy it nearly dripped off the plate.As other reviews have mentioned, when you order water they will bring you a bottle.  I however had no problem telling them that we only wanted tap after he brought out the bottles.Not once at all did they ever apologize for messing up my food order, they never welcomed us to their establishment and they never thanked us or even acknowledged us when we were leaving.  I waited tables for ten years.  So I know what it is like to have the kitchen screw up or to have a bad night, but this was absolutely unacceptable. I hate that I have to give them one star!!  Stay away!!

reviews.name: Kat O.
reviews.review: Tried medium spicy chicken and burned my tongue so badly that I wanted to cry. And I love spicy food. They brought me a second serving of non spicy when I asked though which was ok. Beware when eating chicken even if advertised as medium....it's not.

reviews.name: Keith W.
reviews.review: That was NOT an $11 hamburger. Yesterday I dropped $20 on a beer a soda and a mediocre hamburger. Don't believe the hype, this is NOT the best burger in town.

reviews.name: Ryan O.
reviews.review: Terrible. I'm not a big review person, but I had to write a review on this pathetic excuse of a establishment.Avoid at all cost. Terrible service. Overpriced. Not a good burger.

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: On principal I have to give this place 1 star. I ordered a water with my meal and I was given bottled water... Nothing fancy just typical bottled water. I questioned this in my head but thought, "No way a place like this charges for bottle water." On my bill I was charged $2 for my drink, A little absurd when you are paying at minimum $11 for a mediocre burger with chips as a side and poor service. Over all this may be a good music venue but  a poor restaurant believing the can overcharge due to their location on Broadway. #1 Burger in Nashille... poll was taken by the owner and the owner only I guess. Make a burger yourself, at home, and you've experienced the National Underground.

reviews.name: Kate T.
reviews.review: If I could give this place less than one star, I absolutely would. I'd heard great things about this spot, so when a friends parents were in town, and Dad wanted a burger we figured it'd be a great time to try it! I was actually really excited to try this place, which I think might be part of why the whole thing was so shockingly disappointing. The food wasn't horrible, but was also nothing special. The photos that are posted on this Yelp page, DO NOT represent what I was served. However - it wasn't the food that made the experience so bad, it was the service. First - we were forgotten. There was literally no one else in the restaurant - not one other customer, and yet we still got forgotten, and continually had to get up and go to the bar to ask for drinks, etc. Second - every order was wrong. Which was kind of awesome, because the waitress had insisted that she didn't need to write anything down. Good one. Wrong toppings with the wrong burger, wrong sides, etc. Not one order was  correct. Lastly - and I am not even sure how to categorize this... I asked for lemon for iced tea, and the waitress brought lemon wedges over in her bare hands, and dumped them into mine. I was so shocked that I awkwardly took them, and then set them on a cocktail napkin. I mean... among other things, I think that is probably some kind of a health code violation, right? If I can avoid it, which, i think in Downtown Nashville, I can, I will never, ever go back there.

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: I have been here many times and have yet to have a good experience. The people are completely rude, especially the sound guy and the owner. The only reason I ever go back is when a band I know is playing, and every time I (and the band) wishes they would have not gone. I know someone who use to work here and suggests that I do not eat the food, as it isn't very clean so I definitely avoid that. I know of bands who have come to play here and say they'll never come back to Nashville again because of how they were treated here. That is RIDICULOUS, and so unprofessional. This is Nashville. We want a clean place with good food, good music, and hospitality, not your attitude. No wonder the one in NYC has a hard time finding bands to play....This place is going to run itself in the ground!

reviews.name: Jill R.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times now, and each time I keep hoping it will be better, but it's just not.The food is fine. Not bad, but not great either.  Pretty middle of the road.The service is awful though.  Every server I've had hasn't been rude....they've just been non-existent!  Every time it's the same, it takes forever to even get drinks and then the server disappears completely.  The last time I was in it took 30 minutes to get a grilled cheese sandwich, and there were literally two other tables in the entire place.  That was after waiting 15 minutes for a mixed drink and another 15 to have the server come back and take our orders.  Just ridiculous.I think by now I've finally learned my lesson and won't be back until there's a management or ownership change of some sort.

reviews.name: Caleb S.
reviews.review: This place blows. No tap water. Ordered a sandwich, got a salad. Waitress had a weird demeanor. #1 burger in Nashville? #1 burger in nowhere!!!

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: I wanted to like this place. I really did. It boasts its little reputation of being owned by a famous musician, being a hotspot for local artists, etc., which certainly makes it appealing. But, I will never eat here again. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, which was possibly the saddest, puniest cut of chicken I've ever seen, complete with less-than-fresh greens on the bun. Also included LESS than a handful of kettle chips. For 11 bucks? Are you kidding me? Service was completely sub par. I somehow got roped into getting a bottle of water - I guess I misunderstood over the loud music. Where am I, a sporting event? NIX the stupid bottle, and give me a glass. Its a restaurant for crying out loud. But more importantly, I never once was asked a) how my food was or b) if I needed more water, or ANYthing else for that matter. And there were about 8 people in this entire joint (should have taken the hint). You can make up for crap food with good service, but unfortunately both were crap here.            Now, maybe I made the mistake of ordering a chicken sandwich at a place known for their burgers (or so they say on their sign), but still, this was featured pretty high up on the menu, and that's what I wanted. So if that was terrible as it was, how good can the rest of the menu really be? Nashville is a haven for good food, with a multitude of options. So, go ahead and skip this joke of a restaurant if you find yourself downtown. Cheers! :)

reviews.name: Charlie F.
reviews.review: Our band played a set, they sold tons of beer, then handed us a bill for $44 of burgers we ate that we thought were free. By the way, don't let them fool you, the burgers here suck.  The manager here is a jerk. We came through here and they ripped us off.

reviews.name: Kristin P.
reviews.review: The sign says "#1 burger in Nashville". Should say "worst burger in Nashville".  Gross and dry + stale bread.

reviews.name: Charli J.
reviews.review: At the National Underground, the stage is visible both indoors and outdoors, with seating in both areas.  They offer a full menu all night and although I haven't tried any of their menu options yet, I plan to as this is a great venue for both live music and drink deals; perfect for weeknights downtown or as a first stop for Broadway Bar Hoppin'. This newer venue in the heart of Music City is conveniently located on Broadway, just across from the Hard Rock Cafe and numerous parking lots.

reviews.name: Chuck B.
reviews.review: Tasty burger. Thick, juicy, spicy, cooked just right. A little salty. No option for bacon? Staff were super friendly and helpful. Excellent service!

reviews.name: Art Q.
reviews.review: Walking to a neighboring restaurant for lunch, we passed by a sign:"Nashville's #1 Rated Burger"I've gone to a lot of places specifically for things like 'the best burger in town', or '#1 rated burger', and it doesn't take a lot of convincing. So, there I sat a few days later, awaiting this highly sought after ground beef wonder. The service was really good and very friendly, and the overall atmosphere is pretty good, though unmemorable.Then came the burger.It was pretty tasty, though I'm pretty sure their secret is salt. I've definitely had better, in Nashville and elsewhere, but this one had it's own charm (read: salt). I don't always like a ton of salt, but when I do, I'd go to National Underground for a cheeseburger.

reviews.name: Geoff T.
reviews.review: I have to give National Underground a mixed review. As a music venue, they give smaller up-and-coming acts (mostly acoustic or country-leaning) a chance to play live in a part of town that is normally reserved for tourist-snaring country covers or overdone karaoke. The room is small - I'd be surprised if 40 people could fit comfortably - but the sound of the room is respectable. There is never a cover, and most live acts are paid based on the cash bar take. The idea is that bands are paid based on how well they draw and hold paying customers. Luckily, most of the groups I've come to see have not overwhelmed the audience with encouragement to drink more, which is more than I can say for the honkytonks up the road.The food is another story. It's not terrible, but it is overpriced and over-hyped. My biggest pet peeve is the constant message perpetuated by the owners that National Underground has "the best burger in Nashville." It's one thing to make this kind of pompous claim. Delivering on that promise is quite another. The basic cheeseburger is $11, a price which they do not put anywhere on the table card that passes as a menu. It is a big burger, but it's average at best and a little too salty. I also found it very overpriced. If you want a good burger, there are better places in Nashville at the same or less price (Rotier's, Burger Up, the Pharmacy and Belcourt Taps & Tapas, to name a few). The beer prices were high, but they were no worse than any other spot on lower Broadway tourist strip.My bartender was friendly, and she gets a lot of brownie points for customer service. Our bill arrived without any of my girlfriend's order listed (1 burger and 2 beers). I pointed out that it was half of what it should have been, and our bartender thanked me for my honesty. However, she could not find any mention of the second meal and beers in their register, so she comped it. I split the difference with her on the tip, and I'm giving them the third star for the customer-first attitude.The Nashville branch of National Underground is a fairly new music venue, so I am hopeful they will get better once they've worked through the bugs in their system. There's a chance I might give them another shot down the road.

reviews.name: Nick F.
reviews.review: Unfortunately going to have to give a negative review here due to the service or lack thereof by our waitress.We Sat outside, our waitress gave is her name and asked us to holler if we needed anything. This was after I expressed we would be interested in food soon.45min later and after I walked to the window by the kitchen letting several other waitresses know we were outside and wanted to order food. No waitress.When we walked out right in front of her, she didn't even notice us.We came back the next day because we heard this place had the best burgers in town....this time we received excellent service and the food was pretty good

reviews.name: Matthew S.
reviews.review: Best hamburger I have ever had. Takes a while to get, but they grind the meat in house, so it's worth the extra wait. Fantastic service with very sociable staff.

reviews.name: Kevin U.
reviews.review: Got recommended to us by a local. Great location but didn't put much effort into making it a memorable experience for it's guests. The burger was...good, the beer was...good, the service was...just ok. Didn't hate it, didn't love it. If I was walking by, I might stop in for a quick bite but with all the great choices in downtown Nashville...I'll probably look elsewhere next time we are in town.

reviews.name: Thomas V.
reviews.review: They claim to have the #1 Burger in Nashville? Not even close. No option for bacon (some would argue it's not even a burger without that), but that may be because the burger is so incredibly salty that bacon would be overkill. Seriously, there's no flavor on this burger except salt.Throw in a lack of fries and prices that are about double what the food is worth. Honestly, you can get a better tasting burger for half the price at any honky tonk downtown.

reviews.name: Vincent K.
reviews.review: The burgers are good enough in my mind to justify the cost, and I live 4 blocks up the hill... It's nice to get more music variety. I hear that Gavin Degraw owns the place...

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: We really enjoyed the Live Music here, the band Golden State Refugees was fantastic, so was the Cold Beers, Hamburgers and the Service !

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Above average burger. Spicy seasoning, but it tastes great. Side of sauteed potatoes was just ok. Service was great. They were very friendly and on point. I would recommend going. It's a nice addition to the downtown scene.

reviews.name: Mitchell L.
reviews.review: Service was not rude, but was not the most friendly either. The cheeseburger and Bloody Marys more than made up for it. Water consists of a $2 bottle so beware if you're expecting a free drink.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: I went with friends that are musician and were playing.  I got a Tuna Melt and it was okay nothing to complain about for the food.  What I did not appreciate was the drunk sound guy telling me the band sucks and that he hated the lead singer and like to "F@ck with her."  To get a drink I had to walk to the bar, but the bartender was a very sweet girl.

reviews.name: Robin V.
reviews.review: Interesting experience...seated right away outside. Waitress said hello and told us she'd be back to take our drink order in a second. Never saw her again. We waited for about 15 minutes and left. The place wasn't packed or anything. We were told at the CMA Fest that we should definitely try National Underground because they make a mean hamburger. Unfortunately, I cannot review this restaurant for its food - only for its service, or lack thereof. Maybe the CMA Fest has this restaurant overwhelmed. Who knows. This one star review could definitely change next year. That is, if our waitress ever takes our order...

reviews.name: Elle N.
reviews.review: Went to Nashville back in March and this is one of the places we went to a few times. First off I noticed how few people were in here because all the other bars we went to were jam packed. The music was okay but the sound seemed muffled, it had a weird tone. I did not order food but I did notice that they don't list the prices on their tiny menu. My parents really enjoyed the burgers but there was a bit of a wait for the food. But my favorite thing about this place was the National Underground Beer on tap! And the Yuengling Lager on tap! Overall I would say that it is worth a stop in to drink these brews but not so much for the music and food.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: $4 for a bud light? Food is sub-par...the people working there were nice, though! Not their fault that the prices & the food kind of suck.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: True story: the reason I could never be a vegetarian is because I love cheeseburgers too much. Seriously. back in my halcyon teenage youth, I once gave up eating all meat for about 10 months only to be lured back to the darkside by a cheeseburger. So, just know that I take hamburgers very seriously.After reading all these rave reviews about how the burgers at The National Underground were the best in town, I managed to convince my husband to brave the horror that is Broadway after an event at the Frist to try them out. So, obviously a strike against this place right from the get go, because while I'll happily head to East Nashville or Nolensville Road for good grub, I HATE going to Nashville's honkytonk strip. Parking is a pain in the tush, and the parade of humanity that trawls that end of town makes me stabby. But again, I will brave such hardships if the food is good.When we make it to National Underground, we're pretty much the only patrons there so we decide to sit at the bar. There are a few tables littered about, but it's clear that even though food is served here, this place is definitely a bar and a music venue. Much to our chagrin, we got there just in time to catch a solo act who serenaded us with a variety of Billy Joel tunes during our dinner which was really awkward. Nashville is a tough music city so I feel really bad for performers who sign their hearts out to what is essentially an empty room. This guy wasn't bad, but there was a lot of falsetto going on and it was definitely distracting. If you want to catch a show while you eat, this is ideal, but if you have any interest in speaking to your dining companion, this is a big negative. Still, the promise of a cheeseburger kept me strong, despite an intense case of second-degree embarrassment. With all this build up, I suppose it's no surprise the cheeseburgers we got were disappointing and didn't really seem worth the effort. They were certainly massive, as everyone else has pointed out (I only ate half of mine and took the rest to go), and they were juicy too. But were they so juicy because they were also cooked extremely rare, not the medium-rare we had ordered? Perhaps. And were they also over-seasoned (read: salty)? Yes. The buns they were served on were also a travesty as they pretty much disintegrated as soon as we picked up our burgers... I get that burgers aren't dainty food, but these were so messy I almost wanted to ask for a knife and fork. None of these things were deal-breakers, mind, nor were our burgers bad, but for "best" burgers, they could have been better. Probably the thing I remember most about our meal was actually the grilled potato slices that came with our burgers. My husband is a diehard french fry fiend, so I expected him to dismiss the potatoes quickly, but he wound up really enjoying them. Some of my slices were perhaps more charred than I would have preferred, but they were a nice addition.Can I also just say that National Underground employs one of my BIGGEST PET PEEVES? Their food menu has NO PRICES on it!!! I HATE when restaurants have drink menus without prices on them, so it should go without saying that I don't like going to a bar where you have to ask the price of your meal because it's not printed on the menu. It always makes me feel like a cheapskate to have to ask how much something is, but I would be lying if I said I didn't take into account how much things cost when it comes placing my order. I think our burgers wound up cost $10 each, which is fair, but I would have liked to have known this when ordering.All in all, I actually really liked the atmosphere of this place (the twinkle lights around Christmas were a nice touch) either as a bar or as a venue to catch a show. But I don't think I'd go back if eating were my sole goal, because while the food was good, there were a lot of obstacles involved to get it and there are plenty of other places in Nashville that make a better burger without the hassle. If you're going because you want to drink or hear live music, then by all means, the burger is better than most, but it's not the one that will get vegetarians to renounce their convictions.

reviews.name: Spencer S.
reviews.review: I've never had a worse experience at a restaurant/bar.  We sat for at least half an hour before we finally walked to the bar to get some water.  After we returned to the table, we sat for another while before chasing down a server and requesting someone visit our table.  Owner, Rick, approached our table a little while later telling us that he was going to need our table.  We explained that we would LIKE to order food and drinks, but no one would serve us.  He was hateful and walked off as he was on his phone.  We chased down another server and asked again for menus and a chance to place an order.  It was about ten minutes before she made it to our table.  She didn't ask for drink orders, but she did take our food order.  We had to continue to visit the bar for water and drinks, which were forgotten and never arrived most of the time.  Rick brought our baskets of food out to us.  It was incorrect.  He was hateful as usual, put the food down, and walked away.  Our server came over and explained what happened.  Shortly after, while visiting the restroom (our untouched food, drinks, phones, etc were still on the table), our table was bussed and cleaned.  After this, we were missing food and a cell phone.  The servers were less than interested to help, but, after insisting on a tab, had no problem charging us for the food and drinks.  Did I mention that "our" server had since clocked out and was outside counting her tips?  Never found the cell phone... I asked three different servers to look for it, but they were not interested in helping.  WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! It's surreal to even think about things like this happening.  And, the fact that an owner is so hateful and rude is awful.  Why is this place still open?????

reviews.name: Amanda D.
reviews.review: This place is awful. After ordering a cheese basket, we recieved cheese with a a bite out of it. Such a low value of entertainment compared to the rest of the places in nashville.  Service is OK.  Food selection is lacking.  Do not be tricked by the coupons being handed out for 10% off down the street.  Its not worth it!!!

reviews.name: Trish Y.
reviews.review: Burgers are indeed delicious.  We had a wonderful waitress and there was a live band which is common but not at all places.  Very simple menu can put you off at first but biting into the burger takes any doubt away.  Good eats for sure!

reviews.name: Er'yn K.
reviews.review: Really good burger....slightly upset they dont have fries.

reviews.name: Jared B.
reviews.review: I would say I received bad service, but I actually received no service. The burgers are ok, but not nearly worth the price. Past Perfect is a block away and serves much better food for the same money.

reviews.name: Courtney W.
reviews.review: The burgers are incredibly juicy and delicious!! I paid $13 for a plain one which seemed rather pricey to me for a burger. (Especially since I didn't know how much it was until I received the bill. I didn't see a price list anywhere.) There was live music, which was excellent, and the staff was very friendly. Unfortunately she wasn't very attentive to the table. (It was busy though.) It's a small place but it's a really neat place!

reviews.name: Renae V.
reviews.review: Cute little bar. The nights singer reminded me of a young Adele meets Natalie Merchant. She had a great voice and good stage presence. She's a star. The National Underground beer however was no good. Flat and not very tasty. I would check this place out again.

reviews.name: Patti T.
reviews.review: I don't know if the idiots running this place are new or what but they have no clue how to treat paying customers.  We were with the band that was playing and they took our stuff off the table we were sitting at and started moving it because they had a group of people that they wanted to sit there.  If they had asked we would have moved but they just started grabbing our stuff.  The food took forever to get to us and the idiot with the weird glasses kept trying to get us to move even though we had a full table and no food yet.  This place will never get another penny from me.  This is not how you run a business.  While waiting for the bathroom I saw the cook drop the spatula in the floor and then pick it up and used it on someone's food.  He never changed his gloves after touching numerous things in the kitchen. Maybe a call to the health department is in order.  In this day and age they should be kissing the feet of anyone they can get to come into this hell hole.  I know I won't be back.

reviews.name: Stephanie H.
reviews.review: Rude, surly, and unhelpful! Service was not just slow, it was HOSTILE. These people act like you are crashing a private party at their home! Not only did they not apologize for fucking up my order, they acted like I should apologize for asking them to fix it. I spend plenty of time in dive bars with "relaxed" service. But these people were not "relaxed," they were pissed at customers for being there. No wonder we were some of the only people there on a Friday night. Plus, the bathrooms are nasty (even for a bar) and the whole place REEKS of old beer. I could get better food and service at a Quick Trip, and Quick Trip will give you FREE WATER.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Just ate a cheeseburger, travelled it from the National to my office on Broadway and it stayed nice and warm.  The burger was about an inch thick, well cooked and charred on the outside.  Topped with thick yellow cheesey stuff, tomato, grilled and raw onions and a pickle,  The seasoning was a little salty for me, it was the same seasoning on the veggie burger also, next time I' ll decline it.   I had mine wrapped in lettuce and ditched the bun.  $10 a piece good value.  Feels like the sort of burger Cartman would eat and godammit I feel like him right now.  Stuffffed.

reviews.name: Kelsey G.
reviews.review: Best burgers in Nashville! Don't take my word for it, try them for yourself. Come in for a quiet lunch or a rockin' dinner. At least three live bands play every night- sometimes local, sometimes touring. Either way, its a great experience. The servers are friendly and the drinks are strong. This place is an up and coming Nashville gem

reviews.name: StarPower S.
reviews.review: Expected a larger burger for $11. Seasoned very well. Staff was friendly. I ordered a Sex on the Beach and the bartender faked her way through. Pretended she knew how to make one but it was no where close. LOL! Still good, but a totally different drink from what I ordered. Back to the burger...tasty, but not an $11 burger.

reviews.name: Clark T.
reviews.review: The other day some co-workers of mine were craving a burger.  We decided after hearing some rave reviews we would check this place out.  I have been in there before to drink and happened to look at the chalk menu on the wall so I knew what I was going to pay.  Yes, I thought to myself 11 dollars is high for a burger, but what the hell.  I was dissapointed that they didnt have fries.  The burger however was about as well seasoned of a burger as you can get.  Everything about the burger was wonderful.  From the veggies to the cheese I have to give this burger 5 stars.  Since there were no fries the resturant looses a star...  Some people who ordered water had to pay 2 whole dollars for their water just like i did for my coke.  Well boo hoo! Deep down the Michael Shaw's of the world are just going to have to wake up and realize that every resturant isn't mcdonalds where you can have it your way.  Good burgers arent found on value menus!Thanks for the good burger people at underground!Clark

reviews.name: Taylor T.
reviews.review: BEST BURGER IN NASHVILLE. Seriously. I went there one night to listen to a friend play music, and the server claimed, "We have the best burgers in Nashville." I figured she was just saying that because that's her job, but when I saw someone else order a burger (and saw how big and juicy it looked), I decided I needed to give it a try. My mom, sister, and I ordered sliders, and were skeptical at first. We asked our server if the sliders were still juicy (because sometimes sliders can be super dry) and she affirmed, "Yes they are!" And let me tell you, they were. The "sliders" came with 3 mini burgers (decent size for mini burgers) and I ordered mine well done (because I hate if there is any pink inside. The downside is that the burger is usually dry), and too my pleasant surprise, it was incredibly juicy! A well-done burger with no pink in the middle was STILL FREAKIN' JUICY! I was amazed and delighted and smiling and WANTING MORE BURGER. The one downside, in my opinion, is that it doesn't come with "fries" but with these thin potato things, which were a little soggy. I wouldn't say the atmosphere there is anything spectacular, but the burger alone is a good enough reason to stop by.

reviews.name: Greg B.
reviews.review: My gf and I to NU for the first time tonight. Found out about it through DealChicken (Gannett's groupon/livingsocial response). Burgers are big and good (if a little salty) and the house brew washes it down well. Staff was very friendly - talk to the barkeep with the handlebar mustache and he'll tell you about how they grind their own hamburger meat, how they brew the house beer in house, how Gavin DeGraw and family owns the place, and how the kitchen hours are expanding so late night burgers will be available. Besides burgers, the main attraction is the stage. We listened to a great local band called Dan the Torpedoes who were opened by some talented Belmont musicians. The room is fairly small but has a couple flat screens in case a big game is on. No cover on a Wednesday night. Smoke free but not hipster free.

reviews.name: Abdul A.
reviews.review: I've been going to this place for almost 5 years and still one of my favorite places to eat.

reviews.name: George H.
reviews.review: The people who own/run this restaurant are really very nice and the staff is very attentive.I have had both lunch and dinner. I always opt for the buffet at lunch time, because it is both convenient and has everything I want on it. The meat dishes are delicious and the homemade hummus is very tasty. My favorite item is the lentil soup! I promise you that it is the best you have had (if not, please let me know where you can find better).You need to give this place a try!

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: The gyros here are fantastic, much better than Kebab on Thompson Ln in my opinion.  I wish they served Mythos and also wish their tzatziki sause had a bit more dill in it.  Friendly service; great to stop in for lunch.  Fast and inexpensive.

reviews.name: Carr F.
reviews.review: There lunch buffet had a wonderful array of choices. I was very pleased with the flavor and attentiveness of the staff. It was a surprise honestly. Don't judge the quality based off of the exterior of the building. Bathrooms could be updated but overall good.

reviews.name: Christopher C.
reviews.review: As far as I know they are no longer serving hookah. They never got their name out there. Plus they would put their food customers before the hookah fan's.

reviews.name: Aja B.
reviews.review: Love this place. Been going a few years and everything is always fresh and tasty and well priced!

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: Had dinner with one of my galpals on a Friday night. It was pretty empty. The sign is not really well lit so it took a bit of work to find the place. The portions were HUGE for $5.95 -10.95 ... food was pretty good. I would go back if it wasn't all the way in Antioch.

reviews.name: Neil G.
reviews.review: Checked place out after reading reviews here... Food was hot and fresh. The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly. The food was pretty bland and the angus beef was very tough and had a lot of gristle. Not my thing but apparently others like it.

reviews.name: Vj J.
reviews.review: I'm always on the lookout for new middle eastern restaurants in Nashville. I decided to try out their lung buffet. The buffet had all the typical meats you'd expect to find such as chicken kabob, kofta, and lamb gyro. Of course all this is accompanied rice, hummus, and a couple of different vegetables. The food was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I'll definitely be back here with friends again!

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: This place scored well in their health department inspection, so we tried it out! There were very few people there, and the service was very quick. Their homemade lentil soup was great. We also got salmon and chicken kabobs and gyro meat. The meals are huge, so we will definitely split next time. Our main complaint was that there were 2 TVs in there that really take away from dinner. One was up really loud. We'll probably go back though. The prices are nice.

reviews.name: Douglas W.
reviews.review: Recommended by a friend that comes to Nashville a lot, and the recommendation was well worth it. Great atmosphere, not 'snobby' at all, great service from the hostess and I assume the manager, and our server. We enjoy a good dining experience and this place is well worth the hype. Located near Vanderbilt University in a very quite neighborhood.The fried green tomatoes, twice baked potatoes and steaks were great. Our server was attentive but, not 'in your space' attentive. We really enjoyed our evening here. Already talking about coming back for cocktails and desserts, too much food to have dessert this time!Read all the reviews, we experienced everything the good ones have to offer and nothing that the bad ones experienced! Enjoy!

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: Little-known fact: Most teachers do not go into teaching for the money. Hard to believe, given the exorbitant salaries and sweet benefits (you know...sexy cars, free concert tickets, occasionally the chocolate milk that the cafeteria didn't manage to sell that day). Given my bountiful cash, I tend to frequent many expensive restaurants.But seriously. Given how rarely I can afford to go to a restaurant that doesn't feature free chips and salsa, I want to be wowed when I shell out for a meal. And Jimmy Kelly's does require you to shell out. The steak was good. But was it incredible? Was it forty dollars worth of beefy heaven? No. It was good. (The twice-baked potato, however, may have been an ethereal, carb-laden gift from above.) It is also my understanding that the tiny pancake-y bread that is served is also good (not gluten-free though). To be honest, my favorite part of the meal was our server, John, who had the fantastic personality you would expect from a retired guy who's just working because he wants to. We had a jolly old time. But did we have two hundred dollars for four people eating worth of a time? Eh.

reviews.name: Leonard C.
reviews.review: Good service but food quality far below what the price warrants. Wife and I had standard cut filets, which were both almost  completely flavorless. Zero seasoning that we could tell. And dry. Outback makes better steaks for half the cost.  We had the creamed spinach and the spinach was obviously from a can. God help them if that was fresh; they need a new produce guy, if so. I want to reiterate that our service was good and our poor experience with Jimmy Kells's had nothing to do with our server, Bo. He was great. He should work for a better restaurant.

reviews.name: L M.
reviews.review: First, our family of five was there to celebrate a birthday. They seated us in the bar, and when I looked a little displeased the host said "Mam, these are the most sought after tables in the house." So, we took it. It was so loud in there that we could hardly hear each other. The noise really hurt my ears. I think he may have seated us there because we used the ap Open Table to make our reservations. The food was mediocre to say the least. Teeny potion sizes that were overpriced and lacking in flavor. I walked upstairs to the restroom and it was beautiful there, the decor is fabulous, and it was quiet. The food would have been the same, but at least the ambience would have been nicer. Sooooo disappointed. We drove an hour to eat there. We'll cross that off our list--too many fine dining establishments to choose from in Nashville to return there.

reviews.name: Jeff C.
reviews.review: We visited for the first time in seven years.  I was worried by some of the recent posts which were negative.  I think these are folks who don't understand non-corporate or 'old south' dining.Our experience was identical to previous visits and I believe consistent with the JK brand.  The old house has a wonderful charm and atmosphere.  The food and service are outstanding.  This is the kind of place where waiters will work for 20 years.  The little guy behind the bar looks like the guy I remember from the mid 90s.  Many of the servers are old black men whose intimate service and manners are hallmarks of a largely lost era;
