Yankees and liberals may be offended at the degree of deference they show.  Classy southerners will appreciate how things used to be (and should be), when you're paying for excellence.  Their interest in your choice and happiness is not a front, but a sincere desire for your happiness.The Wife had a caprese salad which disappeared quickly and blue cheese stuffed filet which was grilled to perfection, along with the famous twice baked potato, and creme brulee (which she loved).  I had a ceasar salad and asked our waiter, Marcus, to surprise me with an entree.  He brought a perfectly grilled rib eye and twice baked potato.  Delicious, although I have heard amazing things about the sea bass and will try this next time.You can certainly spend less for a decent steak.  You can spend less and have a good time.  But Jimmy Kelly's is the kind of place you take an out of town guest or a business associate whom you'd like to impress, because it's unique, special, memorable and extraordinary.  It's the kind of place where waiters are professionals who are not merely moonlighting between jobs and pandering for a tip but who are true servants and want to make your night out special.  You remember their names and hope they'll be available the next time you visit.I've you've never been here, you must go.  If you're deliberating about where to go for an incredible steak and/or outstanding service, you must go.  The tables are a little close if you're looking for intimacy-ask for upstairs seating if you value privacy-but the ambiance is unbeatable.  Valet parking as well.

reviews.name: Charlie P.
reviews.review: I've been here multiple times, but sadly haven't been in quite some time. I had received a $150 gift certificate and we chose to spend every penny. For starters, Isaac, our waiter, was incredible. Quite honestly one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She had a kettle one martini and I had a scotch. The martini was made perfectly. Our first plate of corn cakes were devoured what seemed like instantaneously. Damn, I had forgotten how good they are. For appetizers, we shared onion rings (I always have gotten them) and blackened catfish. I literally believe it was the best catfish I've ever had. It was not expected. For entrees, she ordered the king filet (so I could have some) and I ordered the salmon (I'm cutting back on red meat :/ ). The filet was delicious and seasoned well. Her salad was fresh and prepared well. The salmon was succulent. As a side, I had a baked potato...boring, but perfectly cooked, nonetheless. For dessert, we shared the chocolate brownie decadence. Damn good. Here's the deal, if you've read any of my reviews, you'll see I'm not a foodie. I like what-you-see-is-what-you-get, which is my perception of Jimmy Kelly's. The food isn't loaded with frills, but everything was great. Additionally, the stand out this evening and every evening is the service and ambience.

reviews.name: Elliott W.
reviews.review: Before Nashville had a Ruth's Chris, Stoney River, Palm, Kayne, Bob's, Cork and Cow, probably even Sperry's, the high end steak option was Jimmy Kelly's. Walking through the doors of Jimmy Kelly's is like walking through a time machine, down to the pink Victorian lamps (including those on the ceiling fan. It's not just dark, it's dim. The shades were drawn in our dining room. I could barely see. The decor could just as readily be a for funeral home as a steak house. I'm sure a former generation would have felt the luxury. Perhaps I missed the memo.I'm torn on the atmosphere. On the one hand, there is a nostalgia for things that don't change. On the other hand, it feels stale. Upgrades are needed, to get back to a sense of luxury. Starting with the air conditioning. Apparently, the central air isn't quite up to par, so a portable unit sat in the corner. It wasn't cutting it either.We were seated in a room with 7 tables, but only two other diners at the beginning of the meal. Sitting right next to us, it was difficult to have a private conversation and felt awkward.Our server had a great sense of humor. I would guess that he's been working at Kelly's for at least 30 years, maybe longer. He was reasonably attentive, without hovering. However the courses came out fast. It seemed rushed. From arrival to leaving we were in and out in 45 minutes. Our meal was delivered before salads were completely finished. We made reservations during restaurant week and took advantage of the 3 course special. The salad was underwhelming. Just a plate of lettuce and shredded carrots with a liberal dousing of vinaigrette. The steak was cooked perfectly, although not seasoned. The baked potato, hot and served with a small cup of sour cream. The apple walnut cobbler was delicious.To sum it it, good, not great. But worth going to for a piece of Nashville history.

reviews.name: Erin C.
reviews.review: Went there for Restaurant Week and was a little disappointed.  They don't season their steaks.  What?  The dessert, though, was great!

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: Good service and cozy atmosphere.  Ordered the Filet rare and it was over cooked.  For the first time ever I sent a steak back and the server was really great about it.  Filet #2 was cooked properly but just wasn't that great.  For $59 I want great.  JKs filet just simply doesn't compare to the likes of Kayne or Prima.

reviews.name: Mark J.
reviews.review: Went here for 50th birthday party while on a visit to Nashville Had 13 people with us We got right in cool place with tight eating areas But it is an old houseOur waiter Arthur was nice and funny We did enjoy his humor !The food was good not great with smaller portions For the expensive price you payArthur screwed up our bottle of wine and brought us the more expensive one When I asked him about this he just said I presented it you.When asked about a lower price on the bottle he just shrugged it off.. We did have a good time and the service was very good so I didn't complain at length about it. I would have given it 5 stars if the food portions were a little bigger

reviews.name: Leslie S.
reviews.review: This business suffered a fire recently and is closed until early August 2015.  It is always a good idea to call for reservations.  :-)

reviews.name: Mandy C.
reviews.review: Old school, old south steakhouse.Food is good - service is good.  No complaints.  I would return possibly if elders were in town for a special occasion.  I'm speaking for the chilean seabass -- interesting, tasty (wine?) sauce they had  on it.  Cornbread "biscuits" (pancakes) served right away were fun and tasty.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: My husband and I decided to go to Nashville to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary in December 2012. I went to great lengths to plan out the perfect anniversary trip. A nice dinner was an absolute must so I did lots of research which led me to Jimmy Kelly's. I made reservations online and stated that this was our 10th anniversary and we were looking forward to a romantic night out. My husband even called to see if they had any "private" rooms available. The gentleman that answered barely spoke English and didn't understand what my husband was asking. We arrived at the restaurant and it looked very nice. The inside was nice and dark. However, I would not say it was romantic. We practically sat on top of 2 other families that were dining on either side of us. It was like they had tried to cram as many tables in one room as possible. We were told the specials of the day, but no other suggestions (like ordering the twice baked potato because otherwise you get a basic potato with nothing on it). We ended up getting filets. I ordered mine medium well after confirming that that meant a light pink strip in the middle. My husband got his medium. When our steaks came out, mine was charred so much that I couldn't eat it and my husbands was borderline rare. He ate his. Afterall, we were paying a pretty penny for these steaks. I emailed the company when we got back from our trip (I've heard too many horror stories about people sending their food back) and posted a review on Trip Advisor. I did not get a response to either. The owner of this restaurant obviously does not care.Two years later, I'm still upset about it...

reviews.name: Emily B.
reviews.review: There was absolutely nothing special about this place. Average steaks, lack luster sides, very high price. We paid 120 dollars for one steak, two sides, and three glasses of wine. It's not worth the time and I'm sure there is better out there.

reviews.name: Alisha W.
reviews.review: First, what's not to love about stepping back in time to dine?  I loved the decorations and the old house.   If you ever go, request Arthur.  He is a peach.  He was so sweet, nice, funny and made the night an experience.  He called us by our names and got to know us during the dinner. He set us up with one of the sweet wine carafe that made the wine even more delicious.  It is just a steak house, and if you are a person who wants all the fancy trimmings on a steak, then why are you eating a fine steak?  When I want a steak, I want it to taste like a steak.  The filet was amazing, so tender and was perfectly cooked.  The only disappointment with the dinner was that you are not able to opt for something other than a baked potato or steak fries.  I would like to see a few other sides such as  a sweet potato or a veggie.  We finished the meal with after dinner drinks and the blackberry cobbler.  It was delicious! :)

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: Jimmy Kelley's is good, overall. The filet mignon was kind of bland. The quality was good but the chef did not marinate the filet very well. The fried oysters are AMAZING, though. The atmosphere is very nice as well. One thing I will say was crappy about the place was the valet service. It was the company with the red jackets. The valet was very rude and made it clear that he was not satisfied with the tip I gave him.  I tipped only $3 because of his rudeness. Anyways, if you go to JK's don't get the filet. My buddy got the Cowboy Steak and that was really good.

reviews.name: John K.
reviews.review: We are travelling across the US and found some good reviews for this restaurant so decided to give it a go. Firstly let me just say that this is not a restaurant that is just about food. It's about a dining experience. On walking in, we were warmly greeted and immediately seated. Our waiter Marcus was extremely professional and yet still very friendly. Just the right balance. He had a very good way of reading his guests and adjusting accordingly. To be honest, he was one of the best waiters I've had in any country... ever!I order the steak and my fiancé ordered the salmon. Both meals were cooked to perfection although the only thing I could say needed improvement was the New York strip I had. A little to much fat and some grizzle along the edges for my personal liking. But it was still a good steak. The sides were good and we also ordered the blackberry cobbler which had a great flavour. All in all, I would recommend this restaurant based on my experience. And remember... like I said... this is about a dining experience rather than just refuelling.

reviews.name: John T.
reviews.review: One of the best dining experiences I've ever had amazing bone in filet mignon small lobster tail that was huge wonderful fried calamari crab cakes and the blackberry cobbler with ice cream just amazing

reviews.name: Mark T.
reviews.review: Just had dinner there and it was one of the best meals I've had in a long, long time. The appetizer, a shrimp cocktail with remoulade sauce, was excellent (and you get 6 of 'em). The salad was fresh and flavorful, with a very good salad dressing. My entrée, a barrel cut filet mignon, was fork tender and delicious. Dessert, service, both excellent. I highly recommend!

reviews.name: Ruth J.
reviews.review: Was this place once a funeral home?  It certainly appeared so when I dined there last night.  From the outside, it appears as a charming, older home, but when you walk through the doors, it has a funky smell like a stale, old house.  We were seated in a room upstairs, and the entire experience was amateurish and didn't feel like a restaurant.  The food's presentation was lacking and odd; the shrimp cocktail was a bowl of ice with 4 overcooked shrimp.  The dinner salad was a mess of lettuce, 2 small cherry tomatoes, and a pool of ranch dressing in the middle. The steaks were not good - not seasoned at all, and for the price, crazy!  Anyone who thinks an unwashed clipping of kale on every entree as a garnish is attractive and appetizing, will enjoy the cafeteria appearance of the food here.The coup de grat was the baked potato on a plate wrapped in foil and served with a disposable, expandable paper cup (the kind you put catsup in at Wendy's) of sourcream  That did it for me. Save your money and go to The Palm, Ruth Chris' or even Morton's.

reviews.name: Carey S.
reviews.review: My brother, who lives in Nashville, suggested this restaurant. I forgot he was the brother who puts ketchup on his ketchup, if you get my drift.  At his house later in the evening, I asked him what he thought of the meal.  He said he thought it was good.  I, however, did not.  The best part of the meal was the martini at the bar.April 29th, Tuesday evening, 7pm reservation, should have been in the heart of the envelope.  Our waiter was fairly attentive, but he was a lot more impressed with the meal and the legacy of Jimmy Kelly's Steakhouse than we were.The salad was very plain, but tasted okay.  The waiter brought out some corn "johnnycakes" with butter, but they were very nearly burned.  (Later, he brought some more that were not overcooked, but the moment was gone...)  My steak was cooked as ordered, but without much seasoning and had a lot of gristle to cut around.  Not a great piece of meat.  I had asked for a side of sauce béarnaise when I ordered the steak, and it wasn't on my plate when it arrived.  I reminded the waiter and he delivered a small sauce cup of sauce that was cold and clearly made from a pre-packaged mix.  Awful.  The baked potato tasted old, like maybe yesterday old, and was not very hot.  I was very disappointed with my meal and my wife was as well, especially for the price of the entrée.  The restaurant has clearly lost its way as a Nashville treasure.  The wonderful building is the only thing they have going for them at this time.  Sorry, bro, we won't be back to this steakhouse.

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: Nashville's oldest and coolest restaurant. Check out the extra cut filet or the bootlegger's ribeye. Most steaks are unseasoned (salt and pepper is all you need for good steak) and I like that because I like the taste of beef. The Chilean sea bass is one of the best seafood dishes ever, and the fried oysters are awesome.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: My wife and I ordered the same filet cut and noticeable difference in both size and quality of the steak.  Mine was about 3-4 oz smaller and had gristle.  I order mine rare + and was a perfect medium rare.  My wife ordered here medium rare and was more medium well.  The waiter was good and very attentive, but mentioned giving him a "good tip" four times throughout the experience.  This turned me off.  We sat upstairs in what used to be a porch and there is no music or any type of ambiance to make this a special place.I really want this place to be better due to it's nostalgia, but other steakhouses in the area are sooo much better.  Kayne Prime for example.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: Excellent all around.  Our waiter was awesome!  I ordered the The 20oz Cowboy Ribeye.  Which i also got the baked potato.  Salad was great. Romaine lettuce covered in their basil vinaigrette.  For dessert, I chose the chocolate decadence.  My meal was outstanding. Steak was "medium" just like I ordered.  No A-1 needed.  Baked potato was served with sour cream and chives.  Just go there and let it kick your ass. 5 stars all the way.

reviews.name: Nichole K.
reviews.review: We went here for my mom's birthday which is on New Years Eve.I adored the atmosphere. I love old houses that are turned into restaurants. The service was outstanding and our server was friendly and had an awesome personality. We started out with an red wine from Australia which was a nice medium body. They serve hot cakes which are tasty instead of bread.We all ordered steak since it is a steak house, and I ordered the filet and lobster. The filet was tender and flavorful and it was a nice portion of a lobster tail. I just wasn't "wowed" by the flavor profile. We finished with coffee with a key lime pie and the brownie topped with ice cream (which was my favorite).It was a nice meal, but it didn't impress me.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: High hope quickly fled.  It's housed in a beautiful southern mansion that founded in 1934.  This places is outdated and seems targeted for the 60+ crowd.  The service was inattentive and lacking quality.  All of the food wasn't seasoned properly.  The website says generous portions of whiskey and that is a lie.  Upon asking the waiter to recommend a wine to pair with the steak, coincidence the most expensive glass was brought out.  Not a fan and won't return, much better steakhouse options in town.

reviews.name: Brent W.
reviews.review: Best Striper Fish I have ever had. I can't say why, the sauce wasn't all that great, but, the fish was cooked just perfect.The fried oysters and calamari was soso, the bacon wrapped jumbo shrimp with BBQ sauce were amazing.

reviews.name: Candice E.
reviews.review: Extremely slow service, waiter got our order wrong.  I Had the bacon wrapped blue cheese stuffed large cut filet w lobster.  The meat was cooked right but the bacon was raw and the lobster was tough not worth 48$.  My friend ordered the small filet w shrimp waiter forgot the shrimp and her filet came out blue cheese stuffed w bacon. Would not recommend this place even though the atmosphere is unique.

reviews.name: Holly T.
reviews.review: First time at Jimmy Kelly's, and had a great experience.  We were 15 minutes early for our reservation, but were seated promptly.  Attentative but unobtrusive service by our informative server added to the experience. The fried oyster appetizer was light, meaty,  and not geasy. The horseradish sauce on the side had good tang without burning. The johnny cakes were fresh, the salads cold, and all of our steaks (cowboy ribeye, filet extra cut,  and half filet) were prepared as ordered.Our visit overall was beyond our expectations. My husband and I are die hard Ruth's Chris fans, but we will be back!

reviews.name: Dew T.
reviews.review: I don't eat steak, so it's always tough for me to find good options at a steak joint. I love Jimmy Kelly's. Truly.Their jumbo shrimp is huge and absolutely delicious. The blackened salmon could be one of the best I've ever had. Their Mac n Cheese - pretty awesome. Finally - the black cobbler dessert; ridiculous. I'll go back for the jumbo shrimp, salmon and black cobbler over and over and over again.Great place for that special night or to take family when their in town. It's really that great.BTW - I've heard that their steak is pretty delicious too, just can't recommend it! :)

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: Out here for a conference and we had a group go here for dinner. Service was great, Robert  was attentive and fun. Had the Kansas City Strip and it was perfect. Building looks like old home turned into restaurant but nice. Would return I when in Nashville again.

reviews.name: Meghan B.
reviews.review: Definitely not worth the price. No flavor--- husbands steak was blah. And yes, I ordered chicken at a steakhouse - but seriously how do you mess up chicken...

reviews.name: Robert V.
reviews.review: Waiter was well mannered.Menu is a bit odd for a nice steakhouse where every entree includes a baked potato, comes out in foil and not so good. I'd rather the usual al a carte to steer you towards side dishes.Bottom line the bone in ribeye "Cowboy Steak" had much more gristle and sinew than is acceptable and considerably shrank down the amount of edible meat. Although cooked to proper medium rare temperature as requested, this steak was near flavorless and quickly resulted in me requesting A1 sauce. Not something you usually need to make it through a "good" steak.Unfortunately, I would not return for another meal.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Jimmy Kelly's reminds me of a place that probably used to be pretty good.  The location is good and the decor is very nice.  When we arrived some of our 11 person party were already there.  I immediately noticed they didn't have drinks... Water.. Napkins... Menu's... Nothing.  So I asked how long have you been here?  They said... Oh about ten minutes... Red flag #1... My wife ended up going to the bar to get drinks for everyone...  Skipping ahead... We were seated in the covered outdoor area... A rain storm blew through leaking water on our table.  When we asked if we could move... The response was that it was leaking worse on the other end of the tent...  Skipping further ahead... We sat down at 6 P.M.  Our entrees arrived at the table at 7:30 P.M.  Finally... after asking for the checks to be separated... we were told that they are too busy on Saturday to separate checks and we would have to figure it out on our own.  I of course objected to this..... and they did end up separating the checks.... BUT MAN... For that kind of a spendy dining experience... You would think they would try a little harder.  Food was actually O.K.  But the experience was less than what I would expect from a nice restaurant.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.name: Tuck L.
reviews.review: After reading the negative reviews here, there isn't much I can add.  It's all true.  But it is sad.  I was telling a friend recently that Jimmy Kelly's is great because they have professional waiters.  These aren't college students or struggling songwriters, these are PROFESSIONAL waiters.  This is their full time job.  And they are good at it.   The only problem is, our professional waiter just wasn't on his game.  I don't know if he had too many tables or what.  We waited and waited for drinks.  Jimmy, drinks is where you make your money.  Get the drinks! And it seemed our waiter just wanted to get us the food and get us out the door.  What's the rush, bro .... ?I don't know what to say.  I'm so disappointed.   How to fix it:  JImmy, visit other restaurants and notice what they do right.  No one is perfect, but that is a great way to learn and improve.  That's what I do in my business.  I like to see what the competition is doing.  It helps me improve my game. One other thing I'm trying to figure out - who was the dude with the Spanish accent standing next to Jimmy?   Is he the new owner? See you in a few  years.  Maybe.

reviews.name: Mechelle M.
reviews.review: I went with a party of 7, including my young daughter. The service and atmosphere were wonderful.I had a filet and it was delicious. The blackberry cobbler was fabulous.Everyone in my party enjoyed their dishes as well. We will be back for sure!

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: This restaurant was very disappointing. The steaks are not "dry-aged" and are prepared mediocre at best. The service is poor. Overall a disappointing experience. There are better choices for restaurants in this area.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: Excellent steak house seeped in whiskey and steeped in history

reviews.name: Mary P.
reviews.review: Jimmy Kelly's is old school Nashville and it has not lost an ounce of its charm. Took my Dad for father's day last weekend. The food was excellent, the atmosphere very nice, the service impeccable, the price a good value. Overall, a win.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: It is down right sad when you go back a year later after visiting an establishment to give said establishment a 1 star review, however, I'm constantly reminded of quite possibly one of the worst, most disappointing steak house experiences I have ever had at Jimmy Kelly's.The reason I am constantly reminded is I now find myself comparing the price for a pour of Oban scotch anywhere I go to what may possibly be the most I've ever paid for just a sip of Oban at this Wal-Mart steak serving, poor excuse for a chop house.  The price on our bill for what was practically two sips of scotch (one sip each), $60.00.  The reason I know it was only two sips is because we saw the bartender pour the little that was remaining from the shelf bottle into our glasses without opening a new bottle.We honestly thought we were double charged, but nope, instead we got nothing but attitude when we inquired about the bill.  To top it off, the service was pathetic and the steaks were over cooked and almost tasted boiled instead of broiled.I believe people run to places like Yelp to take the time to write a review because they are either elated or deflated about an experience.  Coming back a year later to write a review is proof how deflated I was after leaving this place.  Given some other reviews, I am shocked this place can stay in business, yet, the place was packed the night we went to dinner.  Hopefully management takes the time to read these reviews to better their business!

reviews.name: Brent G.
reviews.review: Ugh.  Disappointing.I try not to be unnecessarily critical when reviewing a restaurant, but after recently dining at Jimmy Kelly's Steakhouse for an important event, I must comment.I will start with the good.  The atmosphere was very pleasant and the patio setting was excellent.  The staff was also friendly and accommodating as well.To begin with, this place had weeks to prepare for our group and everything should have been smooth and near-perfect. Not so. We had problems with the AV support, very slow service, and confusion over the appetizers.  The food was mediocre at best with nearly every item disappointing. The corn bread pancakes were burnt and ordinary, the salads were on-par with what my young children can prepare, and the main course was plated so plainly it felt like we were at a cafeteria.  The steak was fine, but we were not given choices for the starch side (as we should have been) and the desserts were brought out in such a haphazard fashion that half of the group had finished before the other half had been served.Not a place to visit again.

reviews.name: Stacy R.
reviews.review: Absolutely delicious! Our server, Marcus, was outstanding. I'm going to go ahead and say he provided us with the best service I've ever had. He suggested a fantastic wine in our price range and truly desired for us to have a great experience. Our steak was cooked perfectly. My husband had the shrimp also which were amazing as was my twice baked potato (I'm still craving for another one)!  We had the blackberry cobbler and apple cobbler for dessert, both were wonderful.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: Ahh, Restaurant Week, the double-edged sword. I talk myself out of going to "expensive" restaurants all the time for fear of having a disappointing experience. Sometimes those fears are unfounded, all too often they are not. The evening started out with so much promise. From the valet out front to the honest to god Maitre D' just inside, the place just screams "old-school" class. Frank Sinatra would have felt at home seated in a high-backed leather chair at a white linen covered table in one of their cozy oak-paneled private rooms. The service was top notch. Our waiter, Pee Wee, who'd been at working at the establishment "off and on" since 1978, was absolutely perfect. He read my wife and I completely, provided helpful suggestions, and came by only and always when needed. We weren't looked down upon or ignored because we were ordering off the "special" menu. When it comes to the food I have just two words for you: Meat. Glue. I am not a butcher, a chemist, or an adhesives expert, but I've worked in enough steakhouses and have seen my fair share of meat glue steaks. Go ahead and open a new browser tab and Google that if you have to/dare. It's a dirty little secret of the meat industry akin to the pink slime found in ground beef. Maybe Jimmy Kelly's chef doesn't know that he's being sold frankenfilet, or he does and doesn't care; I'm not sure which bothers me more. I halfway considered asking for steak sauce.It didn't end there. Our baked potatoes were served still in tinfoil, and the toppings (for which we were charged an additional fee...seriously?) came in paper ramekins, a la McDonald's ketchup. The salads were bagged iceberg and the house Gorgonzola dressing was reminiscent of Kraft, or maybe, if I'm being generous, Wishbone. The corn cakes all the other reviewers rave about? Burnt. A truly disappointing meal. The only thing we enjoyed beyond the atmosphere, the service, and the drinks were the mushrooms and the two cobblers: blackberry and apple walnut. You're safe ordering those I'm sure --the rest? Well, you're on your own. In short, if you go, get something bone-in (harder to fake with meat glue), skip the potato, and soak up the classy atmosphere, the good service, and plenty of tasty tasty liquor. It will make the bill easier to stomach, especially if you're paying full price.

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: We came here on a Friday night and had reservations for a bachelor party dinner.  We were seated upstairs in private room and our waiter, Robert was excellent.  The steaks were good, the atmosphere was comfortable and the neighbor upstairs even put on a "show" for us.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: Nothing short of mediocre. I could cook the same food at home for much less. The only reason I give it a 3 is because I got the meal half off. I suggest you wait for next years Black Friday  half off gift card sale if you want to try JKs. Best part of the meal was the apple walnut cobbler which I give a 3.5. Save your hard earned money and eat elsewhere.

reviews.name: Mike A.
reviews.review: I've heard various reports on JK's over the years. Finally I had to try it for myself. I enjoyed dinner here with my Dad in May of 2014. I've been to a lot of steakhouses in various cities. And I understand that different people value different things. Personally, at a place like this, I want good service, good atmosphere, and high quality food. All three were achieved at JK's. It's a throwback, Plantation-house style dining experience. It's a little cramped, but that' part of the charm. It's reasonably priced for a higher-end restaurant. Our steaks were cooked perfectly. The sides were well prepared. Our waiter was excellent with very good "feel" for when he needed to come by. I also like this restaurant because it has a very local feel. It's not right on West End or 21st. You have to be actively seeking it out to find it.  A great dining experience and I'm sure I'll be back.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: Very disappointed!   Several of us went because it was recommended with lots of hype.  Let me tell you...if that's the best steak I can get ...I'll never eat another one.  The filets were very bland,  no seasoning,  dry...and this was the concensus of the majority of us not just me.  Nice waiter and nice atmosphere,  but the chains such as Fleming's, Morton's, etc blow this place out of the water.

reviews.name: Jennifer A.
reviews.review: I was so looking forward to trying this landmark Nashville restaurant. I've been to many fine steakhouses around the country and had heard this was one of the best. What we experienced last night was quite the opposite, unfortunately. We were a large group (12) so had made reservations weeks in advance. They paraded all of us upstairs and through and around many quiet diners to a room in the back. A perfect spot for a group, however the tables had not been set up. So, they paraded us back through the dining room and left us as a group on the upstairs landing where we were clearly in the way of the wait staff. We were finally seated, but place settings were incomplete (2 people didn't have forks until after the appetizer course was done) and we soon found the one waiter we had (we'd been told we'd have 2) was not really capable of managing such a large table. At one of the premier steak houses in town, we expected service to be excellent, and this was sadly lacking. Empty drink glasses were removed but no refills offered. Meals came to the table incomplete. A la carte sides, which patrons are encouraged to share among the table, are disappointingly small. Our waiter made a point of telling us how large the asparagus were, and great for sharing. When it arrived there were 4 asparagus (and not the jumbo ones) on the plate. When the time came for dessert, he took orders from some of the table but not everyone, then did the same with coffee. In terms of the quality of the food- the value was sadly lacking for the price. I've had much better steak at Logan's or Outback, and that's just so disappointing. I ordered the special bone-on filet which the waiter raved about. It had so little flavor that I nearly cried when I got the $60 bill. I'm happy to pay a premium for fine food, but this time I literally just threw my money away. My fiancee's manhattan, which was good but no better than a manhattan anywhere else, was $21. Again, I don't mind paying for quality, but nothing about our meal or the service justified those prices. The only redeeming aspect of the meal was my fiancee's cowboy steak (ribeye) that was prepared with the creole seasoning- it really was pretty incredible. Unfortunately, this one shining light was not nearly enough to make up for the rest of the experience. Instead of finding a new favorite restaurant we found one we will for sure never return to.

reviews.name: William T.
reviews.review: I very rarely order the filet mignon but tonight I did. I ordered the extra cut. The steak was excellent. The atmosphere was lively. The waiter was knowledgable and helpful. We will come backWilliam

reviews.name: Amy D.
reviews.review: While I found the service to be a little slow towards the beginning (maybe that's because I was so hungry my stomach was eating itself) my experience at Jimmy Kelly's was pretty close to top notch. It's a true steakhouse - dark, lots of wood accents, not an extensive menu and side big enough to share with the table.Knowing we'd be super full by the time dinner was over, we passed on an appetizer. Instead of bread, Jimmy Kelly's starts you off with corn cakes and butter - they were delicious, but I didn't taste as much corn as I expected. More like a semi-corny pancake. Still really good though!Dinners come with a salad and your choice of side, so I went with the Cowboy steak (a huge rib eye) cooked medium rare. Wow - the steak itself was huge, with just the right amount of marbling and it was cooked perfectly. I did have to add some salt though - and if you know me, you know I RARELY salt anything. So amp it up in the seasonings department a little Jimmy Kelly!The house salad was good, nothing to write home about. The twice baked potato, on the other hand, was definitely letter worthy. Absolutely HUGE and stuffed with all the good stuff that goes into twice baked potatoes. We split a broccoli and cheese side between everyone at the table and by the time it was all said and done we were three very happy and full campers!No room for dessert, but I will say they make a mean Manhattan at Jimmy Kelly's as well. It's a littler homier, a little more personal than the Morton's of the world - worth checking out if you're in the area.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: An institution here in Nashville, I decided to add this to the list of restaurant week adventures the last time around.  An older crowd, many of whom I can bet are regulars, visits this establishment.  It's like sitting in something out of Downton Abbey, with fancy dressed servers and the whole place feeling like someone converted a manor into a restaurant.  And its about as All-American steakhouse as you can get.  Simple dishes, no frills presentation, just meat and potatoes (literally).  But really perfectly cooked meat.  And they have this fantastic alchemy-looking contraction, designed by someone at Vanderbilt (go science!) for decanting wine that I can't even describe, you just have to see it.  I would go there for a bottle of wine and dessert only just to see this thing again.  Also, as a note, its much cheaper to get bottles than glasses of wine here, they have very pricey wines by the glass.  It's a relaxed atmosphere and a good meal.  They have some really great servers that have obviously been there a long time and some that have not, so your experience can vary greatly.  Overall I had a very good time and enjoyed my steak, but the highlight really was the wine decanting.

reviews.name: Rebecca S.
reviews.review: I have grown up going to Kelly's. I love everything about this place, it's such a huge part of Nashville's history. It was a speak easy at one point

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: The food & service here is A+I had fried oysters, and a bleu cheese fillet  :-)Great !    I come from a seafood area, and these were amoung the best....Our waiter was a very fine older gentleman (48 years of service there)Outstanding !We were a large group, who had a few cocktails and maybe a littleToo loud and crazy, but none the less we were treated like gold.I have not been that impressed in quite awhile.

reviews.name: Juan F.
reviews.review: Wow. I need to go back. One of the best steaks I've ever had. Great waiter as well.

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: The first thought that comes to mind, "bless their hearts".  We got a gift certificate so we went to see how they've held up over the years.It's probably been over 15 years since I've eaten here.  Back then there were very few places to choose from when you wanted to go out for a fine dining experience, Jimmy Kellys was one of those few.   My wife had never been before and I told her if nothing else the service will be good.  That wasn't the case this time.  Slow and bumbled are two words that come to mind and the food was ok if it was still the early 90's.  But it's not and they have fallen behind in a very compettive market.  There are just too many places to go in Nashville these days.  Sadly, Jimmy Kellys is no longer one them.

reviews.name: Blair S.
reviews.review: I've been to Jimmy Kelly's a bunch in the past, so I feel sad rating it two stars. It used to be a great Nashville institution. On my first visit in a long time, I left disappointed.First, the good things. Atmosphere a the defining characteristic of the restaurant, which is in an old house with old paintings and charm all around. The corn cakes served just before your salad are a delightful southern classic. The homemade thousand island dressing is great, although some of my lettuce was drowning. My jumbo shrimp were awesome - I've had lobster tails smaller than these shrimp, and believe me, the shrimp tasted better. The blackberry cobbler desert was awesome.Now the bad and unfortunate things. This is a steakhouse. You come here for steak. I remember distinctly some of the best steaks I've ever had coming from this restaurant, and I really looked forward to that. My filet, ordered medium, came well done and extra dry. Instead of filet mignon I got filet jerky. After everyone at the table was done with their slightly overdone steaks, an obviously overcooked steak finally came out much later than promised. It seems like the steaks were sitting under a heat lamp or on a heated rack waiting for pick-up. The waiter was kind enough to take my suggestion of only charging me for the shrimp and baked potato. But I was still hungry even after taking my table mates' leftovers. Then came the onion rings that were supposed to a side dish, not desert. They were good, don't get me wrong, just very late. They comped these as well, which was a nice gesture.On top of the twice destroyed filets, I found myself sucking on ice cubes because my tiny glass of water was slow to be refilled. I think the root problem was a decision by management to take care of a large party - that arrived after my party of six - at the expense of service to other diners. My sever worked hard and was polite, but was clearly given too much to handle as he assisted other servers working the large party. Any restaurant with good service should red-flag replacement orders so they don't get screwed up and abandoned, regardless of workload.I might try Jimmy Kelly's again later, but not until I'm convinced they've returned to the great level of service and steak I saw in the past.

reviews.name: Lindsay W.
reviews.review: Been wanting to check this place out for years after hearing my grandparents talk about it- yeah,it's that old.  Glad that I got the chance recently but there were definitely some hits and misses there. The pros:- Beautiful inside, definitely has that old school charm that is hard to come by nowadays.  Most of the servers have been there for years (ours had been there over 20-  it's comforting to know that they can hold on to their employees)- Known for their steaks and my steak was delicious and did not disappoint- They could easily accommodate our large party with the private room.  We were able to be as loud as we wanted upstairs without having to disturb other diners- The corn cakes when right off the griddle are amazing (see cons)The cons:- Had the house salad.  It was soaked in dressing and was not very appetizing-  Took a long time to get refills on our drinks.  We would order refills on wine that wouldn't come until halfway through the next course.  -  They forgot to bring us corn cakes during dinner (gasp!) so they brought them out with dessert when one of us said something to the server  about never getting them.  He was very apologetic and brought fresh ones out as soon as possible.- The dessert.  I had the chocolate decadence which was listed as a brownie.  It tasted like a dry chocolate crumb cake.  I was very disappointed with it.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: This Victorian mansion sets the scene for a romantic evening.  Paintings on the wall and old fireplaces give the look and feel of old south.  Our waiter, Robert, was very friendly and attentive.  My water glass stayed full all night and that was an accomplishment with the tiny size of the glass.It was restaurant week and the greatest thing about restaurant week is you get the opportunity to try restaurants that you aren't sure about at reasonable prices.  I will be the first to admit I spend too much money on great food but if the food is GREAT I don't mind.  What bothers me is if I spend over $100 on a meal and it is average.  I would have been disappointed if it weren't restaurant week.The cornbread cakes and butter that are served before your appetizers are great and addictive.  I had the fried oysters for my appetizer and they were served in a rock glass with cocktail sauce.  They were good.  I was born and raised in the south so I'm pretty sure you can deep fry almost anything and I will love it.  Basil Vinaigrette on the house salad came before the main entree.Filet was ordered medium.  It was a little charred on the outside and I'm sure some people like that but I'm not one of them.  I like my steak juicy and this steak was on the dry side.  The apple walnut cobbler dessert made up for the mediocre meal.  This would be an awesome place to dine if the steaks were better.

reviews.name: Lisa M.
reviews.review: We were so excited to visit Jimmy Kelly's for our Valentine's Day dinner.  We were so very disappointed!  The atmosphere is absolutely horrible.  We were escorted upstairs through several small rooms to the very back corner of a room, up against a window.  We froze the entire time.  The room was dark and dank, and it was so quiet, we couldn't even talk at a whisper without the people next to us hearing every word.  The barbeque prawns were so hard and overcooked, we couldn't even cut them without a knife.  The salad was small and tasteless.  We both ordered filet, and mine was way undercooked.  Both were tasteless.  We could not wait to get our check and get out of there!  The server was wonderful though.  He was the only reason we didn't get up and walk out.  He was very attentive and professional.  We could have gotten better food and atmosphere at Stoney River or Fleming's for half the price.  Honestly, if someone offered to buy me another meal at Jimmy Kelly's, I wouldn't go back.

reviews.name: Peggy D.
reviews.review: This is an average restaurant at best with a nice setting.  Shortcomings include over-priced food, teeny portions, inconsistent service (I have had impeccable service here as well as terrible service.)  The Apple Walnut cobbler we had tonight came to us with no apple.   It is not a sophisticated team.   No coat-check in winter and complete freak out when asked. Surly host.  Is it because one of us was black and we are in the South?  Good martini and good cesar dressing.   Sauteed veggies super salty and a 2T portion for $4.50.That is the best i can come up with. Sad,  because I  wanted it to be great.  Oh,  and the ladoes bathroom sucks.  There is horrible mold around the ceiling vent and the entire ladies room smells like cheap, horrible gas station air "freshener ".  A cheap, crummy, over-priced experience overall. I will be surprised if it is in business next year.  I will not be back.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: Our CEO hosted a dinner for senior staff at Jimmy Kelly's. When our party arrived at the site, we were greeted by restaurant owner Mike Kelly and welcomed as if we had just arrived at his home. The staff shared the history of the restaurant, and some of their favorite stories with our group. Our servers were exceptional -- knowledgeable, professional, prompt, respectful, and very friendly, yet also not "hovering" as some servers can be. They provided the BEST  IN CLASS service.The arrival of the corn cakes (think hot water cornbread) brought a great many yum's from our diners. One of our officers is a cattleman by profession, and he jump right in with the famous Cowboy Steak.  The person next to me could not decide what to order, so she opted for the "Mixed Grill," which included a half-filet, two jumbo gulf shrimp, and salmon, all grilled to perfection. I had the NY Strip steak it was cooked exactly to order!Immediately, from the moment we stepped foot into this restaurant, we thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening. It's in an old, plantation-style home in downtown Nashville. A must try.  Some of the review as you will read are rough and harsh, but our experience was great. The food, service, and atmosphere were all superb!

reviews.name: Adam S.
reviews.review: THE most disappointing meal I've ever had.  Went there with several out of town guests and everyone complained about their meal.  Dry, bland and way overpriced food.  And, the service was terrible.  Our waiter was non-attentive and had an attitude.  We even saw him just outside our room playing on his cell phone.  We complained about our service and food to the manager, and he did nothing, not even give an apology.You couldn't pay me to go back here.

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: The place is cute and old-timey and feels kinda fun. There are SEC college flags by the bar and I feel like there was red carpet and definitely curvy banisters. While I liked this part, I can't help but think - this place feels kinda dirty. I don't mean that I felt unsafe eating the food or anything, but it felt like a snake oil salesman was trying to sell me a classy experience.  For the extra $5 for a side of asparagus you get a full 4 spears. When they take your salad plate away, they physically take your silverware off the plate and place them back on the tablecloth for you to use for the main course.I sound pretty snooty, I know, but when I'm paying 30 bucks for a steak, I kind of expect a clean fork with every course kinda place amirite? I had a great time here, but again, I felt like I was in a made for TV reenactment of a classy place that didn't turn out quite right. They DID, however, give me a fresh baked potato in my to-go box which I highly appreciated.

reviews.name: J S.
reviews.review: Our entrees were OK, but not good enough to finish at the restaurant or to take home for leftovers. The side dishes were very disappointing. The onion rings were not crispy, the macaroni & cheese was very dry, vegetables inedible. The potato was quite good though. Not worth a second chance.

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: So many peopled had talked this place up so I had high expectations.  And they were not met.  I came here for a business dinner (party of 8), mainly because we were able to get a same day reservation.  I have to say the best part of the experience was the wine....they have these very intricate glass decanters that they pour your bottle into when you order it.  It is mostly presentation but I'm ok with that - it was pretty cool.  I also tasted the wine before it was decanted, and then after - decantation really does make a difference.About the food: we ordered shrimp cocktail with cocktail sauce & remoulade and fried calamari to start.  The calamari was fine, if a little bit greasy.  The shrimp were also fine......pretty standard boiled shrimp.  They also brought out their little cornbread cakes which were ok but several of them were completely black and inedible.  For entrees, everyone but me ordered steaks (I don't eat red meat), and I ordered the sea bass w/ crab stuffing with the standard baked potato side dish.  The sea bass was a bit overcooked which was disappointing, and the crab didn't taste terribly fresh. Not inedible, but it just did not taste fresh & clean.  The baked potato tasted like it had been cooking for several hours, and it was brought out with freezing cold butter and sour cream.  To cap it off, several people ordered desserts.  I don't remember what anyone ordered so I guess that tells you how mediocre they were.  My other gripe is that when the server brought out the second bottle of wine she did not give us fresh wine glasses.  FAIL.  Other than that she did a good job, but that's not cool.  We didn't realize what she was doing until she'd already done it.  Also there were some very loud people in the bar which made for a strange juxtaposition of vibes...very formal and upscale in the dining room, and then 20 feet away Bubba is yelling for his team in the bar.  Awkward...So like I said - the wine was the best part of the experience.  It's the only reason I don't give the place one star.  Meh, not impressed at all.  I don't plan on returning.

reviews.name: JD C.
reviews.review: We visited Jimmy Kelly's looking for a great steakhouse experience. We were greeted with a very friendly and welcoming staff and liked the atmosphere. Seated in a small room on the second floor and with a fireplace, we enjoyed the cozy and peaceful ambiance. The filet was a nice cut of meat, but lacked flavor. The lobster tail was overcooked enough to call it rubbery, which was very disappointing. The salad contained lettuce which lacked freshness for a quality restaurant.  The plates were served at room temperature, leading to the food losing temperature very quickly. The pace of the meal was appropriate and the proportions of food were generous, but they did not compensate for the downfalls.

reviews.name: Erica H.
reviews.review: We were in Nashville for a business trip and decided on Jimmy Kelly's based on a recommendation of a friend who frequents Nashville.  After reading the reviews I was hesitant but not having another place in mind, decided to keep our reservation.  We are so glad we did!  We were with a group of 9 and sat in one of the rooms upstairs and were lucky enough to have Claude as our server.  He was attentive, prompt and incredibly entertaining!  I had a blue cheese crusted filet and added some shrimp (I didn't get the Mixed Grill because I wanted the full size filet...I was starving and eating conference food all weekend...don't judge me)  The filet was delicious and the shrimp were some of the best I ever had.  We ordered a variety of sides and the only disappointment was the asparagus as some others have mentioned on here.  There were only a few stalks and didn't justify the price.  When I return to Nashville I will definitely come back and request Claude.  The food was great but the service was even better.

reviews.name: Andrea M.
reviews.review: First time there and I will NOT be back. Had a party of 4 with reservations at 7pm  we got seated at 705 but that was the last of the good! We had to go get someone to even come be our server at our table and we waited 25 minutes which was way more than enough time for a server to come to our take. Spoke to the manager and he said he would get right on it. It was still a few minutes before our server came by and the manager at this time never came and apologized! After we get our drink orders in it was almost 10 minutes before we had our water..we had the corn cakes before we had or water or drinks! The food took a while to cook but no issue with that time add I expect that when going to a "upscale" restaurant. One of our members if the party had to send their steak back three times to get it right! The food was ok, nothing special, not very flavorful, rather bland add if they took a filet mignon and placed straight on the grill with no seasoning or aging. Very disappointed with the food and the service, when the manager came over after we asked for the filet to be sent back three third time, all he did was say he was dirty and that he would take care of that person's meal, that's fine but there was no apology for the excessive wait time for drinks and the food being brought out in shifts and our party of 4 eating at different times because a side was missing or not all entrees brought out together. I would tell someone to go to Logan's for the same quality of food but you'll get better service at Logan's then here and save money!

reviews.name: Maximus Decimus Meridius M.
reviews.review: Great room, great food, great service, great bar. i had the new york strip and it was outstanding.  why anyone would want to go to ruth chris' or some other chain steakhouse in nashville is beyond me.  also, i had the blackberry cobbler for desert which was double AAmazing.i can't believe all the local yelpers low balling jimmy kelly's on here.

reviews.name: Ms T J.
reviews.review: I went for restaurant week just to see if it's somewhere I would revisit for the regular menu because I've heard good things. We were seated in a small room of 6 tables. Seemed like the room was just for those visiting for restaurant week. My friend and I ordered the 3 course meal for $30.14 a piece on the restaurant week menu. This included a house salad with romaine an mixed greens with basil vinaigrette. The dressing  did not taste homemade and was not good. It was piled in the middle with a few shredded carrots. Filet Mignon was a excellent cut of meat but lacked seasoning/flavor/presentation and a baked potato. The potato came wrapped in foil we had to cut it ourselves an put the butter an sour cream on.  I did not get any sour cream. Desert was the apple walnut cobbler with ice cream which was good. Overall the service was great everyone was very nice ,but the presentation of the food was not. It looked like something I made at home. The steak could've had some type of butter on top to give it a little flavor or simply seasoned with some salt & pepper. Since it was restaurant week it seemed as if they didn't care enough to treat those customers like customers that ordered from the regular menu. I thought the point in restaurant week is to gain new customers. After the meal we had today I would not return to Jimmy Kelly's.  We were both very disappointed.

reviews.name: Allison K.
reviews.review: Came here for a nice dinner while visiting. The setting is nice and looks just like a steakhouse in an old house should look. All of the steaks come with salad and potato and the prices of the salads and sides are the prices to upgrade so when you're ordering a steak just know salad and potato are coming. We started with a bottle of wine and our salads - I was the only one to upgrade to a wedge.  The wine list was good with lots of reasonably priced bottles and they decant the wine for you.  The first issue of the meal was we were finishing our salads and all of a sudden our dinners were there.  This is a major pet peeve of mine - I hate when I feel like I'm being rushed out of the restaurant. So dinner was served - we all got steaks and added a spinach and broccoli for the table.  The spinach was good, but as my mom would say "heavy on the paprika - wait why is there paprika and so much of it on here?"  I would highly recommend that you do NOT order the broccoli. It was depressing - one long floret over cooked with no flavor - and I still swear the menu claimed it had cheese on it but no one would let me ask.  The steaks were ok but not as juicy as they should have been (I ordered medium rare and it was very dry).  It was fine but nothing special.

reviews.name: Lori O.
reviews.review: The food here really is just average, but the service is OUTSTANDING! We had the funniest, nicest guy waiting on us and they really make u feel welcome and at home here.  If u want to go somewhere for a decent steak, a great relaxing atmosphere, and not have to fight a huge crowd, this is a good choice.  I had the bleu cheese stuffed filet, it was cooked med rare and was pretty good...could have used a little less bleu cheese, they really pack ALOT in it and the cut of meat could have been a little more tender but it really wasn't bad.

reviews.name: Laura T.
reviews.review: The place gets two stars for being a neat atmosphere- old house that has an old time feel, maybe even borderline creepy.  Wouldnt want to stay the night here!  The waitstaff have all been there 40 plus years, friendly but maybe a little gruff.  This is okay though, as it just adds to the atmosphere.  The food was okay- thats whst the third star is for.   I was really expecting better and felt a little let down.  The filet was good, but you can get better at Ruth Chris or Stoney River.  Couldnt believe they didnt have any gourmet mac n cheese or potato options (other than a plain old baked potato).  There just wasnt anything that was "to die for".  Glad I had the experience of having been there, but there's probably not a reason to go back.

reviews.name: Valerie M.
reviews.review: As I begin this review, I'm not sure I can still identify the worst part of last night's dinner...the lackluster service, the underwhelming culinary offering, management's thinly veiled indifference to our dissatisfaction, or that I was robbed of one of a precious few date nights I get each year. I think of everything, which I will list momentarily, the one thing that rose above all of this was the server being argumentative with my husband over his order. Listen, doll, if anyone is going to give that man a hard time, it is me. Over the last 21 years, I have earned it and finely-honed my skills, so I say to thee, "how dare you?"And, now, some comments:* Yelp, I gave just one star, not because they didn't deserve two but because the 2-star rating indicated that my experience wasn't DISMAL and it was. "I've experienced better?" Yes, I've experienced a better treatment of beef at Krystal. At 2 a.m.* Mike Kelly, you should be ashamed of yourself. Your family worked hard to bring this restaurant to life and survive in the cutthroat food industry for 7 decades. Take some time away from leaning on the bar and watching a replay of a Devils-Kings game from 2 nights ago to walking around your restaurant. Visit with your guests and when one goes so far as to indicate that the evening is not going well, delve a little deeper and find out what's going on. Walk through the kitchen throughout the night and let them know that you care and you're watching. Have someone come in and give those restrooms a thorough cleaning. Watch as appetizers are being sent back and entrees are leaving tables with more than half of the food still on them. Mike, that's YOUR name out there on the sign. Defend it. You were here in Nashville before any of those other steakhouses. It's your birthright. Bring back the Jimmy Kelly's that Nashvillians know, and love and respect.* To our server, whom I did not get your name but I think you have to stand out as one of, if not the only, female servers at Jimmy Kelly's. Was last night your first night? Just tell me that. You greeted us and tried to take our drink orders. You asked if we would like some wine when we hadn't been given a wine menu yet. When I asked if you had sweet tea, you answered "yes.  Well, it's unsweet and I can bring you some sugar." Baby, this is the south. Tea is sweet and it's equal parts -- 1 cup of sugar to 1 tea bag. Plain and simple. When my husband complained that his steak wasn't right, did you know right then that you had keyed in the order wrong or did you discover that later? We all make mistakes but man up and accept it when you do. My husband gave you a tip last night. Partly because he's a nice guy. I also suspect he did this merely so we could go and salvage the last few minutes that we had a babysitter. Here's my tip for you:  find one of your fellow co-workers in a white dinner jacket and follow him around for a week or two. Learn the ropes from these veterans. * To Fred, another server at the restaurant who was assigned to an adjacent table.  We watched you throughout the evening, smiling and happy and providing top notch service to your table while we floundered in the corner with our gal. We watched you be attentive without hovering. We watched you glide in a beautiful minuet as you showered that other table with drinks, playful banter, corn cakes and impeccable service. And at the end, when everything blew up, it was you who stepped in and showed concern. Not our server. Not the house manager. And not that guy whose name is on the sign. No, it was you, Fred, who apologized for our experience and who implored us to give the restaurant another chance. You said you've been there for 45 years. My, the stories you must have. It was a pleasure meeting you last night.* To the cow(s) that offered my husband's and my steaks last night, I'm sorry. I'm sorry they did that to you. A little salt and pepper goes a long way but they denied you.* And, finally, to Jason and Valerie, the hapless diners in last night's saga. We were given MULTIPLE red flags and dismissed, scoffed and laughed our way past each one. We chose to be impressed by the restaurant's website and ability to make a reservation online rather than heeding other reviews here on Yelp. We walked through a near empty dining room on a Friday night at 7 and didn't think a thing about it. We didn't take the cue from our server that this evening was doomed when she was giving pretty clear signals from the moment we sat down and placed our drink order. And, still, when the 1st appetizer was sent back, instead of asking for the check and cutting our losses, we persevered. We pushed on stubbornly. Hopefully, we'll be smarter next time.

reviews.name: Jo P.
reviews.review: From the moment we pulled up to the restaurant until we drive away, we were treated with A+ service. When we arrived, the valets and maitre d helped my boyfriend, brother and I get my mom, who is very sick right now and uses a walker, inside. They graciously helped us get her inside and seated right away, even though we arrived a little early. The table they had reserved for us was upstairs but when they realized my mom was unable to do stairs, they quickly rearranged seating to have our table be close to the door. We were very lucky to have "King Arthur" as our server. You could tell he's been there for a while and really loves his job. He was pleasant, very attentive and very entertaining. He made my mother smile and laugh more than she had in a long time. We never felt rushed even though we went on a busy Sat night. We could not have asked for a better waiter!!! Definitely request him if you are thinking of trying Jimmy Kelly's. The food was incredible. We had a group of 5 people, my mom, dad, boyfriend, brother and I. The meal starts off with homemade corn cakes which were right out of the oven and tasted amazing with butter. King Arthur brought us fresh ones a few times throughout the meal so they were always warm. Everyone ordered the fillet, which came with a salad and a side. All of our salads were great, especially with their house blue cheese dressing. Our fillets were all cooked perfectly. The boys all has baked potatoes with toppings which they claim were fantastic. I'm assuming they were good, given none of them would let me try a bite, lol. I got the fries, which were slightly seasoned and delicious. Of course after such a wonderful meal, we knew we had to try dessert. We got the apple walnut cobbler and the blackberry cobbler- both of which were incredible! They melted in your mouth! I highly recommend Jimmy Kelly's- for the food, good service and atmosphere. It was an amazing dining experience. We will definitely being going back when my family comes into town again.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: OK, so the people that work here were very nice and the atmosphere was nice.  Cool old house and charm... all that.  I get that.  The problem is, the food flat out sucks.  I go to a restaurant for a lot of things, but the food will always be the top reason.This place fails miserably on the food aspect.  The filet was cooked as ordered med rare, but it had ZERO flavor.  The side dishes were average at best.  It was a lot like going to a friend's house for Thanksgiving and everything was Kroger take out.Even more disappointing that I had heard a lot of good things from some people over the years.  I went in expecting a rival to Ruth's Chris, Morton's, or The Palm.  I left thinking Applebee's (worst restaurant ever) probably would have been a better choice.

reviews.name: Nikky T.
reviews.review: Food was pretty good, but strange Civil war-type service.  The atmosphere was a little Gone With The Wind for my taste, but the flavor of my filet pleased my taste-buds.

reviews.name: Stephanie N.
reviews.review: In Nashville for a week for work - we decided to try this place because a coworker saw it mentioned in a magazine.I really enjoyed our experience here!  Terrific service- As soon as we pulled in front of the restaurant in the taxi, someone immediately opened the car door for us, and then someone opened the door to the restaurant for us, leading us in.  - Our server, Ozzy, was very friendly and helpful.  If I were to ever go back to Nashville and come here again, I'd ask for Ozzy to be our server again!- They offered and helped call us a cab so that it would be there when we were done eatingGreat food- Instead of normal bread, they serve what look like cute mini pancakes.  Ozzy was quick to correct us by letting us know they were corn cakes.  I ate so many of them before our entrees were out.- Tried the mussel appetizer, fried green tomatoes, bootleggers ribeye (grilled), and keylime pie - I enjoyed it all.  And omg, the keylime pie was the BEST I've ever had, and I wish I knew of a place I could get them here in CA.  I am now going to make it a mission of mine to find a keylime pie that's just as amazing in southern CA because I want more!Great atmosphere- Really enjoyed the ambiance here as well.

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: I was very disappointed after my visit here.  I was told that this was one of the best steakhouses in Nashville, but can't say that was the case AT ALL.  We (party of 2) were sat upstairs in a bedroom-turned-dining room, crammed in with 5 other tables.  The waiters (2) were not only doing our room, but the rest of the upstairs as well, so as nice as they were, they were very much overworked and inattentive.  The corn cake appetizers were cold and clammy, like they had been sitting on the table for an hour.  I did not get a refill on my cocktail at all, and only 1 refill on water.  This wouldn't be as big of a deal if the glasses held more than 5oz of liquid.  We were told that our food would be late due to the arrival of a 40+ person party downstairs.  That's poor planning on the kitchen/restaurant's part - they should look at their reservation list and plan accordingly.  Once the food arrived the servers put it down and were immediately MIA.  My medium steak was very much too raw - there was barely a brown tinge to the outside, let alone the inside, which was bloody and not at all what I asked for, however, I wasn't able to get this fixed due to, again, no one coming by or even being in the room to flag.  We also ordered a side of asparagus billed as a "share side" that cost over six dollars.  We received THREE STALKS for two people.  That's just ridiculous!  I paid over two dollars per stalk, and got to eat 1 1/2.  For such an expensive place, that was very cheap of them.  I will not be eating here again, and as part of a business that often takes clients/suppliers out to dinner, I'll be telling everyone there to avoid JK's in favor of anywhere else.  You'd get better service and more food for your money at Waffle House.

reviews.name: Jimmy P.
reviews.review: We has a large party of 10, on a very busy night.  We were seated on time in a private dining room.  Claude was knowledgeable, funny, entertaining, and made the dining experience memorable!  The wine and food was superb. An excellent night!

reviews.name: LG N.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere, great food, and great service!  My steak was cooked to perfection and the twice baked potato is amazing!!   The prawn appetizers were very filling and the fresh tomato salad was fresh and quite tasty!!  Would definitely go back again!!

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: I've been to Jimmy Kelly's once.  On a date.  With a guy I only went out with one other time, and we went to another steak house.  I just couldn't do it anymore!  But aside from that...I like steak.  And I like good steak.  Jimmy Kelly's has both!  I got the filet and a salad and baked potato--loved the filet, the salad was just OK.  But I have yet to get a fantastic salad at a steakhouse.  Baked potato was decent as well.  Wine list--pretty OK for someone like me!This really is a guy's place though.  I have a group of guy friends who go about once every few months--no girls allowed.  Lots of cigars, dark bar, old house...you get the picture.  "Old school boys club" as we like to call it.  So, note to you guys, it's not really a great first date place, but if you've been together a while and your girl enjoys a good steak, check this place out!  Also good for large groups or parties.

reviews.name: Todd D.
reviews.review: Great service.  The servers name was Guy and treated our group of nine very well.  He made excellent suggestions throughout without being pushy.  The food was great...from our group a little of everything was ordered.  I ordered the 8oz filet with shrimp...it had a great flavor and was not seasoned which was perfect.  We had a separate room upstairs which was awesome.   Highly recommend if your ready to get away from the high end chain restaurants!  My group was from all over the country and I wanted to give them a restaurant that was unique to Nashville!

reviews.name: Tom K.
reviews.review: What a great setting.  Unfortunately, the food is marginal and extremely over priced for the quality.  The steaks are fair, but the sides are  simply not good.The wait staff is okay and maybe a little better than the reputation that they have.For the price point, I can't recommend the restaurant.

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: Most people don't like reading a long review so here is my quick review from our dinner on new years eve 2010.        "great atmosphere, entrees are a hit, nice menu selection, skip the sides and request a table on the first floor with a server who has been there for a long time."If you want a change of scenery from the typical commercial steakhouse, definitely check this place out.  The prices are very reasonable, and the place is just plain cool.  You will not stop looking at all the detail in this historical house.  We had the signature blue cheese stuffed filet and the special that night, sea bass; both excellent.  The sides were ok, nothing special.  Maybe order 2 apps instead of sides if your real hungry.  Overall I would definitely go back just to keep taking in all the history of the house and to taste one of the best blue cheese stuffed filets I have ever had.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: The atmosphere and staff is unique.  Old school ambiance.  Wait staff, though not the friendliest, plays the role well.Going to the food, I was very disappointed by the steak.  I ordered the New York Strip and my girlfriend ordered the Filet, both medium.  The steaks were cooked well, but lacked flavor.  Comparable to a steak you'd get from Outback Steakhouse (at best). Get a couple steaks from the grocery store, liberally cover with salt and pepper, sear on a heavy pan for a few minutes per side, then place in hot oven for a few more minutes and you'll have a steak much tastier than the steaks at Jimmy Kelly's.  I went during Nashville's restaurant week, so it was a very good deal.  $20 for an app, salad, steak, and dessert.  Even with this fantastic deal, both my girlfriend and I were disappointed.I had high expectations after reading some of the previous reviews and looking over Jimmy Kelly's website.  I assumed a steakhouse that cuts their own steaks in-house would know steak.  Save your money and go elsewhere.

reviews.name: Allen H.
reviews.review: Steaks were very good, nice wine list. The wait staff was awesome,especially the bartender upstairs. Tim is his name and he is very  and warm and friendly and knows his way around the wine list and cocktails.

reviews.name: Quynh N.
reviews.review: We went here for Restaurant week. Our server, Tony, was really welcoming and knowledgeable, and made our experience really great. The cornbread with really awesome.For our appetizer, we got the BBQ Prawn (note, just 1, but it was HUGE!) and the Catfish Skewers (you get 3). They were both delicious.Our salad, the Faucon, was decent. The dressing was a little watery, but overall decent.We got the Filet and Sirloin, both medium rare with steak fries. The steak fries were crispy and yummy. I usually hate steak fries because at most places, they come to you soggy, but not here! The Filet and Sirloin were good, we also added some butter to them.For dessert, we got Key Lime Pie and Apple Walnut Cobbler. Really good and was a great end to the meal.All in all, we definitely recommend this for others. The whole experience was great.

reviews.name: Ben B.
reviews.review: A steakhouse with unique character and Southern charm. Wait staff is knowledgable and entertaining. Private rooms make dining more enjoyable for small groups. Unique corn cake appetizers are delicious.

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: The food at Jimmy Kelly's is comparable to other steakhouses in Nashville, but the historic ambiance is what sets is apart from all of the others. Jimmy Kelly's is one of those traditional Nashville establishments that has upheld its standards and maintained a solid clientele for decades.   The menu has remained steadfast over the years, and the fish specials are a good bet for those who want a steak alternative.  Jimmy Kelly's also serves a killer twice-baked potato.

reviews.name: Miss. Foodgurl S.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed this restaurant! I love their blue cheese stuffed fillet with the loaded baked potato, and their cornbread pancake. I could eat their french onion soup daily. It is a bit on the expensive side, but the service is like the cherry on-top. Everyone is very friendly. The atmosphere is very dark and "old timing". Also, you must try their wedge salad, IT IS TO DIE FOR! I hope this helped.

reviews.name: Timothy F.
reviews.review: Took my dad to this place for a gift in hopes that he could get a great steak and have a great time.  Not so!  After 3 of us ordering our steak Medium rare, one came out proper, mine came out Medium and believe it or not my moms came out Medium Well.  This review is coming from someone who has worked in the restaurant industry for 27 years so I do know the operations and just about everything else there is to know in the business; lets just say I know my steak temps.  Anyways the steaks were tender but not much flavor, baked potatoes were old; which I had to get mine replaced, and the service was adequate but nothing special.  To wrap up I will not be going back as there are many other places in Nashville I would recommend over this one.

reviews.name: Otis R.
reviews.review: I'm writing this review after my second trip to JK's.  The first time I had a good rib-eye (nothing to write home about). The second time I had a filet again pretty good but not fabulous.  The desert choices are typical southern fare. They have a good key lime pie and a extraordinary blackberry cobbler served with ice cream.  The reason I have gone back twice is because of the atmosphere and service. The restaurant is in a old house and the service is exemplary. They have a full bar and will make anything you like. They have rooms upstairs that are great for dinner party's or large groups.

reviews.name: Ta G.
reviews.review: Dollar-sized corn "biscuits" are given as a replacement for bread. This includes a plate full of BUTTER. These are reallly good!Salads are "cafeteria-style." Like buying a huge bag of premade salad from Costco.Blackened rib-eye and catfish are good here as well. Ribeye was ginormous. I think I had three bites and was full.Crabcakes are just alright.The restaurant looks like a haunted house. The interior is old and creepy with interesting paintings hung about the place. This place definitely reflects food from the South. They give you HUGE portions. I don't know how anyone can finish a whole meal here. It's a pretty good place if you are looking for that southern steakhouse. jimmykellys.com

reviews.name: William H.
reviews.review: Misty C.'s Review says it all.  Very good food.  Mike Kelly the owner will make sure you don't leave unhappy.  We try to go there every time we are in Nashville.  Our family's favorite.  Old school food and old school service.

reviews.name: Jack D.
reviews.review: Hands down, me and my wife's favorite place to eat anywhere! Since we began dating in high school and they were located at Hickory Hollow Mall this was our after church stop. I get a gyro with seasoned fries and my wife gets a chicken Greek with mushroom. I am emotionally unstable when I see their sign. My nose can detect this culinary masterpiece 30 miles away. Would trade my first born if they would open a restaurant in Chattanooga.

reviews.name: Ed U.
reviews.review: What are you supposed to do when you have tickets to the Grand Ole Opry but have only half an hour to eat? Such was the plight of me and Jamie W. as we were readying for our first-time show there. We spent the day downtown and couldn't quite figure out whether we could eat there and brave the traffic.
