Alas, we decided to play it safe and quickly minimized our dining options to the food court at Opry Mills, the chaotic shopping mall across the way from the theater. I have to say this was one of the largest food courts I've ever seen in a mall as it came complete with a carousel (photo: bit.ly/1KFi4Z6).We were hoping to find a hot chicken stand but no such luck, so we were swayed by the loud-mouthed girl who was acting like a carnival barker getting people to come to her kiosk of Middle Eastern fast food. The minute we got up to order, we were treated like prisoners at a cafeteria as they kept motioning us to keep moving along even though there was nobody behind us. All the toppings were in front of us Chipotle-style (photo: bit.ly/1JfO18q), and the staff was ready to make mountains on plates. I ordered their premium item, the $8.29 Pyramid Club Plate.It was a combination of gyros and chicken with grilled onions, green peppers, mushrooms and melted cheese with a cup of tzatziki sauce (photo: bit.ly/1QiAZr0). I have to admit it wasn't terrible. It was actually quite a bit of food even for Nashville, although I frankly don't understand this Deep South habit of adding a pile of shredded cheddar cheese as a topping. There was quite a pile of fresh hummus on the side to go with the warmed pita wedges. I just wish they didn't feel a need to be so abrasive to passing customers like they were aspiring to be the Don Rickles of gyros stands.FOOD - 3 stars...big plates of gyros, chicken and hummus but cut the cheese if you know what I meanAMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's a big food court...take a seat, any seatSERVICE - 1.5 stars...rude, just rudeTOTAL - 3 stars...I'll focus on the food which is middling and filling and filling to your middling

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: The gyro I bought was authentic! The taste was awesome! I ordered a Greek salad as a side and you could tell all the veggies had been cut fresh! The place was really clean! I'm definitely coming back!

reviews.name: Marcus P.
reviews.review: I'm always pleased with the food here. I feel like this is a step above what you would expect from a mall food court.I usually get the gyro plate or the Greek salad. Definitely worth a try if you like Mediterranean food and need to stop in the mall.

reviews.name: Kelsey W.
reviews.review: Great food. And always great service. They are very friendly and make sure you get exactly what you want. Even if you don't know how to pronounce it!

reviews.name: Caitlin C.
reviews.review: As far as mall food court options go I was pretty impressed with Pyramids. There weren't very many options to pick from that I didn't feel guilty or disgusted by in the Opry food court but there are a heck of a lot of options for sure. I had heard someone tell me if you have to eat at the mall, eat at Pyramids so we sped right up to their counter.All the employees were shouting at passersby, try our chicken, try out hummus! Very pushy in an endearing middle eastern sort of way that actually I'm quite used to. I could see this being off putting for a lot of other folks but oh well if you're scared away you're missing out! I knew I wanted the Gyro sandwich with fries and let them know, my boyfriend got a gyro plate, we both got lamb and to my surprise they wanted to know what I wanted on my sandwich. I've never been asked a gyro stand what I wanted on my sandwich, Tzatziki, tomatoes, onions and lettuce, duh. Seasoned fries? Yes of course, duh! They don't mess around with servings at this place...gigantic, which sort of offsets the obscene mall food prices. We both got sodas and our tab I think was like $22! I thought the gyro meat itself was the best part of my meal. The Tzatziki was probably from a jar but sufficed, and the lettuce and tomatoes were pretty useless but again compared to other mall food I've had this was okay. Let me put it this way, I would definitely eat here again.PSHere's how you pronounce Gyro - it's not JYY- ROW youtube.com/watch?v=AHtg…ALSO, always ask for more sauce on the side, you'll want it!

reviews.name: Dawn J.
reviews.review: Surprisingly good Greek food at a mall food court! Generous portions and great flavor. The gyro plate is awesome and more than I can eat. Some of the best tabbouleh I have ever had. Don't let the short line fool you...people don't know what they are missing!

reviews.name: Sandy L.
reviews.review: My mom got the Gyro sandwich with salad and I got the grilled chicken gyro with fries.Gyro:  The pita was piled high with meat, but they were really skimpy on the gyro toppings.  My mom thought the lamb was overseasoned, but not much you can do about a pre-seasoned leg of frozen meat.Chicken Gyro:  Unlike other gyro places I've tried in malls where the chicken is cooked fresh, the chicken here is already precooked.  All they are doing is cutting it up and reheating it up on the grill which I didn't like.  When asked if I wanted cheese on my gyro I said yes, but they didn't actually mean my gyro.  They meant did I want melted cheese on my chicken as the reheated it on the grill.  My toppings were also skimpy even when I asked for extra lettuce and ranch,  The chicken was not seasoned well and the addition of melted (American??) cheese did not appeal to me.Fries and salad:  The fries were hot and crispy with a nice amount of seasoned salt on them.  The salad consisted of a dressing over cucumbers, tomatoes, and some lettuce.  Both of us enjoyed our side items.Definitely would not eat here again because the food concept is definitely more of "fast food" then of fresh food.  I can go to a local gyro place and get the exact same grilled chicken gyro but actually have it cooked fresh for me.

reviews.name: Karen R.
reviews.review: Really good gyros and fries. You get a lot for your money. The baklava was so good too. I recommend it if you are at Opry Mills.

reviews.name: doug d.
reviews.review: I gave 3 stars just out of fairness because we did not actually eat there, so we may have really loved it.But as someone below already mentioned, the employees obnoxiously yell and scream at potential customers and this put us off from wanting to try the food.We were standing way back, simply trying to read the menu and regardless of the fact they were already busy with people right at the counter, 2 or 3 of the gals working there endlessly -screamed- at us... "try our fries", "here is a sample", "here is a menu", "blah, blah, blah..."yeesh, this was too much. I don't like being yelled at, and figured that if they are that desperate, there must be something wrong with the food.Give it a try if you don't mind obnoxious behavior, sounds like most people here like the food, but if you prefer to be treated decently, you will be better off somewhere else.

reviews.name: E W.
reviews.review: Ordered the gyro plate and was pleasantly surprised. The plate was heaped full of hot, fresh tasty food!  Gyro meat was delicious as were the rice and salad. The hummus is some of the best I've tasted. I didn't expect too much from mall food, but this was a lucky find. It was enough for my husband and I to share. Would definitely eat there again. The only down side is the aggressive nature of the employees. I don't like being shouted at to try samples. But I will say that a lot of the vendors (food and merchandise) at this mall use this same tactic. The mall needs to stop to behavior.

reviews.name: Yan W.
reviews.review: I know it's a mall chain restaurant, but it's good.  The ordering process is a little, odd, though.  A lady approached me with a pen and pad and asked for my order.  I then walked to the cashier to pay.  Then I would go through the cafeteria-style line and show the servers my ticket.  They then quickly scooped up all the yummy goodness.  I got the gyro platter, which was good.  It was cut a little too thick for my taste and perhaps there was a little too much "doughy" stuff (I have no idea what's in gyro meat except lamb and beef, but this one, had something else).  The rice was really buttery. However, it may have been cooked a little too long, or sat in the warming tray for a little too long, since it was getting on the mushy side.  The cucumber salad, surprisingly, was excellent.  If I was a vegetarian, I would just go for the cucumber salad.Finally, there was the price - pretty good for the area and "mall food."I would definitely come back if I needed a gyro fix.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: Chicken gyro plate was prettttty tasty...but the cucumber salad lacked some crispness for me.

reviews.name: J S.
reviews.review: I give them 4 because the sandwiches we had were fabulous AND the drinks are free, but the service was a little spotty. Order was slow so mgr gave us free dessert which was cool. I didn't complain she just offered. Managers reception bartender was s bit slow (not her fault). They need to make two separate lines one for mixed drinks and one for wine and beer to speed things up. We had to wait in line for quite awhile for a glass of beer while the bartender made mixed drinks for 6-7 ppl. . Staff was friendly too. Will come back again. Price was good for room. Sandwiches were really good....did I already say that?

reviews.name: Hal R.
reviews.review: We got two orders of wings. One buffalo and one bbq. We also got an order of fries.Let's start with the personnel. The service was as great as can be expected. Our server couldn't have been sweeter...when we saw her. This place was slammed packed and severely understaffed. Anyways, the food was great besides the fries. The wings are crispy and full of flavor. Both have their pros and cons so try them both!

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Great food and music. The Big Chicken sandwich is excellent! Best hotel restaurant I have been to at an Embassy Suites. Check it out. Very good

reviews.name: Rone M.
reviews.review: Fantastic! Fantastic! Fantastic! The Chef has put together an incredible menu that combines comfort food with good old fashioned home cooking. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: I wish I could give this place a better rating but the service is just soooooo awful! Food is good and beer is cold but have been waiting 20 minutes for someone to bring me my bill! WTF! Are you kidding me! You spend $200 for a room and you expect a certain level of service when you spend $50 for a salad and a couple beers. Last time I spend my money at this place.

reviews.name: William N.
reviews.review: I had never been here before and stopped by chance just to try a new place.Halfway through my meal, I realized that this was the BEST meal I have ever had in my 48 years on earth!I had ribeye steak cooked medium and hand cut fries and a salad w/ ranch dressing. If I were on death row, I would literally want that to be my last meal! Everything was SO delicious.Service was fast and friendly and they brought my salad out first quite quickly and gave me just the right amount of time to enjoy it before my steak arrived exactly how I wanted it. I have never done a yelp review before, but this was so great I just wanted to share it. Thanks, I would recommend this to anyone who wants an Awesome steak dinner!

reviews.name: Ellen M.
reviews.review: I've been dining at the Hillsboro Village and Cool Springs Sportsman's Grille for years and I've never had any problems.  On Friday, October 9th, I tried the Belle Meade location for the first time.  Being that it was in Belle Meade, I thought it would be top notch service and food.The restaurant is non-smoking.  The server came to the table smelling strongly of cigarette smoke.  I noticed when I came into the restaurant that the staff was sitting on the side deck smoking.  It didn't look very classy.  The server wasn't very friendly and she just went through the motions the entire night.  Having waited tables for over 10 years, bad service is a very big pet peeve of mine!  She acted as though we were an inconvenience.We ordered 3 Grey Goose dirty vodka martinis.  They were served in rocks glasses over ice.  I've never had a martini served this way before, nor were we asked if we wanted it up or on the rocks.  The server seemed very inconvenienced that we asked her to have the drinks made "up."Whenever was asked for something, she didn't say anything, she just left the table and got what we needed.  I ordered the cup of bean soup, which is .50 with a dinner.  I pointed to where it said .50 a cup when ordering.  When my bill came, I was charged $1.00 for the bean soup.  I ordered the steak and biscuits.  It came with a side.  I got the loaded baked potato.  I was charged $1.00 for the loaded part.  I didn't see the $1 charge on the menu, nor was I told about it.  To top it off, my loaded baked potato was inedible.  The cheese was hard and cold.  I didn't eat it nor could I finished the one bit I took.So I was overcharged $1.50.  I didn't say anything to the server as I had worked a long day and just wanted to go home after paying my bill.  Instead, I wanted to share my experience with you so you can BEWARE of this restaurant.  We debated on going to Finezza across the street rather than Sportsman's Grille.  I wish we should have picked Finezza!  I won't be returning to the Belle Meade Sportsman's Grille.Ellen M.

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: Sportsman's is a Nashville institution that's been in business for decades. It epitomizes a local place with regulars that are known by name.  The servers are friendly and attentive.   The atmosphere is laid back and casual, and the decor reminds you of an old hunting lodge.Sportsman's seems to be quite comfortable with its identity.  The service and atmosphere make up for average food.  The burgers are really good, but not great.  The fresh cut fries are hit or miss.   Their plate dinners and daily specials are a hit.  On Thursdays they have Italian night, and the pork Parmesan is one of the better meals that I've had and reminds me of home.  To me, that is why Sportsman's is so successful....they treat every guest like family and you'll leave feeling as if you've had a home cooked meal.

reviews.name: Jack V.
reviews.review: Sportsman's serves classic bar food with a heavy emphasis on fried food. The fried catfish is known as a specialty. The burger is more meh. They typically have a few specials listed on the board every night that run the gamut from sandwiches to steaks in the $30 range. This location, nestled at the edge of a residential area, brings in a fair amount of families and older patrons. As such, there isn't much of a bar scene. Bartenders typically aren't very welcoming either. This location seems like more of place to grab dinner than drink a beer at the bar. If you want to have a drink and watch football the location by Vanderbilt is likely more your scene.

reviews.name: Tiffany F.
reviews.review: Only giving a star because I have to.- first they were not busy. Our waitress had two tables and we sat there for 20 min before she took our order. She walked by us 5 times and never asked if we were ready. Finally we said we are ready.- we got nachos and the lodge salad. I feel like that's the only thing that was good about our time here.- The chicken parm waste of money!! It was not good

reviews.name: Kristin W.
reviews.review: Worst restaurant experience I've had in a very long time. We walked in on a Sunday around 11:45 am. There were about 4 other tables occupied, it was pretty dead. We sat there for probably 20 minutes and not one of the maybe 4 waiters acknowledged us. Never took a drink order or anything.Not to mention the place seemed really dirty.  Only one restroom was operable and it was filthy. It was frankly embarrassing to receive such horrible service in Belle Meade of all places. Will not be returning to any of locations again.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I went to the third location of Sportsman's finally.  I ate at the bar and had a Gerst or two in a fishbowl glass which is always entertaining.  The special was white fish and shrimp.  I got it fried because the diet always starts tomorrow.  The shrimp were huge and the fish was delicious.  Sportsman's rarely disappoints.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: Stopped in for coffee and dessert but was tempted by the appetizer menu :)Cheese binks were awesome.  I got the apple crisp and my husband got the pecan pie. Dessert was so-so.The menu was very thorough and the decor/atmosphere was comfortable (like the kind of place where your wealthy friends dads would go on a Saturday afternoon for whiskey and trout in the late 80s) with green carpet and stuffed ducks on the wall. We were counting on watching college basketball on TV and we got a great view of one of their many TVs and they were very accommodating by re-seating us away from the blowing air vent because we had our infant with us.Service was very attentive.Crowd was older and chill.There is a $6 kids menu

reviews.name: Rob C.
reviews.review: As close as Cheer's as you can get. Friendly, family-oriented and great food.  Happy hour is filled with locals talking sports, local news, etc. -just a great gathering atmosphere.  Dinner hours - you will have couples out for a laid back dinner to families with kids. Occassionaly have to wait briefly to use the restroom but the overall character, food and service makes up for it.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: I've lived in this area for about 3 years and I've never been here.  Why oh why did I make that mistake?So dragging around two awesome under 4 little boys is always a challenge.  Luckily they were both asleep (one in my lap one in the carseat) so I could enjoy like a responsible Dad my 2 for 1 beer (don't worry, Mama-San was driving) and down some Bam Bam Shrimp and a Blackened Mahi Sandwich with some string hand cut fries.Wow was I surprised.  Damn good for the Bellevue variety.Waitress also loved the fact my 3 year old once he awoke thought she was cute and wanted to bring her the receipt with my signature and tip on it all the way to her back at her prep station at back of the restaurant.   Pretty sure my son won "Playground Pimp" Ooo's and Ahh's from the waitstaff for that one.Bounce.   On to my next Yelp Adventure.

reviews.name: Annette S.
reviews.review: Sportsman's is where I take all my out of town friends when they come visit.  I know it's not your typical "southern food" staple, but the menu has a great selection of southern favorites as well as healthier options. The bar is always stocked with a wide variety and the beer on tap has a great selection of local rotaters so you can always find a local brew on tap. If you're a regular, this place feels like home.  If you're wanting to try somewhere new with great food, friendly service, and a true "local pub" kinda feel, this is your place.  It is now and always will be one of my favorite local jaunts.The fried pickles and catfish are awesome.  Great burgers.  Awesome Prime Rib for a great price.  All around good food and a large enough menu to keep you from getting bored with your options.

reviews.name: Carie W.
reviews.review: When we walked in it was slow. It took our waitress almost 10 minutes to greet us. We've waited over 30 minutes for our order which consisted of a Burger & French Dip. There's only 13 tables occupied and all but 3 tables to include ours have food. The waitress has the personality of a wet sock. I've been in and out of the restaurant business for 30 years. I'm not impressed. Really bad and sad.

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: It is with great discomfort to give Sportsman's 2 stars, but I think it is important.I go to Sportsman's at least 20 times per year.  I went there last night.I love the atmosphere.  But for the past year or so, it has been on a steady decline and I don't know why.  Used to be on a Friday night, all of Belle Meade was in Sportsman's, but not any more.  The quality of the food has really dropped.  They even changed the way they make their french fries ... why, who knows?To me, it feels like they are coasting based on the past.  If it keeps on this trajectory, they will hit the ground hard.Yes, I will keep going, of course, but less frequently.  This is such a great location and great opportunity, I hope they wake up before they destroy a good thing.It just seems like there is no caring leadership.

reviews.name: Shannon H.
reviews.review: Fried pickles were good but came out with our dinner. Older crowd was there watching golf on a Sunday evening about 5pm. LotsOf things on the menu. The Catfish Basket was good. Kids meatloaf was good and the bacon cheese burger was also good. I got the Club sandwich, dry but still good. VERY pricey for what it is. The fries are a shoe string style. I like the more thicker ones. Kids welcome but next time (if there will be one) it will be just the husband and I. $3.25 for draft bud light. $4.25 for the "special" drafts.  4 in our party dropped $80. Averages out $20 per person but we had a child with us. Service wasn't the greatest but I think it was just our waitress. Other's I seen did a good job. Over all a good place for family or date night. Couldn't get aGood pic the place was dark! Bathroom extremely small.Hall to bathroom tight squeeze.

reviews.name: Jim B.
reviews.review: We stopped here for a quick and light lunch before a doctor appointment at Vanderbilt University Hospital.  The restaurant is walking distance (1 block).We both had salads (grilled chicken and grilled salmon).  We both had their Dijon Vinaigrette dressing.  I had a cup of Chicken Tortilla soup.The soup was excellent.  Hot, thick, lots of chicken and cheese flavor and not very spicy.The salads were both very good.  We had the lunch size and it was just enough.Parking is spartan.  They have a few spaces in a lot across the street at the gas station.  We were lucky and had already parked in the free parking garage at the hospital, ahead of our appointment.We'd come back!

reviews.name: Chuck B.
reviews.review: I used to go here at least once per month. I take my family of six so I see price increases quickly! The food was always decent but we felt like we could find better if we just drove another 5-10 minutes away. And we did regularly but with the recent price increase they just moved mostly into the PASS category for us. It's a shame too because it so close. For these prices I'll find higher quality elsewhere.

reviews.name: Tuck L.
reviews.review: I'd like to give the Sportsman's Grille more stars because I like this place.  However, on Saturday night, at 10:10pm, the doors were locked! Hey, I know this is Nashville and everything, but closing on a Saturday night at 10:10?  COME ON, MAN.

reviews.name: Shooter S.
reviews.review: "Everybody knows your name!"Pretty much sets the tone. I grew up going to this place. The food can be hit or miss, but you just have to know how to order. It sounds crazy, but the fries for example: ask that they are fresh and extra crispy. What is great about Sportsman's is that they will do it. The catfish plate or the patty melt might be the best two things on the menu. Very family friendly.

reviews.name: Allie R.
reviews.review: Great bar! Awesome beer selection and even though I didn't eat the food looked awesome every time it went by.  I loved that cool German theme reminded me of bars back home in Wisconsin, once we move into the area I will be excited to come back.  Oh and the service what quick and great.Update:  Finally ate there and it was awesome!  I got the fried grouper and it was just as good as any fish I've had down in Hilton Head!  I was so excited.  Their fries are okay, little skinny and soft for me but they weren't bad.  Their ranch is definitely made in house and is unbelievable! I can't wait to go back!!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: The Sperry's of lunchtime, we split a burger, fries and salad and the two for 1 wine, $15 each, hmm a little pricey.  Food was OK.  The service was friendly and accommodating but honestly it is more for locals with a sense of nostalgia and not worth the trip across town.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: Update to my original review.  Quality continues to decline, prices continue to rise, and the fries still suck.  What was once our go-to place is now "only because it's near the house and we have run out of options."  What put the nail on the coffin is this:  I tired to place a to-go order for four of us and was told that the specials were not available for takeout.  If we wanted them to go, we had to pay full price.  What??  Our solution?  We sat down, ordered, asked for to-go boxes the minute our food arrived, packed our food up, and left.  Also, you now have to order take-out from the bar, instead of the counter up front.  Please, guys, why make your customers have to fight through the throngs at the bar just to get take-out?  You want to make your restaurant more profitable? Quit raising prices, and give your customers good service by charging fair prices for to-go orders and streamline the process.

reviews.name: Kathy C.
reviews.review: I don't know why I haven't written a review for the Sportsman's before now. We have eaten there many times and often order to pick up to bring home.Sportsman's Grille is our neighborhood restaurant / bar in Bell Meade. If you want to stop in for a beer, appetizer , drink or meal it's great  IF you don't go at regular dinner time on weekends or Saturday around lunch time. I love children..I had 3, but my kids are grown now. I just don't enjoy eating when there are 30 or so children in a small place while trying to relax.Going to Sportsman's around 5:00 - 7:00 PM seems to be family time for everyone in the neighborhood. It's loud and chaotic. We've found out that going in between meal times is the best time for a quiet meal or a drink. Now about the food...I've tried everything here from the Chicken Cobb Salad which is delicious to the Ribeye steak which is equally yummy. I've had the patty melt , different appetizers, bleu cheese hamburger, many different items. The only thing I haven't  liked was the broccoli salad ( way too sweet with too many raisins and the mayo or whatever they used. ) Depending on what day of the week and what time you go, the atmosphere can actually be two completely different places : A quiet relaxing restaurant to enjoy a meal and a drink with a friend or partner or a loud, busy place full of families with their small children.Go during an "off time" and you'll enjoy the atmosphere.If you have children, go during meal times and you'll be in similar company.If you place a telephone order to pick up, no matter how busy they are - the person has always said " Give us15 minutes" . The order is ready and packaged when you go to the bar to pick it up and it's always delicious ( and reasonably priced ).I haven't been to the Sportsman's Grille on the other side of town in years, so I can't say much about it, but the Grille in Belle Meade is GREAT. They have a big selection of beer, and a full bar.  No matter what time of day, the bar seems to always be full of regulars. The prices are very reasonable and the food is GOOD.

reviews.name: Andrea H.
reviews.review: Went there for the first time last night. Food wasn't good at all for the price--$20 for a fish sandwich and soggy, limp fries? No, thank you.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: The first time I came here was during the hottest damn summer I can remember before the summer of 2010, the summer of 2007.  The wife and I had contemplated moving to Bellevue and found what we thought was the perfect house.I remember vividly stopping here with my dad, who was in town visiting for the day and out to see the house.  We pulled into here and were sweating buckets.  It was around 2PM in the afternoon, late for lunch but way too early for dinner.  It was nice, cool and dim - a pleasant contrast to the dry, hot hell outside.We asked for some beer and got two fishbowls of draft Gerst beer.  I didn't realize until that moment that the 'Sportsman' restaurants were related to the Gerst House restaurants.  The beer was perfectly cold and the goblets were completely frozen.  A thin film of ice formed on the surface of the beer.  It was like going to heaven after the seltering mess we had endured outside.  We each did another and by that point, really didn't give a damn what the temperature was outside.  I think we saw the house, too.  But good gravy, that was the best beer I've ever had.  Somehow, and to this day I am not sure of the accounting method, we were only charged $5 for drinking what seemed like a gallon of frosty beer.Fast forward to modern times.  I'm a dad, and I contribute to the caucophony of parents and children that plagues this place in the evenings between the hours of 5-7.  They have great fried pickles, home fries(when they aren't too greasy), fried catfish, sandwiches, fish, burgers, bbq, etc - everything is good.  The service is pretty decent too, a must when your young one is in the 95th percentile in height/weight.  I especially like coming here with my vegetarian wife as the scores of stuffed and mounted heads really set the tone well.

reviews.name: Aaron D.
reviews.review: If you don't have young active energetic loud children, you may want to find someplace else to eat early on a Friday night.General cacophony aside, the only part of my meal that I actually enjoyed was the beer (Fat Tire on tap).I really liked Sportsman's Grille when I went a couple times earlier this year, but this time the food just came across as very 'meh' (dry burger, burnt fries, tasteless catfish, decent cole slaw). Oh and lots of Yelpers rave about the pickled chips. I have to say about the whole pickle chip thing - "I don't get it." I mean, I like to munch on one - possibly two - dill pickles from time to time. But a whole basket full of greasy fried pickle slices and a ramekin of ranch dressing? Ugh. My stomach declares defeat.The interior has a nice ambience and I wouldn't mind meeting a friend for a beer there sometime on a quiet afternoon or perhaps late in the evening if I could get a quiet booth (did I just use the word 'quiet' twice in the same sentence?) but at this point I can't imagine going back to Sportsman's Grille for a meal.

reviews.name: Jeff M.
reviews.review: I love the BBQ here...great wines (Sonoma By the glass!) free wifi, family friendly, old school and 2 TVs with sports in the bar...perfect!

reviews.name: Rex H.
reviews.review: This is my neighborhood sports bar, but despite the name, it's more restaurant than sports bar. Actually, come to think of it, the name "Sportsman's" doesn't reflect the "family" type place it is around 5-7 p.m. each night.While I'm not necessarily recommending it for visitors from out of town, it's easily the spot I frequent the most. And unlike some places where I always order the same thing, I enjoy lots of Sportsman staples: the blackened chicken salad is a favorite, but once in a while I'll go for their very good burger. The nightly specials are good and "comfortable" food -- especially the catfish. The staff is very friendly and efficient. And the bar area seems to have a very "everyone knows your name" friendly vibe. Before Nashville banned smoking in restaurants, it was a very smokey place, but that's become a welcomed distant memory. However, for smokers, there's an outside bar, eating area. Not very much ambiance, but the folks out there don't seem to mind.If you are visiting from out of town, I think the most unique and "southern" thing they have is barbecue served with cornbread. At one time, the barbecue was from Whitts, which will provide you with a Middle-Tennessee style barbecue (if there is such a thing) and the cornbread is served in "cakes," which means "like a pancake." Quite good, but I don't really order it as I enjoy my barbecue moments elsewhere.

reviews.name: Hillary Y.
reviews.review: If you're looking for a dive bar atmosphere in a nice part of town, then I guess this is the place for you...it's dank and dark inside, the menus are kinda sticky, and it still smells like smoke. The food is all of the fried variety for the most part, and for fried food it was...typical fried food. Good beer selection, a full bar if you're not into beer, and the service was probably the best part of our experience, as our server was really attentive and energetic. All in all: I don't expect to make this a frequent destination, but if I'm in the mood, and everything else is closed, then I might go there. Maybe. But probably not.

reviews.name: Melissa W.
reviews.review: My sister and I stopped in for a Friday night dinner, and boy will we go back.  We split the Filet tail with a Baked potato, and it was to die for.  Small close quarters, but a definte return visit worthy.

reviews.name: Anthony N.
reviews.review: Great bar to meet the locals and get a feel for Belle Meade. Great local beer and good no nonsense food.

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: I've already reviewed Sportsman's in the Village, which is the location I frequent the most, but the other night I was in the Belle Meade area and had a hankering for some sliders--so I stopped in Sportsman's on Harding.  I forgot how much I like this location too!First off, kudos to them for including fries with their sliders!  Sliders are technically an appetizer, but I get them as a meal--in the Village location, you have to buy fries separate, but here they are included.  That's just the kind of thing that makes my day!  Yes simple pleasures I know.  Other than small things like that, the menu is basically  the same--upscale bar food such as chicken tenders, burgers, chicken sandwiches, fried pickles, salads, etc.  I like the atmosphere here too--it's smaller, but a bit more open and not as dark as the Village.  Different crowd too--a bit older, wiser, and more upscale!  You are in Belle Meade, after all!  No frat guys here.  Which is nice if you are just in the mood to eat and watch a game in peace.  Plenty of TVs and a decent sized bar, Sportman's in Belle Meade is a great place to go to hang out with friends in a quieter yet still sports bar setting.  I'm a fan!

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: This place was always a nice respite to get some lunch when I worked in Burton Hills. It was a quick hop away but was so relaxing to go here and get out of the Green Hills traffic. This Sportsman's may be in Belle Meade, but I can't say you'll feel like you're in Belle Meade when you are inside.It's got the lodge decor, and there seem to be regulars drinking at the bar during lunch. They've got your basics on the menu. I would tell you to try the fried pickle chips which are so good. They may be the best I've had in Nashville. I'm also a big fan of the tuna melt for lunch. Service is fine if a little slow at times. They've got some nice huge salads for lunch as well.I think my only minor complaint might be it seems a little pricey for lunch, but I don't mind it too much. I haven't seen it that crowded for lunch during the week which can be nice as well.

reviews.name: Katherine M.
reviews.review: This Sportsman's is much closer to my house, but it is very, very different than the one in The Village. Much smaller and a different crowd. I like it, but I'm more apt to catch up with a friend over a beer here than the other location. This one is not as crowded or noisy. It also tends to not have as many college kids. But, I've seen it kinda dead on weekends. Then, at times people are spilling off the porch. One never knows!Their menu is the same great bar food. A total fav of mine. The service is great and girls, you'll probably see some pretty cute guys here! At least I think so! It's just a totally different feel. Try them both and pick your favorite!

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: Sportsmans is the perfect neighborhood pub.  Cold beer, hot food, sports on TV, and friendly staff.  It has no airs about it.   If Nashville has a Cheers, this is it.   Don't go if you want something trendy, but do if you want a place you can be yourself.

reviews.name: Emily Y.
reviews.review: Great Shave Ice, Hawaiian style in Nashville!  Very reminiscent of being somewhere warm and tropical.  Lots of tropical flavors.  Glad to see this "establishment", and hope it stays!*The address given is for Hog Heaven.  However, look for the trailer located in the parking lot to the side of Hogs Heaven (away from McD, and closer to Centenniel park).  They said they'd be open until it got too cold!

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Nice place. Plenty of parking and good location. Nice outdoor area. Friendly staff.Drinks are good. They have a good variety of juice and smoothie options, all of which I've had are very tasty.

reviews.name: Armand H.
reviews.review: The staff is EXTREMELY friendly. A rousing "good-morning" every time I've walked into this place definitely makes me want to give them my money. I mean, it's healthy!

reviews.name: Suzy B.
reviews.review: Love the smoothies and food here!  They have a good selection of to-go food and it's much fresher and tastier than other juice bars I've tried in Nashville.   The customer service is really friendly and enthusiastic,  it's actually a little intense and over the top for my taste but can't really complain about that.My only complaint is the music is always super loud in there which makes it hard to order and not very enjoyable if you are eating in and trying to talk to a friend.  Otherwise LOVE this place!

reviews.name: Brittney W.
reviews.review: LOVE the atmosphere of this place! Really great staff, too. I always end up hanging out with them a few minutes just because they're easy to talk to and keep up a great banter. I've only had a few of their smoothies and they always taste great and I tried their sniffle stopper shot (tastes healthy, lol). I plan on making them a weekend stop from now on.

reviews.name: Anita A.
reviews.review: One of my most favoritest spots!  Smoothies, juices, veggies n hummus and spring rolls are yummy. I wish the rice paper on the spring roll was softer but the peanut sauce is amazing!!! The cilantro hummus is yummorama! ! The Doc smoothie and the Mint to be smoothie are my fave! Nice selection of protein bars are great!!! The customer service is always great! Very upbeat!!NomNom!

reviews.name: Laura B.
reviews.review: This place is amazing. I really appreciate the friendly staff and the vegan options. They offer kombucha and that's such an surprising find outside of east nashville or whole foods. I wish there were more smoothie options but they honestly make up for it with great staff and quality drinks.Why go to a coffee shop for a smoothie when I can go to this place. There's almost always a parking spot right out front. I love it. Only serious sad point is the hours.. This place isn't open late so be sure to get there on a breakfast or lunch break!!!!!

reviews.name: Rachel C.
reviews.review: I just had a wonderful experience today at the Juice Bar in Berry Hill. First, I was greeted ever so politely by the staff who didn't rush me at all while I pondered the menu board of what to get. They had lots of yummy options to choose from- juices, to smoothies, to make your own, granola bars, on the go options, salads, and more! While I waited for my delicious Green smoothie to be made, the staff chatted with me and made me feel right at home. I also got the cranberry quinoa kale salad which was also delicious. I will definitely be making this my go to juice bar since they were super quick making my smoothie! Awesome experience - if your in the area I recommend you try this place! :)

reviews.name: Jessica E.
reviews.review: I came here for the first time this morning slightly apprehensive. I'm not much on healthy foods but I'm trying. I had no idea what I wanted but the two people working were wonderful. They walked me through everything, gave me samples and definitely helped me make a decision. I chose the Sweet Greens juice and the slim and sassy essential oil shot. They are both wonderful! Y'all are great and I will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I go here all the time. It is two doors down from my business which makes eating healthy super easy! First of all the juices are the best you will ever have. No frothy weird junk at the top- just delicious, pure juice! My favorite is the ginger greens! I am also a big fan of their 'shots.' I have used their sniffle stopper multiple times when I've felt a cold coming on and it helps me to feel better faster! Their food is delicious! I love the kale and quinoa salad and their spring rolls are one of my favorite things on earth! And the staff is the absolute sweetest. They are so fun and friendly and FAST!

reviews.name: Jamie W.
reviews.review: I'm so happy I found this hidden gem of vegetable juices and more!  High quality ingredients and great recipes! The service is excellent and when leave, your mood is always better than when going in! Keep it up Juice Bar!

reviews.name: Shara D.
reviews.review: I hate to be the odd man out here, but I was thoroughly unimpressed and underwhelmed by my first (and last) experience at the Juice Bar yesterday. The staff was friendly and the place is cute. Two stars for you! However, when I order a $7 juice, I kinda expect it to be made to order. This juice was poured from an uncovered pitcher that had been sitting in a refrigerator, and the result was an overly sweet flavor that honestly nauseated me. I ain't lying- it tasted like bubblegum. Finally, the menu states that it is ¢50 to add parsley, yet adding parsley to my $7 juice made the price jump to $9.55 with tax, somehow. Sorry. I'm thrilled that people are enjoying this new place, but as it stands I still have yet to find a good juice place in Nashville.

reviews.name: Clayton T.
reviews.review: I can't say enough about The Juice Bar @ Berry Hill. The staff is immensely impressive, hard working, and will drawl you in with their welcoming energy and keep you coming back with their incredible attention to detail when creating your item. There are many competitors in this market that to my knowledge popped up after the Juice Bar's Brentwood location was doing so well with business. The differences are endless between the others and the Juice Bar, but the most impactful one to me is feeling so welcomed.I love me some veggie juice and most likely would even if a street vendor used organic veggies and a nice juicer, but the taste and my experience is so greatly impacted by the entire experience. The urban juicer is right next to my house but I would rather drive a touch further or walk in order to feel welcomed and like part of the communithTo sum it up the Juice Bar is Authentic. They walk the walk and talk the talk. The only staff employed i guarantee genuinely cares about your health and taste needs instead of other venues mentioned above with young staff thrown in more concerned with what they say at their friends house the night before or only acknowledging your existence to swipe your card and hand you your drink.Only Advice: My only advice is to have an option to tip when using a CC. We all know any juice is already a substantial purchase and this option is available most likely to not pressure the customer although a tip option button when using a CC would be great to reward individual employees and a way to keep track of which shifts get the most tips charting their hard work and costumer satisfaction.Lastly, go checkout the Juice Bar! Your body will thank you! =)

reviews.name: Katie B.
reviews.review: I read previous reviews about the staff being friendly and they definitely weren't kidding! I stopped by for a smoothie before a road trip and mentioned that it was my first time in their cute spot. They were nice enough to upgrade my small smoothie to a large at no additional cost. The prices are decent, they had a good amount of food available for sale and I was in and out in less than 5 minutes. I will definitely be back and I can't wait to try their other juices!

reviews.name: Vanessa K.
reviews.review: I love this place! I couldn't be happier that it's located a mere 5 minutes from me. I usually go to the Brentwood location, but now that this one has opened, I'll be here often! The drinks are delicious and it's such a cute and quaint spot. The people who work here are friendly & they're super fast!! Great place to run in & grab my morning juice :)

reviews.name: Yasmine M.
reviews.review: This place is amazing!!! My favorite juice bar in Nashville! Not only do they make high quality juice but the customer service we receive keeps us coming back!

reviews.name: Betty K.
reviews.review: I have gone to this place twice, and the juices are amazing! I was accompanying a friend during my first visit so I didn't order anything, but I was provided with a handful of juices to sample which were all really good. I went back the second time and got the Super Greens juice- delish. Go check it out!!

reviews.name: Meredith E.
reviews.review: Great visit this morning. I ordered a smoothie using the app on my way to pick it up. Tasted delicious and the staff was super friendly.

reviews.name: Mark C.
reviews.review: My fiancee and do not got to Mexican restaurants a lot because all of them seem to have the same exact menu as the next. We heard about Guac through some friends of ours and decided to try it even though we thought that it was just another typical Mexican restaurant. Luckily for us Guac is so far from the typical Mexican restaurant. In my opinion, Guac puts other Mexican restaurants to shame.Just like all other Mexican restaurants, there are the typical items: Chimichangas, Burritos, etc. My fiancee ordered the Burrito and Salsa Verde, it was HUGE !! I didn't try it so I can't comment about the taste. I can however comment about my dinner, the Mariscada Ranchera. Amazing and delicious are the 2 only words that I can use to describe it. Filled with seafood that included: snow crab, squid, shrimp, scallops, octopus (didn't eat the octopus, I have my limitations) among other things in a spicy red sauce. It was delicious and very filling. Imagine Joes Crab Shack.....but Mexican style !! Make sure you ask for some extra napkins because you will need them for the snow crab legs !! It is not overpriced at all.  My meal was $15.99 and my fiancee's was $8.99. For the 2 of us for dinner with a some queso and chips and 2 drinks, it was roughly $40. Not bad at all. Our server Jake was awesome and made sure our drinks were filled at al times and was really attentive to our needs. Make sure you give this place a chance. I see some negative comments on here but try to look past those and give Guac a shot. You will not be disappointed.Thanks for reading,Mark C.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: When we pulled up, Mini said "Oh hope they don't close like the other 50 restaurants that have been here"This is exactly the problem of being in a strip mall in Bellevue. You never know if they are going to be there in a few weeks. But this place was far better than I expected. I sort of loath the tons of cheese with no discernable tastes other than peppers that accompanies many Mexican restaurants in Nashville. Guac was noticeably different. The enchiladas looked like chicken with cheese and the fajitas had real steak like meat. I got fajitas which were definitely light on the steak and heavy on the lettuce and beans, but what was there was really good. The tortillas tasted great and they gave us plenty of chips and salsa. We went in for queso and guac both of which were good enough that I ate them but also made the kiddies happy. They definitely could up their salsa game given the number of legit Mexicans that were working in the kitchen - it tasted pretty store bought.Our waiter was super sweet, the portions were generous and everything was clean and relaxing. This place stands out a bit in Bellevue because its quieter than other Mexican places and pretty darn tasty (vs tasteless). For $50 for 3 people and mom's margarita, it was a super solid deal. And the fact that the margarita was the size of a fishbowl didn't hurt at all.We'll put this one in the 'mommy doesn't want to cook' rotation.

reviews.name: Jim M.
reviews.review: If you are thinking about looking for a good Mexican meal in Bellevue forget it. You should just "guac" on by this place. There is a reason there were only four tables being used.If you name a Mexican restaurant GUAC what should be the number one thing you do well? Thats right guacamole. I would bet my house that what they served me was straight out of a pouch. No tomatoes, onions or even chunks of avocado. Guac's guac looked like the "all natural" baby food my wife tried to give our kids in the early 90's.They do get one star for attempting to make homemade salsa, a little heavy on the cilantro.If you order something to drink, drink slowly. The combo of  salsa with heavy onions and no refills because the service was sooooooo slow and inattentive could create a bad combination that will kill your tastebuds before you get your very bland and uninspired food.No regresso a esto restaurante para mi, nunca!

reviews.name: Joy M.
reviews.review: Both times we've been here both of us were very pleased with food and service. Awesome margaritas.Guac isn't the cheapest Mexican restaurant this side of town but we've found it to be well worth it.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: Hrrmmmmm, wish I could put 3.5 stars.  The burrito I just had was a spicy green chili carnitas burrito that was 4 stars, but the first few times I came in they tended to be out of carnets, but I'm letting that slide as they were very newly opened.  They also have some pretty funky options like tongue, which I'm not really brave enough to try yet.  Their salsa is probably the best I've ever had, or at least tied for the best.  If you pull a phone out to take pictures be prepared to have the owner come over and ask you to like them on Facebook, which I find odd.  I had the torta and a couple other little $2-3 items that really were meh, but they do have some good stuff here.

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: Meh. It was okay. The service was good, but the food was kinda blah. On the plus side, the burritos are huge and the salsa is fresh. The salsa is pretty spicy though. I saw another reviewer say it had no heat at all. They have stepped up their salsa game since then!I ordered a traditional margarita, and they accidentally brought me a mango margarita. They realized the mistake before I took my first sip, but when they pointed it out, I decided to taste it, and I kept it because it was good. I got the Burrito Mexicano, and my husband got the Burrito Texas. Other than the size, they weren't very impressive or authentic. We tried this place because we were excited to have a Mexican place so close to home. In the future, I'll be happy to make the extra drive for Taco Mamacita or Sopapilla's.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: Had some solid food here with the wife while in Bellevue, and look forward to going to some more locale versions and hoping they are just as good. The chips? Killer! The home made salsa? Killer! Just don't make the mistake of thinking the green stuff in the ketchup bottle is guacamole or some cilantro mix. It is not, its their rely hot salsa!Ordered a burrito that had steak in it and it was very good. Had some quesadilla like thing that was 2 corn tortillas, one on top and bottom, with some beef I've never heard of, and it was really good. I actually could have just ate one of them as they filled me up pretty fast. My only complaints are, the have menudo but its only on the weekend! And today they were out of langue and I haven't had it in so long when I saw it on the menu I got excited then sad when told it was out!

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Bottom Line: I've heard folks in Bellevue complain there aren't any restaurants. False.First, the salsa. It's fresh like it was just blended together. While heat isn't really here, that's ok. There's a fine balance of fresh veggies and cilantro. I'm serious. It's good salsa.Next, along with the salsa, they deliver with the chips a bottle of Jalepeno avacodo sauce. That's where the heat comes in. Good alone or in tandem with the salsa, the pre-meal chip experience is a good one here.I had for my meal the Texas Burrito with Al Pastor pork. Yes. A delicious, cheesy, full burrito with everything you need and nothing you don't. I didn't know how much I loved pastor until I had it for lunch...and dinner. The burrito was large enough to enjoy for two meals (or one big one.) excellent quality and quantity for the price. My buddy had the ground beef taco salad. He seemed very satisfied with his choice. It looked tasty. Daneli served us. She was terrific! Good server and very friendly. Thanks Daneli! We'll be back.Atmosphere is very comfortable and pleasant.  I'll drive from Green Hills to get my Guac. Bellevue has a gem. Don't spoil it.

reviews.name: Lisa W.
reviews.review: I want to like Guac.  Location is easy to get to, the menu is extensive.  But I've eaten here a handful of times and only had one good item.  The others all fell flat.It also seems to take the kitchen a dreadfully long time to get food out.  Even when the place just our table, we waited a long time.I'm not sure if it's just a new place working out the kinks or inexperienced management.Hope they can pull it together.

reviews.name: Dew T.
reviews.review: Best Mexican addition to the west side of town! So happy to welcome Quac to the neighborhood! The flavor is amazing. I order vegetarian most times and I love the selections. The salsa is great and comes w/ a side of hot sauce to make it hotter! The queso is really tasty too! Chips are flavorful and not too greasy! The veggies are seasoned and grilled perfectly. I've had the veggie quesadilla, veggie tacos, and the veggie chimichanga. I loved each one! And will order them all again! *My husband typically gets a chicken dish and he always loves his too.

reviews.name: Keith P.
reviews.review: They seated us quickly and took an order for drinks,  chips and salsa. But then brought us the chips and salsa but not the drinks. I went to the bar to ask the waiter for the drinks and he told me that he was getting us more chips.I told him that we just needed the drinks because the children were suffering because the salsa was a little hot. He said he would be there as soon as he got the chips.  Food came out for two of the four of us. Had to wait for the rest of the food. Food was good. Service was horrible

reviews.name: Beth L.
reviews.review: My family had a very nice experience at Guac. I agree with the other reviewers that the salsa was very fresh and tasty - it even had fresh cilantro in it! In my opinion, though, it was quite spicy!My two littles got their Kids Quesadillas SUPER fast - such a bonus when you have hungry kids under 5 that get full on chips at Mexican restaurants before their food comes. However, there is no kids menu to draw on which is no big deal but worth noting.My husband got a Burrito Mexicana (with chorizo) and I got the Burrito Verde (with chicken). IT WAS SO MUCH FOOD and so yummy. My burrito was stuffed with chicken and rice and topped with a mildly spicy verde sauce mixed with some shredded queso. I have a hard time eating spicy food but this was just the right amount - it made my nose run but I couldn't stop eating it! My husband's burrito had a totally different flavor from mine - much creamier and richer. I just think that's interesting to note because so often at Mexican restaurants all the burritos taste basically the same but not these! The ingredients taste like quality stuff. The rice was tasty and not too dry - maybe slightly on the oily side. I also liked that it was just rice - no diced peppers or onions were added to it. I am now eating my leftover Burrito Verde for lunch and I still may not finish it - I definitely got my money's worth!Food was good and fast - we will be back for sure!

reviews.name: Scott F.
reviews.review: Clean restaurant, friendly service and the chimichanga was excellent! Can't wait to eat the leftovers!

reviews.name: Josh C.
reviews.review: The food is great....but you are going to PAY TOO MUCH FOR IT!*Note, my order was for carry out.Before I start my review of the food, I do want to point out how insanely expensive it became to carry out food.  We paid $36 for two people to carry out.  We bought cheese dip at $3.29.  You would think that that would include chips with it, but it did not.  We had to pay $1.99 for chips.  I asked for salsa also.  I was asked how many, and given the smaller containers they come in, I asked for 3.  Well, each one was a dollar.  So, all I have is chips, salsa and cheese dip, and I'm close to $9!!!  We aren't talking large amounts of any of this either.  They were smaller fast food style cups of (1) cheese and (3)salsa.  It's my opinion that chips and salsa should be free, and fi not, chips should definitely be included in the price of cheese dip.Given that, the food was a decent step above the others around Bellevue, I was happy with food quality.  I love Mexican food.  I mean, I really love Mexican food, and this was pretty good food.The items we ordered didn't disappoint.  We got 1 gordita($3.99) and 1 mulita(3.99) ala carte, and a Mexican shrimp cocktail (15.99!!?).  The carnitas in the gordita were VERY good and the gordita masa itself was great.  I didn't care as much for the ground beef in the mulitas, but that's hit or miss and too much personal preference.  My wife was happy with her shrimp cocktail, but was still surprised by the price.The other suggestion I would have would be an improvement of the menu that displayed more combination platters.  I would have loved to be able to get a gordita, something else, and rice and beans without paying 14 dollars.  I think more combination platters would better show the versatility of the menu and provide some more value.

reviews.name: Jake J.
reviews.review: Lazy servers, terrible manager running the place just to start. I first walked in and stood around for about 5 min as every waitress looked at me and did not even try to seat me. I sat myself and waited 10 min to find myself having a staring contest with the manager and the staff on hand. Let's just say that they won because I ended up walking out. I Will never come back

reviews.name: Megan L.
reviews.review: I usually get the chicken taco salad, which I always really enjoy, but I've also had the tamales and they were great too. Everyone is really friendly and the service is fast. Chips and salsa are also tasty!

reviews.name: Alvin P.
reviews.review: 2 stars might be generous.  The place is pretty new, so figured to check it out because I like Mexican food.  It's in a packed strip mall, filled with a bunch of fast food options, so it's a bid hidden from the road.  However, there is a good amount of parking to go around, therefore parking wasn't a problem.   The place also seemed pretty clean, it being new and all.  The service was friendly, I called in with an order for take out and they were nice and attentive.  And they had the order ready to go when I got there.   The place was less than half full when I was there, so it wasn't that busy. So far so good.  And then I got home and ate the food.   I ordered two things, and since I'm vegetarian for the most part, none of it involved meats.  So this review is based just on the vegetarian options.  I got a chilli relleno, and a veggie burrito.  The Chilli Relleno was an absolute disaster.   First of all, it's much smaller than I expected it to be.  But I can live with that, but the filling was just horrible.  It's essentially filled with just a cooked egg that you get with biscuits from a fast food place for breakfast.  It tasted horrible, didn't go with the dish at all.  Halfway through the dish, I just took out the egg, and set it aside, and after that, the whole dish was just empty.   No other taste at all, so it was basically just an egg and tasteless chilli.  Would've really preferred it if they would actually have some kind of flavor to the dish. Or if they actually filled it with maybe cheese or veggies.  They could break up tortilla chips and cheese into the dish, and it would be better than this egg based one.  I wouldn't recommend this at all, just a waste of money.  You are better off making eggs at home and eating with bread.   The veggie burrito was a step up from the relleno, but so is biting your nails.  The burrito also lacked flavor, just didn't taste like much at all.  The burrito is definitely big, so there's plenty of it, but just seemed very plain to me.  I covered it with hot sauce at home, but that besides the point, because besides the heat from the sauce, this was a forgettable meal.  Obviously, it's from limited choices that I picked from, and I don't know how their meat options are, but I wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone.  I think I've had better food at fast food Mexican places than here.   On the bright side, there is a frozen yogurt place two doors down, so you can drown out the bland taste afterwards with some frozen yogurt.

reviews.name: Tim R.
reviews.review: i had my first meal at Guac today and it was great! The reviews are right, some of the best salsa ever! The margaritas are good, and i can recommend the Acapulco Burrito. I will be back for sure.

reviews.name: Brian N.
reviews.review: Margarita Pitcher Price on the high side. Ordered a pitcher not asking price and when bill came out it was $44 and some change. I have done this in several Mexican restaurants in the area and typical price is $16-$22 and you can usually get 9 glasses. Was a little upset that wasn't told the price before hand. Food is still great, just won't be returning for the casual drink.

reviews.name: Skepto P.
reviews.review: Do not expect the fast-paced service of Las Palmas or Cancun. Sit back and enjoy this food. It is worth it. Best salsa Ive had in town. Period. Also ask for the creamy green jalapeño salsa. Muy bueno. I was very pleased to find pupusas on the menu. They are a Salvadoran specialty served here in the traditional manner with curtido, a cabbage slaw. You can get them elsewhere in town but this is the only place I know of on this side of the county. They are as good as the best I've had elsewhere. My wife had enchilada suizas, which she thought were excellent. They had a garnish of the eponymous guacamole which was notable for its crazy freshness. I had a "Burrito de Mole."  I only can stand mole when it's good. Duuuuuuuh. Fans know what I mean: bad mole is bitter and burned tasting. This was wonderfully seasoned with a slight cinnamon taste. Not sweet, but still had that piquant edge that makes mole so warm and wonderful. This restaurant is a fantastic addition to our side of town. I wish them the best and hope you give them a try.

reviews.name: R M.
reviews.review: Just not the same when they opened. Service is so-so. Food is somewhat expensive for what you receive now. Since for me it has slipped into mediocrity, it is no longer a destination place for Mexican like before. Too bad. But still, an ok place to fuel up.

reviews.name: John F.
reviews.review: Slow, Slow, Slow! Tart top shelf margaritas, bland cheese dip, cold to warm food. NEVER AGAIN!

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: Bellevue has no shortage of Mexican restaurants, but Guac is the new kid on the block and may just surprise you. The staff is friendly and helpful with explaining menu items. The manager is on the floor and at the door warmly greeting returning customers with a smile and a kind "thank you for visiting us again". To start you are given warm chips and a small carafe of fresh salsa. The salsa is light and slightly smoky. A pleasant change from the standard salsa. I ordered the Texas Burrito with spicy pork, it was good, with a nice balance of spice, sauce and cheese. There are booths as well as table seating. They have a bar but currently the are not serving alcohol, so my battered liver was given the night off. All and all a nice spot, visit and give the new kid a chance, you will be pleased with what you find.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: The food preparation was slow despite the fact that the restaurant was not busy at the time.  The food was mediocre, and the mole sauce did not taste good.

reviews.name: Benjamin T.
reviews.review: In a word: Ewwww.First, the good. The service was fine. Our server was pleasant and patiently took the time to answer a couple of questions about the menu. Service was better than average for an inexpensive restaurant in a strip mall.  Also, the chips and salsa at the beginning were pretty decent.  Most importantly, it did not make us sick or anything, which along with outright rudeness would probably be my threshold for a one-star review.  So two stars, but the bar is pretty outstandingly low.Now the bad:1. The cardinal sin -- the food did not taste good.  We had two main dishes -- fish tacos and a "vegetarian" (more on the quotation marks below) chile relleno.  The fish (tilapia) in the tacos was too salty and WAY too greasy for allegedly grilled fish.  The tacos were served with the fish, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, and cilantro -- but not with the other usual accompaniments for a fish taco like white sauce or cabbage or lime. The chile relleno was filled with what seemed to be melted American cheese.  Really.  It tasted like the plastic-wrapped slices melted.  The breading was very heavy, and it was soggy on top because it was topped with a yucky mystery sauce (see below).  The accompanying rice was way too salty, and the smear of guacamole on the plate was roughly the quality of what I expect on Irish pub nachos, not what I expect at a place called Guac.2. The menu was inaccurate in troubling ways.  Most troubling, the extensive "vegetarian" section of the menu -- maybe 15 items -- wasn't.  Almost all the "vegetarian" items were accompanied by beans, which (to our server's credit) our server informed us were made with pork, even for the "vegetarian" dishes. She told us this when we double-checked about the non-meat status of the fish taco accompaniments.  Lying about the vegetarian status of your food on your menu is a pretty shitty thing to do to customers, many of whom feel strongly about this.  You can label a menu section as "vegetable dishes" and have them contain meat, fine, but if you label it "vegetarian" it damn well better be vegetarian.  Vegetarian means no meat, not just no big chunks of meat.Less troubling but still not great, the food descriptions on the menu were wrong.  For instance, the chile relleno was described as being topped with egg and a tomato sauce.  Our server informed us that the "egg" referred to the breading, not an actual egg.  We expected that the "tomato" sauce would be something like ranchero sauce, but it turned out to be some sort of mystery sauce instead.3. The mystery sauce was just gross.I honestly don't know what this stuff was.  I'm pretty sure it was not primarily tomato.  Maybe some sort of odd mole?  Anyway, it was a bright orange sauce that tasted like canned tomato soup mixed with vinegar, mayonnaise, and sugar.  It could have been an authentic chile relleno accompaniment from somewhere (I doubt it), but even if it was, it was just gross. Yuck.If it wasn't obvious, we won't be going back.

reviews.name: Shane T.
reviews.review: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Nashville.  The location is a bit out of pocket - so I don't get there too often, but the food is great, they have really good spicy options, and the prices are reasonable. There's better food at twice the price - but this spot has the best bang for your buck.

reviews.name: Tyler U.
reviews.review: I recently moved from California where we had great authentic Mexican food.  The search great Mexican food will continue after visiting Guac.

reviews.name: Conner B.
reviews.review: TERRIBLE service...I was placed at a dirty table and it took ten minutes before they cleaned it with windex...I had to remind them a second time for my drink and they gave me food with no silverware...the food was just another typical Bellevue Mexican restaurant...the service alone will destroy this place

reviews.name: Katie M.
reviews.review: POOR SERVICE!! Only three other tables with customers, not busy at all. Waited to be seated, staff talking back by the bar area. Finally seated and once again waited for our waitress. She took our drink order and never returned, a waiter walked by and we asked if he could check on our drinks. He told us he was not our waiter and we needed to check with our waitress!! Seriously?! When she does return, she has a negative attitude and extremely unattentive.  ALL four orders were incorrect! We told our waitress and she took the plates and walked away, no comment. We again waited 15 minutes for our food. I did request to speak to the manager, I explained what happened and he said he was sorry. We had been there so long now and just wanted to leave, had them make the order to go. I went to pay and all the manager said was he was sorry again, no discount offered. This was one of the worst experiences of customer service my friends and I have had! We didn't even end up eating the food, we were so over it. So unfortunately I cannot comment on the food. We ended up going somewhere else, had cocktails and appetizers. We did not hesitate sharing our experience with others! Never ever again will we return. We should not have paid and left the food there. The only thing we enjoyed was the one cocktail, we were never asked if we wanted anything else to drink. I was hoping to really like this place since it's close to home. Staff really needs to be trained or let go and hire new employees!Taco Bell has better customer service!

reviews.name: Razzle D.
reviews.review: OK lets start with the good. Good food, good portions, and good variety.Now for the bad. Service is hit or miss and the menu looks so goofy. Dolphins all over the thing and menu layout is nuts. Don't forget the Spain atmosphere in a Mexican restaurant :). Overall good so far after 4 visits.

reviews.name: S B.
reviews.review: This is my new favorite place! Their salsa is the best in town and I haven't had anything that isn't delicious off the menu. Super casual, great place to go hang out and drink cervesas.

reviews.name: Ted W.
reviews.review: Finally a good Mexican restaurant in Bellevue. I am at this place for the second night in a row as I type this. Last night, we got the shrimp tacos and steak nachos. Both were delicious. And the owner is extremely friendly and welcoming. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: Got my hopes up and what i got was nothing creative or original. Just another Mexican place. Oh my bad their salsa is green.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: Not impressed with my second visit. Weird vibe, the owner stalks around like he wants to make you feel like he is engaged but really he doesn't say much or check on your food/service. But his presence feels like a dictatorship. We had 3 waiters that were unaware of the other waiters having waited on us already. My fajitas were warm, not hot. Not impressed with the taste. I had to go get my own silverware. I had to go get the highchair for my kid, even after they said they would bring it. Once again they had no margaritas and no Horchata even though the weird menu still offers them. Seriously high prices for a bland experience.

reviews.name: Terry W.
reviews.review: I love Mexican food and am generally easy to please. I went in for dinner during the week and left very uninspired. Their take on chips and salsa was different, and the best part of the meal. The entree (fajita) was bland and almost unseasoned. The service was good and staff very friendly. Bottom line though there are better alternatives in the Bellevue area.

reviews.name: Ashley H.
reviews.review: I don't know how the food is but the service is terrible. My family stood at the door while employees at the bar just gawked at us. It wasn't busy and no one bothered to tell us if it was seat yourself or that they'd be with us in a moment. We finally left and went across the street to cancun where they acknowledge us immediately even if they're busy.

reviews.name: Dewayne H.
reviews.review: BAIT AND SWITCH,When this place first opened I thought it was great, however each visit  has been met with a decrease in quality and an increase in price. Management needs a reality check when it comes to customers , quality and competition.  The customers are your life line. Don't  compromise quality and be a step above the competition in all areas. Increased prices after being open for under one year, extra charge for chips with cheese dip!! $40 margarita pitchers ? I don't think so "my friend". Other choices in the area are better suited for customers , quality and are a step above the competition.

reviews.name: Sarah E.
reviews.review: Fresh! That's how I can best describe this location and their food. Had the quesadilla fajitas which are huge and wonderful during my 1st visit this Saturday afternoon, but what will draw me back is their amazing salsa and a friendly staff! If you're into sports, this location is also great for the 4 flat screens spread around the restaurant.Happily surprised and I will be back!

reviews.name: Michelle M.
reviews.review: The best salsa in Nashville. I repeat, THE BEST SALSA IN NASHVILLE. Surprisingly, given the name of the restaurant, the guac is actually "meh." But I'm not one to let guacamole distract me from THE BEST SALSA IN NASHVILLE. Seriously, I'm impressed. The food is delicious. The tacos al pastor are the best!!!!  I've been to Guac three times in 2 weeks. I went yesterday, and I want to return today. I would eat here all the time. The waitstaff is incredible, extremely kind and helpful. I would only suggest they add juices to their drink menu for the kiddies.

reviews.name: Mary E.
reviews.review: Considering how poor the Mexican food is out here, I did not have high hopes for Guac. I stopped in for a take out order and wound up paying more than I expected (over $3 for a *side* of guac? and it doesn't even come with chips? yeesh..) but other than the price I don't have any complaints. The food was flavorful and filling. Easily the best Mexican in Bellevue.

reviews.name: Ed K.
reviews.review: Tasted great when they opened...then raised prices & the food suffered.  We've been OFTEN & I'd say TONIGHT 4/8/15 it was outstanding.  As good as it was 2 months ago.

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: I got a decent Guac burrito that reminded me of Chipotles in size & price. They made my beef burrito just the way I wanted with xtra bell peppers as I requested. The server proudly stated its all prepared in-house, and it amounted to some of the best Bellevue Tex Mex I've had. We sat in the padded booth seating and had a more relaxing time than at that other feverish Mexican place. The Indian owner assured me that besides lunchtime Guac Mexican restaurant is usuallly a subdued place to eat. I

reviews.name: Dez S.
reviews.review: I'd call this more of a Latin restaurant than a Mexican one. Bellevue has needed this SO MUCH! The beef soup (weekends only) is so yummy - like pot roast. The tacos are outstanding and a super affordable way to eat there. The salsa is some of the best I've ever had!  The "green sauce" is a great crema made of avocado, milk and jalapenos. EVERYTHING here is yum-yum-yummy. Our family has been here at least a dozen times and they just opened - haha.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: This place is awesome!  I dined in once for dinner and did take out for lunch once.  I got the same dish and enjoyed it more when I dined in, for whatever reason I feel like it was more flavored. Could have been different cooks working.  Even still, this place is such a great value and everyone who works there is super sweet!  Everyone I know who has been there likes it as well.

reviews.name: Robin R.
reviews.review: Went to Guac during its opening week. I moved to Franklin TN from Los Angeles so finding good authentic Mexican has been a challenge and I find myself craving what I use to find in L.A. Guac did not disappoint. The salsa is amazing and the dishes taste authentic yay!! The neighborhood needed this!!!

reviews.name: Karri S.
reviews.review: dinner is hit or miss, when it's good the carnitas can be amazing but when it's not you are in for some dry meat, but you can always count on the pupusas! the pupusas are made to order and worth the wait! the salsa is always fresh, but I wish there was a queso appetizer. recently had a house margarita, which was quite good...we would have got s pitcher except they were overpriced.

reviews.name: Chandler R.
reviews.review: Best Mexican I've found since moving from Arizona. I will definitely be back. Good food and great service!

reviews.name: Bellevue R.
reviews.review: Guac is the best Mexican restaurant in Bellevue. Elegant atmosphere, affable staff, and fine food contribute to this restaurant. Their salsa was beyond standards and their handmade tacos were decent. Definitely coming back soon!

reviews.name: Melissa S.
reviews.review: We have been here twice: once to eat in and once (tonight) for takeout.  Both sucked.  The food we got when we ate in was mediocre at best.  No flavor, very boring.  The salsa served with warmed chips was okay and FREE.  Not great, not interesting, not unique---it was okay, but FREE.  I ordered a chicken chimichango that was just terrible.  I can't even describe why--it just wasn't good.  At all.  I can't remember now what my husband ordered that day but he was not impressed, which is putting it mildly.  He hated it.Tonight we called for takeout.  I asked if chips and salsa came with the orders like it would if we were eating in.  No.  It would have cost $4 to get chips and a small, SMALL. container of salsa.  We opted for No.  I ordered shrimp tacos, my favorite thing in the world.  Yuck.  No flavor, the tortillas completely fell apart and were just gross.  Shrimp was fair and lettuce was iceburg.  That's it for the taco.  There was some pico de gallo that tasted hot---only hot--nothing else--and I ended up eating with a fork and leaving most of everything else except the shrimp.  My husband had some fajitas left over from a non-Mexican restaurant from two nights ago that he wanted to eat, so he ordered a tostada de Camaron.  Double yuck.  Ice cold, tortilla shredded and fell apart and there was no flavor whatsoever.  His two-day-old fajitas from a non-Mexican restaurant were fabulous compared to all of what we ordered from Guac. I truly do not understand what everyone sees in this place.  We will not go back for take out or for dining in.  Las Palmas is better, cheaper and ... just better.The manager or owner (not sure which) continuously posts on a Bellevue Facebook page about how he is willing to do anything for any customer to love his place.  I guess that is what he has to do.  The restaurant is terrible.  Maybe the bar is good--we have not been there since they got their liquor license.  It would take several really good margaritas to make me like the food!

reviews.name: Raymond D.
reviews.review: Went again today. Tacos al pastor! Wow! I can't say it enough, this is the stuff we all want and can't find, get over there, I ain't lying. Oh, the Salsa,oh,the salsa,oh!

reviews.name: Cameron F.
reviews.review: So today...I went with my family to lunch at Guac, after a nice afternoon on the Natchez Trace.
