Initially, they had given me and my wife positive reviews, so we were interested to see what all the hoopla was all about. Well...upon further review, let's just say one would be wise NOT to buy into the positive hype surrounding the place. On the bright side, they have good guac. On the not so bright side...goodness...where do I begin? I'll start out by saying it was a light traffic day...maybe 4-5 other tables were occupied during our stay. The owner of the restaurant was casually sitting at a corner table, disengaged and disinterested in what was going in the restaurant. After we ordered our food, it took over 30 minutes before we received anything (besides chips). With such light traffic, I can't find any excuse as to the long wait. The lengthy delay became evident when we noticed our beans & rice, once delivered, were completely cold. Not lukewarm, but chilled and bland...as if they had been sitting out on the counter for a good, long while. On top of that, three of the four orders were incorrect in some capacity. For instance, my mother-in-law ordered corn tortillas with her meal, but was given flour tortillas instead. When she asked for corn tortillas a second time, it took another 20 minutes before they were brought out. Needless to say, she wasn't very happy...and felt completely devalued as a customer. For me, personally, I knew something was off when I ordered a diet coke with lime...and it came out a diet coke with lemon (granted, this by itself is a small deal). But the cold beans and rice was a first for me...and I've eaten out hundreds of times at mexican restaurants in the Nashville area the past 6-7 years. On top of this, there was no offer of a partial refund on any part of our order to account for the multiple mishaps. So, that was additional salt on the wound. Overall, the taste was medicore...definitely not anything special to justify the poor service. The prices are fair, but still...I have no clue why the ratings are so high with this place. Now, I assume we simply caught them on a bad day; however, it doesn't change the fact our experience was highly disappointing...and judging by what I'm hearing, the quality of service and management has dropped fast in 2015. So hopefully this establishment can get its act together quickly. As for me, I don't plan on coming back...but hopefully, things change for others who dine there.

reviews.name: A O.
reviews.review: We tried the fajitas and chimichangas and were overall pleased with our first to-go order! Fresher feel to the ingredients than your typical Mexican restaurant.  Interesting menu.  Super friendly staff.  The only downside was they forgot to put chips and salsa in our to-go order.  Nice addition to Bellevue!

reviews.name: Syah H.
reviews.review: My Husband won't stop raving about the homemade salsa & tortillas. He said it reminded him if his Mom's food. The Carne Asada (steak) was great!! My Husband had steak tacos & said they were terrific! The owner & his wife are both really attentive and engaging. This will be a place we'll visit weekly for sure!

reviews.name: Nell H.
reviews.review: We ate there today for 1st time. To begin with, we both disliked the oily smoky salsa & thick chips, but asked if they had a milder red sauce, which they brought & was yummy & warm.My shrimp fajitas were disappointing, as they were small with the tails on & the flour tortillas were tiny & few. It was bland. I actually added salt, which I never ever do anywhere! My husband had the steak fajitas. He really enjoyed them, but both of us shocked to see that sour cream on the side doesn't come with these dishes & paid $1.50 for a dollop. The waitress never returned to ask us if our meal was okay until we had finished. We both detested the beans, which had a strange taste. The rice was bland, as was the pico gallo & guacamole. I guess we must LIKE Tex-Mex, because we have ordered this same meal from another Mexican restaurant across the street & it was just so much tastier, more plentiful servings, large tortillas, tails off & sour cream for free. The same meal at Guac's cost us at least $10 more total & wasn't nearly as satisfying. I guess the best was my husband's tender steak. We left there hungry, not filling up on beans & other sides we usually enjoy.

reviews.name: JLY J.
reviews.review: After being personally greeted warmly by the owner, had a tasty, hot, well prepared meal with quality ingredients. My 2 1/2 year old son who is very picky, loved the kids quesadillas. I live in Bellevue and have been to every Mexican restaurant in Bellevue and this is the best! Prices are reasonable considering the quality. Other Mexican restaurants in Bellevue end up serving very sloppy meals but not this place. I hope it remains just as great as it was today.

reviews.name: Vincent G.
reviews.review: Friendly staff, very welcoming. They made sure we had what we needed. My wife & I had appetizers and drinks. Defiantly will be going back!

reviews.name: Barry I.
reviews.review: The food was ok... The margaritas had very little tequila in them. The service was slow..The price too high ..will not go back.

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: I'm really glad we decided to give this place a try. The Chicken Enchiladas Mole is the best I've had, with a real smoky chocolate flavor. Their tacos pastor could become addicting. This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Nashville and easily the best restaurant in Bellevue, period.

reviews.name: Catherine H.
reviews.review: I got the chicken Enchiladas Suizas and it rocked! Great pulled chicken, great green enchilada sauce. And the green hot sauce they serve on the side? It's SO HOT and DELICIOUS. Great food, friendly service, and fair prices. Too bad there isn't one in Hendersonville!

reviews.name: Mary D.
reviews.review: Very excited to have another good restaurant in Bellevue. Food was great!  Salsa was so good I wanted to just drink it. Not the same menu as most other Mexican restaurants that cater to Americans. Real Mexican fare - many items I had never heard of. So eager to go back!  Do try it, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: Debbie M.
reviews.review: First visit to Guac was so yummy that I went back and took friends the very next day. Fresh, full-flavored salsa and Guac sauce kicked up the starter chips to epic and the meal only got better from there. Fish tacos on hand made tacos, at the top of list for Nashville in my opinion. Next day; Cevieche! Superb and enough for two meals or whole table of folks. Highly recommend this new restaurant in Bellevue....AAAREEEEBA!!!

reviews.name: Bree B.
reviews.review: By far the best Mexican cuisine in town!!!  The pico de gala (salsa) is AMAZING!!!  The flavors are perfect.  Healthy food, great price, and extremely clean!  My favorite, hands down!!!!  YUM!  Ala YUM!

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: Terrible service,  the food was over-priced, and not very good. My Texas burrito (highly recommended by our server) tasted like it had Prego Italian sauce on it.  It didn't taste like Mexican food.  It tasted like a weird mish mosh of Italian/Indian/ Mexican. The server said the burrito came with beans and rice on the side, but it was inside the burrito all mixed together.  It was Nasty! Owner kept telling us to like him on Facebook.  I think he's trying to artificially inflate his ratings for his crappy, and I do mean CRAPPY restaurant.  It's annoying to be asked to like a restaurant on Facebook during my first visit , and before having tasted the menu.  The only thing good was the salsa.  I wish I had just gone down the street to a much much better Mexican restaurant.  I'll be surprised if Guac stays in business for 6 months as bad as it was.  It was so bad that I had to sign up and write my first review ever.  Don't eat there.

reviews.name: A B.
reviews.review: I love this place. Dine in or take out- I have always enjoyed my food and it has always been consistent. Ingredients and a confidence in cooking thai cuisine equate to Royal Thai being the place I prefer to get my thai fix from. If you're looking for ambiance, it's definitely a calm, unique place- & your tummy is sure to be satisfied!

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: I used to come here quite frequently, I would not go back again as the restaurant appears to have changed ownership, for the worse. There is nothing "express" about this place; I placed my order at the counter (that's a change from before), paid on the spot, and then waited 30 minutes for my food to come out. Um... that is not express. Once the food arrived, I was disappointed to find that the quality has declined. The flavors have become more flat, the shrimp more sparse, just wasn't as good as it used to be. So, longer wait + worse food = I'm not coming back. Oh yeah, I think the prices have gone up as well.

reviews.name: PAUL G.
reviews.review: Let me start out with the positives.  We were welcomed with a smile and told we could sit wherever we liked.  The seating options were plentiful as we were the only people in there at 7:00 pm.  Keeping with the service, the host/server was very kind and truly attentive.Maybe it was just an off night for the food.  The Tom Ka Gai was pretty good, but I only ate 1/2 of my entrée of Pad Se Eew because it wasn't all that flavorful.  My friend took a couple bites of his Pad Thai and didn't like it all.  The good news is that the restaurant didn't charge for the Pad Thai as they could see that he didn't eat hardly any of it.  The Thai Iced Tea was a bit weak for my taste, but I like it bold and creamy and that just may not be their style.Like I said, it may be worth if for you to try out ... the service is good and maybe you'll have better luck than we did with the food.

reviews.name: Phil W.
reviews.review: Great service,great cook to your liking, little Thai place for good fresh tasting food at a good price including the beer.Try it out !I've been told this review is too short,we'll it doesn't need to be long with this place .It is a good place !

reviews.name: Jessi K.
reviews.review: Yummy Thai! I don't hand out 5 star reviews like candy, I was actually impressed with the food here. I was visiting Nashville for business and one of my partners recommended this place. I'm always a little nervous to try a new Thai place just because of all the bad experiences I've had but they had a lot of parking so I say "why not?"I'm so glad I did. I had the Pad Kra Prao (basil stir fry). It comes with a choice of meat but since I'm a vegetarian they were able to accommodate me and make it with  tofu. My server was great. I usually get a dirty look when I try and modify dishes but he was really nice about it which was refreshing. The food itself was mildly spicy and had a generous portion of vegetables. Overall, next time I'm in Nashville I will be returning this diamond in the rough.

reviews.name: Dustin M.
reviews.review: The owner is so nice. The lady welcomed me with a smile. Their service along with their food exceeded my expectations. I will be back.

reviews.name: Reina S.
reviews.review: Best Thai food I've had since leaving Los Angeles!!!  Not only the food GREAT, they are so friendly, I love going here!!

reviews.name: Nelle B.
reviews.review: I don't know why I keep bothering to come here. (I do, actually..  It's close to my work, and sometimes I just really want Thai food) I remember that Royal Thai used to be really good...  I think maybe an ownership change brought about the "express" and took away the quality.  The food is mediocre.. ok at best, and often just not good..  I'm currently sitting over a way too salty bowl of tom yum soup with 5 sad little rubberized shrimp floating in it..  They might have been cooking for days before I saved them from the pot.  Service is consistently rude/inattentive and the dining room is always filthy/empty.  At this moment, nearly every table needs to be wiped off and the three tables around me need to be cleared.  I am the only customer in the restaurant, so it seems like someone could find the time.

reviews.name: Lauren W.
reviews.review: Royal Thai had a deal on Scout Mob for 50% off so we decided to try it, big mistake.The inside of Royal Thai is pretty cute. They have nice floor-to-ceiling murals and lots of kitsch and character. If you were to judge a place on decor, you would expect this place to be the bee's knees. But this is just another lesson in "don't judge a book by its cover." (Or more precisely, don't judge a Thai Restaurant by its murals.)When we arrived there were 3 other people in the restaurant. By the time we got our menus everyone was gone and we were the only people there. At 7:30 on a Friday night we were the only people in this place. Not a good sign. The worst part was that the place was completely silent. Eerily silent. No background music, no chatter, nothing. Every word I said bounced off the walls and I'm sure our waiter could hear everything (and maybe even the kitchen staff). I was so put-off by the silence that we decided to take matters into our own hands. We opened up Spotify on my phone and started DJing our table. I would normally NEVER EVER do this, but there was no one else there so I was 100% sure that we were not pissing anyone off. We were hungry so we ordered the pork spring rolls. They came to the table fairly quickly which was a plus. The roasted pork inside the spring roll had good flavor, and the dipping sauce was good. Unfortunately the spring roll was mostly lettuce and cabbage and the normal delicious ratio was off. They were also really cold which made me think that they were pre-made and just chilling in the refrigerator.At this point I guess our waiter was totally bored so he decided to take a break. He got his own Thai ice tea and sat down at the table across from us. He took out his cell phone and I guess he was checking facebook/texting/anything that wasn't his actual job. Good to know that the ONE STAFF MEMBER feels totally comfortable to just kick-back on the job. At least go to the kitchen area or something. We  ordered the duck curry which was supposed to be roasted duck in red curry. What arrived was not duck curry at all, but a totally different dish, roasted duck.  The waiter realized what was wrong and said something like, "yah, that isn't what you ordered...umm...I can take it back." But we were hungry and decided to just eat what they gave him. I would totally pass this off as a normal mistake, but honestly, how?! We were the only people there so they weren't busy. This is just total incompetence.  The duck itself tasted like it was made ages ago and defrosted. The brown sauce it was covered in was pretty salty, probably to cover up the freezer burn.I ordered the Pad Woon Sen with beef. The description said it was "Bean Thread Noodles stir fried with our house Soy Base Sauce" but didn't say it came with any vegetables. All of the other noodle dishes on the menu listed the vegetables that were in the dish, so I asked the waiter if it came with veggies because I didn't want noodles only. The waiter was unsure if this dish had vegetables (WTF?) and went to ask the kitchen. He came back and listed off a bunch of good stuff so I went ahead and ordered it.What I received was not Pad Woon Sen, but a pile of mushy brown stuff that was inedible. It was so salty I could feel the salt crystals burning into my lips, cheeks and tongue. This dish was hurting me!So I sat their pouting, feeling really bad. I was upset because I couldn't eat dinner and that our nice date-night out wasn't going as planned. The waiter looked in our direction and noticed that I wasn't eating and asked what was wrong. I told him that the dish was just way too salty and inedible. While he said they could re-make it, I was so pissed off at this point that we just asked for a bunch of to-go boxes. We packed up our food without eating it. While we did get the Scout Mob discount, we got no money off the check and no apology for the quality of the food or our experience. I guess it's a common thing at Royal Thai that patrons immediately leave after their food hits the table.We had dinner #2 at Woodlands. Woodlands is awesome.

reviews.name: Alan d.
reviews.review: Service was great. Food was greasy and spring roll was simply an eggroll. OK if you want typical chinese but not if expecting healthy thai food.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: Royal Thai is the Thai place closest to my place of work and for that I have to stop in every once in a while to get my fix.  So the ambiance...well...there isn't any.  Tables in a room.  I can't even tell you if there is any decor in there at all...either it isn't or it is so non-descript I cannot remember it.  Not a big deal though, whatever.  I will say during the week for lunch it is pretty busy as it is close to Baptist and Centennial, but this Saturday it was DEAD.  I was the ONLY PERSON and it was high noon.  Weird.They have all the stuff you normally would order at a Thai place.  This weekend I got the Tom Yum Goong which was a nice hot and sour soup with shrimp and tomatoes.  It helped heal the hungover stomach.  I also got the Garlic chicken.  My waiter asked if I wanted that or the ginger chicken as the ginger one had more veggies in it.  I said ok, sure, but then he came back and the lady cooking said she would just add more to the garlic chicken.  Nice to be the only one in there and get made to order dishes eh?  The food was good and the hot was not too hot, I would say better go native Thai heat here if you really want to feel the burn.If you are here for lunch they also have an express lunch menu that comes with soup or spring rolls for $8.  Just choose your meat!  Waitstaff is nice and they are definitely attentive, especially if you are the only one there!  Give it a go if you are in the area - decent Thai for decent prices.

reviews.name: Karla Marie B.
reviews.review: My stomach started aching before I even walked out of the door. The massaman chicken curry was $12 for a lunch sized portion and the only vegetables in it were limited potatoes and onions.

reviews.name: Dot G.
reviews.review: I was in midtown for a dr appointment, and just happened to see this place.  I am so glad i did.  For under $10 I was able to get entree, spring rolls and a drink.  I had the red curry, and it was so good.  It's actually the best I have had in nashville.  The veggies and meat were cooked perfectly in the coconut milk, and the spring rolls were so fresh and delicious.  So many curries I've had around town are so watered down, but upon asking, I was told they use only coconut milk.  The owner and son served me, and what a treat.  I'ts rare to have a stand-out lunch experience, but this was just that.

reviews.name: Mark R.
reviews.review: I cannot in good conscience recommend this restaurant for a handful of reasons:+  When we arrived with a coupon(scout mob), we presented to our server who immediately responded by saying that as a directive from his boss he was unable to fully honor it and would only be able to discount half of the stated coupon.  That was fine.  I then placed my order and was told that they were out of a part of the dish and would it be acceptable to recieve without entire advertised ingredients.  I said okay, he offered no discount from menu price even though I accepted a dish missing priced-in ingredients--and granted, this was a Friday night (night you would expect a kitchen to prepare and be fully stocked..).   And lastly, after placing my food order I inquired about saki.  Waiter informed me that owner had let their liquor permit expire and therefore only had beer to serve.  This was my first visit to this place and I do not see myself going back.  Three strikes in one visit is enough.  Not to mention I paid $16 for a dish that in my opinion was worth $10.  I will repeat, I cannot in good conscience reommend this restaurant.  Only aspect I was impressed with was the decorated walls.  Kudos for creating a visually appealing atmosphere, but I think more attention needs to be paid to proper customer-centric restaurant management.

reviews.name: Mike B.
reviews.review: Very delicious recipes and friendly attentive staff.  So notable I wanted to leave a review.  I've never had a bad experience so I was surprised to see the low reviews.  If anything, they've been listening because my 8/3/2014 visit was a lunch kaeng phed and almost more than I could eat and I'm a big guy.  There was background music playing.  The hostess was very courteous and attentive. The lunch with a side of spring rolls and a beer as under $12.  I'm glad I didn't look at yelp first or I would have missed out on a great lunch!

reviews.name: Peter V.
reviews.review: I decided to come back to grab some Thai food with a friend. It was my birthday and I had a craving. Little did I know that I was about to be in for the worst Thai experience of my life. Being a vegan, I have gotten used to discussing veganizing Thai dishes. I have gotten pad thai at many restaurants with no egg or fish sauce. I ordered that here and they brought out a gross pile of fried rice noodles with no sauce on them, a couple gross looking pieces of tofu on top and a small bowl of peanut pieces on the side. It was a gross sticky pile of white rice noodles. There were no veggies, no bean sprouts, no green onions. None of the things that make Pad Thai delicious. Do they ever put veggies in their Pad Thai? If they don't, that is awful. They expected us to eat it.I asked to send it back. When I asked the server, who was basically incompetent at life, he looked confused. I asked for another dish, Pad Ke Mao, that could be made vegan. When that came out, there was no tofu and it was the most oily noodle dish I have had. We also ordered a Panang curry that was decent, not great but decent. But we did not get plates to split it so we ate off of one plate in the middle of the table (lady and the tramp style). The server didn't bat an eye at this. He was oblivious. Like he had never eaten at a restaurant before. I gave this place 2 chances. first was OK. Second, terrible. I'm over it. Won't be back. It was the plate of dry sticky noodles that ruined it.

reviews.name: Sonya T.
reviews.review: Great little Thai place. And actually, I'll dare to say the food here is better than Thai Phoo Ket. Fresh ingredients. Their spices taste uncomplicated, yet bright. (and not greasy to boot). Their Tom Ka Kai soup is lovely & delicate. The day waitress is a pro. Courteous and attentive. Their lunch specials are a good deal. The wall murals are very impressive. The owner/manager seems to be super-nice, too. Go try this Thai spot again. It's tucked away in up-and-coming area of Midtown.

reviews.name: Jasaiya M.
reviews.review: If you are in the mood for great Thai food, this is definitely a place to go. My dad and I went here on our visit to Nashville. LOVE! My dad and I love supporting family owned businesses which we were happy to find out it was. The restaurant itself is located in Midtown and had its own parking which was a huge plus! The service was truly awesome as everyone was very sweet and attentive. I tried their red curry with chicken which was phenomenal; its made with coconut milk, tons of veggies and great spices that really give great flavor to the dish. My dad really enjoyed his Pad Kee Mao with beef and veggies. He is not a huge Thai fan at all but, he ate every bite of this. This was truly a great experience all around. Thanks again and to all the readers, go if you can!

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: The staff at the Hutton hotel in Midtown suggested this restaurant to us. I had the Pad Thai with tofu and it was excellent! The menu offers fantastic array of tantalizing choices and every lunch includes soup or spring rolls, and a drink. Their prices are affordable and the waitress was fast and friendly. I will definitely be returning there soon and would highly recommend.

reviews.name: Erica M.
reviews.review: Got the Pad Thai, Chicken Satay, and Garden Rolls.  Pad Thai was greasy, and looked like a bunch of ingredients shoved into a styrofoam container rather than an actual dish.  It also lacked any flavor whatsoever.  The Chicken Satay was good, and the peanut sauce was fine.  The Garden rolls were fresh tasting, but not really to my liking.  All in all it was just a disappointing meal.  I wouldn't eat here again.

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: royalthai is close to work so I stop in once or twice a week for lunch I usually get a red curry or a pad kra pow for lunch the curry is always nice and thick with a lot of flavor that fills you up and their spice level is always right the medium is pretty hot. The kra pow I would say they probably have the best sauce in town for kra pow you should ask for a fried egg on top if you are really hungry. Well for around 10 I get my entree an egg roll and a drink which for me is quite reasonable for lunch in downtown.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: I popped into here the other day after a long hiatus (just due to the fact that I know live across town in East Nashville instead of down the street) and my Thai craving enjoyed some S-A-T-I-S-F-A-C-T-I-O-N. Am I pretending to be Mick Jagger for just a moment or two? Maybe so!The staff is always friendly and made note to say that they remembered me too! Gotta love that. I ordered my usual the Phad Keo Mao with tofu and requested extra spicy. This is usually the #805 but if you come between 11am-3pm you can order it off the lunch options (located at the very back of the menu for a very smart $8 which also includes 2 crispy spring rolls too! I owed my friend for lunch and spent under $20 for the both of us including beverages. Royal Thai is very veg-friendly and the menu is easily adaptable for both vegetarians and vegans.This is a fantastic option for carry-out to if you work in the area. I am Royal Thai back to my mix as I just can't get enough!TIP: If you are ordering carryout, the turnaround time is generally around 15-20 minutes depending on your order size! Fast, easy, and inexpensive.

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: this a decent thai place, consistently ok.nothing really special, but is super close to my house so I go every now and then.They are missing a few of the sauces that I like... and the pad thai is a very basic version of the dish (mostly noodles) but I do always eat that or the fried rice combo.the service has always been slow and not so amazing also... its just a good little place if you cant make it out to Jasmine!

reviews.name: Jermaine W.
reviews.review: One thing I can say is that the Food is consistently okay. However, one waiter during a lunch time rush is just poor management. Bless the poor fella, running all over the restaurant.

reviews.name: C G.
reviews.review: I love this restaurant! Every time I go there the servers are super nice and they oblige my vegan requests/substitutions. The food is awesome and the best I've had in Nashville yet! Try this place and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Steve O.
reviews.review: Out of shrimp cakes app. Spring rolls were burned. Green curry was weak. And to top it off, when I finished off my iced tea, I noticed a fly, frozen in to one of the ice cubes. I about threw up. I mean really that made me nauseous. I'm not in Nashville that often, but I'm never going back here. Ever. I should have known when the place was empty on a Thursday night.

reviews.name: JD C.
reviews.review: This is passable Thai, and a great spot for takeout. Not the best in town but for me the most convenient. The service is slow and sometimes odd, and on multiple occasions I have waited for 5-10 minutes to be acknowledged when picking up my takeout order. All in all, where the hell else can you go for Thai food in Midtown? Nowhere... Enjoy!

reviews.name: Alex R.
reviews.review: Not bad food - but pretty plain and unmemorable. If you are in the area and craving Thai, don't be afraid of this place, but I would not seek it out.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: The bad reviews could only keep us away for so long, so we tried RT last night for the first time.  We arrived around 6:30 PM, and we were to only customers there, and remained so for the duration of our surprisingly good dinner. Service was fine, as we weren't competing with any other tables for the one waiter who was on staff.  We started with the standard Tom Ka soup for two.  It was rich and well spiced - a solid 4 stars with a point off for value ($8.00 for what was basically a large single serving).  Next came the spring rolls.  They were freshly made, but a little too "lettucey" and bland for our taste overall 3 of 5.  Red curry was next.  We asked the waiter to make it "extra thick" and the chef did so.  It was creamy and very well prepared.  Like the soup, it was properly spiced (we like it native).  Portion size was slightly on the small size for an Asian entree, meaning that it was "almost" enough to be split between the two of us.  With the spring roll, the soup, and the single order of curry we had plenty to eat and no left overs. The curry rated 3.5 on a 1-5, its lack of complexity in taste (no citrus or sour) and texture holding back an otherwise solid 4.We plan to go back again soon and try some of the noodle dishes.Plenty of parking in the restaurant lot.  And, as noted by "Rachel D," the statuettes are festooned with "for sale" signs - we found this to be slightly odd.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: The two times I've tried Thai in Nashville, I've ordered non-traditional Thai foods. No wonder I've been disappointed.The first thing I noticed when I came in here were the "for sale" signs on all of the decorations. I didn't know what was going on. I came in a few days before Carson C.'s review, which made some sense as to what may be going on. I don't know if my review will be too late.Apart from a couple seated in the corner, I was the only other patron. During my long-ish wait (about 20 minutes), about 3-4 takeout orders came and went. I didn't look too closely, but they seemed like large orders.I perused the menu to see if they had my favorite duck dish (they didn't). I am hardly in the mood for curries or soups. So, I had (just like at the last Thai restaurant in Nashville), something with chicken and a sweet and sour sauce. I don't know what's wrong with me.It was very, very bland. And it's rare for me to not eat all of the leftovers when it comes to sweet and sour anything. I was intending to stretch the leftovers over 2 meals, but barely ate half of it before throwing it away.The iced coffee was great; the tap water was not filtered and tasted very metallic.Quiet neighborhood. If this place does change over, I will try again. But the way it is managed now, probably not.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I got the vegetable Lard Nar yesterday and was very disappointed.  They charged me the same price as the dish would have been with meat and didn't add any additional vegetables.  Either that or they don't normally add any, I got a couple pieces of broccoli and some sliced carrots.  The noodles were heavy and over-cooked, and the generic brown sauce tasted like a stick of butter.  I will not be back.

reviews.name: Heather K.
reviews.review: What can I say? I'm a fatso with all of my Thai food experience being in America. I probably wouldn't know "real" Thai food if it bit me on my ass. However, I am a little cray-cray when it comes to spiciness. I want my food to hurt me. I want the hotsauce to feel like it was brewed by Lucifer himself. I want to leave with blisters on my gums. Royal Thai was very accomdating with my desires. Every time I have ordered here, I have not been disappointed. When I tell them I want it EXTREMELY spicy, they shake their heads and act concerned (like I don't know what I'm asking for), but they humor me and I am pleased. The service is slow, but very friendly and helpful. On our most recent visit, the lady gave me 2 kinds of additional hot pepper seasonings : one a type of pepper-paste, and the other a dried peppery powder. Both were sublime. They even remembered my husband's order from last time!I would venture to say that Royal Thai kicks ass with the heat-factor, therefore, Royal Thai kicks ass in my heart. As long as I live nearby, I will be a customer.

reviews.name: Simply S.
reviews.review: I cant say enough good things about this place. If I could give it 6 stars .. I would! It was the first Thai place I was introduced to in Nashville and as long as I have a choice .. it is the only one I like going to.   Everything is so fresh and  yummy.    it's a very small space and every time I've been it's very slow .. so the service is always splendid! However I've heard when they pick up it's a tad slower. I think that is because the staff is really small.  But trust me -- any wait is worth it!!  The service is great! As a matter a fact .. last time we went .. we left with our fabulous servers phone number! As my man and I walked out the door I told him "Yup, that might be the nicest lady I've ever met in my entire life".  She is new .. but all the staff is GREAT.The old server we used to have knew our order. Let me add we aren't THAT regular. Bi-weekly maybe. He wouldn't even had us a menu! He would just ask if we wanted what we usually get! On to the food.  I don't know what # it is I get or the name. I've had a few things.  But I ALWAYS get the spring rolls. THEY ARE SO GOOD and come with this amazing cashew something dipping deliciousness! I usually get a red curry w/coconut milk base.  I get it as spicy as it comes and OMG ... it's heaven! They always keep your drink full and bring out as much rice as you want to finish your meal ... or take with you. After seeing them slow many times, I was very worried they may go out of business. But in my conversation with our server, she said they have several locations and do alot of prep work out of the kitchen at this location. So hopefully they wont' be going anywhere ... ever!

reviews.name: Amanda H.
reviews.review: Friends and I all live right in the neighborhood, and Royal Thai is our go-to for quick and great Thai food. The curry dishes are hands-down the best part of their menu, and we can't go without one (or all!) of us getting one of them. Green curry is my favorite, but I've enjoyed them all. They're great about catering to vegetarians. Prices are pretty reasonable. Check out the lunch special for the best deals-- served until 3pm. Great for eat-in or take-out.We've never had a disappointing experience at Royal Thai, despite what some others have said here about their own. It's always been dependable, and we prefer it to the others in the neighborhood.

reviews.name: Sari H.
reviews.review: Not only was this was the absolute worst Thai food I've ever had, it's right up there with the worst food I've ever had. Disgusting, inedible slop. I've had plenty of mediocre Thai food and I can put up with it when I need to, but this place REALLY crossed the line. We had lad na (small, unfried noodles floating with broccoli and cauliflower in plate of soup); panang curry (very bland); pad thai (not bad as in that super-American pad thai... just downright horrendous; slimy; foul flavor). See the photos -- everything was actually even worse than it looked. I noticed the fresh spring rolls were served with sweet chili sauce. That should've served as a warning, I guess.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: Straight up, I'm giving this place an extra star just because of how wonderful the service was. My husband and I came here for lunch and we were really pressed for time. After being seated, it took our waiter about 5 minutes to come over with our waters and take our orders at which point we asked whether we'd be able to be in and out within 30 minutes. Our waiter rightfully pointed out that a bunch of tables had come in around the same time so it might be tight but he would do his best to get our food to us quickly and thought it would be do-able. Our waiter totally came through for us because in under 5 minutes of ordering, he had our spring rolls out to us and another 5 minutes later, our mains were sitting in front of us. He never once seemed flustered, nor did he seem annoyed or aggravated with us mentioning we were in a hurry. He also took care of the bill really quickly when it came time for us to pay, which we really appreciated as well. He managed to be efficient but friendly, which is not always easy to pull off and we both really appreciated it. Bravo!As for the food itself, it's not the best Thai food I've ever had (and seems somewhat "Americanized" to me), but the $8 lunch specials are good value, I think (and apparently if you're really pinching pennies and calories, most of the specials are just $6 if you forego the spring rolls... but why would you do that?!?). My husband ordered the Kao Moo Daeng, which is roasted pork in a sweet BBQ style sauce. It was pretty decent (the pork had a good 5-spice "char siu" flavor), but the one thing I found disappointing is that the dish was literally just pork, sauce and rice. No veggies or anything, which I always hate, because that doesn't seem like a balanced meal to me. I got the red curry with tofu, and I think that was a lot more successful. The broth wasn't as rich as some other places, but it was decent and above all, I appreciated that when I ordered it medium spicy there actually was some spice! Not enough heat to fry my tastebuds, but enough to add an enjoyable zing.Overall, this is a middle of the road Thai place in terms of the food, but the service really made a positive impression on me. I do think that if you're in the area looking for a place where you can have a quick and reasonably priced weekday lunch, it's certainly a strong contender; I'd definitely be open to coming back for lunch!

reviews.name: Lauren E.
reviews.review: I've enjoyed eating at Royal Thai. It's my favorite place to get Thai food in the area. They also do a great job at take-out, even letting you get Thai Iced Tea to go (which most places don't seem to do). It's not exactly glamorous, especially outside, but it's quite tasty. While you're waiting for your meal (not too long of a wait) you can look at the hand-painted murals on the inside walls.The curries are all spectacular, and like most places they will allow you to tell them how spicy to make it. Many of the rice dishes are great, too. Check out the specials on the menu, they have some interesting combos with rice. The waiters are really great at explaining anything that's confusing. So many great dishes, I don't think I've ever had anything bad there, and I've probably been a dozen times. Unfortunately, they raised their prices a few months ago, which makes it a little more of a commitment to the meal. About $10 per entree.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: Same as most other reviews: uninspired interior, glacial service in a 1/4 full restaurant, food hit-or-miss. I had a seafood-baked-in-foil - and that was really good. Curries got mixed reviews. Pad Thai - well, I was offered a taste, but couldn't bring myself to try what looked like brown, overcooked glop. Only beer, so buy wine around the corner and down the street at Midtown. Probably ok for lunch if you learn the menu. Otherwise, steer clear.

reviews.name: Katrina V.
reviews.review: Pretty good tasting Thai food place.  Portion on pad thai kind of small, but not offensively so.  Skip the "vegetarian appetizer"...it's just a bunch of fried vegetables tempura style..including whole mushrooms...like the kind you use in salads. what? weird. not too memorable, but service was OK and I suspect that there aren't tons of good Thai places in Nashville...

reviews.name: Liz D.
reviews.review: When I walked in, I instantly thought "Where are all the people?". After my dining experience, I realized why they were not here. The service is slow, even when my friend and I were the only ones there. The prices are expensive and the food was mediocre. The food tastes like it's been sitting in the kitchen all day, it was not fresh at all. I ordered curry and the flavors were all off. The vegetables are wilted and the meat is chewy. I wouldn't come here again.

reviews.name: Renae M.
reviews.review: I always try to find the good in every experience, so this pains me to write about my first and last visit to Royal Thai... We made reservations for a party of 8 on a Friday night at 7pm. The restaurant was busy, but definitely not slammed. Our entire experience took over 2 hrs! There was only 1 server for the entire place! We waited, and waited, and waited before our drink orders where even taken. Then we waited some more to actually get the drinks. Finally we placed our food orders, and couldn't wait to eat our yummy meals. We had heard mixed reviews about Royal Thai, but we know they were voted "Best Thai" by the Nashville Scene. The service may have been slow, but we were fully expecting the food to make up for it. WRONG! WRONG! WRONG! 5 out of our 8 (including me) ordered the Pad Thai and we were all agreed that it was the WORST Pad Thai ever. It basically was a heaping pile of brown mush...not to mention I had ordered mine medium-hot and there wasn't even an ounce of spice in it! The price was way too high as well. Not to mention that we had to ask our server 3 TIMES FOR OUR CHECK! I will never eat here again.

reviews.name: Eve P.
reviews.review: I haven't had satisfactory Thai in Nashville since Sala Thai closed, and Royal Thai has been the least impressive. The pad thai was gummy and flavorless, except for an unpleasant aftertaste. On the plus side,  I didn't have any of the service issues other folks have talked about here - but admittedly I was the only customer.

reviews.name: Sid N.
reviews.review: Jed's is a middling sports bar just like all the others in the midtown area. Sure, they have screens but if you really wanted to watch the game you would be better off at home. There is no distinctive vibe and no special bar/ pub food to write home about. I had a few beers and milled around the bar with my friends. I ordered a cheeseburger and fries - the burger didn't really have much flavor and the fries were undercooked. Tried my buddy's guac & chips - again, no flavor. Later, we sat out on the patio and that was a pleasant interlude. If you somehow end up at Jed's it's a fair enough place to spend a few hours but don't make any special plans to come out here.

reviews.name: Michelle B.
reviews.review: Came in for a late lunch and early happy hour.  Great beer selection and Jane, our bartender, made our day!   She is fantastic!!!

reviews.name: Taylor N.
reviews.review: Tuesday Happy Hour? Thursday after Volleyball? Saturday for the game? Sunday for some patio drinking? Yes, you can pretty much count on my friends and I to be at Jed's for all of these occasions (sometimes multiple times a week). Jed's is a sports bar where you will instantly feel like a regular, and quickly become one. This bar is diverse, leaning more toward the 20-to-30-something young professional crowd who live nearby. With the option of two patios, lawn games, darts and trivia night, Jed's has something for just about everyone. They even have a writer's night on Fridays for those looking for some fresh, local music.Their food is almost above average bar food, and luckily its not all fried. Though it could be better, I don't mind the average-ness of the menu. It features burgers, hot dogs, pizza, sandwiches, even salads. Their nachos are great to share and the (white) queso is far far better than the generic orange sauce you usually come across. They also serve brunch on the weekends, with bloody mary and mimosa specials. On Tuesday's they have 2-4-1's all day and always have a decent selection of draft beers. If you're feeling it, they also have bushwackers.If I wasn't a regular, I'd probably only give this place three stars. But I am one and I love this bar.

reviews.name: Hall W.
reviews.review: I have lots of mixed feelings about Jed's. Lets get straight to it - The Bad: 1. Service can be pretty crappy especially if it is busy... (the servers work their asses off, to me it is about not having enough - they try really hard). 2. The food - eh standard bar food, and it gets old super quick.The Good: 1. Amazing personalities work here and when it isn't super busy they are oh so friendly...2. Has that neighborhood bar feel for young professionals through and through3. Perfect or game watching4. Trivia nights! (beware its really hard though).The Awesome1. BEST BUSHWHACKER in all of Nashville in my opinion 2. Easily walkable from the park so a great place to mingle after a stroll/event in the park

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: I love the atmosphere to watch sports. Beer is always fresh and they have an outdoor patio that has 2 large flat panel tvs.Good amount of seating outside on the first floor. There is also outdoor seating upstairs. The reason for the 2 stars is the food is bland. The chicken wings cooked perfect but need more sauce. Also they water down their blue cheese.  THE worse way to increase profit margin. Always got to go thick w blue cheese.

reviews.name: Caitlin P.
reviews.review: Always delightful the food is good and the drink prices are great! I enjoy the patios and playing bean bags outdoors. They have a writers night, I've briefly experienced. I've made this a regular Happy Hour destination!

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: Every time I have been here it has been ok..I don't know why..because this place is way better than this. I like when more people are there because there is a great buzz within the place, especially when people are cheering for their favorite sports team. They have a great selection of draft beers and a numerous availability of tvs. The service is below average but that's because I believe they are totally understaffed. But it's a great neighborhood hangout feel that is close enough to el casa, so I will always frequent here especially after a sand volleyball game at centennial

reviews.name: Tiffany N.
reviews.review: Cool venue, love the outside patio portion. Not great food. I ordered a simple grilled chicken sandwich, and it was just COVERED in Old Bay. Now, I love Old Bay, but damn -- I just wanted chicken! I skipped lunch so I ate it but I don't think I would get anything but the burgers. Meanwhile, the Old Bay fries had no seasoning on them. LOLWUT?

reviews.name: Cactus M.
reviews.review: Standard sports bar, except for the shockingly terrible food and service.  The first drink took nearly 30 min to get.  I wouldn't have minded so much, but to add insult to injury, the drink was god awful. Then my sandwich was made with a butt of the loaf piece of bead.  Sacrifice the 5 cents and throw that piece out!  Then, to top it off, the bartender was nowhere to be found.  I waited patiently for her return which took about 10 min, and I left, hopefully for good.

reviews.name: Brandi S.
reviews.review: Why do places in Nashville have covered patios when they leave have them closed during nice weather? We specifically chose Jed's because of the upstairs covered patio (as there is a chance of rain today).  However, when we arrived the upstairs patio was closed & the indoor area smelled like a men's urinal.  I could not imagine ordering any food from any establishment that smells as terrible as Jed's.  I will definitely not be visiting again.

reviews.name: Lawson H.
reviews.review: The only reason we come is because it's right around the corner. Food sucks. Service is terrible. This place COULD be the best sports bar in the city if they put out some effort.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Haven't eatin here but I REALLY like this place, they have great beer specials, and have great prices with so many beverages to  choose from, they have corn hole outside and a great service! It's a clean divey bar in a great location right by the park!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Jed's is a large sports bar with 2 levels and some excellent outdoor seating! Besides that... it's a sports bar, not a whole lot else to say :)The food is typical bar food, chips and dip, wraps and burgers. There's really not much to write about here; it's nothing special and does the trick if you just need some food to snack on. I really like that they offer a great happy hour special, 2 for 1 well drinks and beer M-F, and I came here for happy hour after work last week and had a fun relaxing evening on the top patio. I've also been here on Sunday and they have a decent mimosa and bloody mary. The main floor has multiple TVs on the wall so you can watch all of the available games you are looking for. Jed's is A-OK for what it is; a sports bar to watch a game and have some drinks with friends!

reviews.name: Ryan W.
reviews.review: I made this place a pit stop because I really wanted to play at a trivia night while on vacation, and this one fell perfectly into the schedule.  The bar was surprisingly large with multiple floors (trivia was played on the 2nd floor). Trivia occurs Thursdays at 8pm and was entertaining.

reviews.name: Iveylee T.
reviews.review: Great Sunday and Tuesday drink specials.  Do NOT order queso. Super runny and tasted like dishwater. We traded for salsa... Which was fine but most likely store bought Pace brand. Go for beer and sports

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: Let's call this place what it is: a sports bar.  A real unapologetic sports bar.  A giant projector screen and several small ones for all the games during whatever season it may be.  A lovely outdoor patio for nice days and nights.  A wide selection of bar food including quite possibly the largest fried chicken bites I have ever seen (seriously, was it a whole chicken?!).  They have a songwriters night here on Friday evenings.  Jed's does not pretend to be something else.  It's open late with lots of fried yumminess and cold drinks.  It's a great place to watch sports and never seems to be too busy when put up against other sports bars.  It may not be the best but for watching any game of interest it is not half bad.

reviews.name: Erin L.
reviews.review: Great food great atmosphere great service!!!!  Kristie was awesome even served us in the rain! Awesome time highly recommended! :)

reviews.name: Damon D.
reviews.review: Gets worse every time.  When it first opened it was a great spot.  Food, service, atmosphere...All 4 stars.  In terms of location, TVs, it's still good...receivers for each TV so that's nice.  But...service is getting bad, actually terrible.   They aren't rude or anything, they just aren't very good (slow). No hostess so you might be sitting and waiting for a server for a while.  Don't check up too often.  Just not good service.   Beer selection is nice though. Burger choices are good too.  Overall-check it out, you be the judge, but won't be coming back unless I'm forced to (or unless I just want to sit and watch games with friends and not care about service).

reviews.name: Tennessee P.
reviews.review: Jed's is a perfect place to belly up to the bar, enjoy that classic Americana pub food, watch some games, and high five strangers when teams score. I've been here a handful times, and it's worth noting that I've ONLY sat at the bar. So, some of the other folks complaints about service may be accurate, but I have never experienced it at the bar top. The place has a cozy feel to it downstairs, and features your typical beer/drink selection for pretty average prices. For the niche it serves, it's perfect.

reviews.name: Korina A.
reviews.review: We are from out of town. Came to eat at viener fest that was closed for a private party, across the street looked aeound and found Jed's. We asked the owners if our dogs could come and eat on the patio with us. They said sure. We ordered the fish tacos. The boss burger, chicken quesadillas,  boneless wings, and the grilled cheese. The burger was juicy.  Egg cooked perfect.Grilled cheese my grandson said was yummyBoneless wings were fantastic and the chipotle sauce was good spice and nice flavorFish tacos has good fish portions and was good flavor. Wish it had a little sauce.Stadium brat was grilled nicely and the saurkraut was grilled also. All in all we thought it looked okay but the food hit the spot.

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: The food is very good. But this service is some of the worst in the city. Tonight we sat outside on a nice evening with 4 total people. There could have been 25 people in the entire place. Our waiter comes out after we were sitting there for 20 minutes and proceeds to take our order. After taking our order he stops says, "hold on I have to get a piece of paper." Then proceeds to come back 10 minutes later and start from the beginning of us taking a order. I was so confused because I have never seen this before. Not to mention our food came out at totally different times. I will not be coming back here.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: Dear Jed's, You are a sports bar. It says so in your name. So why did you have the CMA's on the big screen playing out loud when I wanted to watch the Predators game? You switched it to the hockey game once the awards were over, but until then I had to read closed captioned commentary on the smaller TV while listening to Taylor Swift make some sort of dying animal noises into a microphone.  Your food was really good (great fries & sliders), beer selection was good, and I love that it's 2 for 1 on Wednesday night, but I'm still a little mad at you. I'll be back, but please don't pull that crap again.Sincerely, Hockey Fan

reviews.name: Brad W.
reviews.review: No.

reviews.name: Dawn L.
reviews.review: This review began as a two but as I started thinking about the service I bumped it to a three.  The three factor. One it is a sports bar so there are TVs everywhere...three floors of TVs and outside...every football game that could be on was and the Yankee's baseball game.  The bartenders were great!  They paid  attention to their patrons, even the ones that were rude.  "Bless the bartenders hearts"  These are the only reasons for the three.The two star factor.  The food IS typical bar food...nothing to be excited about AT ALL...Why should anyone expect typical and ordinary when you have a great place to watch a game?  Come on...step it up make this place more than typical - it wouldn't take much.  Two the beer selection...when there are so many options out there to choose from...I was actually less hesitant about meeting some friend here to watch the games because I had read they had a descent selection on tap...NOT!  If you have any of the three on tap then it's not a descent selection (Miller, Bud, Coors, and let me through in Blue Moon for good measure) but of course it is right next to Vandi stadium so you are more or less catering to the college students.

reviews.name: Gee W.
reviews.review: Big Fan....Good regular prices and even better during Happy Hour.  The staff is nice and accommodating when it comes to putting games on.  I've tried several items on the menu and they all seemed good, especially the nachos.Nice location and great patios upstairs and downstairs.  The whole place is non-smoking, which is a huge plus for me.

reviews.name: Em S.
reviews.review: It's a big bar and located next to Centennial park. What else do you need to know? The usual bar foods such as fried onion rings and tater tots, of course lots of beers, and a few TVs. There's an upstairs outdoors area that can be good for groups at lunch, example, but not sure why you'd want to go here just to eat. On one of the visits here, the credit card reader was down, but otherwise service was bar-friendly. The one plus is it's non-smoking! Hooray for being able to breathe while having a good night out.

reviews.name: Nikki F.
reviews.review: Came here from Cincinnati to join up with the Nashville Chapter of LSU Alumni. We watched the game, ate, drank and we were very merry! This place was awesome and they took very great care of the group. Really nice patio. We had a taco salad and it was really really good. If we are in the area again we will totally stop in if we have some sports to watch!

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Very much love hate relationship with Jed's. Love/Like:Location. West End sports bar is perfect with plenty of parking. The patio is great. I love cigars, so it's nice to go smoke a stick and watch the game. Food is good bar food. No corner pub or sportmens. Staff is generally friendly. Hate/don't like so much:Went in on Saturday at 1015 and the kitchen was already closed. They then turned off the TV we were watching that had a hockey game tied 2-2 in the 3rd period with no warning. Didn't even ask if we were still watching. They kicked 6 of us out of the roof patio after march madness on sunday because they were closing it. At 6 PM!!!! They made us pick up our stuff, go downstairs and watch it out front. I would have left but the Preds game was just about to start. So maybe I am a stickler, but when you have 6 guys drinking and eating heartily, you don't kick them out or relocate them. I'm sorry, that is bad business. Also, I was pissed when they killed our TV without asking in the middle of crunch time. YOU ARE A SPORTS BAR. EFFING ACT LIKE IT.

reviews.name: Jemina B.
reviews.review: I'm about to get real up in here - this place is about as cool as a honeymoon handjob. If you're not familiar with my lovely choice of words, it means it seems cool at the get-go, but then it fades into utter disappointment (and that's putting it nicely). I went here to meet up with friends after work one day only to discover that one person was covering the bar, the main floor, and all its inhabitants. Twenty minutes later when I was approached by our server/bartender/perhaps manager/owner/spokesperson?, everyone at our table ordered two drinks apiece knowing this was the last chance we'd have to get our buzz on. Foolishly, we ordered food, and while that took about the same amount of time to get a drink, the taste was bland. Overall, I'd say the place could use some better specials, more service, and a lot more pizzazz. That's right- PIZZAZZ!

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: I love a good sports bar and, while I am a Sam's devotee, my friends arranged a happy hour so that I could cheat on Sam with Jed.Jed's place isn't in the most obvious location.  Right off of West End behind the Electronics Express.  I don't think Jed gets as many ladies to visit him as he might like because it is hard to see that he's there.  Poor Jed.When you walk up you notice that Jed's place has a nice front patio.  Go in and find a nice sized room with TVs and tables.  Up the stairs to the left find more tables and seating around a raised bar and even more TVs.  Up more stairs you will find a huge patio, currently enclosed for the cold weather, with enough space to host the UT Alumni party.  Not bad Jed!So I sat with my friends and excitedly perused the menu while drinking economically priced happy hour draft Miller Lite.  They have burgers, pizzas, wings, sides, other sandwiches, etc.  I also really liked the option that you could get menu items made smaller if asked - good for when you are trying to stop gorging yourself with huge menu portions.  They had any bar food you would like, plus, PLUS mac'n'cheese as a side option.  Don't mind if I dooooooo.So I got the Boss burger that comes with a fried over easy egg on top.  Ah, reminds me of that time I was in Amsterdam and they brought me a burger with a fried egg.  I'd never seen such a thing and was intrigued...and excited...and, ultimately, pleased.  Plus I had the munchies something fierce.  I digress.  So this burger was a pleasing large size and the first bite makes the yolk run out pleasantly all over your hands and the plate below.  Nom!  However, I really wish the burger had been a bit more juicy and flavorful...and that they had asked me how I wanted it cooked.  Medium to medium rare thanks.  Anyway, still not bad.  The fries were not as crispy as I like them but had a nice seasoning on them.  At the risk of seeming gluttonous, I also ordered a side of mac'n'cheese because I believe I've found the holy grail of mac and cheese dishes (sadly in Dallas) and I'm always willing to give a place a chance to oust them.  This didn't but it did have a nice bread crumb topping and wasn't your standard cheese mix.  Not awesome but not bad.  A-OK perhaps?The service.  Man.  The chick we had was pleasant and she managed to get everything right even though we had a ton of people there.  However, it seems perhaps they understaff because at times you are parched for your next beer or waiting to order food or waiting for your tab and your waitress is nowhere to be found.  I think perhaps more staff would help?  Not sure.Overall, not bad.  They have trivia on Thursdays and apparently karaoke on Fridays.  I do love karaoke at random bars y'all so perhaps I'll give it a try.  Otherwise I will keep Jed in mind when Sam is boring me....but shhh don't tell Sam!

reviews.name: Austin C.
reviews.review: I love Jed's. The waitstaff and bartenders  are friendly and attentive. They have a ton of tv's, decent bar food, a great happy hour, and nice patio. I don't know what else you would want in a sports bar.

reviews.name: Andy J.
reviews.review: If you're looking for a great local bar to watch 'the big game' in Nashville, Jed's is probably one of the best places you can do it.  It's filled with several distinct areas (inside and outside) with plenty of TVs.  That said, if it's a really really big game (i.e. special Vanderbilt or Titans games, etc.) then you'll need to show up early if you want a place to sit for four or more people.  The crowd here tends to be filled with a slightly older and more dedicated crowd.  Beware the few undergrads who think this bar is a suitable place for them to be annoying and drunk.  There aren't many, but some do find there way in...The selection of beers on tap was also more than adequate!  The staff seemed to enjoy their jobs (which makes a big difference).  Overall, highly recommended if you're looking for a sports bar.(I didn't sample the food, so can't comment on that...)

reviews.name: Wes B.
reviews.review: In the Ancient Greek days of yore, when Dionysus roamed the earth delivering delicious drink to dried-up dullards, he established four central tenets of the sports bar industry:1. Large, diverse draft beer selection2. Regular drink specials3. Abundant flat-screen televisions 4. Gluts of greasy goodness Jed's satisfies each of these criteria, with extra points for location (right next to Centennial Park) and strong service.The draft list is extensive enough to satisfy without being so large you get a hangover-sized headache just trying to decide which beer to order.  The Scrimshaw Pilsner is a new favorite of mine thanks to its inclusion on the tap.Jed's also boasts another Bacchus basic: two-for-ones.  If you like to double your trouble, you'll usually find a special here.If you're going to Jed's to watch the big game, you'll also get to watch ten others.  There are enough televisions to satisfy sports-obsessed people like me, although the night I went, they were blasting the CMA Awards while the Predators were on mute, a fact that was not lost on my Canadian girlfriend.When it comes to grease, well, the sliders do the trick.  Savory beef, gooey cheese, sweet buns...they're ideal beverage companions.Jed's is my new favorite watering hole.  Dionysus approves, too.  And so will you.

reviews.name: Brad W.
reviews.review: It's a crime this place has such a great balcony.Slow, slow, slow service. They're clearly skimping on payroll.Awful drinks. Like the worst I buy out. How do you screw up a whiskey and coke?Ask JedsDecent food.I'm ready for another Chagos or a bar that's serious about staying in business to replace this meh place.

reviews.name: Caroline L.
reviews.review: Pros: Jed's has a great location off of West End, plenty of parking, and lots of space to watch your favorite game in the company of like-minded fans. The wings are actually really good, too.Cons: Ridiculously overpriced. I had a Miller lite and turkey wrap for $20. I don't really mind overpriced food that much if it's good. This, however, was not. The wrap was like something you'd make a picky 5 year old for lunch. A flour tortilla with shaved, package turkey, and a slice of provolone cheese. Boring, flavorless, not worth the empty calories. I've also had their burgers which are SO overcooked, you'd get more value using them as a hockey puck. I ordered mine medium rare. It came out dry and cooked to within an inch of its life. The service is mediocre. In general, the young staff seems more interested in flirting with each other than waiting tables.... this coming from a 24 year old. Ha. Needless to say, I don't plan on ever going back.In general, a good place to go if you want to sip a beer, watch the game, and get fresh air on the really nice patios. But go somewhere else for dinner.

reviews.name: Andrew C.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times now and am pleased with not only the food, but also how helpful the staff is with accommodating my group everytime with extra chairs or what game is on. Ranks in top 5 burgers I've ever had!Reasonably priced drinks with a great quality atmosphere of people. Be patient with them as they're still very new and whipping into shape and you'll always be taken care of!

reviews.name: Aimee S.
reviews.review: "Food 2.5, atmosphere 4. Nice outdoor seating with tvs. Good service. It's just a sports bar, people."

reviews.name: Gordon H.
reviews.review: Was expecting to have a good time however, that was not the case.  After waiting several minutes for service, we had to go to the bar to order drinks.  Once the server, Katherine, arrived at the table she was not very pleasant and asked if the drinks had been paid for at the bar. Of course they were paid for, don't know of too many places giving away free drinks.  She was not very friendly. We were able to order an appetizer that was decent. Nonetheless, Katherine was so bad that negated the food quality. We wanted to move to the bar once several seats opened up but were told they were reserved as the folks that had been sitting there who were playing corn hole. Some other people sat down at the bar and when Katherine was asked she got somewhat upset and said she had nothing to do with it.  Katherine was the one that told us we couldn't sit at the bar.  Bad experience, won't be going back. Unless you know the bar tender or wait staff, expect the same.

reviews.name: Jill S.
reviews.review: Food was decent. Our server Katherine was horrible. We would have sat at our table for 20 minutes without anything to drink had we not gone to the bar ourselves. Then when she finally did get to our table she was rude about us going to the bar for drinks. Then when spots opened up at the bar we went to move (telling her we were fine with cashing out with her) when we were told the open spots at the were saved for the people that just left to go outside to play cornhole. Shortly after we were told this new people sat at the open spots at the bar without being told try couldn't sit there. We will not be going back.

reviews.name: Christina V.
reviews.review: We were in town for a concert and looking for a place close to the hotel with a local feel. We definitely found it here. We first went in about 3 in the afternoon. I wish I had gotten the names of our bartenders, but I didn't. The girl behind the bar was super friendly. She was knowledgeable in the beer selections that were on tap. Offering a small sample of a local beer that was similar to what my boyfriend was drinking, He loved it, and drank that the rest of the time! The prices were decent, we did not try the food. Day time trip was a success. After the concert we decided to go back to Jed's because it was right across the street from the hotel we were at, and the hotel bar was closed. I was hoping for the same friendly experience, but it was not quite up there on the same scale as the daytime. The bartender was quick, he knew his drinks, and he wasn't rude by any means, but he wasn't really friendly either, more like indifferent. It was obvious that his friends were in the bar drinking, so he spent his time entertaining them, it wasn't bad enough to take off more than a star though, and we would definitely return.

reviews.name: Alison B.
reviews.review: I received really good service from the bartender . . . After I moved away from a table . . . After I waited 20 minutes and was ignored.  Food is decent sports bar fare.  Did I mention I miss Acorn?  Long story short: sit upstairs and sit at the bar if Christy's working.  And yes, they will change the channel on at least one TV to your game.

reviews.name: Mark D.
reviews.review: Before reading the entire review, I will save you the time if you don't want to and just let you know this place is literally the worst sports bar I have ever been to and don't recommend anyone step foot in this place.This place is awful.  We showed up to watch the Tennessee game at 2:30, and the place was packed.  Standing room only.  That was fine.  We waited about 30 minutes for one waitress to walk by and take a drink order.  Inside there was a projection screen with 3 flat screen TV's right next to it on either side.  EVERY TV was on the Auburn game.Once it was time for the Alabama-Penn St. and Tennessee-Cincy games to start they had a hissy fit when they were asked to switch some of the other TV's to the game.  It took 10 minutes to begin with.  You run a sports bar, this aspect of your business is critical....know when to switch on games.Once the Auburn game was over, their fans flooded out and we had a chance to get a table outside, only it was 15 minutes before someone came out there to switch the channel to a game instead of watching a Dan Rather interview.A guy at our table ordered food at one point, and when a guy brought out his food, and another table's food, he gave the other table food then turned to walk away.  My friend spoke up and said it was his and that we were just a different table right next to them.  He snapped at my friend and  said "I know you're another table"!And as if the service and basic intelligence of the bar ownership wasn't bad enough, the owner came out at the end of the night and told the group that we "certainly had a lot of ways to tell her how to run her bar".  She then made reference to how Clay Travis was downstairs and loved the place.  Who gives a s**t?  The owner of this place is a joke.  And if you don't believe me, look at other reviews because it appears others agree.Well when you, and your staff is incompetent you need pointers since we've been in about a thousand of them.  Save yourself the headache, don't step in this place.  They are like a lot of sports bars...they think if they start a sports bar in an area where there aren't a lot of them it doesn't matter how pathetic they are at running one, people will come.  No thanks.

reviews.name: Salah N.
reviews.review: Our department happy hour headquarters!  Love this place!

reviews.name: bryan h.
reviews.review: It's everything you want in a sports bar - big with a ton of TV's playing every game, good beer selection both on tap and bottles, great outdoor seating both on the ground level and the upstairs deck, solid bar food selection (i.e. burgers, sandwiches, pizza, appetizers). I'll definitely return.

reviews.name: Janet K.
reviews.review: Truly disappointed! Ordered a captain and diet...it was flat.  When I told the waiter he said...yeah I know.  Nachos were not worthy!  Would not recommend as the next sports bar...does not compare with Sam's!

reviews.name: Tuck L.
reviews.review: Jeds is great if you don't mind very slow service.

reviews.name: Guy R.
reviews.review: Where to start?  Very disappointing....Went there Saturday night to hang out with some friends and watch the Saints/Lions game.  Our server crammed the four of us around a table that was better suited for two people.  When I asked our waitress if she would move us to a larger table if one became available, she said "no - this is my section."  I went upstairs and asked another waitress if she would let me know if a larger table became available and she said, "it won't happen."  Off to a great start...  So the four of us crammed around our Playskool table waiting to order some beers.  It was 20 minutes before we saw our waitress again.  In fact, we waited for service all night long.  We ordered the wings first.  They were dry and boring.  Can buffalo wings really be dry?  Isn't that like pizza without sauce???  When it came time to order our meal we asked our waitress some questions...  she told us that the "pizza isn't any good - isn't anything like Sam's" and that Sam's "is kicking their ass right now."  Needless to say we went with three sandwiches and one small pizza.  All were slow, lousy and not as advertised on the menu.  In addition to being stuck with bad food now, we also had to listen to the waitress tell us how she was looking for another job elsewhere, how bad the owners are and how she would run things differently...  Apparently the food was so bad that the waitress comp'd it for us even without us complaining.  She knew...  We will not be going back and I don't believe they will be there very long if things don't change dramatically.  Go to Sam's if you're in that area.  Cross Corner isn't bad in Brentwood, either.

reviews.name: Chris K.
reviews.review: We (The most excellent LSU Music City Alumni group) watch LSU games here and it's awesome!!!! The owners are so nice and take suggestions and follow up. I have Celiac disease and require certain dietary restrictions and food preparation demands. Pamela & John took the time to listen to my concerns and have said they'd be happy to act on my suggestions.The facilities are clean, well attended and the service is good compared to other sports bars of comparable size. If it is packed, expect your server to be working as hard as possible to limit your wait. They are service people, but more importantly, they are people. Treat them kindly, tip them well, and you will receive service accordingly.oh....and GEAUX TIGERS!!!!

reviews.name: Kristin M.
reviews.review: My boyfriend stumbled upon Jed's for Tuesday 2-4-1's. The bar staff was so nice, the atmosphere was very upbeat and happy, and the parking was surprisingly very easy. We ate a burger, o-rings, and fried pickles, all of which were spectacular!  We are both planning on making Jed's our go-to bar after work! :)

reviews.name: whitney D.
reviews.review: My family loves Jed's! We can go up to the tree-house inspired third floor and watch the game. We could go downstairs and play wii! And the food was above average. The sandwiches were delicious but the fries were cold (however they quickly brought us more that were hot so it was all good) we will be back for sure! The outside patio bar is also one of the cutest things I've seen in a while.

reviews.name: Kira S.
reviews.review: Could be good if they get it together. I've visited twice. The first time it was just to check it out. It was a weeknight so quiet and our service was quick. My fish tacos were above average for a sports bar, but I could've used more salsa/pico for the chips. They also have a good draft beer selection.The second time, we visited on the opening night of the NFL season. It was definitely hopping, and they were woefully unprepared for the rush. Our food took over an hour to come, and my sandwich was not at all what I ordered. Instead of goat cheese and portabello mushroom, it just had some lackluster tomato and lettuce and cheese. The fries were soggy and cold. We finally got the attention of a waitress, and she got it fixed. But my husband's burger NEVER showed up the entire time we were there (over 3 hours). At one point, the waiter informed us that the kitchen wasn't taking orders for the next half hour because they were so backed up. We couldn't believe how slow and bad the service was. Apparently some kitchen staff hadn't showed up so the general manager was back in the kitchen cooking. They did comp our food, so that was one bright side. We didn't have to pay for a burger we never even received.It's a great space with lots of different niches for different crowds, but they need to fix the service if they plan to stay in business.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: A girl reading a book and eyeing the guys fit okay with the Vanderbilt jocks hanging out. Wholesome looking jocks were watching championship poker from Vegas with a $100,000 jackpot. Two airy patios outside also gave fun fresh moments. The pub snacks and sandwiches are definitely above average but next time I'll skip the fried pickles with honey digon. Big Jed's is now the only clean traditional West End sports bar.

reviews.name: Christina G.
reviews.review: Great wings and great atmosphere! The outside bar is perfect!

reviews.name: Bryan L.
reviews.review: Good bar food - burgers , wings etc are a plus. Good small outdoor  bar with cigar smoking. There is a real  Football focus on the weekend so if you are a  hockey and baseball fan - you may have to ask for your game. Good offering of brew but Prices are a little high for drafts.

reviews.name: Bryna W.
reviews.review: After the initial opening issues and adjustments, Jed's has become one of my favorite places to dine and catch a game on the big screen!  Their food is great, & the servers are super friendly....and trust me, we put them through their paces every Saturday during our alumni view-in parties! LSU Music City loves Jed's and we're very happy they're our new home on Saturday nights!

reviews.name: Christina C.
reviews.review: Jed's is a very chill sports bar with an above average craft beer selection. There is a television any where you go and it's perfect for football Saturdays. You can't beat their happy hour prices either. The establishment is clean and friendly. The food is typical bar food and the service is mediocre. I love the plethora of out door seating available and the Yazoo tiki hut in front despite the cloud of cigarette smoke. That's so 2011, nashville- get with it. I was at Jed's the day they opened and I've been disappointed since.

reviews.name: Jason E.
reviews.review: Happy to report that they now take credit cards!  I don't always have cash.. so this is good.  The food is as good as ever, and quick too.

reviews.name: Jami M.
reviews.review: Deli Cafe is a great quick eat! Friendly owner and good food. Only takes cash though so make sure you have some before going!

reviews.name: Renee B.
reviews.review: Best wings and biscuits in town!!! Great desserts too. If you want some delicious, greasy food this is the spot to be.

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: 3 stars. Yep.  Customer service screwed the ratings. Food was decent but I think the workers need retraining on customer service skills. I'll leave it here for now.

reviews.name: Verlisa W.
reviews.review: The biscuits yes with the honey butter .... The chicken not so much... This place is a hit or miss on chicken... The chicken I had yesterday was fried way too hard that I couldn't even eat it... Moistness what moistness nothing but crispy chicken inside and out which could really damage ur teeth and gums... The flavor and spicy is there but I can't just order and pay for chicken to lick the sauce off

reviews.name: Neek C.
