reviews.review: If you're a TSU/Fisk/Meharry student and you want hot wings, this is your place to go. Great wings and cajun fries. And the biscuits...GREATNESS. I always order 2 extra biscuits.

reviews.name: Lauren R.
reviews.review: Just got invited to this place by a friend. The variety of choices is tempting. I ordered the whiting fish combo with cajun seasoned french fries and lg. sweet tea. ($6.70) Every thing was fresh and the tea was the best i'd had in a while. All in all I would visit again, area of jefferson was fine as it was close to farmers market and in a good location.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: The absolute WORST customer service on the phone. I was left on hold for over 10 minutes twice and they never came back to take the order. Tried to call 19 other times and it was busy. They have their system, CC processing and phone all on the same  line....very inefficient business. They have no menu online either. I chose to order from them over all the others based on their recent wing contest win. I won't anymore. I only support businesses that understand how to operate effectively and efficiently and that offer good customer service.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Knock Out Wings was our third stop in the Winter Wingathon.  It's not much to look at with its strange boxing gloved chicken (how is a chicken going to wear boxing gloves?), and the GPS took us down a back alley saying it was a road (Wing, wing, nudge, nudge) but we got there okay.Parking is fairly decent but it can get to be a bit of a tight squeeze because people will park behind you on the edge of the lot in such a way you have to back out and make sure you don't try and drive thru them.The food came pretty quickly, though not as quickly as the group of us who got there almost at 11.  It seems like it fills up pretty quickly and near as we could tell there were two people making the wings and one person working the register. It got very busy, but they *were* knocking out some wings.Now, lets talk about the food.First of all, I accidentally ordered the tea. I'm not much for tea usually, but this was absolute.. What's that word for a happy accident? (asks Google) Serendipity!  The tea is delicious! very sweet (maybe too sweet for some) with a nice touch of lemon.We ordered a 16 piece combo with a side of Cajun Fries to share.  Each order comes with a honey roll, and they were kind enough to give us two.  In fact, without even asking, they split the order into two 8s with a roll for each. So extra points for consideration.  The honey sauce on the wings was fantastic, and the wings were cooked just right.  The Cajun fries were hot, but not TOO hot, so the better half could eat them and not be uncomfortable.The booths were a bit tight, especially for the girth-some (Hey, I review food, so I'm not shy about it), and by the time 11:30 or so rolled around it was hopping, but Knock Out Wings delivered a KO in my book. I certainly recommend it for anyone looking for some really great wings.

reviews.name: Huyen T.
reviews.review: The hot wings are seriously....no, dangerously HOT.I felt the heat and I was getting really red! Homemade Biscuit was BOMB. Omg, I'm drooling... I might consider getting some more when i'm in nashville again. I got the meal and it was served with fries and a choice of sweet tea or fountain soda. I got the sweet tea. It got that hint of lemon/lime in it. taste like nestea. But I heard they made their tea so I'm not sure.

reviews.name: Adams C.
reviews.review: Get off your butt and get yourself a wing combo with Cajun fries, extra-hot sauce, and at least two extra honey biscuits, which are perhaps the most perfectly constructed food item on the planet. Sometimes I zone out and start salivating just at the though of KO wings. A+ one of the ten best restaurants in Nashville.

reviews.name: Roxann B.
reviews.review: I phoned in a carry out order on today... First I was on hold for 10 minutes, then they hung up on me after asking if I could hold.  The females that answer the phone have no customer service skills.. Don't offer their names and sound like robots when you ask a question.  I was a frequent customer... As if today I am a former customer!!! Rudeness will lose you money EVERYDAY! So long...

reviews.name: Lance G.
reviews.review: I went here with my son and nephew on our way through town and had the BBQ and mild wings. The mild wings had a great flavor, the BBQ were good (different kind of BBQ flavor that was really good), and the biscuits were fantastic.  The restaurant was quite dirty so recommend getting them to go.

reviews.name: DeAndre H.
reviews.review: I went here over the weekend, and my friend recommended it over Prince's Hot Chicken. I went and ordered tenders and fries; I should of ordered the wings because the tenders tasted so plain. Tasted like something I can get a Captain D's. Their fries and bread are very nice. The place was filthy when I went in. Wings on the floor, trash on the table it was a wreck. Sorry, won't be coming here again.

reviews.name: Tiffany R.
reviews.review: These are some crazy good hot wings! They are big and flavorful and the Cajun  fries were great. The staff was very friendly. The dining area needed a good wipe down of the tables. But I will definitely be returning!

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: Coming from someone whose experience with wings in the past is mostly Hooters and Buffalo Wild Wings, I have to admit that because of them I usually order the chicken tenders when given the choice. However, since I joined a group of guys today who are out to find the best wings in Nashville, I decided that I should play along. Boy, am I ever glad that I did! These wings were awesomely tasty! On the menu, the BBQ is actually Honey BBQ, which is what we ordered. They're messy, but oh-so-worth-it for the flavor. The wings were cooked to perfection, not dry or underdone. The vibe of the place is that the people working there really do care about their customers. As first-time orderers, I felt like they were patient and answered questions without irritation. The food is made to order, so there is a slight wait but not unreasonable. I gathered from the way the orders were coming out that they make a huge batch of wings at a time then put the orders together, because they would 'knock out' several orders at one time. Highly recommended to check out, especially if you're like me and your experience with wings has been national chains. Give these local guys a try! Oh, and the honey biscuits really are worth their proclaimed "famous" title. For real!

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: Ew!

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: This place Pretty good.  I've pretty much exhausted my options for hot dogs a long time ago, so I thought I'd try a few wing places.  I've had Ghot Wings, and they're pretty good, and everyone knows Buffalo Wild Wings.  And Knock Out Wings is tasty.Normal pricing, a little more than I care to pay for rings but that goes with the territory.  It's not really cheaper than other places, and since it's not close to the places I normally am, it's hard to justify.It's also on Jefferson Street, between TSU and Downtown.  This is something of a questionable area of town, but you make choices in life, and I survived. Somewhat uncomfortable sitting area, but the wait wasn't bad, so I didn't mind, and at least they had ESPN on.There's nothing thrilling about this place: Ghot Wings and Nuttin But Wings are just as good, but there's nothing wrong with it, either.  So if you want some tasty wings, it's not a bad choice.

reviews.name: Jemina B.
reviews.review: I went here during lunch one day, and while the food was great, it wasn't so much fun working for the remainder of the afternoon with a belly full of spicy chicken and biscuits.Biscuits, you wonder? Oh, yes. The biscuits. These honey-tinged doughy wonders are right up there with Loveless Cafe's in my opinion. You will want to eat a million of them, and if you're like me, you may actually try to eat more than is humanly possible.Now, onto the chicken. I got the chicken tenders with wing sauce and, while other reviewers on here may have turned their nose at said tenders, I honestly liked 'em! They were spicy yet tasty, and had a kick without making me wish I were dead. The staff was friendly and had quick service, and I enjoyed eating in what may have been a Captain D's before K.O. Wings got their hands on it. Definitely worth a visit!

reviews.name: Mark W.
reviews.review: This is my go to spot for late night food in Nashville.It stays open late and the wings and fries are great .

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: This place should change It's name. The wings are ok, nothing special but the play their role nicely. Let's talk about the real reason anyone goes here. It's all about the tea and biscuits. My friend turned me on to this place and I have gone back and bought the tea by the half gallon and 6 bicuits, well just because I can. They are simply amazing. Trust me you need to try this place at least once. You will be glad you did!

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Definitely a good deal for the money, but wings were dry and over-cooked.  It's a "one-night stand"... not likely to come backI'm all about being friendly so it's not too often that I get a cold shoulder, but the employees did make me feel that I didn't belong there.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: If nothing else, I would go back here for the biscuits.  AMAZING.  I probably could have eaten about 10 more.  Nay, 20 more.I'm not a huge fan of wings, so I went with the chicken tenders, generously drenched in their mild buffalo sauce.  Not bad, but not great.  They did, however, destroy me the following morning.  There's a good reason their chicken mascot looks so cocky standing there with his boxing gloves - I can't imagine he's ever lost a fight.

reviews.name: Heather K.
reviews.review: This is a review of take-out only:I am a huge-normous fan of chicken wings. I am also a snob when it comes to hot sauce. I want blood to pour from eyes from the heat. That being said, Knock Out's hottest wings were a mere tap. They didn't knock anything out. We also ordered other flavors: Lemon Pepper (too oily, but the meat was dry), Country (just plain ol' fried chicken), and Cajun (regular fried chicken with some spices). Overall, I found their wings to be consistently dry and smothered in even more dry breading. I do like that each order came with 2 single servings of ranch dressing. I go through that stuff like a hooker goes through blow. I found it to be the only thing to combat the dry meat.So here we are. Why did I give them the A-Ok rating if the wings sucked so bad? Answer: Their freaking biscuits! They should just start calling that place "Knock Out Biscuits". Fucking phenomenal. The biscuits are light and fluffy. They aren't flakey like dinner biscuits.The consistency is more like that of a shapeless cupcake. They have a neutral mild flavor on the inside, but on the outside, they have a thin glaze of sweetness. I think it may come from honey. I am not usually a fan of sweet stuff, but these are an absolute treat. You owe it to yourself to try a biscuit, but don't bother with the lame wings.

reviews.name: Gia T.
reviews.review: First of all, let me say that the purpose of this review is not to slam this business into the ground but to help them take notice of what your customers and potential customers think of your product and for you to make the necessary changes to maintain those customers.I ordered the 15 pc wing in a 3 variety flavor:  BBQ, Cajun, and lemon pepper.  I must truthfully say that the wings were hard, dry, and lacked flavor.  The Cajun wings are not dipped but have a dry rub. The lemon pepper wings did not taste like lemon pepper, and the BBQ wings were hard, dry, and also lacked flavor.  I was sorely disappointed.  People pay good money for a product and they expect to receive their money's worth.  Go back to the drawing board and embellish upon your concept.The sweet tea good and flavorful but a bit too sweet for me (it's a southern thing).  The cornbread  tasted pretty good.  I'm from Indianapolis and I may drop back in next time I'm in Nashville. Good luck and please take this constructive criticism with love.

reviews.name: Scott D.
reviews.review: I used to drive by this place when I attended Tennessee State University almost 3-4 times a week. Now, a few years later I'm finding myself finally eating there. It's exactly what one would expect from a place that specializes in wings: No frills. When I got there, about 1:30p on a Saturday, it was lively and busy. People were waiting around the restaurant for their orders and the sassy counter woman was shouting back to the kitchen after every order. People say that this is located in a bad neigborhood, but I think that sometimes people are projecting personal feelings to avoid good food. Would I want to hang out all day and basque in the atmosphere: No. Would I want a place to serve me wings and just that: Yes.I ordered buffalo chicken strips and cajun chicken wings. I wish I had known that the cajun wings were breaded and seasoned instead of sauced. They were tasty, just not expected. They came with this buttery, sweet cornbread type of thing that was amazing. They also came with what I call "Southern Ketchup", what others call Ranch Dressing. Overall a good experience for when you're craving some delicious football snacks.Added bonuses include video game selection of antiquated arcade classics. There was a Nintendo game selector with all the classics and "Raiden". Nice touch.

reviews.name: Ebony C.
reviews.review: The biscuits are amazing, the grilled chicken used on salads is grilled really well, and the wings are just OK (I think they're fried too hard, but that's just personal preference), but the wings are significantly larger than those found at other wing shops. Further, the pricing is much more reasonable than comparable wing places. It's a neighborhood chicken place that catered mostly to students at the 2 colleges nearby and the neighborhood is going through the gentrification process. Accordingly, the customer service isn't amazing on the best day (but it never has been and since most people don't eat in, there isn't really an expectation that it will be), the crowd is growing, and hipsters claim they have the best wings ever. Realistically, the wings are far from the best ever, but the grilled chicken salad and biscuits are good enough that I order in about once a week.

reviews.name: michael s.
reviews.review: My wife was working late so that left me and  my son to fend for ourselves for dinner, and I didn't feel like cooking. Well my 11 year old son would eat chicken every day if we let him, so we decided on wings. We normally do the BW3 thing or Pizza Hut or some other place like that, but I decided we needed to try some local, less advertised, mom and pop type place. GREAT CALL! First off, while the place may not be all light up, don't let the look  of the building fool you. Its what comes out of that kitchen that counts. It took about 20 minutes for our order to be done, (and there were a few folks who came in after us and got their food first, but I am assuming they either called their order in or were regulars who order the same thing every time), but the wait was worth it. The wings, unlike most buffalo wings you eat, actually had meat on them. I like to eat hot foods, so my son got the mild wings and I got the hot wings. Hot?? Someone ought to check the recipe because I swear acid is one of the ingredients. They were really hot but I couldn't stop myself. Unlike most places that have hot sauce just for the sake of being hot, these were hot but with flavor. Amazing wings. This brings us to the sides. I got cole slaw, which was great, and the cajun fries were the best I have ever had. Even my wife liked the Slaw and she hates everything. That brings me to the Baked Beans...As I have said, my wife is the most finicky eater in the world. I let her try a small spoon of the baked beans, thinking she would turn her nose up and say a half hearted "they are alright". Wrong. After I gave her that spoonful and asked her what she thought, her eyes lit up like a kid that opens a present on Christmas Day and gets that Pony they always wanted. She then not only cleaned the bowl, but God as my witness, STARTED LICKING THE BOWL! By the time she got done, that bowl looked like it had just come out of the sleeve. I, in the 10 years we have been together, have never seen her react to a food like she did to those beans, EVER.While the biscuits were good, compared to the rest of the meal they were not on par with the chicken and the sides, but thats like saying that you have two players on your team, Michael Jordan, and "only" Kobe Bryant. In case you haven't guessed it, yes, we will be back, again and again.Those who say they are the best in Nashville won't get an argument from me.

reviews.name: C.C W.
reviews.review: I just recently had K.O wings and they were good! I can't say they were the best I've ever had but they were good. The biscuits were amazing though!!!

reviews.name: Reya G.
reviews.review: Best. Biscuits. Ever!

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: Tried this place for lunch yesterday. Service was quick and friendly. I tried the hot wings. The wings themselves were a little meager -- small and a bit dry -- which is the only reason this review isn't better. The highlight was the sauce, which appeared to be made fresh (it had whole chunks of tomato in it), and was very flavorful.Although I definitely broke a sweat and cleared my sinuses, the heat was not as bad as I was expecting, considering I got the "are you sure you want the hot hot?" lecture (which at other places like Prince's is not a warning to be dismissed lightly).I'll definitely be going there again, but it wasn't as amazing as I was hoping.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: man, this place is something else. there is no posturing here, if you come here it's because you want to eat some good food at a great price. the food to price ratio works very much in your favor. i'm not one for spiciness, so i went with the mild wings, and the heat accumulated nicely as i plowed through three chickens worth of wings (since each chicken really yields four wings. real talk.), but my friend told me he hot really isn't too hot. now, let's get to what i wasn't expecting. i love biscuits, people. like... a lot. you get one with each meal, but if you want another/don't care what you're eating (aka cheat day) spend the fifty cents and get another. people say things are "smack your mother" good, but these biscuits are "kick that bitch in the fucking mouth" good. for real. get to know this place.eric b

reviews.name: Mr Mrs J.
reviews.review: If you want some real down home soul food type of Chicken Wings, then I would suggest that you venture out to where everybody from Fisk University or TSU go to eat wings!  They have great fries and great wings.  They give WingStop, Wing Zone and every other wing shops a run for their money.  Knock Out Wings offers a lot of flavors, I can't rememer how many and some pretty HOT wings!  I can't take the hot ones, but the mild ones are the bomb.   No it's not in the "best" part of town, but it's worth going with a group of friends, ordering your wings and take it home to pig out in the comfort of your home.  You'll love it!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Knock Out Wings is a pretty good little chicken wing eatery.  They have tons of different sauces and of course varying levels of "heat" to go along with it.  Knock Out would definitely be a good choice for most wing aficionados to check out.  The sauces really stand out as being fresh tasting and lack the metallic and bland taste that some wing joints offer.  I have been here twice and one time the wings were a bit too chewy for my liking, but I definitely recommend checking it out, especially since there are not many other wing places in Nashvegas.

reviews.name: Jonathan R.
reviews.review: Great wings. I really like the buffalo mild wings. The Cajun wings are quite good as well. Best option for wings I have found in Nashville so far.

reviews.name: Marie B.
reviews.review: Whiting fish, macaroni and cheese, & cabbage is what soul food is all about and it was delicious. They had a steady flow of patrons during lunchtime but the line moved quickly. They dropped the fish when I place my order so my food was hot and fresh. The dining area has approximately 10-15 tables but I took my order to go. Plentiful portions that included one meat and two veggies with hot water corn bread for $8.00 (tax, tip, and beverage not included).

reviews.name: Deb D.
reviews.review: I like to choose local places - and this place had a steady stream of very local customers.  I ordered eggs and bacon, so not really one to comment on the varied choices, but my dining partner had grits and biscuit, and other "stuff" that you can only find in the south.  What he said, "This is a place you come to for lunch - not breakfast."  Bacon is precooked - and placed on your plate from the serving area. crisp and thick sliced. I watched as the lady actually dips the pancakes (stored in a pot) into hot?butter before smacking it on a plate. Decor could use help.  $19 for two

reviews.name: Andy O.
reviews.review: Best meat & 3 in Nashville.This place IS what Arnold's tries to be.

reviews.name: Jesse Q.
reviews.review: Wonderful food.wonderful service..The meats the vegetables were off the chain and the banana pudding mercy...I wish u could eat here everyday...

reviews.name: Nina P.
reviews.review: I hadn't been here in years but I had a taste for some home cooked food for lunch today.  Next time I'll get mom to cook the same meal and I know for sure that it will be better.  I chose fried chicken, mac and cheese, hot water cornbread and okra.  The hot water cornbread was much too thick on the inside and very bland.  I picked around the edges and did not eat the whole piece.  I probably would have got choked on it.  The mac and cheese was mushy.  It was on the steam table too long.  Chicken and okra was okay.  I also got lemon cake with cream cheese icing, which I hadn't tried it yet.  $10.91 was quite a bit to pay for lunch to be dissatisfied.  Next time I'll keep going on pass Silver Sands.  Must be some reason I hadn' t been in years, I must have forgotten.  This place is really busy so you would think it has really good food but I beg to differ.  I feel like for what you pay, the portions could also be a bit larger.

reviews.name: Shirley F.
reviews.review: My mother just brought me some of the peach cobbler for dessert.  It was really delicious.  A must try...IMO.

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: Went for lunch today because a co-worker had heard of it and wanted to try this place. Read that the pork neck was good so I ordered it along with the greens and okra. All was mediocre . I tried the tea and I think I am a diabetic now. My other friend tried the lemonade and same thing. They were both exxxtremely sweet. yuck! My mean came out to about $8.50 so it's not a cheap meat and 2. I would recommend you to go to Monell's or Arnolds.

reviews.name: Wendy B.
reviews.review: Great spot for mediocre soul food with right mix snarky attitude.  Fried chicken was just ok, mac & chez was soupy & corn was yucky!  The person with me had meatloaf that had the consistency of pasta sauce.  I am generously giving out the 2 stars based on the tea & lemonade alone.  Oh, the hot water cornbread -- bllllaahhh!  We really thought the long line of Nashville natives was a good sign, but after eating here I now know better.  Bon appetite'!  But somewhere else, not this place!

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Great soul food at a really cheap price.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: I have only been once, as my schedule hasn't been conducive to a repeat visit.  But it was one of the best lunches I've ever had.  Their green beans were EXCELLENT; the only ones that give them a run for their money are found at Southern Bred on Trinity.  Only after-the-fact did I learn that the Sands is famous for their pork necks and rice, so I'll be sure to get that next time.  Sounds fantastic...  Overall, I'd still call Arnold's the best lunch in town (though inconvenient, cramped, and with long lines...all part of the charm, I suppose), but the Sands is an unsung hero of meat-seasoned goodness.  And it's just around the corner from the Farmers Market and Bicentennial Park, so make a day of it!

reviews.name: Ron C.
reviews.review: The food is great, the service is great, I recommend this restaurant if you want great food. Your family will LOVE this place!

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I had really been looking forward to trying Athens, and they let me down... I love Greek food, and I thought I could start a steady relationship with this place, especially considering it's a only a couple miles from home, but the first date didn't go so well.First of all, they really need to work on their first impression. The floors and tables were dirty, the salt and pepper shakers were grimy and the air vents on the ceiling are surrounded by mold. We ordered the hummus and tzatziki for appetizers. The hummus was so-so, but the tzatziki was downright gross. It tasted like there was mayonnaise in it, and there wasn't even a hint of cucumber. My husband got a burger which he said was not all that great, but he did enjoy the fries. My Greek salad came with a thick, creamy dressing. Not at all what I was expecting with a Greek salad, so I asked for vinaigrette. The server brought out a bottle of balsamic vinegar and a bottle of oil. Both were very low quality. This place left a lot to be desired, and I won't be going back.

reviews.name: Kristi R.
reviews.review: Based on yelp reviews and the Triple D connection along w/ the fact that I wanted some good pita, we decided to check this place out.  We were the only customers when we arrived on Friday 3/13/15 at 4:00 pm.  Mari was the greeter/server/cashier on duty.I ordered the Chicken Souvlaki Sandwich w/ a mini Greek salad $7.75- Greek dressing and Tzatziki on the side.  I asked for more kalamata olives as I only received one on my salad.  The chicken was scant, the pita was tasty, the Tzatziki was thick and tasted ok- I've had some that was more flavorful w/ a better cucumber and garlic flavor.  I wouldn't order this dish again but I would order something that comes w/ pita.  I would like to try their breakfast options next time.  My boyfriend ordered the Bacon Lamb Burger $9.99 cooked medium w/ french fries and unsweetened tea $2.25.  He said the french fries were crispy and the burger was good- not knock your socks off/omg I can't wait to return good but it was a good burger.  He was envious of my pita and agreed that he would like to try their breakfast options next time.The women's restroom smelled like a urinal which was incredibly gross- hopefully they'll get that resolved.  The restaurant itself is dated.  Service was friendly.

reviews.name: Kathy C.
reviews.review: I really do not like to leave poor reviews, but hopefully this may help. I can also only speak to the breakfast menu as that's All I have had. (Bellevue location)I will start with saying the lack of front of the house staff is apparent as there was no acknowledgment upon entering, then basically seating yourself and hoping someone notices you are there.  Both occasions were Sunday's around 10:30, a day that one would probably staff up for to handle the volume?  All of that aside I can tell now about the overpriced breakfast options! I love omelettes so I ordered the Athens special- basically choose your own ingredients.  It's was very underwhelming, looked like something I could have done. Nothing special. A $10 omelet should be a little bit more special than what I saw. Toast was cold...also I am from the northeast where there are several amazing Greek diners that are crazy cheap with unbelievable food.  I guess the lack of diners here is a great reason for overcharging customers for lackluster brunch! Skip breakfast here, folks, you can find a solid one elsewhere. They may want to staff up a little, too- at least during peak hours!

reviews.name: R M.
reviews.review: No thanks for here any more. I used to come here regularly at least once a week. The prices were a bit high for what you received but the restaurant service seemed to run smooth.  As people moved into this area, the restaurant  has become more crowded but service and standards has not kept pace at all. It is a bit frustrating too that servers play favorites in who sits first and who has orders taken first.We waited about 20 minutes to even get a cup of coffee. Good luck to them. They will survive because until even  more people move here, restaurant infrastructure will lag. There are a few other nearby places we will go. We found food and service is better anyway there.I had the time to write this review waiting over 40 minutes for our order. Oh well.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: My dad and I chose Athens in Bellevue as our meet up lunch for our birthdays. We had not only me and my parents, but my brother, his wife, and the 8 month old twins for their first high-chair experience.First off, I think this is in an old fast food place so it is tiny. The parking lot made me feel like a great white shark as I circled and circled just waiting for people to move. And when we went in we had to wait quite a while for a table to open up that was big enough to seat us all. But we weren't really in a hurry so no big deal.By the time we were seated, I felt like I could eat everything on the menu because I was so hungry. The problem with being that hungry is that you are going to be indecisive. They have the lunch menu going on but ALSO the BREAKFAST menu all day. i mean, what am I going to do? Breakfast sounds killer but so does lunch! Oh the stress.So I got an appetizer because I had never heard of it before...Htipiti. it was a spiced feta spread and it was FUCKING DELICIOUS. I haven't had anything like it before and we were all pretty enamored with it.So I chose the bacon lamb burger despite the fact that they said it had been featured on Food Network. The burger was ok but was small, a little dry, and there was no bacon. However, it had taken so long to get our food that I wasn't about to give it back. Plus there were ample fries to munch on. My dad got the full Greek sampler which looked good. My brother had some Cowboy burger that looked like a total artery clogging dream. All the food I tried from their place was good - standard diner far with a Greek twist. Overall I was pleased with this place.So why, if my lamb burger was not probably up to their usual standards, did I give them 4 stars? Well, the lamb burger wasn't BAD, it just probably wasn't their best. I am sure if I had said something they would have remedied it immediately, but I didn't because I wanted to just eat.  However, they seated us at like 1:30pm when the sign on the door said they were closing at 2pm for a holiday staff party, and they still seated our large party. The waitress had a lot of tables and busted her ass. And she was friendly and fawned over the twins and chatted with us when she could have rushed us out the door so they could clean up for the party. And we were there quite a bit past 2pm after all was said and done and never felt rushed. There was just something about the home owned, diner feel that made me feel at home. I am going to keep this place in mind as a meeting point when me and the family want to go out to eat together and want to meet in the middle to do it.

reviews.name: Deanna W.
reviews.review: I cannot give this restaurant an adequate review because you have to eat here to get the full quality of the food and the people!! This is the best place I've been to in a really long time! I wasn't too intrigued by the outside appearance but once I came in and there was a short 15 minutes wait, but I would have gladly waited longer! This was my first time eating here but it surely won't be my last! Go here if you're in the Bellevue area, it's worth every penny!!!

reviews.name: Stacy F.
reviews.review: This is an amazing find! Food is great and service makes it even better. Heather has waited on us numerous times and after the first time remembered everything that we ordered. She always goes above and beyond. She knew almost everyone who walked in the door by name! I highly recommend this place for breakfast, lunch and dinner!!!

reviews.name: Len R.
reviews.review: We had a terrible experience overall at the Harding location .  No one greeted us or seated us when we walked in.  We eventually had to seat ourselves.  A couple stared at us because my son, my husband & I were all wearing Indian tops because we had just come from a Hindu Festival.  Our waiter didn't look very happy either when he was taking our order.  Maybe he didn't like the fact that my husband was Indian. The food was ok but the portions were too small for the price we paid.  Sadly my son's chicken nuggets looked like they came from a frozen bag.  Because I felt like we were being judged; I will never go back to any of their locations.  Maybe they need a reminder that they are serving ethnic food!

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: This is gonna be one of my new favorite restaurants for sure! We've tried the shrimp creole, vegetarian flaky roll with mouthwatering spinach and the dreamiest flaky crust (starts with an s.), and the hummus. Oommgg.Everything we've tried has been full of flavor--seasoned perfectly. If you love Greek food, they have tons of options and they make dreams come true.

reviews.name: Jeremy M.
reviews.review: We came here for a late breakfast on a Saturday morning and weren't sure what to think at first. This place is a converted fast food building (an old Long John Silver's, maybe?) and is pretty shabby. But that's never stopped me, plus the DDD poster with Guy Fieri's big face watching us was comforting - it's a stupid show, but he usually visits pretty legit places. I ordered an omelet with a pancake on the side. Both were good, but nothing outstanding (especially considering the price point). The menu is huge, so maybe there are some things in there that really deliver. But, while breakfast certainly filled out stomachs, it did nothing for our souls (*insert sad violin music here*). I'm not sure why Guy stopped in here... then again I don't understand a lot of the decisions he's made (that hair, for example). I just know that I personally won't make a point to stop in here again. I can get a better breakfast at a better price at the Waffle House down the street.

reviews.name: Katie U.
reviews.review: Great food and amazingly helpful / friendly staff.  They have a great variety and I've really enjoyed everything I've gotten.I would give 5 stars if the prices were a little lower.

reviews.name: marcelle d.
reviews.review: 3 stars, is this a joke??  Athens is amazing, have these reviewers ever eaten here? Haha seriously though my entire family goes here regularly, I go every time I'm in town, sometimes twice! What haven't we liked!? The baklava is amazing, the burgers, the hummus, the spanakopita!!!! I could go on...And they serve breakfast ALL DAY. Do yourself a favor and order the grits, but prepare to have all other grits ruined for you, because these are CREAMY!!!  And their housemade feta is amazing.Yesterday 6 of us savored 6 different amazing meals plus appetizers AND they have no corking fee if you bring your own wine!!! On the cheap people!We went for my bday celebration, brought a couple bottles of wine, and had the best meal!!! Doran was our server. They are all friendly but his service was above and beyond! He was the best!!! So helpful and attentive and engaging. He even brought our table two complimentary caramel cheesecakes for my birthday!And this cheesecake is unbelievable! Like seriously, you see it and are like 'eh ok that's nice' and them you taste it.... Literally the non-cheesecake lovers and chocolate-only lovers, and cheesecake connoisseurs in my family alike made the 'omg what' face when they tasted it. My sister started singing R&B slow jams to it, it was so amazing. Yes. She. Did. The caramel sauce was like a salted caramel and it was perfect. Seriously. I could go on, but clearly this was a 5 star experience. We love Athens! :)

reviews.name: Ellen F.
reviews.review: I wanted to update my review. I've completely changed my opinion after having several DELICIOUS breakfasts here. My friend and I have started coming here regularly for breakfast. It's fantastic and fairly priced! Today, instead of breakfast we had lunch and it was good. The soup was really tasty and the salad was super fresh. For breakfast, Chris likes the skillets and they have FANTASTIC grits. We'll keep coming back!

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: I've been to Athens in Bellevue two or three times.The breakfast is a typical breakfast.  There's not really much else to say.Today for lunch, I ventured a little outside of the norm and tried the lamb shank.  It was one of the better dishes I've had in a while.  It was served with rice and smothered in the braising liquid, with a side of pita bread.  The sauce was silky deliciousness, packed with veggies and fresh herbs.  The shank was very well prepared and fell off the bone, with enough fat remaining to keep the meat moist and tender.  I was very satisfied with my meal, especially when I saw the price tag under $9.If the other menu items I tried were as delicious as the shank, I'd easily give a higher rating.  I'm trying to judge this place on the bigger picture, and not by one dish alone.

reviews.name: Shawn G.
reviews.review: Maybe some of the best Greek food in Nashville.  The gyro plate is amazing and the homemade sauces pull it all together.  You must start with the calamari with the sweet chili sauce.  No seafood place anywhere can top it hands down.  Coffee is great too.  This one is a can't miss if you're in Nashville and looking fur fresh Mediterranean food.  Love this place and the staff and cook are really friendly so expect a visit from the chef to your table to see how you're looking it.

reviews.name: Katie M.
reviews.review: Great food, Great service! I did not give this restaurant a fair chance in the beginning, but I have returned numerous times to great food and service. Amazing breakfast with lots of food for what you pay. I call on weekends to order to go and I always seem to get Angel who takes my order. She has my order correct and ready each time we pick it up. You won't be disappointed with this restaurant in Bellevue. It does get very busy for breakfast on weekends so arrive early! I think the omelets here are better than the ones from Loveless Cafe!

reviews.name: Jeff W.
reviews.review: My comments are limited to breakfast, where I've found the food to be spectacularly uneven. Sometimes it's pretty good. Other times it's pretty bad. Yesterday, my pancakes were so tough I had to cut them with a knife. The French Toast on a previous visit was pretty good. Most of the menu is a la carte, so your total check can get expensive real fast if you order an extra or two. I wouldn't make it a destination for breakfast. The Loveless Cafe a mile or two away is much better. But I'll probably go back sometime because it can be convenient for me and it's not terrible.

reviews.name: Kristin B.
reviews.review: The double lamb burger was outstanding and the service was awesome...Reuben sandwhich is a must have. Smoked corn beef awesome..

reviews.name: Nancy T.
reviews.review: My favorite breakfast in Nashville! ! Benedicts,skillets omelets are amazing!  They hand cut fresh fruit each time a fruit bowl is served!  Sometimes it IS the little things:) and they have a warm,friendly welcoming staff!!

reviews.name: Heather B.
reviews.review: I love Athens. The Greek food is very authentic. My favorite is the chicken souvlaki  sandwich or salad. They up the notch on French fries by adding feta cheese to them! Portion sizes are good. Kids meals are large and reasonably priced. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they close too early during the week. Their humus and pita bread are off the chain. It's BYOB so grab your favorite bottle of wine, a good friend and enjoy!

reviews.name: Ed H.
reviews.review: Very good food and service. Seating is minimal, especially for a larger group. However, overall a very positive experience.

reviews.name: Ashby F.
reviews.review: New breakfast special omelettes are delicious, fresh, and an amazing value. Thanks Athens for listening to us Bellevuers who don't want to spend $15 on breakfast :-)

reviews.name: Annie S.
reviews.review: I'm sitting here now and I feel so bad for our poor waitress. completely understaffed. she said it's always one person on the floor so it's not just a day where there was a no show. she's running the place by herself which is making for  poor service. Which is completely not her fault. The food was not very good. Soup was cold, thick and flavorless. It's supposed to be broth based lemon chicken soup. I couldn't taste the lemon at all. Pita bread was wonderful though. My gyro was fine I suppose, it had little meat and the taziki was just plain yogurt it seemed like. Nothing special though. the French fries were straight out of a freezer bag and into.the fryer. Prices are way too high for the low quality you are getting. my boyfriend and I like Sam's gyros across the street way way better. This place is sad and I do not recommend it. I hope the waitress at least got some money from her two hours in the weeds because she was sweet as pie

reviews.name: Nate G.
reviews.review: This place is pretty good. We went there for breakfast and it was satisfying. I got the Greek omelette and it was very good for an omelette. So all in all the food is good. They have a wide selection for the menu with all day breakfast. Maybe a little pricey for breakfast food.

reviews.name: Cassie S.
reviews.review: Sorry, this place just did not do it for me.The food:First problem was that the appetizer and the entrees came out at the exact same time.  We ordered the appetizer because we were particularly hungry -  if we'd known we weren't going to get it before the entrees, we wouldn't have ordered it.  (it was good - the eggplant dip).  We both ordered the gyros platter.  It comes with a tiny little thing of tzaziki in a little plastic container, and the same sized thing of salad dressing.  Stingy much?  Anyway, gyros were just OK - really salty (and I love salt) and not enough sauce.The environs:Unpleasant to say the least.  We were next to a window, the blinds were down and on the blinds was a bunch of splattered food.  Not super appetizing.  Also, very dusty.  And the flies.  Black flies everywhere.  Since it's kind of an open kitchen, I can only imagine what the fly situation was like in the kitchen, given how it was in the dining area.  Also not very appetizing.  Service was very good.  If it wasn't for the dirtiness, I'd come back to try breakfast.  But there are other places to try first.

reviews.name: Megan L.
reviews.review: I had only been to Athens for breakfast, but decided to go for lunch the other day and I'm really glad I did! I ordered the Greek salad with Gyro added and it was the best lamb I have had! Plus our server was very nice and we got our food quick. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Elizabeth R.
reviews.review: My favorite restaurant in Bellevue! It's not a chain, you can get an amazing breakfast all day and the Greek food is amazing! Highly recommend it!

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: My fiance and I came here for dinner one night with his grandmother for our first time. We had seen this restaurant on Food Network and decided to give it a shot.If you do eat here, be prepared and bring a jacket. It was so cold in the room that I was freezing and it irritated my allergies. I ordered a gyro with no tomatoes and french fries, and my fiance ordered a gyro as well (but with tomatoes). They mixed our order up and we had to swap food around. I liked the gyro, but all I could taste was the bread and the sauce, thanks to my allergies knocking my tastebuds out. Not sure yet as to if I will come back.

reviews.name: Jesse M.
reviews.review: This is one of our favorite places to go! Great vegetarian options. The staff are always friendly. For vegetarian options my favorite is the baked eggplant. Delicious!!

reviews.name: Geoffrey J.
reviews.review: I came here with my girlfriend for dinner. From the outside it didn't look like much; the building was obviously a fast food place at some point. The service was great though, and the food was fantastic. I had the lamb special, a shank with tender, fall-off-the-bone meat resting on a bed of rice with a tasty red sauce and potato dumplings of some kind. She had the lamb bifteki, which was two groud lamb patties, perfectly seasoned. Even the pita bread was perfect. One of the best meals I've had in months. I only come to Nashville a few times a year, but if I happen to be that way again I will definitely go back for more.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: Full disclosure - I've only had breakfast here AND breakfast joints in Bellevue are pretty sadly limited, so I will do all I can to encourage this little 'can-do' joint to keep slinging out their omelets and scrambled eggs even if you can do better at a chain restaurant.  The staff is friendly even if the outside looks like a take over of a Long John Silvers (is it a take over of a Long John Silvers??).  We've always gotten in within 15 minutes even with a party of 6 or 7 on a Sunday morning.  Priced reasonably - about $7 for eggs, bacon, hashbrowns and carbo mania, the place is clean, fast and very diner feeling.

reviews.name: Jenn S.
reviews.review: Fantastic breakfast. Fast, friendly service. The portions are large, the menu is unique and the food is great. We've had several different things off the menu, the skillet with hashbrowns, cheese, peppers and topped with fried eggs is my favorite. The boyfriend liked the pancakes and steak/eggs. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: David W.
reviews.review: Athens Family Restaurant is awesome! Tonight the sea bass and lamb dish were specials among others....the lamb shank was spectacular! Always fast and friendly service...LuAnne made us feel welcome...and we will come back very soon!!

reviews.name: María D.
reviews.review: This was my first visit to Athens in Bellevue. Upon arriving I was seated fairly quickly. I was struck by how noisy and how bright the place was. The atmosphere felt more akin to a fast food restaurant, and I would not recommend it if you wanted an intimate or relaxing dining experience. After I was seated, my server disappeared and I was left waiting almost 15 minutes at my table (even though the restaurant was not busy). The server who eventually visited my table was very friendly, which partially made up for the wait. I ordered the vegetarian Greek platter and an olives/hummus appetizer. The olives and hummus appetizer was tasty - the pita was warm and plump, the hummus was not special but good nonetheless, and for the price I thought it was a good deal.The vegetarian platter, however, left a lot to be desired. The moussaka was meh, ok, kind of tasted like some frozen gourmet meal. There was a small dish of vegetables in tomato sauce that I actually thought was quite tasty. The rice was a huge no - it tasted like the kind that comes pre-cooked in a bag. There was a cheesy potato side dish that was tasty - but then again, it was almost pure cheese, so hard to mess up. The portion was big - I had enough to take to work for lunch the next day.As a Bellevue resident, I'm glad to see this place here. The more variety of restaurants the better I say. If you go here, you will probably get something that tastes decent. You will probably not get something amazing though. The service is just ok, and the atmosphere is diner/fast food joint. I probably will not visit this place again. I'd rather visit someplace outside of Bellevue where for the same price the food is tastier, the service better, and the ambience cozier.

reviews.name: D A.
reviews.review: Great Bellevue secret. Great food, breakfast or burgers! Greek food is fantastic and if they are serving it, the clam chowder is ridiculously good. Let's keep this gem in Bellevue. Wait staff, while small, is the friendliest ever.

reviews.name: Lakeisha H.
reviews.review: Me being from Chicago and having a Greek Town in the city makes the review somewhat unfair BUT...... I've been to several other places around town and much better than this.  I'm never going back.  The people were friendly and nice but the food needs some serious work.  If you want good Gyros go to Pyramid's in Opry Mills or Rivergate mall

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: Sometimes you have a dining experience where one tangent can throw the whole meal one direction or the other. Could be a great meal with a crummy server, a stinky smell in a fine restaurant, or fantastic ambiance that saves a rotten meal.The other night, we went out with our kids to meet some friends at Athens.  I have eaten here several times before, and I have no idea why I don't come here more frequently since we literally live five minutes down the road.  It is probably because we don't eat out with the family that much and if we do, we usually try to get out of Bellevue.  Nevertheless, it was solid food, but what changed the night was the guy running the place, Doran.  In his joint role that evening as cashier/server, he showed us great patience, warmth and kindness.  He was really sweet to our kids, and super attentive to everyone at the table. Fantastic graciousness and hospitality; he really made it feel like we were in his home.  You go, Doran!At the end of the meal, when we ordered baklava for desserts, he brought us the gift of the caramel cheesecake.  Now wait a second.  Cheesecake?  I haven't ordered cheesecake for dessert since 1989.  But my friends, this is not your standard cheesecake.  It was light and fluffy, dare I say custard-like, almost like a flan.  And a delicate caramel sauce on top.  I will absolutely order it next time, and good for himAnd also, why in the heck have we not eaten brunch here?  The menu is AMAZING and available all day!  If I could smuggle in a Thermos of Bloody Mary's, that place would be PERFECT!My advice, clone this Doran fellow, and put him in both restaurants for all shifts, all the time.  Quick, before I hire him away from you.

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: We frequent Athens because we live in the neighborhood and it's a reliable place to go for a relatively healthy and fast meal.  However, I have to say that the food is really nothing special.I typically go for the chicken souvlaki platter every time I eat at Athens, which comes with chicken, Greek salad, pita bread and choice of carby side.  The chicken is the best part of the meal, and the reason I keep coming back.  It's consistently delicious--always flavorful and very moist and tender.  The salad is usually fresh and full of feta, cucumbers and tomatoes, but nothing you can't get elsewhere.  The pita and rice pilaf always leave something to be desired--every time I take a bite of either, I wonder why I bother to order them at all considering they obviously come from packages.  I also made the mistake of ordering the avgolemeno soup, which was a bland bowl of overcooked rice in unflavored broth, with more of the packaged pita. I don't care for gyros, but my boyfriend ordered one at lunch one day and said it was quite possibly the worst he's ever had.  He had fries with his sandwich, which he did not care for--personally, I thought they were very good, especially when eaten with a hunk of feta cheese.The service and atmosphere has always been fine--never spectacular, but never awful.  The restaurant is always clean, parking is ample, and the waitstaff performs their duties efficiently enough.  This really isn't a horrible spot for a quick bite, but you can find better Greek food elsewhere.

reviews.name: Mary G.
reviews.review: Wow, we're new to the area and SO happy we went here!  My husband got the "Lamb of the Day", a braised lamb shank over rice, with carrots, celery and onion. It also came with a simple, Greek salad.  The lamb was so flavorful and tender, all for $9.00!  I got the homemade spanakopita, which included the above salad.  I've tasted many variations of this dish and this is the first one where there was absolutely NO bitterness from the ample spinach, thankfully, not a heavy hand with feta,  just pure flavor and flaky phyllo!  The hummus was smooth and lemony, the tzatziti, while tasty, needed more of cucumber.  Oh and you can bring your own bottle of wine...nice.  It's one of those places where we say, "We're not done yet......." Thanks for the great meal!

reviews.name: Paul S.
reviews.review: Athens has a new menu and I'm working my way through it. My new favorites are the calamari (best in Nashville) and the crab cake burger.  They are both delicious and reasonably priced.

reviews.name: Steve J.
reviews.review: I had a great breakfast experience today at the Athens Family Restaurant in Bellevue.  The employees were friendly and helpful.  At least three different people stopped by to check on my experience.  The service was fast and my order was correct.  The restaurant was bright, clean and full of other people.  I have allergies to cow's milk dairy and they stated that they cooked their eggs in butter.  At first, I was concerned, but the waitress stated that they would cook mine in oil and it would not be a problem.  She took extra time to make sure the kitchen staff did not use butter or milk.  That was awesome!The food was good, warm and served quickly.  I will definitely go back again for some Gyros and update my review.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: So my grandma wanted to go here for dinner and she took my fiancee and me. I had seen them on Food Network's "Diners Drive-ins and Dives", so I thought, "It can't be that bad".And in all honesty it is not bad at all. It is good, fresh food, with friendly service and a nice menu. But it is nothing to rave about. Also, the restaurant was very cold, freezing almost. I wish I had brought a jacket, but with Nashville weather being what it has been, I opted not to.Decent food and a nice environment, but I have had better in both Spain and Israel, in terms of Mediterranean cuisine. Also, maybe it was wrong of me to expect this, but I was kind of hoping they would have falafel. That being said, I had a gyro, but the meat on it lacked flavor and all I tasted was sauce.

reviews.name: Shea M.
reviews.review: I've been to this restaurant several times now and the food and service are always great.  They serve the best hummus I've ever tasted! Seriously.  Ian's the chicken is always flavorful and tasty.  Good prices, and friendly staff.

reviews.name: Conni E.
reviews.review: An authentic Greek diner, fabulous food, and a great hang.  As a meat-eater, my husband loves the lamb dishes; as a vegetarian I love the horiatiki salad and the incredible array of breakfasts, served all day. One of the treasures of Bellevue!

reviews.name: Deepak B.
reviews.review: I used to really look forward in coming to Athens. Noticed a bit of trend downward in the amount of portion size and quality of service. Recently ordered a gyro platter and just four slices was given? Also, the person behind the counter for my take out order was really rude to my wife on the phone.

reviews.name: Jenifer G.
reviews.review: I expected to be content with my biftek sandwich.  Why doesn't my pita ever taste that good and what do they do to make ground beef so awesome?  What I didn't expect was how truly toddler friendly it is and how well they make GRITS!  Talk about a creamy southern delight at a Greek restaurant... my daughter, 4, said she is not sharing with me next time.I'm sorry I didn't save the photo of the kids pancake, but it was too cute, a huge Mickey Mouse-esque shape with cut grapes for eyes and a blueberry mouth.  The kid loved it.

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: Would have given another star if I didn't have to witness the chef and owner (I think) yell and degrade his servers. I was waiting for a to-go meal with my son and had a birds eye view of the kitchen. Could not believe his temper and tone with the sweet, meek server. Wow! Other than that, the food is decent and unique. The mousaka and suzikakia are good, as well as their pastry custard filled dessert. Very sodium ladened dining though...thirsty for water all night after that place. Hummus is good and their pita is more like naan. Have had some cold dishes before. Overall it is exciting to have a family style restaurant in bellevue. Lord knows we need more non-chain casual dining options, because there are none. It's ok...still pissed with that unprofessional bastard of a chef.

reviews.name: Elliott W.
reviews.review: A coworker and I stopped in for lunch earlier this week. While not earthshattering as I might have expected from the Food network raves, it was definitely a step up from other area greek fare. I had a the beef souvlaki pita which was good, tender and seasoned nicely. The pita was lightly toasted and crisp, a nice change from the almost stale and soggy pitas that I'm accustomed to. Nina's potatoes were ok. Next time I'll probably stick with the fries. The prices were reasonable and the service prompt and friendly. Really, 4 stars is a tad generous, but warranted because they do better than the rest of the just OK Greek places around town.

reviews.name: Mary Ann D.
reviews.review: We are new to the area and have become regulars of Athens. We enjoy that we can get a delicious breakfast any time. Their specials are great especially the beef stew and goulash. Cindy and Heather are super servers. A shout out to Angelo for terrific cinnamon French toast. Mary Ann D.

reviews.name: Phil G.
reviews.review: I must admit I was a bit skeptical of Athens when they first came to Bellevue. The building is the old Mrs Winners/ Churches Chicken establishments , and i wasn't quite sure how one could convert the building into a sit down restaurant. While the dining area is a bit small it was still a comfortable environment to dine in. Our waitress and everyone in the restaurant seemed to be in good spirits. Along with the extensive menu, Athens also offers daily specials. Our food came out in a timely manner and was absolute delicious. As we were getting ready to leave one of the men working asked the elderly couple next to us how their meal was. The woman wasn't exactly satisfied with what she ordered and preferred what her husband had. Immediately and politely the gentleman went to the back and prepared another order of her husbands meal and brought it out free of charge.Athens really surprised me and I am very confident this restaurant has the potential to serve the residents of Bellevue for years to come.

reviews.name: Jennifer G.
reviews.review: These guys do a great job -delicious food and friendly service. One of my favorite places to eat.

reviews.name: Faith B.
reviews.review: I want to like this place more than I do. I have been lucky enough to live in towns with great Greek restaurants and god knows, Bellevue needs all the variety it can get. I've only gone in for carry-outs and the service was surprisingly quick both times, even though I didn't call ahead. The food was decent and better than no Greek, but plainly Americanized. Their veggie moussaka leaves me yearning for Milwaukee or Greektown in Chicago - it's almost satisfying but not quite right. They do have plenty of options for veggies. The atmosphere is non-existent (it was a Mrs. Winner's after all) and the place is always packed. Parking there sucks.A liquor license might be the only reason to go in and eat rather than order take-out, but for now...  Eh.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I'm always happy when I support Bellevue's local businesses.... I was even more thrilled the day I was able to step into Athen's Family Restaurant, freshly opened off of Hwy 70 and Old Harding Pike.  I had always wanted to go.  I had been taunted by The Food Network when it featured their local fare from their Franklin Road location on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  I had attempted to go a few times to that location, but every occasion didn't quite work out.  I was ecstatic to see the potential it had in my neighborhood.  I have not been disappointed....I have dined there at least 10 times with this exception, they have an expansive and rather delectable looking breakfast menu that is available all day but I have yet to try breakfast so with that, their review is way overdue!Their staff is friendly, courteous and very efficient.  They have taken the time to try menu items and give recommendations if you are torn between a few dishes, which I always am since they seem to offer an array of authentic fare that I was not used to getting at other traditional Greek restaurants.  In addition,  I always bring our toddler along and I  feel that special attention is given to her needs which makes us feel even more welcome.  I have tried so many of the menu items, but the one most recently that stands out is the Vegetarian Mousaka.  I am not a vegetarian by any means, but every now and then I like to give it a try.  It was excellent.  The layers of tender vegetables, carrots, broccoli, eggplant and zucchini really just melted in my mouth.  Topping it off was this subtly decadent bechamel sauce.  The dish was paired with a greek salad and tangy dressing.  Needless to say, I didn't think I was going to leave feeling too guilty, until my husband insisted on dessert.  (I'll get back to that.)I have been thrilled with all of their Greek sandwiches on their menu.  Their lamb gyros are just really tasty, better than I have had, but the Lamb Souvlaki really is the best.  The lamb is tender and perfectly marinated and has become my husband's favorite.  I can always count on having a taste while I branch out for something new with each trip!Now, for dessert....ahhhh!  They really know how to spread the love with phyllo!  They have the best Baklava I have ever tasted.  It's not the usual pistachio nuts layered with phyllo dripping in syrup.....nope, it is a heavenly but flaky warm pillow of phyllo goodness encasing walnuts and cinnamon, not too sweet and  with just the right amount of a light lemony syrup.  It absolutely melts in your mouth and it's made fresh daily and enough to share, but really, who would want to do that!  They also have my now second favorite, but could move to number one or at least tie the baklava.  It's called Bouyatsa.  It too is a decadently flaky warm pillow of goodness, but with a homemade custard inside and sprinkled with powdered sugar and cinnamon on the outside.   If I had to describe it, it's like chess pie married phyllo and they had offspring.  Really, really good....!With such a wonderful addition to Bellevue, you must come out and try!  Get to know their staff, the chef.  They make you feel like you are part of their family.

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: Have been meaning to go to Athens for awhile now for breakfast. And it's really very silly that it has taken me this long considering it is literally right next door to my apartment. I went in on Saturday morning at around 8 and it wasn't very crowded. I was able to pick a seat right by the window. I got the pancakes and sausage. It was a very generous serving. So much that I ended up taking half home. The pancakes were very filling and heavy, almost too heavy. Very cakey. The sausage was very good and the service was speedy and considerate. The menu had a lot of variety. It's a basic decent diner and a nice convenient discovery right next to my apartment.  The breakfast prices are reasonable. I will have to come back and try lunch or dinner.

reviews.name: Gregory B.
reviews.review: My intent last night was to simply get gyro plates from Sam's Kebobs, but my wife told me I should try "the other place" across the street. I am glad I did. A greek place in Nashville that actually serves something other than the standard gyro, rice, salad, falafel and hummus.The location on Old Harding Pike used to a be Mrs. Winners Chicken place, so it does not have the most ample seating. Fortunately, the staff is very good at clearing tables and getting people sat. While I waited for my to go order, I saw a few people come in and sit down to wait and the longest was about 2 minutes. Having the manager out on the floor is a definite plus when you want to be able to sit down and eat.My thrill, even though I did not order it, was seeing Pastichio on the menu. As I mentioned above, it is hard to find more than the standard gyro place fare in Nashville. The reason I did not order  the pastichio was the fact they also had Lamb Souvlaki.First, the negative. The gyro is presliced and grilled on a flat grill. The gyro has a nicer flavor than most of the flat grilled gyro I have eaten in the past, but I wish they had gyro off the spit, as it tastes so much nicer that way.On the positive side. The lamb souvlaki is nicely spiced and succulent. Lamb can taste pretty bad when it is not prepared correctly, so souvlaki is a good food to judge the quality of the restaurant. This is nice and tender and has a wonderful flavor.The greek dinners comes with either french fries, rice pilaf or Dina's creamy potatoes. Of the three, I would definitely pick the last. The creram sauce is similar to avgolemono soup with cream added. Something I ate had a hint of cinamon, which really made the flavors pop. I am not sure if it was the souvlaki or the tzadtiziki, but the two together were quite beautiful. I talked to the manager about saganaki (Greek flaming cheese), which they unfortunately do not have. He mentioend the Avgolemono soup and threw in some for me to try. Although I am not a huge fan normally, the avgolemono was the best I have had in Nashville.I need to go back and try the pastichio some time and see if it is as yummy as the food I had tonight. i was also supposed to try the baklava some time.In summary, if you are interested in real Greek food beyond just gyros, try Athens. If you are just interested in the normal fare, swing across the street to Sam's and get a gyro platter.

reviews.name: Anne D.
reviews.review: OK, I'm sorry--I promise, I really did want to like this one.  I have been here at least a dozen times, each time convincing myself that I just ordered the wrong thing on the menu.  I don't like leaving negative reviews.  But I really think I'm done, and if I can forewarn you then I have done a good deed!On the first visit, my husband and I ate dinner and I ordered the Mousaka.  It sounded delicious, anyway.  In reality, it was bland and very cold in the center.  (Microwaved?)   It was long enough ago that I don't remember details about any of the sides that came with it, except that I didn't like those either.  Total miss.  That was the only time we visited for dinner, because husband didn't like his (at least his was hot though).  If we are in the mood for cuisine in this vein, Sam's across the street has great gyros and the Anatolia Turkish Restaurant on White Bridge is still our go-to place by far.  We just couldn't justify going back here for dinner.  The rest of the times we have been here were all for breakfast.  In short, if you order eggs (basic, scrambled), you're fine.  Order from the specialty menu and you're treading dangerous ground.  Everything else that requires more cooking ability is going to be horribly bad.  I've tried eggs benedict, and it is quite honestly the worst I have ever had.  The English muffin base was not good (stale?), and I'm still trying to figure out what they did wrong with the hollandaise sauce.  It tasted like mayonnaise treated with food coloring, and it had a bizarre thick semi-solid consistency.  I asked my husband to try to draw a parallel because all I could think of was semi-dried paint, and he nailed it: if you've ever had orthodontic accessories made, it is exactly like the plaster they use to make a cast of your bite structure.  Awful!After that experience, I ordered plain scrambled eggs and those aren't too bad, but I could make those at home (and I can barely cook toast).The omelettes are just eh...not fluffy, slightly greasy (even if you're ordering the vegetarian version)...again, I have managed similar at home.One day, more out of frustration to find something that was good and not scrambled eggs, I ordered the stuffed french toast.  It is described as "Texas french toast stuffed with cream cheese and fresh strawberries."  In reality, it is a sandwich cut diagonally (on regular bread) with cream cheese and strawberry jam.  Seriously!I would recommend sticking with basics, but even then you're not guaranteed an edible meal.  At one time the oatmeal was good but they have apparently changed to instant and it is made per order by the servers.  Our last oatmeal came out crunchy, and it was so bad my husband actually sent it back and told them to forget it; it had taken so long to come out that we were both already finished with the rest of our breakfast.  We got the full explanation of how our server wasn't sure how much water to add. Oh well...Service is hit or miss.  Everyone is friendly but you could end up waiting a long time, even if there are few people in the restaurant.  On the last few visits, I have given up waiting for the bill and just stood by the register waiting for someone to check me out.Atmosphere was pretty fairly described by someone else on here: it's a former Mrs. Winners.  I can forgive cheap atmosphere if the food is good, but this place just doesn't cut it.    How was this place featured on the Food Network?  I just don't get it!

reviews.name: M R.
reviews.review: I've experienced both incarnations of Athens both the original on Franklin Pike and this one in Bellevue. I can't say I've been impressed with either, which is surprising since they rated a visit from a Food Network show. After many visits I suspect that Athens is just one of the "lucky ones" that got a little buzz (probably mainly b/c of their late night hours and breakfast over in Melrose) and they now are just coasting on the hype.I've had the gyro meat as part of a sandwich and alongside eggs for breakfast. Both times I found it dry and like some sort of pre-processed strips of meat. I've had the Spanakopita which I'd give mixed reviews, since it seems to either be hit or miss. I've sampled a few other items off friend's plates from their pretty extensive menu, and I can't say that any of them have been impressive. Things often seem to have a dried out, re-warmed sort of texture and taste. The service at Athens is hit or miss, but most of the servers there don't make you feel rushed to finish and free the table, which is a good thing. Sometimes that lack of rush borders on being ignored though. While the waitstaff in general are friendly enough, the (owner?) management is not so cordial. Pricing is a bit high on some things for the portions and quality, but Athens is an ok place to try the more complex "homestyle" Mediterranean dishes if you don't want to leave Bellevue. Just don't expect them to be as good as you may have eaten at other restaurants. If you're just looking for gyros and Greek basics, I'd say visit Sam's across the street for better taste and a much better portion-for-the-price ratio. I really wanted to like Athens, but after so many tries, I think I'm done giving them a chance.

reviews.name: Brian N.
reviews.review: I wish I could write a review and give this place Zero stars, but oh well.As you'll be able to tell from my review of the alternate location of this establishment (the one on Franklin Pike) I really do like the Athens Family restaurant, or wanted to like them. I had a great experience with both food and service at the Franklin pike location so today a co-worker and I went to the Old Harding location for lunch.When we arrived, we were looking for a parking spot and drove around the building. We happened upon the executive chef (I know this because he was wearing his chef's jacket with the title stitched into the cloth) opening/messing around with the man hole cover in the driveway, which looked to be the sewer cover and was also smoking a cigarette.  Smoking I can handle, wash the hands, all good. However I wondered what an executive chef would need from under a manhole cover.Having faith that he would adequately clean his hands, or at least, let someone else cook we decided to enter.  The place was not very busy, only 4-5 tables were full and we were told by a waiter to go ahead and sit and he'd be with us in a minute. No Problem.Except, that was the last and only time we were spoken to or even acknowledged for the entire 10-15 minutes we spent sitting at the table.  The table behind us was checked on and supplied with needed items. Two tables to the right of us were also checked and re-supplied. All while the waiters walked completely around and past our table. we didn't even have menus, so there was no wondering about if we were ready to order.  To beat it all, a guy who came in after us and sat in a far off corner was brought a drink, a menu and was having his order taken as we left, by the SAME server who asked us to sit down.When we got up to leave another server was standing RIGHT beside our table. He didn't ask what was wrong, try to stop us, nothing. It was as if the staff here could care less about you or your business. (Unless I suppose you're one of the lucky few who got there before us.)All in all, I will most likely never go back there and not to the one on Franklin Pike either. If it was a large chain like O'charleys or Logan's and I received bad service I'd try out another location. But since the same folks who own and operate the Franklin Pike location own this one, I see no reason to support a total lack of quality control and management.I posted a small rant on this on Facebook as well, since Yelp was doing maintenance and I was ready to give this review. A friend who saw it said that they know these people and basically they do not care about reviews or opinions anyway. So, I'm glad I did not take the time to complain while in the place. It would have fallen on deaf ears most likely anyway.I'm hoping this review will at least help those in the Bellevue area who want to try this new place know what's in store for them.

reviews.name: Evie C.
reviews.review: Very disappointed in the  Athens Family Restaurant, Bellevue location today. We got there around 11:30 am, there was a small wait. The server kept trying to seat us ahead of another couple. After we told her twice that the other couple was ahead of us, she seated them and then proceeded to seat a table of 4 that came in AFTER us. Really! She went to the list, which our name was on and deliberately skipped over us. People should be seated in the order in which they arrive, unless it is a larger party and tables have to be placed together.  There was very much a lack of organization with this. The manager should have been out there helping the staff with the seating. We are, or shall I say WERE  'regulars.' I don't know if we will be back or not. My husband is in the restaurant industry and he agrees with me that this could have and should have been avoided.I plan on posting this same content on all of the review search engines, i.e. Yelp, Urbanspoon, City Search, etc.  You only have to make me mad once and I will do my best to hurt your business.

reviews.name: Sasha T.
reviews.review: I'm thrilled to have Athens as an added option here in the 'Vue, but I can't say I'm completely in love.The food has been hit or miss. Anything off the lunch/dinner side of the menu has been "eh" for me. The breakfast options have been  a much better choice. Then again I'm a breakfast junkie. Pancakes and eggs are solid, but man the corned beef hash is freaking awesome.Service can be either slow or non-existent depending on the time of day. We'll still stop in since it's convenient, but I'm hoping the longer they are there the little things will improve.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Great for dine in or carry out, very friendly staff, and nice dining area. Food is mediocre in quality and quantity. Sams Kebabs and Gyros across the street has better food with take out atmosphere.

reviews.name: Paul G.
reviews.review: Yes, it is official for my family, this expansion cooks just as well as the original in Melrose. I find myself in Bellevue regularly and noticed that the Athens Family Restaurant had opened an branch in what was the old greasy spot occupied by Mrs.Winner's Chicken. Dragging my teenager out of bed early (Thanksgiving Break already) this morning we hit up the restaurant for a late breakfast and early lunch. He had a traditional breakfast and I had Greek. Both were tasty, well prepared and out of the kitchen in a hurry. The place was almost fully occupied (at ten am) so  I am hopeful that is will be a successful addition to the Athens Family.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Galaktoboureko pastry dessert stuffed with custard is a Greek treat I've most enjoyed at Athens Family Restaurant. They have other sweets like baklava but this one is better. Roasted lamb souvlaki is my main favorite pita style sandwich at Athens. The actual dining room has little personality so when I return it will be for the authentic Greek food. Although it's small it works as a neighborhood dining place and is affordable for middle class Bellevue purses.

reviews.name: Lola L.
reviews.review: I would go back just for their fries! So delicious!!! It has a "diner' type atmosphere- kinda dive-y, but good service and friendly staff. The lamb burger was yummy, but the fries would keep me coming back!

reviews.name: Batsell S.
reviews.review: Really good food, friendly staff and the cooks come out and talk to you about the food. I really enjoy this place and the wide variation they offer on their menu. Great place to check out if you're in the area.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: I ate here once after drinking too much.  Aftermath wasn't pretty.  Honestly don't even remember if the food was good or bad or....OOOOHHHH YEAAAHHH...it was in between average and boring but not quite good but kind of bad, but edible and sort of tasty but you were better off eating somewhere else but you are here so you eat and drink and go home and kind of regret it later.

reviews.name: Blake G.
reviews.review: Absolutely delicious! Being from a restaurant background I was overjoyed to find such a gem right down the road! Everything is made fresh and with thought and care. From the house made tzatziki sauce and baklava to the fresh local lamb. Must try dishes are the lamb pie, suzukakia, kitopita, fresh ground half pound burgers (the lamb burger is one of my favorites) and absolutely ANYTHING for breakfast! The grits are to die for, made slowly with heavy cream and butter! The prices are very reasonable for the average family (we go multiple times per week) especially considering high food costs these days and the effort and preparation it must take to make the wonderful dishes that come out of Chef Adel's kitchen. I can't say enough about this place!

reviews.name: Tracy M.
