reviews.review: Service was great. My husband and I both had players. I had the chicken and he had the gyro. Salad was good, bit the rest was so bland. Next time I want a platter I will go across the street to Sam's and at half price.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: Three strikes, you're out.  As former devotees of the other location (please read my other review which will explain why we are "former" devotees), we tried this location several times.  Service was laughable, no matter how busy or slow.  The food, like the other location, was just so-so, but prices were entirely too high for what you receive.  Our last visit, we watched as several people who came in after us were seated, even though our name was before theirs on the list.  Three times this happened.  Each time they would apologize, but then it happened again.  Totally disorganized.  One person needs to be in charge of seating to avoid the chaos.  We walked out.  No matter how hungry we are, we won't we returning.

reviews.name: Jessica B.
reviews.review: 4 adults and 2 children.  We started with the Ethiopian coffee for 4 served in the traditional clay pot. Smooth and dark.  We ordered the seven vegetable platter and the meat platter for two.  the meat platter for two had five different meat dishes. chicken and lamb and beef. the vegetable platter had cabbage potatoes carrots and beans, two types of lentils, greens and seasoned beets. Including the coffee the total bill was $45 and they bring you a huge stack of Injera- the tef pancakes.

reviews.name: Cassie S.
reviews.review: Let's be clear: the food is fantastic.  If you like Ethiopian cuisine, or if you've never had it, the food is wonderful.  Deliciously spiced and cooked meats and veggies over injara - what's not to like?  Fantastic for sharing, or not, if you're not so inclined.That said, our experience here left more than a little to be desired.  Slow is one thing.  I can deal with slow.  Especially at a small restaurant like this, and especially given the size of our group.  If that was the only problem, this review would be 4 stars.  However, we also encountered the following: "we don't have any appetizers tonight"... huh??  How do you not have any appetizers?  Also, the ice machine was broken, so all water was lukewarm.  Speaking of water, ask for 3-4 cups at the beginning of the meal, then you won't have to worry about the fact that they NEVER come to refill, even when you ask them to.  Regardless, I will be back for the food and hope that the overall experience improves.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: Sometimes, when I have a spare 3-4 hours in my day, I like to enjoy Ethiopian food. Don't get me wrong; I always enjoy Ethiopian. However, the time investment involved in going to any of the Ethiopian food restaurants does not allow for a quick dine and dash. If you want to hold your date hostage for a while so you can wow him or her with the philosophy you picked up in that intro college course, Ethiopian is definitely the way to go, time-wise. This is not because you are being served a particularly elaborate or time-intensive meal, but rather because the servers seem to frequently forget that they are actually supposed to provide service to the people sitting in the restaurant; they often seem confused by the fact that anyone is sitting there. But now, on to the incredible part, which is the food. Mesob is the best Ethiopian I have had in Nashville, and everything I have tried on the menu has been uniformly delicious. I recommend the meat and veggie combo platter, which is more than enough to feed two people, and comes with a sampling of pretty much everything. Injera, the spongy Ethiopian bread on which the spiced meats and veggies are served, allows you to eat with your hands without your tablemates acting as if you are insane. If you have time, this place is a wonderful culinary experience that provides consistently good food.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I have only tried the other Ethiopian restaurant in Nashville and this came up on my Foursquare so I thought I would try it. I showed up at 3pm which is an odd hour for lunch. I asked them if I could still eat lunch and they said yes. I got the Yeater kik Alicha we't - on the menu it said it was "Yellow split peas cooked in mildly flavored sauce, seasoned with garlic, ginger and turmeric. it was 8,99$I got Injera with it. LOTS of it. Because that was a concern, I always think I won't have enough. But they accommodated me in a big way. Holy crap. Let the face stuffing begin. Good god. Delicious as Ethiopian food is. I was well satisfied. The ONLY drawback is they did not refresh my water and I am a drinker -so.Other than that I have zero complaints.

reviews.name: Alen B.
reviews.review: Great food.  Great service.  Have to try the Ethiopian coffee.The food portions were very large.  The diversity of the food was great.  The taste was beyond description.  The services was outstanding.

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Great food.  Friendly service.  I haven't had Ethopian food this good since the last time  I visited California.  Sure, it's kind of a social hang out for local Ethopians to shoot pool and drink tea, but that makes all the more legit in my book.  My only complaint is that they don't have a license to serve wine yet--only beer.  Red wine goes superbly with Doro Wot (chicken in spicy tomato-based sauce) which I highly recommend combined with a veggie platter.  The bartender barely spoke English, but he was friendly and I dug the Ethopian tunes he was playing over the restaurant speakers straight off of his laptop.

reviews.name: Alissa G.
reviews.review: Delicious! Heads up to those of you who are gluten intolerant: the injera is made traditionally (gf) & no need to order it separate. It's all Gf! So feast & enjoy!

reviews.name: Leigh M.
reviews.review: This was my first time trying Ethiopian, and my "uneducated" opinion is that Mesob is fantastic!As soon as you walk through the door, you're hit with a plethora of fantastic smells. Had I been blindfolded, I would have guessed that I had been led into a spice market. If you're a fan of Indian, Moroccan, or any other heavily-spiced cuisine, your mouth will be watering before you even take your seat.As an appetizer, my coworker and I ordered the chicken sambusas. They were wonderfully flaky, crispy, and delicious. I could probably make a meal out of those things alone.Since this was my first time trying such food, for my entree I ordered the "meat combo for one", since I figured it would a good way to try a wide array of things all at once. Everything I tried was amazing! Wonderfully spiced, perfectly tender, and a nice spectrum from mild to semi-hot. Take note though; even though the menu item I ordered says "for one", it could easily feed two people, even three if they're small eaters.The staff was very friendly and happy to answer any questions we had about the menu items.I definitely plan on returning here regularly!

reviews.name: Bill S.
reviews.review: I had lunch with a friend. The food and service were excellent. If you like Ethiopian food you owe it to yourself to try this.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: I've eaten here once. It was good, I have nothing to complain about. Service is good too. It was almost empty when I was there (during a day on Wednesday).

reviews.name: Sugar X.
reviews.review: Take a trip around the world!!!  PSA: there are no utensils!  None so mani pre meal okay.  Your hands and the spongy unleavened bread will be your fork.  Dig in!  The food is close to the equator;  flavor that packs a punch of intense aroma your sure to not forget!  Served family style sharing is everything.  We had the beef, chicken, tips and veggies.  My favorite by far the veggies total soul food.  The lentils, carrots and cabbage absolutely amazing.  Decor humble.  Plain, and simple.  It's in a strip mall so a great lunch option, many locals who stare a bit I would not go alone.  It's not "welcoming" to all, a little why are you here vibe.  I chalked it up to cultural difference.  This vibe (staring from groups of men) docked two stars and a pass on a return.

reviews.name: Benny K.
reviews.review: The place seems a little quiet/slow paced and more of a close friends hangout place than a restaurant. We ordered the veggie platter with injera and a chicken dish and it was good while the service was average. Hope their business will pick up.

reviews.name: Lauren W.
reviews.review: Here is a little known fact about why I chose to settle in Nashville: They had an Ethiopian restaurant. When I was making my way across the country visiting grad schools I would take myself out on a "date night" to see if I could live in whatever city I happened to be in. My night in Nashville consisted of dinner at an Ethiopian place close to campus (which is no longer in business) and visiting the Frist museum. Culture and ethnic food in the south? I was so ready for Nashville. Since I moved here more Ethiopian restaurants have opened (or they're just new to me). My favorite will always be Addis Red Sea in Boston, but Mesob in Nashville comes fairly close! Located a little out of the way from my usual dining circle in a tiny strip mall, Mesob is a no-fuss type of place. The decor consists of what appears to be old banquet dining tables and chairs mixed in with cheery paintings and artifacts from Ethiopia. I was hoping that a restaurant named Mesob (after the traditional Ethiopian table) would actually have them for seating. But they didn't, and that was tad bit disappointing.We had the beef Sambusa, the vegetarian tasting plate and the Qey Wot. I was so happy with our choices. Everything tasted so good! My favorite was probably the Yemisir Kike We't (red lentils in a spicy berbere sauce).Overall, I really liked Mesob. The service was great and we got our food rather quickly. I was really impressed by this because a HUGE group (maybe 30 people, 75% of which were kids under 10) arrived at the same time we did. Our waiters didn't overlook us to take care of the big table, a problem I have often. The owner was sweet and even stopped by to say hello and introduce himself. I highly recommend Mesob for your next Ethiopian food adventure.

reviews.name: Jinesh P.
reviews.review: Visited for a sat night dinner, our 3rd time here, ordered veggie combo for 2, quantity was good, but the service was avg, quality has dropped since our first visit. My biggest concern is location of this rest, plus random ppl in the rest, not customers.Looks like the place is more of a social joint for fellow ethiopians and less of a restaurant.

reviews.name: Sara B.
reviews.review: My date and I showed up on a Monday at around 8 and the place was empty. The service we got was great, the food even better, and the prices were very reasonable!  I wish it was closer to Vanderbilt.

reviews.name: Faith B.
reviews.review: Visited this place for the first time with a large group. It was very, very good and I'll be back. The atmosphere is just fine. What do you want? It's a strip mall. But I have no idea why there were two different rooms with pool tables...The veggie sampler of four items was tasty. It came with a lentil dish, spicy and red and good, a split pea dish that was a lot like a dal, beets and a cabbage and carrots dish.The rest of the group seemed pleased with their meat dishes as well.Recommend you try this place.

reviews.name: Kristina G.
reviews.review: First time I came here I got the veggie and rice dish and absolutely loved it because it was full of flavor. Decided to stop by to eat lunch and grab something to take to work for dinner.  I got the chicken on the bone marinated in lemon and cooked in sauce with a hard boiled egg, horrible, it was one chicken leg which was tough and dry, the hard boiled egg was rubber from being cooked too long and the sauce was grainy with no flavor.  I wasn't too worried because I still had my veggies with rice for dinner and is just stick to ordering that from now on.  Just warmed up my rice and it's horrible, it's like they cooked up some basmati rice, warmed up some frozen vegetables and threw them on top of the rice and that's it, the dish has absolutely no flavor and the rice is still slightly undercooked.  For these two dishes and a pot of hot tea it was $24, not worth it, I'm completely disappointed with both items and probably won't return again even though I was going to make this a regular stop.

reviews.name: Esther L.
reviews.review: We visited Mesob with a groupon/LivingSocial/something of the sort. My main interest was the food. The sambusas were a nice start to the meal, and the vegetarian sampler was pretty good. One of the seven items was an injera "salad" served alongside other vegetarian items atop injera, so that kind of seemed like a shortcut. Meat dishes were greasier than in other restaurants, but several flavors were represented. I would have liked more spicy options, as there was a heavy emphasis on sweet marinades reminiscent of St. Louis BBQ. I wasn't expecting exemplary service, but we waited for a few minutes for anyone to greet us, then waited again for water. We waited for our order to be taken, and then for the food to come. I might bring a snack next time :)It took a while for me to get used to the combined sounds of the TV and music playing in the background; otherwise, the restaurant had a comfortable noise level.P.S. The Baklava was HUMONGOUS. I think I liked it.

reviews.name: Praveen B.
reviews.review: Did not find what was on the menu. Was not satisfied with the service. Doro wot that we ordered tasted bad, it was bitter and the chicken was cooked bad It tasted like rubber. This place is not as good as the other Ethiopian restaurants. Definitely not coming back to place again..

reviews.name: Mandy P.
reviews.review: The vegetarian sampler was tasty, but 5 out of the 7 things were lentils so I felt like I just had a big plate of different colored lentils for the most part.  Both of my carnivore friends ordered other entrees with lamb, one grilled and one baked? - The grilled was much better than the other that was EXTREMELY chewy.  We didn't have any problems waiting on our food, everything came fast and also did not mind the music; although why tvs in the restaurant, it's not a sports bar!  For 3 entrees and one appetizer, our bill was $50 (was glad I purchased a groupon); I probably won't be back.

reviews.name: John C.
reviews.review: Went with some friends using a groupon. I can't say that the service initially was that great, but once the waitress came out it seemed to speed up. You definitely get your food faster if you're actually Ethiopian.The food was all very incredible, out of about the five different things we each got all of them were great. I would say that maybe one entree / two people is a better ratio though.We had the coffee and liked it, so maybe that's just a roll of the dice.Either way, food was great, service was good, and the overall experience made this a definite repeat visit.

reviews.name: Leslie F.
reviews.review: I have never had Ethiopian food, and was ready to try something new. When I arrived with my peeps at the restaurant, we sat ourselves. It was clean and spacious. We were quickly greeted by our server with a very warm smile and some menus. Having never had Ethiopian food, I had to google a lot of the options :). I decided to go with the Awaze Tibs with lamb, my fiancé had Kitfo Dulet, and our friend had Qey Wot. Our server very vigorously warned us of the spice in these dishes, and she was quite right. If you can't handle the heat then do not order these dishes. However, we have very spice driven pallets and therefore really enjoyed it. Our Injera came out first, and we all tried some. It's uniquely spongy texture entertained us, and it's sour yet sweet flavour satisfied us. The pairing of this unusual flat bread and our dishes was very fulfilling.As we were finishing our meal, the owner came out to great us and ask about our experience, he was very excited to hear it was our first time. His enthusiasm and kindness was better than dessert. And speaking of dessert, they have Baklava! I didn't get any due to the lack of space in my belly, however, it will be happening at a later visit!

reviews.name: Anna W.
reviews.review: The food is great and servers are nice (once they notice you) but the two times I've been it's been very slow:  slow to get the ordering started, slow to get food.  The last time we went someone in my party ended up refilling waters and handing out utensils to our table.It's worth a trip as long as you're not in a hurry.

reviews.name: María D.
reviews.review: Visited for the first time last weekend. The ambience inside was nice, but casual. There were TVs on, but it wasn't loud. The service was friendly, although not especially organized or fast. The dish I ordered was tasty. I have to say that I've been to a number of Ethiopian restaurants, and this one was by far the greasiest. The prices were good, although my chicken dish only came with two very small pieces of chicken (smaller than the size of wings). They didn't have Ethiopian beer, which I found disappointing. Long story short, I would eat there again if I found myself there for some reason, but I'm not planning on eating there again any time soon.

reviews.name: Lisa P.
reviews.review: I was so impressed with the food at this restaurant! A group of 4, we split the veggie and meat sampler, beef tips and a sort of minced lamb dish. It was all absolutely amazing; succulent and juicy, with so many flavors. The spongy bread was delicious, and the atmosphere was very comfortable. The service and attitudes of the employees was exceptional;  they were very gracious. I don't have a single negative thing to say about Mesob, I just can't wait to eat there again!

reviews.name: Craig W.
reviews.review: I am very familiar with the Ethiopian cuisine and have had my fair share in the states, and visiting the country of Ethiopia a few times. My experience at Mesob was pleasant, but it was not my favorite. I ordered the seven veggie combo and it seemed like all the vegetables tasted the same. All were very sweet and none were spicy, making me request a side of awaze. The interior was clean and tastefully decorated in ethiopian decor, and the service was ok.  As far as Ethiopian restaurants go in Nashville, Gojo Ethiopian Restaurant on Thompson lane is the place to go!

reviews.name: Gabe D.
reviews.review: My wife and I loved this place. We had the vegetarian sampler. It was very delicious and very filling. This was one of those rare occasions when I was wishing I wasn't getting so full, so that I could eat more, because it tasted so good! We chose this restaurant because we were in the mood for Ethiopian food, but I felt like having a beer, and the other Ethiopian places we had been too, though also tasty, did not serve alcohol. The service was a little M.I.A. at first, and there were TVs on, but those seemed like minor things compared to the food and the kind and polite demeanor of the servers.

reviews.name: Susan B.
reviews.review: We were the only customers when we arrived so the service was fine and the food came out super quick. We ordered both the 7 item vegetarian sampler for 1 and the meat sampler for 1 and shared. Everything was very tasty. The meats were a little oily, but I still liked it. There was so much food we had a big box of leftovers. Don't order the Ethiopian coffee. I'm usually a fan, but this stuff tasted burnt. The traditional tea was good.Delicious food, friendly staff, okay atmosphere (I'm not a fan of TVs).

reviews.name: Matthew S.
reviews.review: If you like Ethiopian food or want to try it for the first time, go to Mesob!  The staff is super-friendly and accommodating.  We were guided through the menu and steered to items that both my wife and I -- and our kids -- could enjoy.  We parents had been to Ethiopian before, but it was the first time for our kids, so we were hoping "it would take."  And it did!  The food was so yummy and the atmosphere friendly and inviting.  We got the chicken sambussas (small fried pockets) for appetizers, and the kids fought over them!  Then with the traditional injera bread, we got the lentil entree, the doro wat (chicken), the lamb, and the minced beef --- all spectacular!!  We all left very satisfied.  My advice (if you are budget-conscious like we are) would be to order one fewer entree than you were originally thinking, because the injera will add MUCH bulk to your meal.  Don't expect to see any utensils, but then again, don't be afraid to ask for some.  But the cultural experience of eating fork-less can be a great time!

reviews.name: Laura B.
reviews.review: Visited this place again, this time we got a meat and veggie combination platter and sambusa. It was much easier on the stomach, still delicious. They had already set up the platter when they brought it out which was much better.  Service is still pretty lacking (we constantly had to flag our waitress down, the language/cultural barrier presented a bit of an issue when asking about a food allergen, we ordered coffee for 5 people and were brought 4 cups, etc.), but since Abay closed it looks like this is the most conveniently located Ethiopian food for me, still prefer some other places in town but this one isn't bad.

reviews.name: Vicki S.
reviews.review: I write this review while putting aside my personal thoughts on Ethipoian food (glad I tried it but this will probably be my first and last Ethiopian restaurant). I wasn't sure why the waitress wanted to talk me out of getting my dish with chicken as opposed to beef, and it took too long for our table to receive our drinks since at the time we were the only patrons in the restaurant, but overall the restaurant itself was clean and the staff was friendly. One thing that will forever stick out in my mind was the smell when we walked in - it wasn't overpowering spice or anything food-related, which would have been expected and forgiven - but a stinging and pungent incense-like smell that clouded the lungs and actually made a couple of us cough. Mesob, I think you're doing a good job, but I won't be coming back.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Mesob Ethiopian Restaurant is located at Harding Place and Antioch Pike in a strip mall right next to Sam's Club and across the street from the vehicle emissions testing station.  It is a large restaurant so there is plenty of seating available.  The decor and artwork is nice and tasteful with some Ethiopian artwork decorating the walls.  The menu includes items for breakfast through dinner and I have not seen a menu that extensive at other Ethiopian restaurants.  I had the Awaze Tibs which is a dish of beef tips in a dark, spicy sauce.  The injera bread is very good and fresh and easy to use when eating your meal.  I certainly plan to return of Mesob in the future.  My only gripe is that the service was slow and inattentive.  I was there with a friend and there were very few other customers there and we had to ask for refills and our checks.  There is no excuse for that so I have removed a star for that.  Don't eat there if you are in a hurry.

reviews.name: Morgan J.
reviews.review: Very good traditional Ethiopian food.

reviews.name: Jami W.
reviews.review: New to Ethiopian food?  Give it a shot. Try the meat combo if you're a carnivore. It gives you a great sampling of what the place has to offer.  You get a lot of food for a small cost. Plus, you eat with your hands here, which is fun.

reviews.name: Diondre V.
reviews.review: Had the mesob tibs. Meat was cooked thoroughly with a touch of spice.    Also had the mashed chick peas with berbere sauce  which wasn't bad at all. I definitely recommend anyone give this restaurant a try. Different from American restaurants in that you eat with your hands and use the injera to pick up the food.

reviews.name: Vanessa G.
reviews.review: Early dinner at on a Friday night and it was not crowded. We shared a veggie/meat sampler platter at a very reasonable price of $14.99 and we couldn't eat it all. It was a nice selection of seasonal vegetables and the meat included two lamb choices, beef and chicken.  The atmosphere is nice and the staff is very friendly. The location is not my favorite but we will make the treck again the next time we want Ethiopian fare.

reviews.name: Dawn N.
reviews.review: After trying three Ethiopian restaurants in Nashville, this is the best I've tried so far.  It is on par with Ethiopian restaurants in larger cities in terms of quality, flavor and ambiance.  I absolutely adore all of the dishes in the 7-dish veggie combo.  All of the veggie dishes are great, but my absolute favorites are the spicy lentils, the cabbage and carrots, the green beans, and the salad.  The service is pleasant and the ambiance is fine on the interior, though it is in a strip mall.  But overall, I would absolutely recommend this as the best option for Ethiopian in Nashville.

reviews.name: Jason E.
reviews.review: Good, reasonably priced, hearty food. Definitely worth checking out if you know nothing about Ethiopian food.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: this place is so unique. the food is very different than i am used to but if you go in with an open mind you will not be disappointed! everything we got was spicy so make sure you ask if thats not your thing. I had never had beet root but now i cant get enough, so so yummy!!! our favorite thing was the grilled lamb with peppers. makes me want to eat communal style all  the time!

reviews.name: Cynthia F.
reviews.review: I loved the 7-item vegetarian sampler plate, but the bread it comes with is spongy in texture and has little taste.  Maybe it's an acquired taste. I had never eaten Ethiopian food before.

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: My very first experience with Ethiopian food and now, I am totally ADDICTED! It might look like a total hole-in-the-wall place, but I swear they have some of the best food I've ever eaten! I went with a friend and per her recommendation, ordered the Veggie & Meat Combo sampler. I was a little concerned about ordering a lunch entree that was $14.99, but oh my goodness, did I get my monies worth! I practically had to have my friend roll me out the door! The sampler came on a HUGE platter (like half the size of our table!) and had a generous spoonful of each item: Salad, cabbage, beets with fresh goat cheese, ground beef, lamb, chicken, split peas, chicken and carrots, and some of THE BEST collard greens I've ever eaten! And don't even get me started on the injera (Ethiopian yeasty flatbread)! It's been nearly two months since I visited and I can STILL remember how great everything was! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: great traditional ethiopian food!

reviews.name: doug d.
reviews.review: My first experience with Ethiopian food, so I make no claims of being an expert, but i liked this place very much.I got the 7 veggie sampler, and could not eat it all. I recommend you consider  the 4!Place is very clean, people very nice.Only complaint is there were 2 tv's with differing channels, and music going! It was hard to tell what to listen to or talk easily.Expect to pay around $10.

reviews.name: Kyle P.
reviews.review: I took my wife last night for her birthday (her choice on cuisine), and we both really enjoyed it.  It's only our 2nd time having Ethiopian, so we can't really speak to authenticity and all that- the other time was in Nairobi, and as such we are not entirely sure the Ethiopian there was any more likely to be the right stuff.  But we had similar stuff both times, and both times we loved it.  We got 1 veggie platter and 1 meat combo platter and shared it all.  Both of those are $11 and we ate until bursting and left some behind. Injera was tasty- veggies were collards, beets, lentils, carrots, tasty salad, potatoes- meat were a few kinds of beef and one of chicken, and more collards.  All were excellent.  As to service, we arrived at about 7:30 on a Thursday night and were the first patrons of the night.  As such our service was great and by the time we left other patrons were arriving.  We will definitely be back to branch out a bit more and try some new things, but highly recommend.  I should add that I chose this over Gojo due to more recent reviews on here, so we haven't tried gojo yet to make our own comparisons.

reviews.name: Kirk P.
reviews.review: Food is wonderful!! Fast services- server was nice and polite. The enchilada grande was huge and seasoned wonderful. I would highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Mod F.
reviews.review: This is a great taco truck that stays parked, so you can always find it here. I always get carne asada and it's always spot on. Since Craft Brewed doesn't serve food, but are cool with you bringing in, we often stop at the truck to pick up food to eat with a nice cold beer on the patio of Craft Brewed on 8th just a couple of blocks up.

reviews.name: Tim Q.
reviews.review: This place is a delightful Taco Truck meal. Super affordable- less than $6 for 4x tacos. I can't say enough about the tacos.  Simple and delicious. And cheap. If we could get the screaming child off the actual grill, my score would be perfect.

reviews.name: Ridge D.
reviews.review: This is a taco truck parked in the lot of the shell gas station. Very good food and fast service. A great place to grad something quick or to buy a meal for the whole family. Most of the lunch crowd are blue-collar workers of Hispanic origin, but even if you do not fit this profile this is a great place to visit. Two thumbs up!

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: Great tacos, don't let the appearance deter you. I tried the beef and chicken tacos and they were both amazing! It only took about 5 minutes and $3.75 and I was on my way! Keep in mind they are quite small tacos maybe 5 inch tortillas.

reviews.name: Rob B.
reviews.review: Definitely an off-the-radar kinda place and home of probably the best street taco in Nashville. You like that place in East Nashville? Give this place a chance. Great flavors and quality at a very low price which is evidenced by the lines of a broad mix of blue & white collar workers. Only one or two people working in the truck so expect to wait a while in the gas station lot if you hit the lunch rush.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: The first thing I do when moving to a new neighborhood is find the local pizza place. Castrillo's set the standard for me since 2003, when I first moved to Inglewood. Over the years the place has gone through owner changes, experiments in dine-in, menu expansion, and ups and downs in quality and service, but I kept coming back. Their thick, chewy pan style crust is amazing and flavorful without being greasy. Toppings are fresh and generous. Their specialty pizzas (especially their BBQ Chicken Pizza) are some of the best in Nashville. And the wings....ohhhh the wings. Castrillo's hot wings are dry rubbed in hot spices and jalapenos and run through their pizza oven. Not fried. Maybe my favorite chicken wing ever. Paired with a slice of pizza, its no wonder that I have stuck it out, even when their quality dipped after it was bought out that time, or when hipster weirdos seemed to rule the roost and make ordering a chore. Many local businesses go through such times, and the food has made it worth coming back.As of my most recent experiences with Castrillo's I can say most issues have been addressed. The guys running the place are friendly and efficient. They don't work too quickly, so expect an hour for delivery, but as long as you plan ahead you should be fine. If you need it sooner than an hour, go pick it up. Good food is worth the time. Get the wings. Seriously, get the wings!

reviews.name: Tulané H.
reviews.review: Meh. The Greek salad was an extreme disappointment considering it was 6 + dollars. It was small but more importantly, really bad. It seemed to be a random assortment of pizza toppings thrown together. It was 80% spinach, 10% feta and the rest very small amounts of onion and literally 3 small pieces of warm iceberg lettuce. My advice, do not offer something on your menu if you're not going to do it right. The small Greek pizza was pretty good but the thin crust we ordered was actually quite doughy, which we both were surprised by. Honestly, I do not plan on going back.

reviews.name: Ang E.
reviews.review: Good pizza, good services, friendly staff, but prices are a little high.

reviews.name: Daniel L. G.
reviews.review: Quick delivery. Excellent food. Got the buffalo chicken calzone and feta cheese breadsticks. Worth the money.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: Castrillo's is okay, comparable to Roma Pizza. Customer service can vary wildly when you walk in. Their pizza is fine, but I prefer ordering from Italia and Five Points since they're in the same neighborhood.

reviews.name: Cate H.
reviews.review: Online ordering & prompt delivery! Great cheese bread! Average pizza, slightly underdone dough but tasty toppings. I prefer the pizza from Italia or steak and pizza.

reviews.name: Amber R.
reviews.review: I've had both their pizza and their spaghetti. Both were good. I love the crust on the pizza, it has a buttery, salty/garlic taste. The delivery is always much quicker than expected. Last time they quoted us 45 mins, and they literally had the food at our doorstep in no more than 15 minutes. We live close by and order regularly. I definitely recommend it!

reviews.name: Vanessa G.
reviews.review: I ordered the feta cheese sticks (not extremely flavorful but tasty & cheesy) and a one topping personal pizza which was a great size for a personal pizza. The crust was hand tossed-not too crispy & not too thick. The price was comparable to the typical chains. This may be my go to delivery joint (but I'll have to order in advance since delivery took an hour).

reviews.name: JT S.
reviews.review: Updated, from the front of the restaurant, 15 minutes after my order was supposed be ready. They still don't give a shit about doing your order right or on time. But the pizza is usually pretty good. In other words, no change except I'm not sure anything has been cleaned since my initial review a year ago.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: Castrillo's is tasty, no doubt. Quick Delivery, killer carry out specials and overall really great pizza. We're a fan of their mushroom and pepperoni, or pepperoni and banana pepper. Thanks to my husband's lack of adventure when it comes to food, we stay pretty basic when ordering, but we're never disappointed.

reviews.name: Emily M.
reviews.review: The food is OK, but be sure you don't use the online system to order! It ran my credit card twice on Jan. 30. I called about it that same evening, and they told me they would take care of it. I'm still waiting (now it's Feb. 10) for the credit to be processed. I called to day to ask about it and got the manager on the phone. He said "I'm in the middle of working, but I'll look into it later today." I suggested he go ahead and do it now, since I've been waiting since the 30th, and he said, "I'm working and can't deal with this right now." No idea if I'll be getting that money back or not, but I'm not really excited about paying $60 for $30 worth of pizza! Customer service most definitely leaves something to be desired!

reviews.name: Ginger F.
reviews.review: I have been there twice.  First time I  ordered the beef ravioli which was super good, impressed for a pizza place, o my bad thing was they didn't give me any silverware to go.  Second time, I ordered delivery and ordered the chicken  alfredo pizza and buffalo medium wings.   The dishes were also good!  The wings I should have ordered more because I couldn't put them dowm.  My only bad feedback was they didn't give me peppers, parmesean cheese, and silverware once again for my delivery :(.  (so frustrating but at least the food made up for it.)

reviews.name: E C.
reviews.review: Hands down our favorite pizza in Nashville! Their crust is always perfectly cooked- a tiny bit crunchy and seasoned with something yummy. Overall, they have great flavors and great specials. Since we moved to the neighborhood about 10 weeks ago, we've probably had their pizza at least 8 times. It's more of a mom and pop type shop, which we love to support! Highly recommend if you haven't tried it!

reviews.name: Derek E.
reviews.review: This is an above average pizza place. They don't try to be too fancy like other local joints. Just straight forward delicious pizza. There are slices at a decent price. Their pies are more expensive than the chains, but they are also much tastier. To save a little, there are daily carry-out specials. I haven't tried the subs or other offerings yet, but I look forward to it. Not much of a dining area. But if you're looking for a good pizza to eat at home on the east side, give this place a chance.

reviews.name: Meagan M.
reviews.review: Any of the specialty pizzas are amazing!  I don't know if they add crack to the crust but its amazing.  For whatever reason a regular peperoni doesn't knock my socks off as much.  Also I kind of want to marry the feta cheese bread, one day it will be legal!!Great delivery times and awesome prices.  Best neighborhood pizza joint in town.

reviews.name: Brittany M.
reviews.review: Worst service I've ever had ! It's been two hours since I've placed my order and my food has yet to be delivered ! Ridiculous! I do not recommend this place to anyone You're better off waiting at a restaurant in person than waiting on a delivery from this shit hole !All we got were sorries last night . Some communication about the back up and people answering the phones that knew what was going on would have saved the evening . A discount or a free dessert - things most placed would do if your good was over two hour late

reviews.name: Grayson W.
reviews.review: Good pizza and calzones. The wings aren't my favorite and they are pretty slow, but the pizza is really good. Buffalo chicken pizza is good but ask for light Cajun powder, it can be overwhelming.

reviews.name: Sarah V.
reviews.review: Best Pizza in a wide radius in Nashville! Bacon and olive pizza rocked our socks and the buffalo wings were fantastic- on the spicy side.

reviews.name: Doug J.
reviews.review: The service was friendly, the delivery was quick and on time, but the "food" was horrible. It would have been better for me to go to Kroger and get one of those super cheap Totinos pizzas. The food quality here is extremely sub par. I sampled a little bit of the three items I purchased and couldn't eat the rest. Kinda like melted plastic on top of cardboard. I know it's tempting. A pizza place in the middle of east Nashville that delivers, but don't do it. You will regret it forever.

reviews.name: Chad E.
reviews.review: Looking for something different while in the area, and while they were not simple to find (being from out of town), the GPS found them easily enough.There was a daily special, which included a large pie and some wings, which probably saved a couple of bucks compared to buying them individually. Also picked up a nice salad, and all told we stuffed ourselves crazy. Pizza, salad and wings were all quite tasty - and you will find things here (like corn) that you probably do not find many other places to put on your pizza.Only downside is that their cold pizza the next morning is not the best. Not sure exactly why, but it just didn't hold up all that well.

reviews.name: Laura R.
reviews.review: Ugh. Just tried them again because I wanted some pasta. BIG MISTAKE. I ordered the beef lasagna & it was like a school lunch. Weird little meatballs (like the ones you find in canned spaghetti-o's), covered with cheese & stuck in a broiler, hardly a bit of sauce, & the bread sticks should have just stayed at the restaurant; awful. I also ordered a piece of cheesecake...listed as "A Cheesecake Factory product"... Definitely not. I've gotten the cheesecake they are talking about from Sam's Club, it's great! The crust was like dough, not like a cheesecake crust. The only reason I am giving them 2 stars is because the food was delivered on time & my canned Coke was a highlight. I wish so badly there was a quality Italian delivery in East Nashville...I'll never order from here again.
reviews.location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: I recently moved in the area and needed a quick solution for dinner so I turned to Yelp and decided on Castrillo's.  I order a medium pizza, I was impressed with it but the five stars come from the baked wings. I ordered them hot and they where great. I loved the jalapeños and the dry rub. There are many options for food but if you want to avoid the normal chains, which I steer away from, go online order a great pizza and wings. If you have company I promise they will be impressed.

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: I came here with my friend's wife while my buddy was busy studying. We kind of settled here after finding some other places closed but my buddy's wife did have good things to say about this place. Well, my friend enjoys it but she thought it was just okay. We settled on a large Greek pizza but I wanted something with a little more meat to it and so we got Italian sausage added in there. The pizza took about 15 minutes and we took it back to eat it. Right away the pizza was just oily-I've had greasy pizza before but this one was just was super oily. I guess it makes sense since the pizza had no sauce but was nothing but olive oil. The flavor of it was pretty good though, besides that. A lot of veggies and they didn't skimp on the sausage either. I'm eager to try their other pizza varieties like their kitchen sink or the buffalo chicken. If their ordinarily meatless pizza is tasty then I think their meat pizzas must be pretty good.

reviews.name: Andrew S.
reviews.review: So thankful to have these guys in my neighborhood.  Pizza is always great and comes out quick even on a busy Friday night.  The tomato and artichoke pizza is my favorite and I always come back to it.  Delicious!  The guys that work the front counter are always friendly and seem genuinely interested in delivering a quality product.  Places like this are what make East Nashville great!

reviews.name: Thomas L.
reviews.review: My wife and I ordered a pizza here on a Saturday night. We got their nightly carryout special, an X-Large two topping pizza(spinach and mushrooms). We also got some cheese bread.      We were so pleased with both the pizza and the cheese bread.  The cheese bread had a ton of cheese on it and was very satisfying in taste and in being filling.    The pizza definitely ranks at the highest tier of pizza in the area.  The toppings tasted very fresh and crust of the pizza was just awesome. The amount of cheese on the pizza was perfect as well.    We normally ordered routinely at another pizza joint but I think we were convinced that the extra cost  here is definitely worth it.  The X-large pizza lasted a few meals for this married couple.

reviews.name: Kate W.
reviews.review: My husband and I ordered the Sunday night special for takeout. Pizza made it home really hot which was great! The crust is like medium thick, and the reason I'm rating it 4 is that I just prefer thinner crust. But the sauce and toppings were good. Service was great!

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: Just moved near Riverside Village and was so happy to have a non-chain pizza place to try.  This place gets an extra star just for not being a chain.  I've had both take out and delivery now and both were relatively quick (25 min for take out and 45 for delivery).  What impressed me most with our delivery order was pizza and wings were actually hot when they arrived, which I can rarely say for any other pizza deliveries.  I really like the pizza.  It's tasty and the crust has more flavor than most.  I read reviews that said it was soggy.. I haven't experienced that yet and I'm really anal about getting soggy pizza.  Both the thin and hand tossed I've had seemed to be cooked exactly the right amount of time.  Have had the kitchen sink which I can see the appeal in, but I personally just don't like a ton of meat on my pizza.  Was a lot happier with the Greek tonight which left me feeling satisfied but not overly full.The hot wings are different from the usual drenched in buffalo sauce.  Although I like the saucy kind, I think these guys are smart for serving them a different style as delivered wings usually mean soggy wings.  The hot wings are peppery and served with jalapeños.  Not the best wings I've ever had, but by far the best delivered wings I've had.  They do offer other styles as well as buffalo.  Would order them again.The salad is fine.  Again, not spectacular by any means but better than the chain options.  Service is friendly, food is good, and it's in my 'hood.  Can't complain much about that!

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: We decided to try Castrillo's one rainy late evening when we both agreed we did not feel like cooking dinner! Fresh pizza from a local place conveniently near our neighborhood was an obvious solution. I was elated to find that I had a coupon in my City Savers book we purchase every year from my Daughter's PTO, the frugal Mom in me was even more willing to try this place out when according to the coupon, we would receive a free medium pizza with any purchase!We walked in, ordered our pie(s) and sat down to wait. It was about 20 minutes tops. We ordered a Kitchen Sink, and also the free medium cheese pizza. Our total was about $20 - what a steal right?The service was friendly, and prompt. We felt good about being close to home and giving our business to a local place with quality we were sure would top the chain places. Castrillo's did not disappoint. The cheese wasn't greasy, the crust was baked perfectly, the toppings tasted fresh. We were pleased with our pizzas and have definitely added this to our list of local spots. I am happy to have discovered another small business in Riverside Village worth visiting on the regular! The only down side is this is strictly a pick up and go or delivery place, they do not have seating for an eat-in option but if you are like us, this is close to home anyway! *a note for my vegan and veggie friends, I did notice a veggie friendly pizza on the menu however I do not know if they offer vegan options.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: As a huge fan of Italia Pizza due to their vegan cheese and gluten-free crust offerings, I haven't ordered any pizza from Castrillo's due to this.However, due to my mischief and affection for Malbec the previous evening, Castrillo's was now an option due to their delivery service. It should also be notated that I only live 2 blocks away. I was not going to peel myself off the couch today!I was stoked to find out that they were able to accommodate my vegan requests by serving up spaghetti with marinara sauce, "dry" breadsticks, and a salad sans cheese. The food was filling and hit the spot and was delivered in under 45 minutes. I am curious to try the vegetarian sandwich but am bummed that pizza doesn't appear to be in my near future.Service was friendly, fast, and the daily specials offered on the website are enticing.Their prices are quite reasonable! I was leaning towards 4 stars but would like to try a few other items on the menu before I can commit to that. Hopefully, some vegan cheese will be on their menu soon? I will definitely order up from Castrillo's again...let's hope that I can actually have the energy to do carryout next time?

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: Located in Riverside Village, Castrillo's offers a different variety on pizza than other local options (non-chain). We ordered two pizzas that were fresh and hot when delivered. One was the Kitchen Sink and the other the Jordan's. They were perfect except for leaving off the basil pesto that we had ordered to be added to the Jordan. Mistakes in a restaurant are easy to fix, but those related to delivery aren't. Having regularly ordered from another pizza place in East Nashville regularly, this will make me second guess my choices. Back to the za; good stuff! The pizzas here are always cooked to near perfection. I feel the baking time should be increased to another minute or so because the crust isn't quite stiff enough to hold up under the weight of the toppings. For this, we toss them in the oven at home for another few minutes to tighten them up. Also, the crust is more on the softer side. You can eat the crust without a back of beverage and also is sweet and savory. They do make a good pie. The ingredients are top shelf and the sauce has a every so slight sweetness that makes eating that one extra piece more than you should, a must. The delivery times here are short. Usually 5-9. So, be sure to take that into account. Badda bing!

reviews.name: Michael R.
reviews.review: Ordered "The Dylan". The blandest pizza I have ever tasted   Ordered the feta cheese sticks. The same. Only thing good was the delivery guy was good looking. First and last time.

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: You've gotta love a place whose official name is "Castrillo's Pizza and Stuff."  Seriously.  Castrillo's recently closed their pretty sizable dining area, which is a shame, because now your only options are carryout and delivery.The pizza is delicious; it outshines any chain delivery joint in the area, and they are remarkably cheap.  They also offer some subs and pastas, and I'm a pretty big fan of their meatball sandwiches...nice and sloppy.  The staff is sometimes a bit ornery, but it's best not to take that personally.  They make your pizza quickly and well--I've never had a sub-par dinner there.So while Castrillo's used to be the perfect place for dining in over a couple of pies with some friends, now you'll just have to settle for taking it home with you.  That's not too bad, because the toppings are plentiful and something about that crust is addictive.  I enjoy supporting a local family-run joint, and while their pizza is great, their "stuff" is where it's at.

reviews.name: Alexandria G.
reviews.review: I've gone in and ordered a couple of times and I highly recommend Castrillo's. The food has been delicious both times, the portions are generous, and the prices are reasonable. Great place to check out!

reviews.name: Carrie A.
reviews.review: Castrillo's used to be one of my favorite pizza joints.  However, the last few times I've ordered from there, it's been about average, and my order hasn't been completely correct either.  I always order the same thing, and I expect it to be consistent.  A few weeks ago, I ordered my usual for delivery, however when I ordered "extra cheese", that must have been translated to "very little cheese".  There was so little cheese that I actually had to go to the grocery store and pick up a bag of shredded pizza cheese to add.  Then last week my  usual thin crust pizza I that I picked up  turned out to be regular crust, which I don't like at all.  After I got home and realized the error, I called and politely mentioned it to the employee and he said "oh yeah, sorry about that - I remember you said thin crust".  I was surprised that he didn't at the very least offer a couple of bucks off my next order.  With some of the other really good pizza options in East Nashville,  I'd think they'd want to keep their regular long-time customers satisfied, but maybe not.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I have been using Castrillos for years and I think they have gotten under new ownership in the last 6 months and I don't like it as much... Crap, I mean I really want to, I do. I even tried again the other day and I was just underwhelmed. I don't think the sauce is all that good any more and I have gotten some soggy dough a few times. This last time the pepperoni so so over cooked it had hardened and started to shrivel. I didn't even finish one piece. So, whomever bought this business needs to call the old owners and find out their secrets and go back to the way it was because that was working for me and this is just not even close.

reviews.name: Kirk K.
reviews.review: The pizza and salad were excellent. Very quick delivery.

reviews.name: Nadeau N.
reviews.review: YUMMY!  This is the best Pizza in East Nashville, perhaps all of Nashville!  I can order just about any of their pizzas and not like one of them.  I am a huge pepperoni pizza fan and theirs is awesome!I also like their BBQ Chicken with Pineapple pizza.  :)  Not sure if it is on the menu, but I love to order it!My one and only issue is if you are starving you better go pick it up!  If you know you are having a party or a group over in an hour or two go ahead and order early.  They have improved greatly over the years, but you still have to wait an hour for a pizza, even on an off night.  I have waited nearly 2 hours before, but you forget all about the wait when it arrives!

reviews.name: Rebecca B.
reviews.review: Castrillos is really goodl. The pizza sauce is super yummy and the whole menu is packed with awesome specialty pizzas. They make good brownies too that are always on the counter when I come in so of course i get them.  The delivery guys are always quick and the people who work there are always very nice and extra helpful. I am really happy they are at Riverside Village

reviews.name: leslie a.
reviews.review: as all pizza lovers know, the first thing you need to find when you move to a new city is a good pizza place that delivers. i think we lucked out that castrillo's happened to be the closest neighborhood place, and the nine months since, it has remained a great choice. now, i know the new yorkers will say, as one reviewer did here, that the crust is too thick, and it's too cheesy. whatever. pizza is one of those things, sort of like human beings, that comes in many shapes and sizes, and they all have the potential to be beautiful and marvelous if you just let them be what they are instead of trying to force them to conform to some preconceived notion. so don't expect it to be like whatever your other favorite pizza is, and try to judge it on its own. (i learned this when i had zachary's chicago-style pizza in berkeley -- i couldn't appreciate it until i decided not to think of it as pizza at all, then i realized how amazing it is).ok, castrillo's. let's start with the crust. oh, the crust. it has never failed me, never been burnt, and never been underdone. it's fluffy and a little bit sweet, and light in your mouth, and unlike my favorite pizza in san francisco, where i never ever ate the crust, i can savor this to the last bite. the crust is awesome. and the toppings have been great in every version i've tried my usual is pesto pizza, with onions and feta cheese. it's truly perfect. when i'm in a meat mood, sausage and pepperoni, both of which are high quality meats (bad pizza sausage, which is used in lots of chains, is not edible -- but good pizza sausage can make your day). the hawaiian was great too, and i tried one that had bacon and banana peppers on it, which was interesting. and yes, they're all cheesy, so if you don't like a lot of cheese on your pizza, tell them to go easy with it. but really, i can't imagine the argument against cheesiness. and the bread sticks are fantastic, they must be made from that magical crust dough -- and the feta cheese sticks?? oh. my. god. they are so good it's amazing that you can get something like that for five bucks, though with pizza, it's a bit of bread overkill, so you might want to get a side salad to go with them and make a meal of just that. (the side salad was totally edible, if ordinary, but eating salad makes me feel just that much less guilty about eating too much pizza).oh, and they also take their magical bread and make cinnamon bread sticks, which they deliver with a little tub of that sugary topping that makes cinnamon rolls so good. for under five bucks for something like eight of them, you can save them for breakfast. heat 'em up, put on the icing and yum.and if you need dessert, they even have new york cheesecake from the cheesecake factory if you want, and reese's peanut butter cheesecake, but i'd suggest the homemade brownies. yes, delivery can take up to an hour, but ji just plan ahead. it's worth the wait.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Castrillo's is the neighborhood pizza joint of Riverside Village.  There's no indoor seating, so it's a pick up and go or get delivery kind of place, but I love ordering from there whenever I'm visiting in East Nashville.  They offer your typical pizza place toppings and pies as well as a couple more creative options.  The seafood pizza is in reality as crazy as it sounds, definatly for the adventurous.  I remember when I picked it up after ordering, the employee behind the counter greeted me with a 'so you're who ordered that pizza'.  Not really sure if that was to him a good or bad thing but he was jovial when he said it.  As good as it is, their pizza is not what makes them stand out to me.  They're Feta Cheese sticks are so delicious, and the amount they give you is amazing, you could really order that instead of a pizza and be full.  They offer salads, sandwiches and other pizaa shop type food but its their wings that I will recommend to anyone thinking of eating here.  They are hands down the best I've had in Nashville so far.  First of all they're huge, nothing like the wimpy chicken wings you get in most places.  I can easily say they're twice the size of your average wing, and they cook them until they're so tender the meat falls into your mouth.  They only have three flavors, but they're all so tasty you could eat them every day.  The mild wings are a dry rub which is deliciously unusual and come with banana peppers sprinkled on top, the hot wings are wet and come with jalapenos and the bbq come with pineapple.  I'm craving them again as I'm sitting here writing this and am contemplating driving over there right now in the cold to get some.

reviews.name: Cory P.
reviews.review: Castrillos was a friendly and quick pizza option.  The pizza crust is the best part and they load their pizza with cheese.  My only complaint is that the toppings were scarce.  But besides that it was, overall, a great pizza with great service!  Much better than the chain pizza joints on the NE side of town.

reviews.name: Dan E.
reviews.review: Well, I was sucked in by some favorable reviews, too bad. I have lived in this hood for about 7 years, and want so badly to have a local pizza place I love, but alas this is not it. I am from St. Louis where even the average bar pizza beats anything in the area in my opinion, so it may just be that nothing will do it for me, I am aware of an accept this possibility, and you may feel my bias cannot yield an objective review.  All that being said, I just tried it again after about a 3 year layoff and am definitely underwhelmed. The crust is the thing in my opinion, and whether you like thick or thin, that part has to be right. So, have you ever had thin crust that was soggy and chewy and kind of burned on the bottom and thought, wow, this is really great? Doubt it, such was my experience tonight. I won't be back, I really want it to be otherwise, I am all about the neighborhood businesses, but I can't recommend this to anyone. Sorry guys.

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: If you live within the delivery area for Castrillo's you have no excuse to order from anywhere else.  It's delicious and local; what more could you want? Delivery is always prompt, and I've never received the wrong order which is more than I can say for any of the chain pizza places in the area.  Make sure you add a side of the feta cheese sticks to your next order.  They toss big chunks of feta over the melted cheese blend for a tasty twist on an old classic.  I have yet to try the stromboli, but be sure it will be my next order from Castrillo's.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: We've ordered carryout a couple of times from here- they have good daily specials and lots of yummy toppings to choose from.  The thin and regular crusts are delicious, the sauce tastes very fresh and not sugary like some chains.  I ran into one instance where they're phones just kept going to voicemail on a Sunday, but we finally got them.

reviews.name: Jesse P.
reviews.review: Solid pizza, but I haven't been blown away by it yet. The crust alone deserves 4 stars though. The cheese sticks are pretty fantastic, but I could've used more dipping sauce.

reviews.name: roger t.
reviews.review: DO NOT ORDER PIZZA FROM THIS UNPROFESSIONAL PIZZA JOINT!  Tonight was the last time we will ever EVER order form here.  The customer service SUCKS!  We support our local businesses and tonight was the last straw.  We ALWAYS ask for our pizza to be sliced and tonight was the 4th time it has come to us cut in squares.  We called to ask for our next pizza to be discounted and Jessica the manager got hateful with me, told me it is our problem because we order thin crust, then hung up on me.  When I called back she hung up on me again.  This is ridiculous!!!  I am a business owner too and if I treated my clients like this I would be broke!  I am NEVER ordering from here again.  I suggest using Papa Johns or Little Caesars over this RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL establishment!  We will be talking to Jacob the owner on Sunday; since the manager blurted out this COMMAND out before slamming the phone down in my ear!!!!  My husband took the pizza back and was refunded the money for the pizza but was told that the tip we gave our delivery driver WOULD NOT be refunded!!!!  What kind of BULL is this?!  I am offended and shocked by the way we were treated.  All of this after waiting for an hour and ten minutes for our pizza!

reviews.name: Michael K.
reviews.review: We will NEVER use this business again! EXTREMELY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE! We have had our order messed up the LAST 3 TIMES we have used them. We like to support local companies instead of chains, but their customer service could take a few training seminars from their competitors. We always ask for our pizza to be cut in slices. A simple request. And it comes to us cut in squares. We called to ask for a discount on our next pizza. Jessica, the manager on duty, was EXTREMELY RUDE and told us it was OUR fault because we ordered it as thin crust. She then HUNG UP the phone. When I called back she HUNG UP AGAIN! So my husband took the pizza in to get our money back. When he walked in she was abrupt and would only refund the money for the pizza, NOT THE TIP! She also proceeded to laugh at him on his way out of their establishment. She should be demoted or better yet FIRED. I would NOT want her representing my business. We will be stopping in on this coming Sunday to speak to the owner, Jacob. Once again, I would NOT suggest using this company.

reviews.name: B C.
reviews.review: I'm going to give Castrillo's two stars because it was underwhelming to me.  But it was not bad.  I stopped in for a slice because it's really the only place that I've seen that offers slices.  Having moved here from NYC about 8 months ago my eyes lit up at the prospect of getting a slice!  Well, it was a bit disappointing to find out that they only serve slices between the hours of 11am-1pm.  ???  Weird.So finally, I remember the time properly and was able to stop in for a slice.  At first glance - eww...the slice of cheese pizza looks like a big pillow. (strike 1.  Slices should be on thin crust and not oooozing with cheese.  That's just not necessary).  Then I take a bite and I am pleasantly surprised that the sauce is actually pretty good.  So, I'm thinking I would entertain the idea of possibly ordering a pie for delivery one day and make sure that I ask for thin crust, light on the cheese.  I really just don't understand why people think it's necessary to pile on the cheese.  That is just not what makes a good pizza slice.  It's all about having the perfect balance between sauce and cheese and perfectly baked, of course...we shall see how round 2 goes.  Whenever that may be.

reviews.name: Rachael P.
reviews.review: The BBQ Chicken Pizza will change your life! I've ordered from Castrillo's over 5 times and I haven't ordered anything but this pizza, can't get past it. I do wish they had the option of an eat-in area. The delivery is usually around 35-45 minutes but it's worth the wait for this yummy pizza!

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: Tried a couple varieties of the stromboli - the supreme and sausage & mushroom - both were outstanding.  But, what really stood out was the crust.  It was thick, chewy, buttery, salty and garlicy - in short, it was good.  This place doesn't skimp on the fillings - which were fresh and well-seasoned.  The prices aren't too bad either.

reviews.name: Anna T.
reviews.review: I was impressed with this pizza place's selection.  I stopped in for a quick bite and ordered a roast beef sandwich (that was very delicious.)  The sandwich did take about 15 to 20 minutes to get out of the kitchen.  Seating is non-existent in the restaurant, but there is a community patio next to Castrillo's.  I am excited to try their pizza.  I've only heard good things.

reviews.name: Liza D.
reviews.review: We got a Flamethrower and it was pretty good! We love spicy food and this didn't disappoint - however, the one thing I didn't like about it was the dousing of the pizza in cayenne pepper - it made it way salty and almost too spicy, if there is such a thing for a dish called "Flamethrower" - it was totally like gilding the lilly at that point. It's hot and delectable enough without the added salty-hotness of the cayenne/other spice blend. I'll request it without next time - but overall, it was a great take out and the guys were really friendly.

reviews.name: matt c.
reviews.review: My review is based on dining in once. This is a great spot to grab a couple surprisingly good slices of pizza on a saturday, maybe after or before a trip to neighboring Sip or the used bookstore. The tables have those red-and-white checkered tablecloths.

reviews.name: Ian K.
reviews.review: The pizza here is fantastic.  There is just something special about the crust - its buttery?  Garlicy?  I can't put my finger on it, but its wonderful.  My wife and I tried it for the frist time on a Friday, and when we had guests the very next day, we ordered some more!Delivery takes an hour minimum, we're pretty sure, so we've always gone to the store to pick it up.  You can dine in, as well, which isn't a bad option.  We've never found the dining area to be busy and its comfortable.  I believe they've got a deck/patio area for warmer days - I can see that as being a very popular option soon!The pasta and subs are great, too.  Be sure to ask about their daily specials - I'm pretty sure there are different pickup and delivery specials.  Oh!  We've heard the wings are great, too, but haven't tried them yet.My wife and I highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Had a monster stromboli here and was impressed.  The dough/crust is buttery and salty and delicious, though perhaps a little too doughy for some.  The ingredients were fresh-tasting, the staff were patient (I lost the ability to use words momentarily while ordering), and they have old-fashioned childrens' coloring activities while you wait.

reviews.name: FoodCritic 6.
reviews.review: This place is good. A nice and comfy place styled for music city. Been here a few times. The first time I was unsatisfied. However being back a couple more time everything is great nice and friendly staff with good food.

reviews.name: Tj J.
reviews.review: Service was over the top! BUT!!Food was HORRIBLE! Not being from the area I was very surprised at how the manager handled my feed back. Give it a try - maybe there are changes for the best but I'd past on it as my first choice if I happen to be in the area again.

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: Service was sub par. I believe the Football game was more of a distraction to the server than a enhancement for the customer. Food came out and it seemed like it had been sitting in the kitchen for a while. Had to seek out the server for refills and every little thing that normally are brought to you.

reviews.name: Val B.
reviews.review: The crabcake sandwich was the best ive ever had, very tasty. But they seem shortstaffed on Saturdays, two bartenders is not enough when everyone is waiting a long time to be served, i think they need more cocktail waitresses to help them out.   Once i ordered my food came fairly quickly but the service was pretty bad.  I sat at the bar and i actually had to ask them to clean the dirty plates and drinks from my area! The stuff sat there a long time and once they took it, they never even wiped down the bar.  I took a paper towel and did it.  Theyre very slow and dont expect them to pay you attention.  It looks much nicer than a shack but their unsanitary attitude concerns me, and if sitting at a table is cleaner, Im sure the service is still lacking.

reviews.name: Allison L.
reviews.review: Wow Service was so bad!  We asked to sit upstairs. At first they did not want to sit us there ... They finally did and it took forever together acknowledged.  Food was good. Drinks ok. Service was mediocre.  So disappointed!

reviews.name: Victoria G.
reviews.review: I read bad reviews, but went anyway. Service wasn't too bad, food was delish. Is go there again.

reviews.name: Diana O.
reviews.review: Worst service ever. Server slow had to keep asking for my drinks. Took forever to get our food order. Had the $30 cajuan ragin steampot. Enough for one person. It actually had more spices to it then what i thought. Everyone else in the party had a different steampot but theirs were bland unless you like it like that but i perfer mine with spices. Appetizers were the usual mussle and the trio. Definitely not a place I would  want to come back to. Parking next door had cost us $26. If you dont mine walking you can find one 2 blocks away for cheaper. The only star they deserve is for the great location. They have happy hours on weekdays 4-7pm only at the bar.

reviews.name: Joe H.
reviews.review: The food at this place isn't fit for human consumption. Not only was it terrible but my entire plate was cold including the crab cakes. Can you imagine trying to eat cold crab cakes? Nasty. I didn't expect to be wowed being as though this is a crab shack in Nashville but I was hoping it would be decent. If you want crappy seafood you might as well go to Captain D's and save yourself some money. Do not eat at this place.

reviews.name: Anthony T.
reviews.review: I really have to do better and check the reviews before I go to an restaurant because I would have know that the service is really bad. Not that they didn't try but they didn't have the demeanor to be bartenders (neither one of them). That job is for extroverts and not introverts because it showed that they didn't want to interact with any of the consumers and I don't blame them but blame the managers because he or she didn't hire the right people for the job..Don't get me wrong but they really tried but you can tell. The food was really good and so I guess that what I should be focusing my attention on. So if you want some good food and not be bothered this is a 5 star spot and you should visit.

reviews.name: Shannon R.
reviews.review: My entire family went here very excited to eat our last meal of our Nashville trip. To start off with, we all ordered a cup of soup. My sister and I got the lobster bisque and my mom, brother and dad got the clam chowder. These soups were fairly good and account for the one start that I'm giving this restaurant. Although they were pretty good, the clam chowder especially most likely came from a can. The crab cake sandwich was absolutely awful. It was very dry and tasted nothing like crab. The sauce was decent which made it easier to choke down. My sister ended up sending hers back. The waitress took it back without question, possibly as a good customer service move, but it was almost like she agreed that it was terrible. My dad got the mahi tacos and he said they were terrible too. The water tasted like toilet water. Our waitress was very nice, but it took 40 mins to get our $75 worth of terrible food. When it came to getting the check, we waited and waited. My dad ended up having to leave to get the car out of the paid time limit lot while the rest of the family paid stayed behind to pay our bill (we eventually got up from the table to walk over and ask to pay). We figured that we had more than enough time to go in and eat, but weren't factoring in the hour of time (outside of actual eating time) it took to get our food/check. Do yourself a favor, save $60 and go to chick-fil-a.

reviews.name: Darlene O.
reviews.review: Came here twice! Both times no major issues. Sidenote: Most recent visit I came solo and sat at the bar and received quicker, more friendly service than when I came with my friend and we had a booth. I ordered the Big Shrimp Platter but subbed the coconut shrimp for grilled shrimp and instead of the fries and coleslaw I got two servings of rice (dirty rice and white rice). My two drinks were a strawberry/mango daiquiri (really good and sweet, very concentrated and thick like a smoothie, not watery at all) and Southern Comfort. I enjoyed both especially the Southern Comfort! Next time I plan to try the Category 5 Hurricane drink and the Southern Stuffed Shrimp. There is a parking lot adjacent to Joe's Crabshack (the kind where you insert money into the box with your corresponding parking lot number). "Eat at Joe's!" (lol)

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: Hate giving negative comments... But at 4pm on Friday night a party of 6 people we waited 1. 1/2 hours for our food ... Server was sweet but not trained .. We asked for plates to share appetizers .. Her answer was we have no clean plates... ???? OK what ... Looking around there where more servers then customers ... Everybody that came in after us had food before we even got appetizers !!! .. Drink refills ... Only after we asked twice...  Don't waste ur time in this city going to this horrible place !!

reviews.name: Laura G.
reviews.review: Just what the Dr. ordered - a pot of steamed shellfish.  Calamari was really nice - the pot of crab, shrimp, lobster - good!  Not life changing but good and the price was right.  Our service was good (not at the bar but when we were sat) - food was good.  A-OK!

reviews.name: Memo L.
reviews.review: First visit and I really wanted to like this place. $25 to park unless you want to walk a mile.  Service was the worst I have ever experienced.   Ordered the crabpot.  Lobster was over-cooked to the point of rubber consistency.  Melted butter was way oversalted.  No complimentary bread for a $30 meal.  Spoke to the manager who was professional enough to comp the meal.  Gave us two $20 coupons for next visit.  Thought well MAYBE we will give it another chance....until we went into the bathroom only to see the toilet bowls were feces caked as if they hadn't been cleaned in God knows how long.  With our experience tonight, I can't even imagine what goes on in the kitchen.  Joe's Crab Shack, you should be ashamed.  We handed the coupons off to someone on the street.

reviews.name: Linda G.
reviews.review: Have been many there times but tonight was horrible. Service was the worst I have ever had in a restaurant  after waiting 1:20 to be seated. Was reallyLooking forward to a nice meal. Don't know what's going on.

reviews.name: Fiona C.
reviews.review: Okay so my partner hate's Chain Restaurants. That said, we really enjoyed our meal @ "Joe's Crab Shack"ATTN: YELP! Your App told me they were closed on a thursday night!? This was not the case. Lucky we were nearby & found they were open. Staff told us 7 days a week. (must be some bad intel?)As 'out of towner's' we had no issue with the price at the end. Everything was spot on.Jonathan was our server & i must say...... Fantastic! Super enthusiastic & very helpful. Excellent server to utilise with the tourists.''Lobster Nachos', Lobster Daddy Feast '& 'Orleans Steampot ' were all fantastic! ( I drool while posting this). Every thing tasted fresh. (Corn could have been cooked a little longer) Cocktails were not 100% but as a tourist i enjoyed my souvenir cup.We walked out very happy in a Seafood stupor......

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: I would give them a 2.5 if I could. I don't think they are terrible but it wouldn't be a first choice of mine.Food isn't cheap but I don't think it is "Pricey" as others have claimed. I mean most of what you order here is crab, lobster and seafood. I don't know if you realize this people but getting amazing seafood in a land locked state is not CHEAP OR EASY!The food is decent and I think the price to quality ratio is about right. That being said for a chain and being a landlocked seafood restaurant its not bad. It just isn't that good either.While the whole high energy, servers singing and what not is part of their business model I find it to take away from my meal. If I wanted dinner and a show I'll go to a legit dinner theater. If you get plan on getting a steam pot, get a salad and split the pot with someone. They are big.All in all, If you want seafood and don't want to break the bank it isn't bad choice.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: I like this place. Everything was delicious. Try the kj!!! and they are willing to fry scallops if you ask (even though its not on the menu). Our waitress was really cool. We ate outside on the balcony area and it was really fun. My complaints are that there was a bit of a wait to get seated, their gift shop kinda went downhill, and in the past, the servers were kinda slow. Lastly, the food isn't super cheap, but its not expensive either.

reviews.name: Nikki C.
reviews.review: First time at this chain. Always wanted to try and glad we did. We did a late lunch/early dinner so the place was empty, plus it was a Sunday and tourist crowd was either too hungover or heading home (or both). The bartender was fun and friendly, putting up with our antics and serving us everything in mason jars (even if it wasn't supposed to be) because hey, it's Nashville and everything should be served in a mason jar.The food was great. Large selection and reasonable portions (we got a variety of apps). You have to try the lobster nachos...an interesting concept, but very unique and yummy!

reviews.name: Daniel I.
reviews.review: Alright. I know this is a chain restaurant. But when you want crab, this is the place to go! It may not be unique, but it's fun and you're guaranteed a great meal.

reviews.name: T.A. H.
reviews.review: Great experience all around.

reviews.name: Michelle H.
reviews.review: We decided to form our own opinion after reading all the reviews for this Joe's Crab Shack. We usually love their food but definitely not this locations. I ordered the Maine Grill an I had nickels bigger than the 3 tiny ass scallops I got on my plate. They weren't wrapped in bacon like the menu said along with the over cooked shrimp. Lobster was so over cooked you could bounce it off the floor. When I said something to our waitress, all she said was "Sorry". Nothing else was said an she walked away. We have visited many Joe locations throughout the south an this one is bare far the WORST one we've ever gone to.
