My husband works at one of the largest hotels in downtown Nashville and guest's always ask him where to eat an he said he will discourage any of his guests from eating at this location. We left hungry an that's never happened to us anywhere before. Stay away from this Joe's! Foods terrible, highly priced an you'll leave hungry!

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: ate here before my Shell fish issueGot There at 10 PM and they close at 10:30, no one else in the place. We asked if we could order and they said yep. I ordered the Crab and loved it. I was supprised at how well it was seasoned. Very happy I picked this spot. It just right off Broadway. Big place and the staff was great. Good stop for some good foodVisited November 2011

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: Great Crab. Drinks not so much. Pricey. Love the enthusiasm of the staff and the atmosphere. My wife an I eat here several time a year, food is consistently very good.

reviews.name: Terri V.
reviews.review: I went to Joe's crab shack in Florida it was so good . so when I came back to Nashville I took the Family expecting the same . It was just bad the parking 11 dollars but I didn't care . It was father's day when I went . 1st thing that happened they told us it would be ten minutes OK I'm fine with and we were the only ones waiting so 30 minutes later I ask how much longer because they said it was only going to be 10. So the lady ask my last name I said they never ask my last name needless to say other people had came and was already sitting down. The lady said they forgot about us. OK next we were ording food ask the server could we get one of the pots but with no pork because my son can't eat pork she said sure no problem. She brought the pot with pork inside I told her again my son can't eat pork she took the pot and brought it back like in 5 minutes I told her is that the same pot because my son can't eat it if it had pork , she takes it again 25 minutes later after everyone was done eating she brings my sons food back. I ask for more drink after she came to the table 2 times and did not ask if I wanted more drink and my glass was empty. She takes my glass goes one way then 10 minutes later she goes past my table with my empty glass in her hand. Then maybe 5 minutes later she brings my glass back . If that wasn't enough my shrimp was over cooked and had a burnt taste . everyone else's food was good .

reviews.name: Don P.
reviews.review: I have been to Joe's in other cities and have always found it to be a great place for seafood. That being said, DO NOT GO TO THE ONE IN NASHVILLE and expect the same experience. I live in Nashville and really like seafood, so about a year or so ago, my wife and I went to Joes. The food was as always, very good, but the service was less than stellar. After a year, we decided to go back and try again. The first problem is that in the Nashville downtown area, there is little to no parking, so you have to pay 8$ an hour. Not a big deal, I figured an hour should be fine since the place did not look at all crowded. So we parked and went on in. We were ignored by the host as he continued to finish his conversation with another employee, but I figured that was probably something important, so I waited patiently. A couple minutes later, he seated us. We sat there for 15 minutes and no one even came to get our drink order. Now understand, from my table, I could see 9 employees, 5 of which were standing in a corner visiting with each other, and there were only 11 tables with people seated. So now here we are, 20 minutes into out hour parking and we have not even been able to get a glass of tea. So we left, and I suggest that if you find yourself in Nashville and want good food and good service, go anywhere else in the city, but skip Joe's Crab Shack for sometime in another location.

reviews.name: Tim B.
reviews.review: Never been to any of these before. Ok food. Got one of their crab pots. Crab not the freshest. Potatoes weren't done. Very hard. Overall ok, but nothing to right home about.

reviews.name: Brian B.
reviews.review: Meh, had better from this chain. I ordered some steamed bean town pot thing that was $40 full of two lobsters, clams, shrimp, corn, potatoes and corn on the cob. I have had these steam pots at other locations and have liked them. This one had two lobsters and the meat was a little gamey, might have been overcooked and between two lobsters, only one had one claw. Two lobsters and only one claw? The clams were supposedly a pound but at least 6 or more were closed on on delivery telling me they were dead before they were steamed and I know better than to force open shellfish and eat something that did not open on its own. No I did not complain but maybe I should have. Everything else was decent and the service was super good. And oh yeah, the parking lot right next to the place is a minimum of 4 hours for $25. $25???? What is this Chicago? That was  a rip and I should have hunted for something cheaper but did not know the price until I was parked and at the meter machine. Not cool.

reviews.name: Tabitha S.
reviews.review: Food is delish and always cooked right. I usually get the steamer buckets and the kids get the kids meals. We always have left overs too. The kids love the decor especially the huge shark hanging from the ceiling. Price is right and big portions. Service is great, fast, and friendly.Only con to this place is you have to pay about 10-15 bucks to park and walk to the front doors. This place would be so much better if it was not located downtown and had its own parking lot or offer valet. Im not sure if they offer valet or not but I would pay 10 bucks for someone to park my car instead of paying 10 bucks to park and have to walk with the family to the place. Im thinking they need to build one in the Boro! Yes, this would make me happy and probably even a loyal monthly maybe even weekly customer!

reviews.name: Emily E.
reviews.review: I was actually pretty disappointed by this location. I've been craving crab for a while and while in Nashville we decided to stop for dinner. The place was empty. The food was good, but the service was slow. Our waitress was super slow to bring things out or refill drinks. She never brought me the side of melted butter I asked for. She spent most of her time laughing and giggling at the waitress stand. Only after she took our payment did she offer us a refill... You know as we are getting ready to leave.. The crab was alright, I didn't get very much which kinda stinks for the price.

reviews.name: Stefinos L.
reviews.review: lobster and grab was good, the lobster was frozen food, which is maybe normal here in TN. the corn which came with the lobster was not very fresh.

reviews.name: Cammy M.
reviews.review: I'm giving Joe's Crab Shack 5 stars because the food was excellent and we love the atmosphere and location. I'm also going to give the manager working last night, Matt, 5 stars because of how he handled our concern.  We were a table of four. Me, my friend and two healthy, starving 12year old boys!! We had waited over an hour for our food.  The manager was summoned.  Matt went in the kitchen, cooked our food himself, brought it out, was polite, apologetic but what my friend and I both thought was great he told us to take our time and enjoy the food.  He comped our entire meal and checked on us later.  He knew how to handle that situation and he did and we greatly appreciated him and his EXCELLENT customer service. Thank you!

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Descent place, descent service, descent food. Nothing to get fired up about.  Get hush puppies!

reviews.name: Rhonda T.
reviews.review: We had a very good meal. The crab pots were delicious.  Always a good experience and Joe's!!

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: I know this is a chain, but with it's awesome location downtown I was really hoping for more-- in both the service and food department. The service was lackluster. It quickly became apparent the whole staff was getting ready to close up, nearly two hours before closing! It made us feel unwelcome and rushed. As for the food-- it's probably hard to mess up meals that are standard at their chains around the country--BUT we each ordered the lobster bisque that came out cold, lukewarm at best.If looking for food on Broadway-- I'd say check out a local place because at least you'd be paying for a unique Nashville experience.

reviews.name: Tamera C.
reviews.review: My office is now downtown so we decided to stop at Joe's Crab Shack this week for lunch. WOW that was disappointing. They have 3 or 4 items on their lunch menu that run about 8 bucks. Other than that you are paying 11-20 dollars for a meal. That is terribly over priced for what you are getting and how you are getting it. Service started out really slow and considering there was no one in there and several people working this should not have been a problem. After our server got to us he did a good job but then food delivery took too long considering I got chicken tenders and fries and my co-worker got the soup and salad. The waiter went on and on about how great their food was. I am sorry that I have to disagree. How in the world do you screw up chicken tenders? They were terrible. The oil they were fried in was old you could smell it. They were very small pieces of chicken that were tough, dry and kind of hard. This meal cost me $11, yes chicken tenders, fries and the coleslaw I asked them to keep. His salad was nice looking and the soup was ok (I did taste it). I will not go there eat again that is for sure and I will warn anyone that mentions going there.

reviews.name: Molly S.
reviews.review: I arrived in Nashville burnt out on BBQ, burgers, and anything deep fried - a state I never thought possible (thank you, Memphis!) I wanted a tasty meal that had not been in sight of a fryer and which would not write off my evening or break the bank.Joe's Crab Shack fit the bill. It's not downright cheap, but compared to London prices for seafood it seemed very reasonable. We started with crab nachos to share. While not out and out dreadful, this was a pretty bland dish and the crabmeat got lost in the mix rather than adding another level of texture and flavour. My tip - skip the starters!For a main, we shared two steampots - the Arctic Bay and the Ragin' Cajun. Both were absolutely delicious and full of meaty claws, lobster, prawns, clams, sausage, sweetcorn....all steamed to perfection with wonderful herbs and spices that really made their presence known.This is not fine dining - you will wear a bib, you will make a mess and a bottle of beer is probably your best bet to accompany rather than a dainty glass of crisp white. The service can be hit and miss and the venue is huge and sometimes a little rowdy.This is not cheap chain dining - while this is a chain, the prices certainly aren't rock bottom. I dare say there are places when you could get, for example, steamed crabs or oysters cheaper if you had the time to investigate further.But the quality of the seafood we feasted on was to be admired and it certainly made a welcome break from the heavier, richer fare we indulged in on our trip round the southern states. I wouldn't exactly avoid this place if back in town.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: It was cool, I will eat here again

reviews.name: Nicole U.
reviews.review: We arrived and we're seated immediately,  which I was not expecting, but to our displeasure our wait came after we had been seated: it took ten minutes for our waitress to come over to the table. No introduction, just "what are you drinking?" At that time we ordered our appetizer as well. She then returned with our waters and my husbands beer, and took our dinner order. At this point I get beer envy and I decided to also order my own beer. Our stuffed mushroom appetizer arrived by practically be slammed on the table and our waitress running off. No forks no plates..we then spent the next 9 minutes trying flag down anyone in order to get at least a fork. Literally we had people look right at us and turn around and walk away, others walked right past our table completely ignoring us. Eventually I was able to get a waitress to stop, but was accompanied by an eye roll. The hostess finally came over slammed a bucket with some utensils on the table with out a single word. At this point my beer has still not arrived. We then got our bibs, but before I can say anything she runs off..still no beer. Eventually my beer finds its way to my table with the lame excuse "they had to change the keg." Dinner has arrived, and don't get me wrong the crab is pretty Damn good. Our waitress finally begins to be very attentive on us..by dropping our check off while we are very clearly still eating and continues to come over to check on the bill.. still eating mind you. So I proceed to tell her that we are planning on ordering dessert later, and will need a menu. So she shows us the menu and leaves, not even 3 minutes later...STILL EATING OUR DINNER..she asks what we want to order. I honestly never felt so rushed in my life. Why would I want to order a ice cream dessert while I am still eating my crab legs. I will never return ..and don't recommend any one to go here! The service was THAT bad. I might give Joe's Crab Shack another try in another city but never Nashville.

reviews.name: Dae R.
reviews.review: My family called a few hours ahead to ask if we could reserve a table or two. The staff told us that they did not accept reservations and that we would just have to wait and see if they were full. So, we arrived to a mostly empty restaurant, and guests just standing around. When speaking with the other guests, it was learned that they had reserved tables. In fact, several parties had magically reserved tables! My family tried to get the attention of several wait staff, but many just walked by and pretended they did not see us. After having small talk with several families and looking into a half empty space for about 15-20 minutes, I finally asked to speak with a manager or hostess. The other families got seated, and we were told that it'd just be a few minutes until some tables were cleaned.After 10 minutes we thought our tables had been set, only for one of the wait staff to ask the same round of questions that we had been asked by three other staff members, just 15 minutes prior: How many, what's your group name, and can you hold on one moment while we get more information? The staff member told us that we had been wait-listed and then quickly made her exit. After 5 more minutes of looking over the same overpriced menu and having personnel ignore us, we did what they so obviously wanted us to do...We all left.When I think about it, I'm pretty sure that the restaurant wasn't expecting so many people on a Tuesday night. However, the staff made absolutely no effort to speak with the guests to explain their situation nor did they provide my family with any alternatives. We would've happily put in to-go orders to alleviate the front of the house, but no one bothered to come up to us. I know of several seafood restaurants in the Nashville area that have better pricing and quality food. I will be going to those from now on.

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: We recently ate here... Typical touristy food chain dining.  Overpriced and food was average.  I have ate at other locations which left a better impression in my belly.

reviews.name: Barbara C.
reviews.review: Worst service ever from the door all the way to my takeout order. These kids don't realize that we pay their damn salary. If you treat people like crap, what does that say for the business and the employee!  I'm over spending my money at places and being treated like its not good. Never again will I visit Joe's Scavenger Shack!

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: I don't need the big, loud scene that this place is to make me happy. I do need those steaming buckets of crab though.God was good to give the courage to that first man who was brave enough to suck out the insides of a crustacean, and He was good to give us Joe's.

reviews.name: Haze L.
reviews.review: I'm very unimpressed every time I come here with the waiter service. I would think this restaurant being in the heart of downtown and that you have to pay $20 for parking just to eat here that it would be a WHOLE lot better. The only reason I come is because I am a seafood lover, but the standoffish, neglectful attitudes of the waiters/waitresses is absolutely ridiculous and takes away from my experience every time. I no longer invite my first-timer friends here, because of the negative experience we have each time they even notice.

reviews.name: Chadd C.
reviews.review: I have eaten at this Joe's several times and had great food and service but today was a mess. The manager was in a daze and the place was falling apart. To bad I love the sunset grill crab.

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: I give five stars to the BBQ flavor crabs king or queen. now I KNOW this place is some corporate chain that im supposed to hate, but they have a few select items that are so fun! the crabs with BBQ flavor added is the bomb! get it with a limey beer!

reviews.name: Luke S.
reviews.review: We like the food at Joe's.  It's good for a food chain.  You can't go wrong with the crab steampots.  Choose your crab and rub flavor.  Our favorite flovor is Joe's BBQ.  Service is typically okay.

reviews.name: Sofia T.
reviews.review: I don't live in Nashville, but my mom and I were here for the weekend and we've been to Joe's elsewhere and liked it so we decided to go. I had the big shrimp dinner plate. It came with coconut shrimp, fried shrimp, and crab stuffed shrimp. I didn't really care for the crab stuffed shrimp but the other two were good! Service was very attentive and quick! It's hard to get good seafood in Tennessee, but Joe's has it!

reviews.name: Betsy H.
reviews.review: The only thing good here is the 2 for 1 beers on Thursday nights. You'd be much better off eating at Rippy's BBQ which is a few blocks down on Broadway.

reviews.name: Jeffrey C.
reviews.review: This place is great one of my favorite places to eat in Nashville. Amazing buckets. This is not a place for cheap skates ordering chicken baskets... it is a crab shack. Great staff that sing and do all sorts of stuff while you are there. Perfect location for all sporting events too.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Okay, so I went here with my coworker and her friend a few months ago. We thought it would be a good place since it was located across the street from a venue we were headed to later in the night. We figured if we got there early enough, we'd have an easier time getting a parking spot than immediately before the show. The entire thing was a big disappointment. They took forever to get us our food, the orders were wrong, the food was bad and the service was slow. We were all extremely disappointed. We had expected at least things like burgers to be safe bets, but we were wrong. The place was entirely empty too, which made it so they didn't have any excuse. I won't be back.

reviews.name: Archie R.
reviews.review: Crap.I got crabs in Nashville.Not as memorable as the time I got crabs in San Francisco though.But still, I got crabs.And that's all that matters I guess.Butter.

reviews.name: Jimmie N.
reviews.review: Ate here on Saturday night. Won't be returning. Food was OK but our service was subpar. Though I'm a 60 year old retired black man with a bit of gray hair,being asked for my ID to purchase beer was acceptable, the law and company policy.  But when I was asked for my drivers license when I presented the waitress (Katie) with a credit card for payment I was offended. Especially when the family sitting across from us (who happened to be white) used a credit card without being asked.  I won't be returning!!!!!!!!!

reviews.name: Brandon G.
reviews.review: Wasn't crowded and food was good.

reviews.name: Sissy D.
reviews.review: Don't go. This Joes use to be good about 3-4 years ago. It was a usual spot for me, but not anymore. The food has went south quality wise and the price has went up. Ordered fried clams only to be served a tall basket full of fries with a handful of clams on top, just unbelievable. Not worth it.

reviews.name: Mr Mrs J.
reviews.review: I took my family here Saturday night.  Fun atmosphere, very casual.  Servers looked like they're all having a great time.  Food is decent.  Crab legs were pretty good,  corn delicious, potatoes good.  My hubby loved the crabcakes and Chris loved the chicken fingers.  The garlic Mussels were really good, we killed it.  Can get a little pricey, for 4, our bill came to around $120.  Great frozen Margaritas!  The 6 layer chocolate cake was okay, not the greatest.  Worth going back, just watch what you order.  Parking after 6pm is $10 next to the building.

reviews.name: Misty L.
reviews.review: great drinks, friendly staff. didn't order food, but we will next time :-)

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: This is a fun place to go, but I will not order the Alaska Crab again. Not only was it way overpriced, but also not that good. Everything else was OK, but definitely a fun place because the staffs tried to put on a show to entertain its customers.

reviews.name: Meg D.
reviews.review: I gotta say, they've upped the ante! The nachos are back to their original glory!Thank goodness!Happy yelper here!

reviews.name: Sarah A.
reviews.review: Was craving a sportsman's cheeseburger yesterday, stopped and had one with my husband. Place looked a little slow for lunch, but  we were greeted at the door by our server, sat, with drinks ordered and delivered swiftly. My bottle beer was SOOO cold and tasty.  Food order was placed quickly and food was delivered fast. Our server was efficient and didn't stand around and talk (we hate when servers do that). He was there when needed and dropped check with perfect timing. I always get a cheeseburger cooked medium and ff or o'rings,but went with the slaw for something new. Food came and the burger was awesome as usual, bun was perfectly toasted, onions were perfectly grilled, and my burger was a nice pink medium. My slaw was horrible, it was looked and tasted like KFC slaw. My husband got fries as his side, and he had plenty to share. I love this bar and its burgers! I don't know why these people give it such bad reviews. ITS A PUB/GRILLE!! If you want a sterile bright restaurant with servers that act like robots and frozen food go to a corporate chain. There's plenty here in Nashville

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: This place may have had its glory days back in the1970s, but it's in rough shape now. Went Here to kill some time when Tennessee was playing at Titans stadium. Fruit flies and bugs flying all over the bar area.Then guy next to me, who ordered food, found a roach an inch from his plate.Place was sickening.Bartender said it's a 100-year old building and they've had exterminators here, but no luck. Avoid this place if possible.Did feel sorry for the bartender. She was sweet and couldn't do a thing to help the situation.

reviews.name: Laura H.
reviews.review: I finally checked out Sportsman's for happy hour with some grad school friends this weekend. While the 2 for 1/ Half off beer and $7 hamburger and fries got me in the door, I'm not likely to come back.I love an old building-- and the Sportsman is definitely that. A nice old-school vibe, kind of like cheers. Wouldn't be my pick on a sunny day though. Service was a little slow, but friendly. They've got a nice selection of beers for happy hour-- mostly Anheuser-Busch, but a couple local crafts as well. My burger was up to snuff but nothing special. Fries were soggy, so thats a huge minus from me. One of my table-mates ordered chicken tenders, and when he bit into his third tender it turned out to be a fish filet. Our server was polite to remedy the situation but the kitchen requested the non-eaten fish tenders be returned for proof. He didn't receive any sort of discount on his meal either. I found this mix-up quite disturbing mostly for food safety reasons. Kitchen staff should have things straight enough that a fish/chicken mix up wouldn't happen.

reviews.name: Addison S.
reviews.review: Five stars only because Lexie ,the evening bar tender downstairs  is incredibly accommodating, warm and friendly . rod and pat are also great  .  wonderful experience ever time . the servers and hostesses have always been very friendly .    chicken wings are bomb and drinks are well priced and strong.  Good job y'all!

reviews.name: Susan W.
reviews.review: I only give two stars because the food tastes  good. Save that, zero stars. The kitchen staff couldn't get their own names right, and the table service is horrible. They just don't care. After many sub par Sportman's meals, tonight was the last straw, and I will never go back. My sandwich came out with the toppings I asked them to hold and without the condiment I asked them to add. So I thought, no big deal. I'll just ask the server to get me what I ordered. That would have been fine... if the server ever came back to the table. Yep--just took our order and disappeared. We were without drinks for well over half of our meal, I never got my order corrected, and we actually had to hunt her down to get our check so that we could get out of there. They could be giving the food away and I wouldn't go back.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: Sadly it seems business most be going pretty badly.  Sportsman's used to be one of my faves.  On a Friday night they had no one there at 6:30pm.  Seriously like 3 tables.  They were out of several draft beers.  They have decent food, but it seems something needs to be done.  Their upstairs seems behind the times and slummy almost.  I stopped going there on Sunday's for NFL last year when the bartender lady was rude.

reviews.name: Shelby S.
reviews.review: Upstairs bar is the way to go. Whether it's Pat, Brad or Dianne they will take care of you.

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Why did I allow someone to choose this place?  I've been here before and each time it's a bad decision. This restaurant can only be surviving because of it's location. The food is mediocre and the interior is so dated and dark. Every visit the server seems bothered to have restaurant guests.The restroom was horrible. I've said before that the condition of the  restroom is a sign of how the kitchen runs and looks.  The dining room was slow, but the restroom floor was spotted with wet urine.Next time I put my foot down and say, "NO WAY!"

reviews.name: Gary H.
reviews.review: I've been coming to Sportsman's Grill for years! All three locations. They all have that warm and cozy feeling and the food is great, in a comfort food kind of way. One of my favorite choices is the BBQ on cornbread with fries and beans. Delicious!!!!! The cornbread is a sweet jalapeño type, cooked like a pancake. The fries are hand cut and wonderful! Good burgers too! I hear the catfish is good but I haven't personally tried it. I love their chicken tortilla soup. Yum!

reviews.name: Philicia C.
reviews.review: horrible!! We went in, it smelled bad and then we were seated and waited and waited -  a waitress never showed!! A table behind us was then seated and one in front, the same waitress picked up those 2 tables and didn't even acknowledge us! Never going back!!!

reviews.name: Roy S.
reviews.review: I've worked across the street at Vanderbilt for years and never bothered to visit Sportsman's. I finally went with a group of 4 co-workers yesterday. We mainly went for some drinks but ended up ordering food after a couple of hours.The first thing we noticed as soon as we walked in was this strong odor in the air. It smelt like stale smoke/food/sweat all combined.  You get used to it after a little while or that might have just been the alcohol dulling my sense of smell. Either way it wasn't an issue after about 30 minutes.I started off drinking vodka/cranberry. It was happy hour so my drink was in a tall glass and supposedly with a double shot of vodka.  I'm no alcoholic, I can almost count on both hands how many times I drink in a year. I had 5 drinks within a 4 hour period and had a buzz but nothing like I should've had after the equivalent of 10 drinks. I don't think I was getting double shots. I even confirmed it was happy hour with the bartender.  The rest of my group drank beer and they got their 2 for 1's in 2 separate glasses. After an hour, we moved from the bar to the patio. We were immediately greeted by a server. Nice guy, very happy but very forgetful. We ordered another round of drinks which came in a timely manner but then we didn't see the server for another hour. We had to go back inside to the bar to order more drinks. Not sure what the problem was as there were only 10-12 people in the whole place at the time. Once the server finally returned we ordered some food. Two of us ordered the buffalo wings and two of us ordered cheeseburgers and fries. The wings came out quick, like 10-15 minutes but it was a half hour before we got our burgers and fries. The wings looked and tasted damn near perfect, I'll get those next time. They were crispy fried and tossed in the sauce with extra sauce on the side. Yumm. The burgers were greasy but still good, cooked to a perfect medium-well. The buns were a little soggy but whatever. Unfortunately, all the grease had puddled on the plate right under the fries so they were extremely soggy and nasty.The prices were right on with every other bar & grille in that area. The wings were $9.99 and the beers were in the $2-$3 range. My mixed drinks were around $7 and the burger n fries were on the special of the day for $7.99.  The server was quick to come around and drop the checks off, before we were even half-way done with our food. I had to go back inside, yet again, to get another round of drinks before leaving.All in all, it's just OK. I mean, I would go back again but, only because its right across the street from my work. HA!

reviews.name: S M.
reviews.review: Still a great place for beer & burgers (or catfish). Not an exciting menu, but you can get a well-poured draft beer, a big juicy burger (not overpriced like so many in town), and decent service -- in a comfortable environment. It's classic Nashville holding up against the newcomers.

reviews.name: Parker H.
reviews.review: I have never EVER been to a place with such bad service. The food was decent (but a little overpriced). When we came in we waited for a hostess or waitress to seat us and no one was found. It took us over 2 and a half hours to get our drinks, food and then paying was the hardest part. I recommend going somewhere else for food, sportsmans was terrible.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Great for football games, great food and drinks (fried pickles are a must, and they have a great club sandwich).  Smoking upstairs, non-smoking downstairs.  Parking in the bank at night is no problem; and street parking is usually available during the day.  Bartenders are usually quite friendly.Classic favorite; will continue and continue returning.

reviews.name: Camrin W.
reviews.review: Just left here. Was on a late night food run with my boyfriend. Went upstairs, as the downstairs bartender told us to. Sat at the bar for approximately 8min. Watched the bartender serve other guests who even came up to the bar after us. Even came within inches of us & never said hello, be with you in a minute, nothing. We were never even acknowledged. Sad thing is, is I'm a bartender myself & tip really well. Oh well. We'll never go back there or anywhere where we don't feel welcomed. Maybe that bartender needs a new job.

reviews.name: Em S.
reviews.review: Not the best place to eat for vegetarians - they have some overpriced salad, onion rings, fried pickles, potato, and fries, most likely previously frozen like at most bars. Upstairs there's a dimly lit bar that has pool tables and TVs, but it is rather smokey. This place wouldn't be a terrible place to come to for drinks, I guess.On the plus side, it's super close to Vanderbilt - probably the closest place to walk to from the esteemed Medical Center.

reviews.name: Terry J.
reviews.review: Always slow service but amazing food.  Chicken tenders and cornbread are two favorites and all of their salad dressings are fantastic.  Good burgers and salads, too.  Atmosphere is lacking but everything on the menu is good.

reviews.name: Amelia V.
reviews.review: Great upstairs area for groups. Not sure if this is a pro or a con but you can smoke upstairs and rumor is you can even bring your dog! Strange!

reviews.name: Mark S.
reviews.review: Bad review time - I always start out with four stars and add or subtract accordingly. This place was my hang-out in the 70s and 80s when it was called Spats - I went there somewhat until 1992 when I went on a 9 year hiatus from alcoholic beverages. Went back in tonight after not visiting Sportsman's in about three years - the restaurant had been upgraded and looked much roomier, gone were the out of date ferns and dusty feel that the old place had.We were seated fairly quickly and after about five minutes of no attention the power went out. After power was restored the waitress came back in and took the other table in the room's order and looked at us - still no acknowledgement. By this time we'd looked at the menu to exhaustion. I noticed immediately that the prices had climbed significantly since my last visit; $11.99 for a Reuben and fries in Nashville? Other items were priced comparably. When I was ready to leave my father went up front and asked for service; the young man up there came in and took our order and about 25 minutes later our food came. The Reubens were cooked well and the cole slaw was simply okay. The server apologized for the delay and was very attentive during service.We probably won't be going back any time soon because of the makeover pricing; if I want big city pricing for a sandwich I'll go down the street to Noshville.

reviews.name: Andrzrej K.
reviews.review: U gotta get upstairs! This is where the fun happens, and you can smoke.I was impressed with the smoked applewood spoked bacon, smoked buns and smokey cougars at the bar asking me if Connecticut was in Canada. I didn't get their numbers, sadly, but I did find a place in Nashville that has good food and a great mix of people from students to hipsters to Memphis born-agains to Murfreesboro MILFS. In that order

reviews.name: Sarah W.
reviews.review: Where do I even begin?!We showed up for dinner and immediately noticed the place needed a major renovation. It smelled stale and looked less than clean.The waitress was nice and friendly as she greeted us and took our orders. I ordered the Ribeye Steak with two sides, Lima Beans and Mashed Potatoes. About 5 minutes after we ordered our waitress came back to tell me they were all out of the Ribeye. Ok, no problem. I then decided on the Teriyaki Chicken, which comes with a veggie-pineapple skewer and rice. I also added my Lima Beans again as a side. THEN about 10 minutes after that, our waitress comes back to tell me they're all out of Lima Beans. Ok. No problem. I told her I was fine just having the sides it came with. THEN about 3 minutes after that for the THRID time she comes BACK to tell my fiancé that the onion rings he ordered as a side had to be changed to something else because they only had 3 onion rings left. Ok. Do they have anything on their menu? As they were discussing his next choice of side, she then informed me there was also no more pineapple for my skewers. And she said it as a side-comment, like it didn't even matter! She giggled and walked away. Even after all this, we were still holding on to some hope the food was going to be good. Umm, nope. Once our food showed up, my Teriyaki Chicken had the pineapple-less, burnt skewer and no rice in sight. We waited about 15 minutes after our food arrived before we saw our waitress again, in which we told her about the rice. She said, "Oh yeah, it does come with that" and walked off. The chicken tasted like water. The skewer was decent. The rice (when I got it) was like eating straight oil.We were expecting some sort of accommodation for all the mishaps that went on, but nothing was offered.  Everything about this place is ew and gross. Saying we were disappointed is an understatement. Steer clear and save your money for Burger King. You'd probably get better service.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: The main problem I have with Sportsman's has been that I visited it with a group of people at 6pm on Wednesdays for years and nearly every time the service was so bad it was laughable (and we have many notes from the evenings about it too).What I learned on the patio over the years before our group left:1) If at a group, anyone pays and has to leave, you can expect service to stop to the table.  Your waiter will look occasionally to see if the rest of you are done.2) If seated and nobody has come to see you in 10 minutes they forgot you.  We ran the clock up to an hour and 15 minutes one time before going in to grab drinks, at an hour and 17 minutes we had a waitress.3) If it's 6pm / happy hour, you must order every drink you're going to want for the next hour at that point as you're most likely not going to get a second drink order in before happy hour ends at 7.4) No matter how you try to contact the manager electronically or by leaving messages, you will never get a call back unless you're wanting to rent the place out - we tried seeing if we could get an extension on the drink specials if we were bringing in an average of more than $200 a gathering, and were never able to get a second round of drinks due to nobody ever coming back out to serve us. Calls and emails went unreturned, so did our business.5) If you have a really good waiter, they will be gone and never back there the next time you're there.6) If you sit on the patio and there're 3 waiters working, you will be told that the reason service is so slow is that the 1 waiter you've got is also handling the largest table inside.  If you happen to go inside there will be one table of 6-8 people and another table or two of 2 people and no particular reason evidenced to why there's no way to get a second round of drinks before happy hour ends.7) If you have an event that will pay off immediately and not over the course of 4 -6 weeks in profits, you will receive a call in under a day.  Learned this when we had contacted them about how much money our group was spending and one of the group also contacted them for a private party for work.That's about that.  The food is average, there're a couple of vegetarian options and they're ok but not good bar food.  on a 2-4-1 they serve you both beers at once, which means they're warm by #2 unless you're a hardcore alcoholic.  I, and the group I'm with, want to love this place (it was home for years in spite of the service) but we've consistently been treated like we're an imposition, and the place is always less than 1/4th capacity when we're there so it's not like we're taking up space, and our bills and tips are high enough.That's my review, mostly seen from the patio as that's the reason we went to Sportsman's.  We have not been back in a while.Edit 10/20/2010 - service was good, still don't know why we went back - get there before it starts to suck again / current good outdoor waiter quits.

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Sunday night.  They're out of a third of the items we ordered.  Establishment?  Run down, smells like stale everything.  Server was nice and apologetic, which saved a zero-star rating.

reviews.name: Ali B.
reviews.review: The back patio is great. Its shaded so it is a good place during the heat of the day or at night.The Club sandwich is good (McAllister's Deli still has my heart for with their club). All the food is very reasonably prices along with beer on tap. I payed $10 for a sandwich and a beer. Not bad by my standards.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Best Hamburger in Nashville. They have a upstairs smoking section, and down stairs is completely non smoking. Both are completely separated. another review mentioned they had smokin there false. Just in the upstairs bar separate entrance and everything.

reviews.name: Yifei W.
reviews.review: Food was good but the menu was probably never updated since the 80's. If you want old-fashioned greasy greasy greasy barfood, you've found the right place. But for what you pay, you could probably go to a waffle house twice.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: *This review is for the secret bar upstairs... oh wait. damn.*Big fan of the smoky bar upstairs. It has never been so packed that we couldn't get a table and I appreciate a place where people aren't standing shoulder to shoulder and pushing their way towards the bar.  Great place for pool if that's up your alley, as well.Double points for having Gerst on tap!

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: This place gets the job done.Sometimes you need delicious bar and fried foods with a frosty cheap beer.  Enter Sportsman's Grille.I'm a big fan of their location that is on the West Side, which is definitely my favorite of the two.  The Vandy location was the first I ever went to, though.  Decorated with various dead animal heads, pelts and rich wood, it screams manliness.  The fare is typical bar food, burgers, fries, fried pickles, peppers, etc.  I am also a fan of their catfish, because clearly breaded and fried traif is going to keep me from getting too smashed.  It's a scientific fact.Upstairs is another area with a pool table and another bar.  There is also one of those terrible Jägermeister shot venting machines, for when you really need to get a jumpstart on making horrible decisions in a hurry.  If you haven't had Gerst Beer, which is now made by Yazoo I believe, they serve lots of it here cold, as this establishment is part of the Gerst family of restaurants.

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: The favorite watering hole for people from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center.  Frankly it has never impressed me.  The bar is crowded, cramped, and dark. The food is basic Americana and the dishes are fairly pricy at that.  Coming here thrice, I have yet to see someone purchase food besides appetizers.  The fried pickles are quite good, and are of a large enough portion to share, though beer and pickles is a good combination to make you feel sick. The biggest draw seems to be the happy hour 2 for 1 special for beer from 4:00-7:00.  Unfortunately lacking proper alcohol dehydrogenase enzyme makes me barely able to finish one.  If you want to hit a few drinks around Vandy, this is probably a good deal.  Everything else is kinda meh.  Stupid alcohol dehydrogenase.

reviews.name: Jemina B.
reviews.review: For some reason I find myself at Sportsman's every once in a while, and I have an excellent time. Each time I tell myself that I should go more often. One of these days I'll follow through with that. Anyhoo, Sportsman's is a great place to sit back, relax, drink with friends, and have an overall pleasant time. I usually find myself in the upstairs portion watching friends play pool, slip money into the jukebox, or stumble down the stairs. All of these are viable entertainment options when drinking. I promise I'll come back sooner than 6 months from now, Sportsman's!

reviews.name: Kate D.
reviews.review: Food ans service was great.Nice to see some full size pool tables upstairs.Even more suprised to see some gents who know how to rack.

reviews.name: Janet K.
reviews.review: This was my second visit here; only this time I was here for an event and it was held upstairs.  It is definitely and older establishment; lots of dark wooded paneling but very spacious and they have several tables as well as pool tables and dart boards.  The fried pickles here are really good but this time I was in the mood for a good cheeseburger.   Pleased with my choice; regular sized beef patty; not your usual flat frozen selection.  The fries were a little bland; some salt would have gone a long way.  The bathroom was a one stall and left a little to be desired.  For a bar this size you need more than onsie for the ladies.  A negative here is they allow smoking; and while I don't discriminate against the smokers; there was a lot of smoking going on here.  Opening a window or door would have helped.  Overall experience; typical sports bar; nothing to write home about.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I have been to the Sportman's Grill twice. I went only for the bar so I haven't tried the food yet. The first time I went, I was there during the happy hour. I was able to get 2 for 1 drinks which was sweet. The atmosphere was nice and grown. The female bartender was very nice and engaging the customers. The second time I went was after the happy hour. It was a little later in the evening so the bartender wasn't attentive at all. I was very disappointed. I was shocked that they allowed little kids to sit at the bar. I would like to go back again to check out the upstairs bar. I am kinda wary since they allow smoking up there.

reviews.name: Kevin P.
reviews.review: Service was okay, not great...as well as the food.  The Local Tennessean that I was dining with loved the Chicken Strips and baked potato,...but hey, anyone can make that! Otherwise mediocre food,  dark/dingy atmosphere with uncomfortable seats.  Our group of 6 ate here for lunch and, well, I can't remember what I had....and don't remember anyone else in our group saying they LOVED their meal....so, as Simon Cowell would say..."no one's going to remember you!!"  If not for its close proximity to the hospital....we probably would have eaten elsewhere.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: Close to work place. Decent food and drinks. Not so great.

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Love the upstairs bar. I went last night, smoked a cigar and ate wings and sliders. The wings are really good here. Crispy, good sauce, plenty of bleu cheese. Sliders were good too. The fact that you can smoke a cigar should give this place a 5 star rating, but the food is 3.5. Patrick the bartender upstairs is also consistently great.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: My first lunch back in Nashville - where to go?  Well, my brother suggested this place and all he had to say was "BBQ on Cornbread" and I was IN!  We were immediately seated which was nice since it was busy and during the lunch rush.  They have daily specials, sandwiches, entree items, salads, etc.  Pretty much something on the menu for everyone.  But I came here for one reason only - pulled pork on cornbread.  I got that with a house salad instead of fries because I'm trying to cut the fried food for a couple of months for the sake of that pesky high school reunion coming up.  They brought the salad out first and I thought it was going to be a tiny side salad but this was an entire plate of salad with lettuce, tomato, chick peas, cheese, cabbage, etc.  I got the yogurt honey mustard which is just made with yogurt instead of that evil white substance - mayo!  Pretty good salad actually, but way too big so I didn't eat even half of it.  Now on to the star of the show - pulled pork on cajun cornbread.  First off, this cornbread was not cajun or spicy at all, and although they were tasty griddle cakes, they were just ok.  The pulled pork surprised me though - this was some good meat! (That's what she said!)  I didn't even really sauce it up that much (sauce was too sweet, but the meat didn't need it anyway) and I still loved it.  I eventually finished the pork while leaving the cornbread on the plate.  Still, that was damn good pork.  I guess fitting for my welcome back to Nashville.Service was friendly although the food came out slooooow.  I think it may have just been busy.  Atmosphere was very hunting lodge-esque with stuffed animal heads, dark woods, etc.  Apparently upstairs there's a bar area that allows smoking and has pool and darts and stays open late night.  Sounds like my kind of place!Overall a solid lunch spot and possibly a solid late night spot too.

reviews.name: Beef Eaters U.
reviews.review: Last week's BEU Nashville was well attended with a good mixture of regulars and some new faces...about 20 meat eaters (and Kim) in all.  We braved the apocalyptic ice storm that never came to sample the burgers at Sportman's Grille in Hillsboro Village.  I made the move from BFE, KY to Nashville 13 years ago and somehow never managed to stumble into Sportsman's before Tuesday night.  I can promise it won't take me near as long for a return trip as this was personally my favorite so far.  In an attempt to offset the freezing temperatures, I ordered the Cajun Roasted Pepper Burger that came with red and green peppers, grilled onions, pepper jack cheese and Cajun spices.  It wasn't super spicy, but the Cajun spices and toppings were excellent and the burger exceeded my expectations.  I thought the fries were good, although a little soggy and the only thing lacking most of the night was the service.  It wasn't terrible, but no less than three people enjoyed Trisha's drink in their lap.  Accidents happen, and let's face it...only the writers/artists we work with are harder to please than we are.  Glancing over the scores it appears most folks thought the bun was better imagined than in reality.  Manti Te'o understands.  As for this whole Super Bowl thing, all you need to know is Kim Stephens picked the Niners over the Ravens 30-14 and he was a statistician for the NFL for years.  Kim knows his stuff.  Couple that with having a relative of Patrick Willis at the table (and they're my favorite team) and it looks like a lock that the 49ers improve to 6-0 in the one that matters most.  To the scores...- Jeff SkaggsAPPEARANCE 8.411765PATTY COOKED8.235294OVERALL TASTE8.941176CREATIVITY OF BURGER7.470588BUN7.058824TOPPINGS8.058824PRICE7.647059SERVICE7.411765WHO WILL WIN SUPER BOWL:SF beats Ravens (10 for SF, 7 for Ravens)OVERALL TOTAL7.904412

reviews.name: Simply S.
reviews.review: I love this place. 5 STARS for the food .. for sure!!  I only gave it 4 stars because our last 2 servers have been HORRIBLE.  The reason I am so in love with this place .. #1 -- I discovered how amazing their salads are ... and now I never want to go anywhere else for a healthy lunch.  ALso,  my order is always complicated and very specific and never once has anyone messed it up!!!  I kinda of do a mixture of 3 of the salads .. and I have a food allergy, etc.  Never once have they messed up!#2 - They have this amazing patio that no one seems to know about!! Once this horrible Cicada invasion is over .. I'll be back to my little patio hideaway :)  I've also heard the upstairs is a great place to hang out late ..with pool tables,etc. But a sports bar isnt' really my "Scene" so I haven't checked it out yet!

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: Upstairs Bar=5 starsFood=3 stars (good, but the quality doesn't quite match the price)This is one of my regular places in the Village.  The upstairs pool room, while smoky, is a great room and fantastic for large groups.  I've attended many birthday get togethers here.  The bartenders are great.  Pat makes one of the best martinis in town!The jukebox is one of those internet jobs, but the single credit options are fantastic!  And if you can't find it, you can always download it for an extra credit.

reviews.name: Em P.
reviews.review: I've never sat at a proper table in the bottom restaurant, but I've had quite a few pints in the upstairs bar. Sportsman's was on a list of places I've always liked, but never seemed to think of when looking for a place to go... until recently when I started playing trivia there every week. Now it's on the rotation of regular spots. The food is REALLY good for a bar, and the menu is large (not really varied though). I have never received a meal I didn't like, and some things are even noteworthy like the handcut fries, juicy burgers and perfectly fried chicken and/or catfish. The bartenders are always great upstairs, however the table service is awful, so just order at the bar. It's great for groups up there versus the restaurant downstairs. Downside is it can get REALLY smoky up there, and there are basically no windows to air it out. Sometimes I miss living in a state where is illegal to smoke in bars, but it is what it is.TV's aren't the best for gamewatching, but they have the proper sports cable packages if you need to camp out in front of one to watch a particular game. Price for an hour of pool is a little steep, especially with H. Cue's right across the street. Still beats playing with quarters though!

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: I'm a big fan of Sportsman's for the bar food.  Their sliders are magnificent--they are on the starters part of the menu, but I eat them for a meal!  They are basically gourmet Krystal burgers.  Lovely!  Also, their fried pickle slices are divine.  I am a huge fan of fried pickles, have had all kinds, and these definitely rank in the top 3!  Dip them in ranch and they are extra special.  As for drinks, hey it's a sports bar--I usually just get beer.  They do have a full bar though.  And both upstairs and down, their bars are huge and well-staffed.  I've never had a problem with service there.  I generally enjoy the upstairs, because that is where the pool tables and extra big screen TVs are, and my friends are typically up there.  But be warned, it's pretty smoky.  Overall great place to hang out, watch sports, and chow on some much better than average bar food!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Because of its proximity to Vanderbilt University Medical Center, this can be a very busy place unless you come around 11 for Lunch.  Also, because of this, parking is abysmal.  The closest lot is actually for Suntrust Bank.  I've never had them tow my car, but they threaten it quite liberally.  The ACTUAL Sportsmans lot is a tiny thing behind the gas station across the street.  Its clear that they expect you to walk from Vandy.  The food itself can be of very inconsistant quality, from delicious to poorly prepared.

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: So if you're looking for a place to catch up after a long work week with some friends for happy hour, and you're not offended by moose heads hanging on the wall, then Sportsman's might just be the place for you.  It's certainly nothing fancy...it has quite the lodge feel (think Gaston in Beauty and the Beast), but they have a decent selection of beers on tap, and they happen to be 2 for 1 from 4 pm until 7 pm on weekdays.  There are also specials on a couple of appetizers during this time...wings, jalapeno poppers, and nachos.  They have a decent selection of typical American cuisine/pub food, and everything that I've tried has been good, even if a little greasier than things that I would normally choose.  All in all, a pleasant happy hour experience but nothing to really write home about.  And, unfortunately, at Sportsman's, it doesn't pay to Discover.

reviews.name: Bryan L.
reviews.review: Lodge like atmosphere with good selection of bar food and beers

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: This Sportsman's location definitely has much more going on since it is in Hillsboro Village. The food is the same as their other locations and is good as far as bar/pub food goes. If you are looking for a large crowd, this is a good place to go. It's friendly; it's laid back. Lots of college kids, but there seem to be a fair amount of regulars as well. They have their amazing fried pickle chips. What is not to like? Parking is the only thing that confuses me about this location. I think there are some spots in a lot somewhere...but I never can seem to find them. I did find some street parking the last time I went in. I believe they went with the smoking-ban so the inside is smoke-free. Nice. A good place to go for happy hour.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Tuesday 2 for 1s on various libations.  Alternatively, I would generally opt for Mafiosos if you are in the 23-33 age group.If you want to watch the game.....this is NOT the place.  TVs are beyond TERRIBLE.

reviews.name: Katherine M.
reviews.review: This place has great bar food. But beware - the food is ultra greasy. Even seemingly menu items like the turkey grill sandwich is swimming in grease, though delicious. But, when you want this type of food, you can't beat Sportsman's. Everything on the menu is good. I love their cheese dip. And of course they are famous for their burger. I have heard many people say it's the best in Nashville. The menu also offers soup, various hot and cold sandwiches, and even salads. Mind you the salads are topped with mounds of cheddar cheese, but hey - at least you're getting your veggies!!They have a great beer list. Everything you could think of and more. In the fall this place is really fun because they have tons of big screen TVs, so whatever is the game to watch that week, it's on at Sportsman's. The patio is perfect for dinner and drinks with a group. And you can't ask for a better location, right in the heart of Hillsboro Village. Eat dinner here than walk to any of the local hot spots around. Or, pull up a chair and watch your favorite team. Either way, you can't go wrong!

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: Sportsman's is one of Nashville's casual dining traditions.  The dark wood-panel walls and the masculine interior make for a chill place to drink some beers and grab a fairly inexpensive, tasty meal.  Most would characterize the food as "bar fare", but several selections far surpass any bar food I've eaten in Nashville (barbecue on cornbread sandwich, catfish basket, patty melt, and steak & biscuits are my favorites).   Sportsman's fresh fries are consistently tasty.Upstairs is 21st Century Pool Hall, which is still a smoking venue.  Friendly bartenders, good beer selection, and ample seating are the main reasons we come here.  You can order food from the Sportman's menu, but there are no servers upstairs, so you place your order with the bartender.

reviews.name: Ron M.
reviews.review: Great service, very friendly waitress, and the food prices were reasonable. The menu has a lot to chhose, and the atmosphere is great for a sports Grill.

reviews.name: matt c.
reviews.review: The Grille in the Village is great for animal lovers -- especially the kind that love animal trophies on the walls and divers, delicious animal parts on the menu. It has a dark pub-style interior, Gerst on tap, and is dependable for airing soccer games, among other sports on its many (but mostly muted) televisions. The television at the bar is the only one bought after 1980, and the only one over 14". As a snack or starter, I like the pickle chips; you only need a few but they give you a whole basket. I also like the options for small meals, like a cup of red beans and rice w/ sausage for 4.50.

reviews.name: Dianne W.
reviews.review: MLB package? They've had it for at least two years cause I've been watching the games there. They also have college game day package and sunday's NFL package! As of TV's? They have all flat screens with the exception of two downstairs and they have a total of 17 up and down. They have happy hour every day 4 to 7 with half off wings and nachos, 2 for 1 every sunday all day and Monday til the games over, 2 for 1 all on tues, five dollar cheese burgers with fries on Monday, friendly staff and great atmosphere up and down. What the heck else could you ask for??!!

reviews.name: Oliver G.
reviews.review: They do fried frozen as food as well as anyone, a little greasy but edible.  Nice patio for outdoor dining, good service.  Try the fried pickles!

reviews.name: Taylor W.
reviews.review: How you can call your bar Sportsman's and then not have the MLB package is beyond me.  Had some good times on Tuesday nights though, so they get an extra star for that.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Are you in a hunter's trophy room? Nope, you are just at Sportsman's. Though at night it's populated by the Vandy crowd usual to most of the Village bars, I still have had some good times here. I would never end up at Sportsman's if it wasn't that a friend's band has played there a couple of times, but it always seems to fulfill its promise: booze and bar food. If you just want to come for the promised food and booze but want skip the onslaught of undergrads (most who cannot possibly be 21) I would get there early. Late at night be prepared for the ensuing faux fraternity sorority exchange that you will find yourself in.

reviews.name: Cheryl K.
reviews.review: Typical pub, everyone smokes like chimneys in here, and the furniture lay-out is not very crowd-maneuverable which was kind of annoying. Drinks seemed okay and the bar was extensively long. Well-lit, didn't seem to be any dancing. Not bad of a place to hang out.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Its nothing special, but the waitstaff is friendly, the crowd young, a good happy hour scene, tasty pub food.  Overall, a jovial, easy experience.

reviews.name: Janet A.
reviews.review: Absolutely my new favorite hotel and steakhouse. The ambiance can't be beat along with spectacular food and customer service. Chef Brian came to the table to introduce himself and make sure he heard our dietary request first hand. The waiters Grant and Wayne were outstanding Grant waited on us the other day too. He is one of the best waiters I've ever had. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: G C.
reviews.review: Went here last night for a business meeting. The menu was very limited and I wanted a slight modification performed to an entree because I have a food allergy. The waiter explained that he needs to "check with his captain" and that it wouldn't be a problem. 20 minutes later he comes back and says that his captain told him no. We had to continuously ask for drink refills, including wine. Very disappointing considering the premium price you're paying. It's a very interesting atmosphere, but unfortunately I wanted a positive dining experience from start to finish - they did not deliver. If you need modifications to dishes for any reason, I would advise against going here.

reviews.name: Kelly G.
reviews.review: In town for a vacation staying at the hotel.  Went looking for a nice dinner location for dinner and this was lovely. Ambiance was great and the good was delicious.  Probably the best creamed spinach I ever had.  Well worth having dinner here.

reviews.name: Katie McHugh P.
reviews.review: I give this restaurant a 5 star rating!  Out of the 4 people in our party, 3 of us ordered the Filet Mignon, which was cooked & prepared to perfection!  (Better than any steak I've had a Ruth's Chris restaurants!)  Our waiter, Anthony, was very attentive, and the General Manager, Mike, even stopped by our table afterward to ensure our dinner was to our satisfaction and expectations.  I will definitely recommend this restaurant to others, and will visit them again when in Nashville!

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: I really want to give the old hickory steakhouse a four stars instead of three. They are RESERVATION ONLY!! Old hickory advertises that they are a five star steakhouse. I personally have been a five star steakhouses and eateries like LE CURQUE, and ALIZE in Vegas. smith and wollenskys, Morton's and the palm. This place should not be advertised as 5 star. The old hickory steakhouse was definitely not a five star steakhouse. They do not compare to any of the other places that I have been that have been five star. I went here with six people for dinner. The waiter was extremely nice and accommodating I had no problems with the staff whatsoever. I started with the lobster bisque. I really did enjoy the lobster bisque and it was definitely worth the price. For my meal I ordered the 8 ounce filet. Which was $46 the filet was good but I have had better at Morton's or the palm for around $30. I don't know what these people are thinking charging $46 for a fliet. I could see a ribeye being $46. I should have just ordered another bowl of the lobster bisque. At our table there was 1 person out of the six that had 2 drinks. When the meal was over the bill came to $1,100 for six people we had 2 appetizers and 2 soups and our meals. I thought it was going to be around $700 but for $1,100 for basically no alcohol. I thought was a bit much. Like I said the staff was great. If you want to eat here I recommend just getting soup. Unless you like to overpay for steak. PROS:- quiet and secluded- soup was goodCONS:- overpriced food. - Reservation only. - not a 5 star steakhouse!

reviews.name: Scott M.
reviews.review: Just had dinner here last night with a group of six.Everything was just perfect,we all was impressed with the service and food.I had the rack of lamb which was just delicious!Everyone else had a form of the steaks which they are known for and everyone was just very pleased with the taste and size of them.Will be back!!

reviews.name: Amber P.
reviews.review: Fabulous food, staff, and restaurant!  Best filet I have ever had!  Executive Brian is ready to accommodate your every desire!  All of the staff is top notch!

reviews.name: Claudine V.
reviews.review: We came here for business dinner and had a great time.We had the following:1) rib eye steak- good but not flavorful enough. Needed more salt but overall was okay . $46 for 22 ounces. 2) foie gras- good but I had better in Carmel, CA3) crab cakes- they were okay but not as flavorful as the ones I had in Monterrey 4) Brussels sprouts and carrots- good sides to have5) braised lamb shank- tender but not very flavorful6) Malbec wine- very good Overall the food here was good but not very flavorful. And for the $$$$ I was expecting  for the food to be spectacular. However, the service and the ambiance is great. To get here, once you enter the lobby, make a right and the restaurant will be at your left. If you take a left from the lobby, you will have to loop around for about 20 minutes but you get to see the whole hotel which is great to see with all the decorations during the holidays.

reviews.name: Andrew E.
reviews.review: Great food, great atmosphere, great staff. Little slow with food though. Was a little disappointed in how long it took to get our main course, besides that everything was great.

reviews.name: Carl W.
reviews.review: Nice ambiance friendly knowledgeable staff. Had 2 dirty martinis very good, highlight was the artisan cheese bar and wine pairing. Kimberly was very knowledgeable on the cheeses and the wine to pair with them. The meal my wife and I split was a 22oz cowboy ribeye with crab topping asparagus and sweet butter golden mashed potatoes. I have had better ribeye for half the price, steak was fairly bland except for the crab topping and full of gristle, mashed potatoes about the best I've had asparagus was asparagus. It was my birthday the comped a very delicious desert, I believe it was a chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream.  Had a bottle of Melbec with dinner it was OK. Being we like wine and have fairly good knowledge of wine prices felt there's were quite expensive. Over all it was a nice experience but overpriced. However it is a tourist attraction.

reviews.name: Jen I.
reviews.review: We wanted to treat ourselves to a nice dinner and this was a amazing choice! The staff made the perfect recommendations and were always there before you needed them.We all got the fillet, one of us got the bone in filet - all of us agreed it was one of the best filets we've ever had. I highly recommend the  Oscar option as it was AMAZING and came with the best asparagus I've ever had! We also got 2 appetizers - the asiago potatoes and a cauliflower dish - both were equally as delicious! It was pricy but the food and experience was worth it!

reviews.name: Naomi S.
reviews.review: From the moment we sat down we could tell this was going to be a great meal. Milad was an assistant to our server and he was super friendly as well as very attentive. Our server Tim was very knowledgeable and also very friendly and attentive. The Chef Mike came to our table to see if we enjoyed our meals. Maggie had the lobster caviar potato salad. It was amazing and I had the surf and turf and ate it all. Amazing place anyone should try when going to Nashville.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: The service here was wonderful. I was a little upset that the cheese tasting was unavailable for the night, but quickly forgot once our good came. The drinks were superior, the food was fresh, and the atmosphere was pleasant. I enjoyed the low lighting very much. My finances steak came out over cooked at first, but was quickly remedied and brought out by the chef himself. I highly recommend the creamed spinach for a side, and the fresh squeezed lemon drops! We spent about $400 before tip for 4 adults - which included about 3 rounds of drinks. The restaurant will validate your valet parking, which saves you about $30. This is a must for fine dining in Nashville!!

reviews.name: Scott K.
reviews.review: The service was very kitschy and over the top with stories of Taylor Swift and 100 year old recipes. Had the lobster and corn bisque (one of the original dishes of this establishment) which was one of if not the best bisque I've ever had-thus the three stars. Has the 22oz Porterhouse. It was cooked perfectly to order but like everything else at this hotel was too salty. The sides included creamed spinach which again was one if the best I've had anywhere. However, the cauliflower with tahini and cranberries was awful. Did t have room for dessert. Should've stopped at the bisque.

reviews.name: Maggie F.
reviews.review: Yes, this place is very expensive... My bill was $84 for my dinner alone. It is, however, well worth it.  Wayne our server was amazing, he gave us details on the specials, broke down the menu and anticipated our every need. We were a group of 5 that needed to split our bill 3 ways, no problem! I had the salmon, he said it was flown in directly from Scotland.  I dunno about that but I can tell you it was fantastic. It was perfectly seared and seasoned, laid on a bed of mashed potatoes and broccoli. I also had a tomato salad on a bed of arugula. The wine was very good. They have an extensive list and I had a Pinot Noir from the Willamette valley. They also have a cheese sommelier that will explain all of their cheeses and you can select 3-6 for a tasting.The vegetarian meal was also worth noting. A bed of Israeli couscous topped with a variety of sauteed veggies. My friend said it was very good. Dessert was beautiful; we had bananas foster and their specialty, chocolate hazelnut mousse torte. So light and chocolaty, there aren't words to describe it. The bananas foster was good too but it paled by comparison.Basically, if you want a nice, "fancy" dinner with excellent service and food,  come here, just know you'll pay for it.

reviews.name: Charles J.
reviews.review: We stopped at this place because of the bar.  It's called the "Library" and it has very nice seating with comfortable chairs.  It has a formal living room feel to it.  It's not that noisy so it's perfect if you want a drink and good conversation.   There are sports bars around but this is nice for a casual visit with friends or business associates.A good place to just wind down.

reviews.name: Martin S.
reviews.review: Great food and very attentive staff. Very personable. The side portions are huge. Everything is a la carte. Very expensive. I love the steaks at The Palm and Ruth' s Chris but somehow the the filets my wife and I had were d.....licious. I ordered a peppercorn sauce to accompany the steak and I did not use it. The steak needed nothing. Enjoy but bring $$$$..

reviews.name: Tom G.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere and wait staff but overpriced for a good but not great meal. Was glad it was a business vs personal dinner!

reviews.name: Bonnie C.
reviews.review: We had a very nice meal, with wonderful food.  Two people in our party had the salmon, very tasty, two of us had steak, great.  The streak come with a choice of different toppings (for an added cost) but provides and very nice added flavor.  The side with the meal were good especially the brussell sprouts.  Coffee and dessert completed our meal.  Overall a great dining experince.

reviews.name: K C.
reviews.review: I ate here two nights in a row and was greatly pleased.  The first night my steak was overcooked; however, I am still giving 4 stars because they remedied the situation extremely fast.  Once I got a new steak, rare just the way I like it, I was pleased.  It was buttery, lean and delicious.  Before that, I had the tomato salad. I expected a little bit more, as it was bland and the heirloom tomatoes weren't that sweet.  We shared three sides: lobster mac and cheese, onions and mushrooms and the broccoli rabe and carrots.  The lobster mac and cheese wasn't as tasty as I expected it to be.  I think they missed some seasoning in that batch.  The other two veggies were outstanding, with the onions and the mushrooms being my favorite. I could have just eaten a side of that.  The second night we started with the Oyster Rockefeller.  Be warned, the oysters are not sitting on a bed or seasoned breadcrumbs, it is SALT! I completely ruined my oyster by sprinkling some on top.  I had the same steak the second night(can you tell I am a filet girl?) and it was equally delicious.  Before dinner, I had a Belevedere martini and our server was so nice to get me blue cheese stuffed olives, even though I was told they didn't have them(I wish I remembered his name as he was fabulous, and sang me Happy Birthday at well.  Dined on May 15th around 7:30).  The dessert was a chocolate ganache with fresh whipped cream and it was the most delicious dessert. I ate the whole thing, as no one from the table wanted a bite. The wine list in good, not too overwhelming which is good. Nice blend of varietals.  I would like if they poured a better sparkling in the glass, however.  My only negative would be it gets so dark in there at night that it is hard to see your plates, hence taking salt for breadcrumbs.  It would be nice to have a little more light.  I would recommend the restaurant again for sure.  If you are attending during a conference, please make reservations.  There were people that were attempting to walk in and no tables were available.  Oh, the library is a perfect to have a cocktail prior to dinner. Thanks for a great experience!

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Great place to eat at the Gaylord. I had a steak that melted in your mouth. Everyone is so nice at this place. One of the reasons I love Nashville. I would suggest you make a reservation. This place is packed. I sat at the bar where you can get the full menu. Its a must while in Nashville.

reviews.name: Brittany Y.
reviews.review: Loved the shrimp cocktail and crab cakes! Yummy bread served before dinner. The wedge salad wasn't my favorite, but still appetizing nonetheless. Loved the 8oz fillet with béarnaise sauce, served medium. One of the best I've had in awhile! All of the sides were great- we had them served family style. My favorites were the Mac and cheese (had a unique smoky flavor) and the fries! I would definitely go here again! We left very full and satisfied.

reviews.name: Dave L.
reviews.review: First, be prepared to drop coin, a lot of coin.This is the most expensive place at the Gaylord, however they do not hide the fact that it is. Had two different dinners here with clients and all total combined was 10 total people with a $1800.00 dent.Each time we had great waiter. I do apologize for my CRS moment as I have just drew a blank on his name. I asked for him each time. He was from Cairo where my main base was during the Army. With this, we clicked and talked about days through the country and North Africa so attention was way above par. 5 star.The menu is rather limited, which is a good thing. IMO a large menu offers different fare selections at mediocre quality. Limited menu means less options but great food. Naturally I had the fish dish others steaks. All side items like the lobster mac was spot on.The check tally grew with the wine. The wine list was very good. Black Tears was the choice. Decanted and pouring on! 5 bottles later we were all in a happy mood. If you have a question here they have a person on staff to suggest make and vintage. Question about your meal, heck the chef will come out.Overall I think the Gaylord itself is way overrated, however Old Hickory is excellent and good as it gets.FYI, make sure you make reservations well (I did 3 weeks) in advance. This will A) get you in and B) provide you with seat selection of choice if you know the restaurant layout. My suggestion is make a reservation for the patio corner. This will provide privacy and a good view of the fake outside/inside. Arrive about 30 minutes early and enjoy the bar. It is great too.

reviews.name: April S.
reviews.review: Very pricey! Worth it. (80-90$/person) The food was excellent, nice dark atmosphere, service was "ok", the waiter was very knowledgeable. Nice cheese and wine selection. The 8oz center cut filet is small but delicious. We did not try any of the few desserts they had because they did not look good to any of the 8 of us. However,  we were all stuffed.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: First, be prepared to spend $$$$ (at least $60 per person, plus alcohol).  With that said, you are in the Opryland hotel and know what to expect.  Plus, it's enjoyable to walk through the atrium while you wait for seating.  Now, with all that said...:This restaurant is a true gem.  Very classy and elegant, and the food does not disappoint.  Women will be seated, waited upon, and served first, something I expect from a restaurant of this caliber.  The steak (at at least $35 per plate) was absolutely perfect.  Deliciously seared on the outside, my medium rare steak was prepared to perfection with the juices sealed in.  Great wine selection.  Sides are about $10 and meant to be shared (blue cheese potatoes au gratin are to die for).  Highly recommend a side of mushrooms for your steak in lieu of the mushroom with bacon topping.Perfect for a special occasion - anniversary, etc.  Will be back when the time is right.  A rare 5-star rating.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
