reviews.review: I will start out by saying this is not an inexpensive place to eat.  However, the food and service more than match the price you pay.  I had probably the best steak of my dining-out life at this establishment with truly fantastic service.  Plus, it was my first chance to really explore the Opryland Hotel, which to quote my companion, was like being at Disneyland.  Parking in pricey at the hotel so I suggest walking over from the Opry Mills Mall.  The hotel itself can be very confusing (there are three gardens, which I didn't know until I was lost in them) so if you make reservations here be sure to give yourself enough time to find your way around, especially on the weekends when wandering around becomes impeded by lots of children and families.  The restaurant has patio seating, which isn't actually outside, just overlooking the garden, which is really nice.  Its romantic and relaxing and good for any season.The service was top-notch, our drinks constantly filled and our food delicious.  My steak was perfect, and I recommend getting sides to split between two to four people (that had to be the largest asparagus I've ever seen).  Even their baked potato was gigantic.  They also had the best creme brulee I've ever had in my life.  And their after-dinner cocktails are truly fun.Do not come here and expect to not spend money.  Steaks can run upwards of $40-$50.  The sides alone are $10 (but again, they are HUGE).  This is a place to go for a special occasion.  I really enjoyed being able to sit "outside" by a garden in the dead of winter.  The hotel is a beautiful setting for a great meal.  I will absolutely be coming back to this great little steakhouse gem.  If I could remember our servers name I would tell you to request him, he was perfect.

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: I went to with a group of men on business and everyone thought their prime steaks were delicious but the lamb was gamey. We really enjoyed the ala carte  sides, the lobster Mac was the best.

reviews.name: Steve W.
reviews.review: Rude Hostess. Manager made no apology. Will not return.

reviews.name: Glenn B.
reviews.review: I just had my second experience at The Old Hickory, and it was fantastic.  If you're looking for Outback prices, this isn't the place.  If you want something that you'll remember for a long time because of the food, ambiance and service...I believe it's worth every penny.My first experience was maybe 5 years ago, and included the Maitre Fromager with her artisanal cheese cart.  I've literally retold that night to all my friends and have thought about that cheese cart often.  She wheels up the cart, with some 30 or more choices on it, then through a series of questions, pairs cheese to your taste, then adds in little accoutrements to accent the cheese.  (That's right...I worked in the word "accoutrements."  Cuz that's how I roll!)  Superb.The steak was exceptional.  Our server was top notch.  The wine list is "Grand Canyon" wide and deep.  It was pouring rain outside, yet we sat  "outside" (in the atrium) and felt like we were dining on the veranda of a mansion with the jungle as our backdrop.  Yowza.  Now to dream of this place for another 5 years.  Huh.

reviews.name: Scott A.
reviews.review: My team and I were here for an event and stopped in as a walk in one night. This was the best meal in the hotel!I am a steak snob and my filet mignon was cooked perfectly! I recommend without any hesitation.Try the roasted cauliflower as well.I thought this Resturaunt was good. Yes, it's expensive, but where else would you go inside the Opryland?

reviews.name: Jonathan D.
reviews.review: I ate here two times. They have a great steak. I have only tried the filet. This is a must if your in Nashville. I will be back in the future to take the family. The price is a little high but worth it.

reviews.name: Albert W.
reviews.review: You get what you pay.   They meat that they use is from Harris Ranch in California.   Harris Ranch is also the beef supplier for In-N-Out.

reviews.name: Terry H.
reviews.review: Excellent food, excellent service.  My wife and I split a delicious New York strip and our friend had the lamb chops which she said were very tasty. We ordered family style asparagus and roasted potatoes which were enough to feed all of us. We also had Avery nice Malbec with our meal and the whole bill came to less than $250.00, which was well within our budget. I would highly recommend the Old Hickory Steakhouse for anyone who desires an outstanding evening.  On the service side our waiter was attentive without being intrusive, and was always there with a recommendation or to check on the meal. If there was any complaint at all it would have to be the assistant waiters who were a little too quick to remove the dishes, and they were a little over zealous in filling the water glasses.

reviews.name: Pamella B.
reviews.review: Bad experience!  Don't mind spending $200 for an extraordinary dinner experience; however, this was definitely not worth the money. So looking forward to a special night to celebrate the end of fantastic week in Nashville - bummer it didn't work out that way...

reviews.name: Jeff C.
reviews.review: Nice restaurant at the Gaylord. Service was excellent. Had the filet for dinner which was fair and not worth the 42.00 price.

reviews.name: Peter B.
reviews.review: Don't get me wrong the food was very good, as was the service. However, I have enjoyed some of the best stake houses around the country, I feel this was about 50% over priced.  $350+ for my wife and I was just too much for what was presented.  If money is no concern - enjoy.  If my bill was about $250 I would have felt better and given a higher score. It is about 4.5 on food and service but value is about 2.5-3.0.

reviews.name: Heather W.
reviews.review: Everything was delicious and perfectly prepared. The ambiance was wonderful. I would highly recommend!

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: The service was fantastic. I am not a wine drinker but my wife was not impressed with the wine list. We had NY strip, porterhouse, and bone in fillet. The Ny strip was seasoned well but the steak was average quality at best. The fillet was over salted and not tender. the sides were good. The asparagus was the best. This place was a good $50 steakhouse at a$125 price tag. The food was good but definitely not great.

reviews.name: Jason K.
reviews.review: We ate there the weekend the hotel reopened, thinking it would be a safe choice. Unfortunately, it does not compare to its cousin, the Old Hickory at the Gaylord Texan outside Dallas. We had to catch the Rockettes show at 8, so we ate at 5. Service started out very friendly, but moved along at a glacial pace. Two courses later, it was almost 7:30 and we were in danger of missing the shuttle bus to the Grand Ole Opry house. A lobster chopped salad had pretty good flavor though the serving size was less than a racquet ball. An onion soup was a reltively credible version, not too salty, yet full of flavor. The steaks, however, were quite a disappointment. My Kansas City strip was medium-rare as ordered, but tough and dry as leather (more like a tough Timberland working-class leather than a soft, buttery Connoly leather). There was no marbling at all (nor was there any fat whatsoever)...what grade of meat was this??? At $44, you would think it would be a dry-aged prime, but I suspect not. The steak was hardly edible even when drowned in the steak sauce (2$ extra for two tablespoons!!). My wife's 8 oz filet suffered from the same malady though fortunately, there was less of it to down.As time ticked on, we finally tracked down our waiter who had originally been friendly. We timidly mentioned that we were in a hurry and wouldn't be having desert. I wonder if he took this as some personal insult because we were shortly being shown out the door with nary a tank you or any acknowledgement at all (ever see Benny Hill?). Anyways, we won't be returning here anytime soon.

reviews.name: Erin W.
reviews.review: Very, very nice location for dinner--celebrated a birthday here.  Make reservations in advance and let the reservation service know you are celebrating a special occasion.  The service was fantastic and to top it off, they delivered a cake at no cost.It was an exceptional evening.

reviews.name: Chain B.
reviews.review: I was very much hoping for and expecting a great meal.  I was very disappointed. Worst prime rib I have ever had.  Out of the group of 6, no one was happy with their meals. The service was mediocre at best.

reviews.name: Mr M.
reviews.review: I cannot emphasize this enough, this is a very over rated, overpriced place to eat, bone in steak was very average for $44.00!   Better steaks at Texas Road house for half the price, actually felt violated by the place.

reviews.name: Sarah W.
reviews.review: This is my best kept Nashville secret.  The prices are quite pricey (in the $30's) for small steaks and each side is ordered separately for around $10.  So dinner for two with salads, mains, and desserts easily reaches over $100 even without alcohol.  The service is bar none.  The waiter we had most recently was a gentleman named Paul, who was quite knowledgeable and gave well-informed suggestions with non-condescending tips on how one might most enjoy eating a new dish.  I also cannot recommend the server, Michael, enough.  Both are engaging and good-natured and pay attention to the smallest detail.  The support staff are on top of the mechanics of refills/clearing/etc in a pleasant, non-obtrusive manner.  Now to the food.  Excellent.  My filet mignon was medium rare to perfection.  I was not a great  fan of their OH sauce and ate in on its own, loving every tender bite.  The mushrooms and tomato salad were perfect as well.   The cheese cake for dessert was lovely though I would have preferred another topping other than blueberry.  The bread was perfunctory but not stellar. The ambiance cannot be topped.  The Hotel gives the sense that you are dining al fresco, but of course, it is the illusion of the grand glass ceilings.  You are spaced out amongst the restaurant to offer privacy and other nearby tables' conversations never interfered with ours.Now, onto my Best Kept Nashville Secret:Between the beautiful foyer of the hotel and the bar, The Library, is a charming paneled room decorated like a fine Victorian club.  There is a lovely fire place and large, inviting chairs, though they recently remodeled these and I miss the originals that had more ambiance.  If you sit there, the bar staff (Joey is very nice, in particular) will see to your needs and you can summon the fromager.  There is a cart laden with 20-30 international cheeses of all varieties.  For a quite reasonable price, you can order a tasting plate of your choice with little nibbles of other delectables that bring out the flavor of each.  My husband and I do this little ritual for almost every anniversary and birthday as we live quite near the Hotel.  We do a progressive dinner through the hotel.  We start with sushi in The Cascades, go on to the cheese and port here and then on to another hotel restaurant for our dessert.  The great thing about the hotel is you can take unfinished alcoholic beverages with you as you stroll leisurely through the gardens and water features to your next destination as it is all one indoor establishment. For the final secret, save yourself the $25 by valet parking your car and getting it validated at the restaurant.  There are two or  three other restaurants that validate, too.  Simply present your validation as you claim your car and make sure you tip!Now, as I am the only local regular, I hope I have not turned my little private slice of heaven into the next Patterson House where I will have to wait for two hours instead of gliding in to a spacious club where it seems I am the only member.

reviews.name: Lucinda D.
reviews.review: Expected so much more from this upscale restaurant-am sitting here one hour and thirty minutes from the time we sat down & still no entree.  They should have their act together better than this.  Allegedly a "squabble" in the kitchen.  Very disappointed!!!

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: The food is wonderful. For a resort, I would expect a more enthusiastic staff, especially at the bar which was slow.  Slow service.  I felt as though the bar staff was just visiting the planet.

reviews.name: Terry T.
reviews.review: I didn't eat here, just came in for a cocktail at the Library.  There is everything from traditional bar to cigar lounge feel to sitting outside with all of the beauty of the Gaylord gardens and waterfalls.  All of the plants, vegetation and flowers are real and feels like you are in some kind of Oasis.

reviews.name: Crissy H.
reviews.review: Everything here is great! I highly recommend starting off with the six cheese sampler platter. They have about 20 different kinds you can choose from. We decided to try a little bit of each, so we had a Gouda, Cheddar, Brie, Goat and two others that I cannot remember. Each one tasted better than the first. As far as a main meal, the filet mignon with blue cheese was extremely tender and buttery. The spinach, glazed carrots, and french fries were my top three picks for sides.Service was great. Everyone was very attentive. The best part was that you didn't even need to make a reservation, but then again it was a Tuesday night. On second thought, maybe you should make one, just in case.

reviews.name: Larry J.
reviews.review: This restaurant should  be shown with 4 dollar signs as its way overpriced.  I had the rib steak which turned out to be the worst steak I have ever been served.  It was so tough it dulled my knife.  Service did not match the prices either. The filet mignon was good.

reviews.name: Jeremy T.
reviews.review: Simply put, this place is too expensive for what it tries to be.The Grand Ole Opry complex is a casino-like compound with music, waterfalls, a small reproduction of the French Quarter in New Orleans, and overpriced restaurants. My guidebook recommended the Old Hickory for the best steak in Nashville. Fail.The service was INCREDIBLE! But the New York Strip was not what I would expect for $40. The steaks ranged from $38 to $50 if I remember correctly, and everything else was a la carte.The ambiance was interesting in the Las Vegas casino way, but it was very loud due to waterfalls and some sort of ambient music playing. It was very difficult to chat.The wine list was excellent for a restaurant in Tennessee.Next time I'll just go to some BBQ somewhere. It certainly wasn't worth $200.

reviews.name: Citizen J.
reviews.review: Steak was very good as was the wine we ordered.  It is not cheap, but then again neither are most good steakhouses these days.  Definitely the best restaurant in the complex as some of the others simply aren't worth the money.

reviews.name: Liz M.
reviews.review: I ate here for business and found myself not in the mood for a steal so had the grilled salmon served over potato purée and broccolini with basil oil. It was wonderful. The flavors all worked perfectly together and my salmon was cooked perfectly. I also tried the potato gratin with blue cheese, again, wonderful. Even those who were not blue cheese fans enjoyed it. The side of mushrooms was mediocre and the fried oysters Rockefeller were good not great. I had a chocolate dessert and I can't remember the name but it was fabulous.  The only downside to eating here are the prices and I'm afraid I am spoiled because my favorite restaurant at home is less expensive and better and it is a tough standard.

reviews.name: Jonathan M.
reviews.review: Medium rare filet with chardonnay sauce with a blue cheese topping! Excellent taste. My steak was cooked more medium well then medium rare. All the sides were prepared and tasted of good quality. Pricey but, worth the money.

reviews.name: Renee M.
reviews.review: Wonderful, wonderful food. Excellent service and amazing atmosphere.

reviews.name: Ben M.
reviews.review: The Old Hickory Steakhouse is deceivingly spacious and pricey, but this is mostly due to the fact that it's in the Gaylord Opryland, which is gargantuan itself, and because the restaurant caters to its captive visitors.We walked into the bar and lounge area, which was a little crowded but comfortable once we found seats. However, we had come for dinner, so it wasn't obvious where the hostess was. Eventually we found her at another entrance, but not before ordering drinks in the lounge. We would've been seated earlier had the hostess asked us how many were in our party instead of just assuming there were only two of us. Frustrating, but what are you gonna do?With drinks in hand, we sat down at our table. That night, we were feeling a little obnoxious for some reason, but that didn't seem to bother our servers and the manager, who all seemed to take it in stride. I mean, if you're spending all of this money, you can take a little abuse, right?With respect to the reviewer who thought the dinner took too long, it's a restaurant that serves starters, cheese plates, steak a la carte with family-style sides, and dessert. The experience is not meant to be quick; it's meant to be enjoyed at a measured pace.All of the food was excellent; the cheeses the fromager selected on our behalf were fresh and rich, the New York Strip was cooked perfectly medium rare, and the "signature" popcorn ice cream was a nice touch at the end. The wine selection was decent, though the first couple of bottles we selected were unavailable. Most of the bottles were overpriced if you purchased them outside the restaurant.What I liked the most was actually the storytelling behind the food. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu, and would explain the options with charm and enthusiasm. When I asked about the popcorn ice cream, he told the story of how it came to be, a 5-minute novelette recited. It was actually nice.Overall a great experience, but three stars still because of price and navigability.

reviews.name: Dan M.
reviews.review: Horrible steak-Look,I love a good filet-the one they brought me was horrible-and they only have an 8oz-They charge you 40 dollars for this small steak-I would much prefer to pay 80 and get a 12 oz and have it prepared properly.The staff is great-the steak is horrible...

reviews.name: Bill M.
reviews.review: I rarely take to the internet to voice dissatisfaction with a restaurant, but I must. While, for someone who has not experienced many steakhouses, this restaurant may seem impressive, for someone who loves great steakhouses, this was a very disappointing experience. First, the steakhouse insists upon itself. Their menu brags of a sustainable menu and hand-selected producers of beef... okay, but who is doing the selecting? They brag of an extensive cheese menu... that isn't very extensive... and their wine menu is both overpriced and under assorted. Now, before you dismiss this review as that of a snob, let me assure you that I simply make these points to emphasize how much this "signature" steakhouse insists upon itself, only to be quite unimpressive. The service was adequate, and the server seemed interested in accommodating our requests; however it took a very long time to get drink refills - when I am paying $24 for a GLASS of wine, excuse me if I would like it to be prompt.  Both my wife and I were impressed with our first course, she had their Ceasar salad and I had the Lobster Bisque soup - which I confess was very good. Our steaks and sides were another story. My wife ordered the filet and I ordered the NY strip - I am being God's honest truthful when I say that we have had better-prepared steaks at a Texas Roadhouse. Just awful. My medium-rare was more like a dried-out medium-well and her filet was so crusted with salt that she actually had to cut off the top of the filet just to eat the rest. Unfortunately, because we had tickets to the Opry, we didn't have time to send either meal back. Their cabernet reduction sauce was a waste of money, even at just $3 extra. It's bland flavor wasn't even sufficient to make my beef-jerky steak tolerable. I cancelled a reservation at Fleming's Steakhouse to eat closer to the Opry on the night of the show - HUGE mistake. We were both so solidly disappointed that as we were walking away from Old Hickory, my wife said that we might as well have eaten at the mall food court next to the Opry and saved our money to prepare a steak dinner at home.   $208 that I will never see again - don't make my mistake. Make a reservation elsewhere and enjoy a better meal... I recommend Fleming's or Morton's in Nashville.  Then again, if you like the way that a Ryan's steakhouse cooks their food, and you simply want to pay 10x more than you would at a Ryan's, Old Hickory is the place for you.

reviews.name: Gregory B.
reviews.review: Pricey but well worth it based on the ambiance, quality of the food, great wine list and exemplary service. Dined for our 36th anniversary and we both had the 8oz Fillet which was exceptional along with a good bottle of Duckhorn Decoy. Service was exceptional from Steven and also included a special anniversary cake which was a pleasant surprise considering we we a walk up with no reservation at 9:15.

reviews.name: Kurt K.
reviews.review: first of all, you have to go here planning a "destination" dinner of 2 hrs or so. ambience great--eating "outdoors" in middle of january when it is 20 deg outside. service on the slow side but all that served us were very knowledgable and helpful. food presentation was awesome. lobster bisque to die for. cheese lady with cart had maybe 15 cheeses and i picked 3 with wines she matched and it was awesome. steaks themselves cooked well and were good, but i can do a little better at home with prime steaks and big green egg. if you're going here just for the steak, go to Morton's or Southern's Steak and Oyster. if you're in for a 2 hr experience this is the place to go. recommend getting there 45 min early and sitting/drinking in the Library where service is impeccable and wine list is large but expensive. expect to drop $200-$300 for two people including alcohol.

reviews.name: Christie R.
reviews.review: I agree with Jeremy T., it is way over-priced-you are paying for the convenience.  The service was excellent, the food was quite good and the ambiance was pretty unbeatable.  I had scallops and my husband had a steak-both were cooked perfectly.  We split a dessert which was really tasty, but our final bill for two iced teas, one split appetizer, two entrees and a dessert was over $100.  My conclusion, it the prices were about 25% less, I could give them five stars!

reviews.name: Cerene P.
reviews.review: There are many fantastic steakhouse's in Chicago. I thought that since we were down south, maybe just maybe the food would measure up. NOT SO!!!!!  We had a group of 8,with a reservation. From what I could see the place was half empty, so i'm not sure why we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated, minus 1 star. The menu wasn't that expansive, the choices were primarily various steaks, with one choice of fish and one of chicken. All the food is ala carte. So if you only ordered steak, that is all you ate. I had grilled Salmon, which was the best i've ever had, however $43 for Salmon just isn't right :(  minus 1 star. It was good but for that price, i would expect to have the whole fish and not just a regular piece. For sides the table ordered, Blue Cheese Mashed potatoes, some weird but cheesy mac n cheese, grilled asparagus, and green beans. The sides were good, but extremely over priced. Some folks ordered salad, I'm sooooo glad i didn't go that route. The salad consisted of huge chunks of lettuce was barely no dressing. I mean no cheese, carrorts, tomato, cucumber...nothing but lettuce. Are you serious! I would have been hot, if that was my food!!! Just sayin... Now for the other missing stars. When it came time for the bill, we were pleased that they took the time to give us all separate checks, not bad right. Some paid cash others paid with a credit card. Whatever the case, we sat there until everyone's transaction was completed. We left the establishment and continued with our evening. Well, when we finally got back to our rooms, we had a message waiting from the restaurant, that someone didn't pay!!!! Seriously, they accused us of skipping out on one of the bills!!! We were hot!!! The restaurant left numerous messages and when we tried to go down and straighten things out they were closed. The entire group became very offended because we all witnessed everyone pay whatever their bill was. I think the waiter pocketed some of our money and tried to pull a fast one. He thought wrong, In the end everything was settled, but I have never experienced anything like this and will not support this establishment ever again!!!

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: Great steak. Service was out of this world. Sides were decent. The company...outstanding.

reviews.name: Dan K.
reviews.review: Great steaks and the salad was awesome.  My wife had the garden salad three times while we were staying at Opryland.  The chef, Seth, is very friendly and told us some of his cooking secrets about what we ate.  This place is expensive, but worth it.

reviews.name: Nancy P.
reviews.review: featuring steaks,  a maitre fromager, & hand-made, small batch artisinal cheeses....surrounded by lush greenery, this restaurant is the height of epicurian delights for steak lovers. walking through the mansion with a dim-lit bar and cozy nooks with plush seating, to the patio-type setting where we enjoyed a leisurely dinner with a very attentive staff.we split their big, 16 oz. aged, melt-in-your mouth NY strip steak and had the old hickory salad (excellent!) with crumbled smokey bacon & aged cheese, with italian sparkling water to drink. our waiter was Amir, originally from Egypt - he let me take his photo & asked me please to post it, for this review. i did...mais oui! make reservations for this one...it's very busy!

reviews.name: Bob G.
reviews.review: First let me say that the setting is relaxing and beautiful, and the service was personal and unobtrusive. Both the Cesar and the Goat Cheese / Beet Salads were outstanding. However, the NY Steaks, were mediocre. They were tough and dry; clearly NOT Prime Steaks (as one would expect at their $44.00 ala carte price). I've dined at numerous steak houses in the US, and I can say that the steaks at Palm, Capital Grille, and even Michael Jordan's in NYC were FAR better. This place should be ashamed to charge $44.00 for a tough dry steak. The previous night, I was angry about having to pay $4.50 for a slice of pizza at the Opryland Hotel's Pizza restaurant. However, that slice of pizza was top quality. The steak here wasn't. However, I have to say that nowhere on the menu does it say that the steaks that they serve are Prime.

reviews.name: Alex G.
reviews.review: I'm somewhat torn in this review: great service, classic ambiance, delicious wines, and solid (but not amazing) food.  The prices are high; come here on an expense account if you can.  We started with a glass of wine in the comfortable lounge area- over sized chairs perfect for conversation.  Our table was seated "outside," with soft "candlelight.". For appetizers, we started with an above average escargot; hot and tender but not as rich or garlicky as I'd have liked.  The seafood platter wasn't a chilled one as I normally order, but a hot one.  The lobster tail was tender and flavorful, but a step below the quality of a top, independent steakhouse.  The crab cakes were small but delicious, jam packed with real crab meat. The shrimp cocktail was pedestrian, and the shrimp small; if the shrimp don't require a leash, I'm not interested.  For main courses, the filet mignon was the clear winner; tender, well seasoned and perfectly cooked.  I was talked into the ribeye special, which was a minor mistake.  The flavors didn't meld well (wine reduction and coffee grinds?) and it didn't add anything to the underwhelming meat quality.  Too fatty, and just not my thing.  The Mac and cheese side dish was fantastic, and my calorie count exploded; but it was perfectly prepared and I'll give credit when due.  Broccolini was a small portion and uninspiring.  The wine list was top notch, and the Bordeaux style blend we had was outstanding.  Overall, I have mixed feelings. I would definitely return on someone else's dime, although I'll stick with a simple steak.  For the wine and service, thumbs up.  For the food prices, I'm not so sure.

reviews.name: Manny K.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying the service was excellent!  As a steak house it was average both in terms of prices and quality.  The group I was dining with started with a selection of cheeses which were enjoyable and presented by a knowledgable fromage sommelier.  While it was nice to try boutique cheeses from around the world I would not do it again as it did not add to the meal.   I started with the Caesar salad which I found adequate, lacking a bit in the dressing but I did like the fact the I was able to enjoy the salad with white anchovies.  The filet mignon was cooked a perfect medium rare topped with crab oscar.  The filet was very tender and just the right size.  The sides of mac and cheese, potatoes au gratin, and cream spinach were very average,  specifically the mac and cheese as it was very bland.  For desert I tried their bananas foster which I did enjoy - this is the first time I tried this desert so I can't comment on the quality as I have nothing else to compare it to.  The wine list is very good offering something for everyone.My overall rating is a four and not a three because of the service.  As a steakhouse it is average but the service is top notch and helps to elevate the overall dining experience.

reviews.name: Linda B.
reviews.review: We were very disappointed in the food here for the price.  The hotel was awesome, and we were very happy with Opryland Hotel, however the steaks were not what we expected, it took a VERY long time for a disappointing meal.  I would recommend going out of the hotel if you want a great steak.

reviews.name: Erin O.
reviews.review: Our longest dinner ever!  We were there for nearly 2 hours.  Way too long.  We were seated promptly at the time of our reservation.  Service was pleasant, but slowww.  The food was good, but not worth the $100+ per person.  We dressed for dinner per the Business Casual dress code of Old Hickory Steakhouse, so it was a little off-putting to see a couple of diners underdressed in jeans.We expected more from this pricey restaurant and much preferred the Cascades Seafood restaurant at Gaylord Opryland.(We visited in December 2007.)**Did not do several courses; service was unusually slow for what we ordered.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: I give four stars because our family has had good to great experiences since we've started going on a regular basis. We've typically enjoyed the food, especially breakfast. One thing that Vittles could work on to make me happier- consistency. Every now and again I can't help but feel that things are loose in the back. The servers are constantly turning over (which feels weird for this type of restaurant) and the food has on occasion fallen short...not terrible, just inconsistent.I recommend this place to friends, but with a little caveat...

reviews.name: Marie L.
reviews.review: My sis and I stopped in around lunch time on a weekday.  The service was friendly and the food was decent.  It definitely did not live up to the hype; my Aunt says it's one of her favorite places in Nashville.  There are much better places in Nashville, in my opinion.We tried the fried chicken.  It was pretty good but the sides were blah.  You can also find much better fried chicken in Nashville.The place itself could use some updating, but I care more about food and service than ambiance.  Service was good; food was average.I have been told my numerous people that if liver is your thing, this is one of the best places in Nashville for liver.  I can't really comment as I don't care for liver.

reviews.name: Marc A.
reviews.review: Around the table we had: Waffle breakfast for our two Littles, biscuits and gravy, smokey mountain eggs, and chicken and waffles. We all enjoyed the entire meal.  Although I prefer crispy waffles, the rest of the fam doesn't. The chicken was moist, the biscuits just right, and the hash brown casserole was really good. All at a very affordable price.  My college son said he would be back.

reviews.name: Brittany F.
reviews.review: My husband and I were near this location and were in a hurry! We had not left enough time with traffic and eating to get to the event we were heading to in time. We walked into Vittles and asked about how long it takes to get food, one of the employees told us it takes maybe 5-10 minutes so we decided to risk it. The decor is definitely lacking, I know its in a strip center but it feels pretty dingy inside. I was a little hesitant to stay when we walked in, it was only because the girls working were so friendly! We sat down and immediately picked out our dinner and the server was very attentive to make sure we kept our time there as short as possible. It only took about 10 minutes to get our food and it was alright. We decided to share chicken fried chicken with a side of mashed potatoes, lima beans and green beans. The green beans and lima beans were nothing spectacular, the type of beans you would expect out of a can. The mashed potatoes were a bit cold and the chicken fried chicken was really salty. We ate it and the server brought us our bill quickly and we were out of there in a timely manner! They were really great to accommodate our time constraint and the girls working were very friendly, the food just wasn't very outstanding.

reviews.name: Anita P.
reviews.review: Some what tasty. Food lacks seasoning.  Had the pork chop.  Well fried.  If your in Donelson and want home cooking  stop here but bring salt, pepper and butter

reviews.name: Ronette T.
reviews.review: This was a horrid dining experience the mac & cheese was soup like my friends pork chop wasn't cooked all the way I had my check on my table before I was asked how my food was. I guess we didn't qualify for dessert.....lol..... I WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT. First impression is the lasting impression!!! The "fried corn" is just canned cream corn & the table behind me had to find their own server after being here 15 mins just to get drinks. Smh....the server just grabbed food from one plate with her hand & put it on another & served it. YUCK YUCK YUCK

reviews.name: Bart A.
reviews.review: I give this  4 stars cause it is exactly what it is supposed to be:  no frills, basic good southern style food.  I was there peak of lunch hour.  They were busy, but I was quickly seated and served.  Service was very fast, and friendly.  Tried my basic gauge for this kind of place:  meatloaf, mashed potatoes, and green beans, with a cornbread muffin.  It was good, nice portions.  The dish could have used some gravy, but it was ok without it.  I'll return, try breakfast.

reviews.name: Joseph M.
reviews.review: I would give less than one star if possible. I ordered food. The waitress felt the need to the waitress that took my order that this was her table. This set the tone. The check was delivered before the water. That made no sense to me. The hashbrowns were cold in the middle and room temperature on the outside. The eggs were cooked but were cold as well. The bacon, toast and water were fine. The waitress asked before I took a bite if I needed anything else. I never saw her again. She was suppose to check me out. So I finally went to the front of the store and had to wait for the waitress to check me out. I literally took 2 bites of hash browns and three bites of eggs. I hate half a slice of toast and half a strip of bacon. She never asked if something was wrong with the food. Never returned to refill the water.The waitress was very friendly with other patrons. They seemed to know her or were regulars. I don't get it how people are ranking them high. My guess is that they had a different cook.  I saw nothing redeeming about this restaurant for me. But again, they were friendly to others perhaps I need to know them to be treated with any type of respect. Good luck if you go.

reviews.name: Rachel H.
reviews.review: This was The Dinner Bell when I was a girl, my grandparents took me here often and it is a very fond memory. After they passed, and although the restaurant changed names and owners, my friends and family stuck with it. The food and service had always been fine and I enjoyed the nostalgia.  We were regulars, sometimes three or four times a week!Sadly, my friends and family will no longer be going to this location for our meals. On several occasions I have been witness to overhearing a great deal of yelling and cursing coming from the back of the establishment, and have noticed a GREAT deal of turnover. I started to pay closer attention because I know that a lot of turnover in an establishment is usually a bad sign, and I was curious about all the yelling. On some visits I noticed the usually peppy, friendly server girls looking very nervous and not acting their selves. I then took it upon myself to ask a few of the past employees, who I had gotten to know over the time they worked there and I saw out other places, as to why this is such. I was shocked beyond belief to learn that they are very poorly treated by their boss, and even more horrifying, some of the kitchen staff are made to cross-contaminate the kitchen, and even the food, when sanitary items, like gloves, are senselessly not ordered by the owners. I know from working in restaurants many years myself how important it is for good sanitary precautions to be in place. It's a very big "no no" to cross-contaminate a kitchen, whether you are a business or just in your home. I have children, I wouldn't chop up meat and then put a plate or bowl that I am about to serve to them on that same spot without thoroughly washing that spot first. But, that is exactly what some of the staff are instructed to do at Vittles! The past employees also complained that they were possibly stolen from because their paychecks never came out right. My fellow man and Nashvillans are being mistreated, stolen from, and potentially poisoned. From the outside, Vittles of Donelson looks like a loving, family oriented business, but I assure you, they are not. This review hurts my heart. I held Vittles very close to it as a continuance of my memories of people I loved very much. However, I can no longer risk my families health for mere memories, and I can no longer support such an establishment.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: The food was delicious, the staff was nice as could be and the prices for the portions were unbeatable. I most definitely recommend this place if you like good old country southern cooking!

reviews.name: Ridge D.
reviews.review: Not good food, but good service. Honestly, I do not get this place. They are all about "serving my ma's the best cookin..." bla bla bla but their food is not made from scratch and it is not good in the conventional way. I am not going to come back. What saved them from a one star is that the service is excellent! Super nice and helpful staff.

reviews.name: Jason R.
reviews.review: I'm a huge fan of this place. The food is great, and they give a lot of it! The prices are very competitive, so with a large family it is very helpful. The only suggestions I would like to see happen is better table and chairs, they are old and often sticky. I would also like to see them upgrade their coffee ;-)

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: I had a great time here. I had the country fried steak and free waffles! My service was quick and the wait staff were exceptional. The food was ok. I've had better but it's a nice place to grab a quick breakfast.

reviews.name: Jeffrey B.
reviews.review: Good Southern cooking.  Sit and be sever style.   The only menu item not to my liking are the greens.  A bit too much vinegar.   Props to the fried chicken and chicken fried steak in white gravy

reviews.name: Hamilton M.
reviews.review: The service was quick. The food was fresh and delicious. I had the Mountain Eggs. The portion size was large and a great value. The coffee is really good too. I'm so pleased to have a great breakfast place in the area!

reviews.name: Kellie S.
reviews.review: We were very disappointed when we arrived that they only serve breakfast until 10:30 on Sunday. We arrived at 10:35. Staff was awesome. Everyone very friendly. Club sandwich was good. Made on sour dough bread. Fries good too. Hubby had country fried steak. Said it was a bit bland.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: This was simply THE best catfish I have ever eaten. My wife had the chicken & dumpings. She said the dumplings were chewy, but the chicken was plentiful, and tasty.

reviews.name: Deborah G.
reviews.review: Huddled into the shoulder of the Crossings shopping center at Lebanon Pike off Briley Parkway. It's as close to a family diner as you'll find in this area of Donelson: a little homey, a little folksy. The wait staff are friendly, the food is "home cookin' style," and they are now open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, although the morning hours are a late start for any real breakfast on the weekdays. Soon, according to one of the check out staff, they'll be open at 7 a.m. on the weekends for breakfast. We had dinner: salmon croquettes, mac-n-cheese, and fried okra for me. My partner had the chicken fried steak, ambrosia and mashed potatoes. All dishes were classically prepared and pleasant. No ball-out-of-the-parks, but filing. The owner makes the cornbread muffins herself. We will go back, especially to try breakfast.

reviews.name: Robin D.
reviews.review: Blah, boring, lacking in flavor. Always trying to find a locally-owned brunch/breakfast place near home so we tried it. Unfortunately, we sleep late on weekends and didn't arrive until 11. Alas, breakfast service ended at 10:30. We stayed anyway and opted for lunch. We weren't told the specials, like the people that came in after us - maybe that would have been good. So disappointed in the canned veggies and general lack of creativity. "Down Home cooking" is a big stretch. Friendly people and good tea. But that's all I've got.

reviews.name: Dawn S.
reviews.review: Great catfish!  Better service would make you a 5 star.

reviews.name: joan d.
reviews.review: This place has just what I needed for breakfast this morning - turkey and dressing with cornbread! Delicious, and served by an excellent waitress in no time at all! We will definitely be back - Vittles is a great neighborhood find.

reviews.name: Carie S.
reviews.review: I love comfort food and after trying Vittles in Donelson twice, I can say this is my "go to" spot now when I am missing grandmas cooking. If you want stick to your ribs southern food, this will be your place!

reviews.name: Jennifer M.
reviews.review: My mother and I had breakfast at Vittles yesterday. The atmosphere is exactly what you would expect at any meat and three-type establishment. The menu has ample options, which are well-priced, I might add. The food was good, and the service was amazing-you would be hard-pressed to find a group of friendlier waitresses anywhere. So, what's the problem? Apparently, a lack of small kitchen appliances. Specifically, according to our waitress, the place only has one waffle iron and it only makes one waffle at a time. You can see how this creates a problem at a bustling breakfast place that has both a Big Waffle Breakfast and Chicken and Waffles on the menu. Yes----it takes a lifetime to get your food if you make the mistake of ordering any dish that involves waffles. Of course, both of us happened to order waffles, so the wait was doubly bad. And, with only one waffle iron, no two waffles can come out at once, so you can forget getting served at the same time as your dining companion. I will probably check out Vittles for lunch, but count me out for breakfast!

reviews.name: James S.
reviews.review: Vittles of Donelson is utterly unremarkable.  It's a mile from my home and I've eaten there three times during the 2 years I've lived here.  This place is trading on the sentiment and charm of "home cooking" and "southern comfort meat and three" but they in no way do justice to that culinary tradition.  Generic corporate giants like Shoney's and Perkins are better, Cracker Barrel blows this place away.  I'd love to support a local business but the food is no better than the Kroger or Publix deli.  They do no more than the bare minimum in terms of ingredients, flavor, and preparation.  Service was honestly limited to the minimum required to get paid.  No drink refills, no "how is everything", nothing but what seemed to be a deliberate avoidance of eye contact with us. It reminds me of those dives off the interstate in the middle of nowhere that know most of their customers are travelling and not coming back anyway so don't even try.  We gave this place a good faith opportunity to win our continued business and are giving up on it as a waste of time and money.

reviews.name: Rick B.
reviews.review: Great meat&3! I have had the country fried steak, and the fried pork chops. My wife has had the catfish and the meat loaf. We both thought everything was very tasty and well seasoned. The green beans are THE best I ever ate. Great addition to Donelson dining!

reviews.name: Courtney M.
reviews.review: We just had the BEST meal/layover experience with Amy at the Tennessee Tavern at the Nashville International Airport. Prompt service, a friendly smile, and a truly warm welcome to Nashville. We appreciated it all - especially while visiting during our travels home from vacation. Thanks Amy!We'll be sure to swing by again next time we are at BNA!!!Also -- the Mac and Cheese bites with BBQ Sauce are something I dream about... Can't wait to snag some again in the future!

reviews.name: Chuck P.
reviews.review: The gas station sushi of airport BBQ.Where do I start?  This culinary Mecca features days old stale burger buns, chisel-off-the-bone-with-a-jackhammer ribs, and mushy fries.Do yourself a favor and try one of the other available choices.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: I ALMOST ordered the wings, but fortunately the guy sitting next to me already had his and they looked HORRIFIC! They were soggy, scorched, sad little things and he wasn't impressed either. He ate two or three and left the rest behind. I DID order the smoked turkey sandwich and french fries. They were both excellent! Like, really, good. Yumm!The vodka drinks were stiff and the service was fast and friendly. Not a bad place at all... especially for an airport. Had I ordered the wings, this would be an entirely different review.

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: The food is pretty good. But I felt "a little taken advantage of " when I got the bill, $8.99 for a tap beer!  Crazy! There was a reason they didnt put the prices in the menu.

reviews.name: Brittany M.
reviews.review: Quick, friendly service and decent enough, only sliiightly overprice airport food. I ordered a burger with swiss and mushrooms and fries and an extra side of mushrooms with a diet coke. Simple enough. Everything was realllly good, down to the bun, minus the burger which was definitely a little fatty and gristly, and the mushrooms which were very very thin.Tables were extremely tiny like in most airport restaurants, but it seemed to make the servers even more attentive. The guy next to me was downing beers with shots and the waitress was quick to get him more alcohol and go along with his way-too-talkative-to-strangers-shtick.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: This was quite possibly the worst service my husband and I have ever had in a restaurant. We honestly were not expecting much, and the place was very busy when we got there, plus we had about 1 hr and 15 minutes to give, so we were in no rush.We first arrived at 5:30, and got the last open table. We sat down and were quickly greeted to get our drink orders. We asked for a beer each and a water. The waitress seemed eager to get them to us, and she placed the order and asked to see our IDs on her return. We got them out and had everything ready. 15 minutes later we got our beers, but no water. She took our order. We asked for the burgers to be medium cooked, and she said company policy requires them to be well done. We figured we had to do it because we were already there, so whatever. She then made sure we had "10 minutes or so" to spare for our burgers to be cooked. It was 5:50 at that time and our flight boarded at 7 so we figured sure. She then assured us our water was on its way.The water never came. We finally started nursing our beers to save them for dinner, assuming we would never get the waters. The place was beginning to clear out, so we figured we would be getting our food any time. 6:15 rolls around and we still have no food, and 2 tables beside us have sat down, ordered, paid, and left since we've placed our order. The waitress was at the register, so my husband went to ask her about our food. She said we were the next ticket. Ok cool. But now we were pressed for time, as we still had to get to the other concourse.At about 6:22 the manager comes out to speak with us and gave us a lot of attitude. She said, "you know you have to be patient, these burgers are made to order, and your ticket time was 6:13." Number 1, the burgers are not made to order, they are made well-done because they are frozen. Second, we placed our order at 5:50, not 6:13, so our waitress forgot about us and placed the order when my husband approached her. BULLSHIT. We were now nearly about to miss our flight, and we still had to pickup food. My husband said if he didn't see someone or our food by 6:30 we were leaving. No waitress in the restaurant to be seen, and no food at 6:30, so we got up and left, without paying for our half finished beer. About 10 seconds later and we are being chased down the concourse by our waitress, suddenly visible to her. She exclaimed, "it's not my fault" and told us we were going to be made to pay for our beers. My husband went while I went to Wendy's. Miraculously the burgers were done and given to us "free of charge", but I had already ordered Wendy's. So now we had 4 burger meals and we were out $40. Then we ran to our gate, ate burgers on the floor, and nearly missed the plane.If you have a flight to catch, a place to be, or any respect for yourself, this is not the airport restaurant for you. I would rather go hungry.

reviews.name: Allison R.
reviews.review: BNA didn't seem to have an abundance of sit down eateries, at least not in the terminal I was in. Tennessee Tavern was then calling my name, bbq and drinks? Sure thing. I ordered a special drink made with cider and fireball, but they were out of fireball, I asked for another special and they were out of the bourbon that was used in it. Ended up with a Jack and Diet. They serve Neely's BBQ (despite the closure of their Memphis locations). The food was typical chain BBQ (think Sonny's or Dickey's quality). My brisket was moist enough and had enough sauce. The coleslaw was under seasoned, and the beans were slightly sweeter than I like.

reviews.name: William L.
reviews.review: Had the half rack of ribs with Mac and cheese, fries and onion rings.  Not much flavor in the ribs where there was no sauce. Not bad just not special. I suggest asking for extra sauce.  But value was good. Service was attentive.  I'd try something else next time I'm there to see if it will be better.

reviews.name: Justin M.
reviews.review: If you are in the Nashville airport this is the place to go grab some food and bevvies. Your other options are the touristy spots of Tootsies and Gibson or the food court. The food here is Neely's BBQ which is pretty tasty especially for airport food. The portions sizes don't suck either. You do still have to deal with airport prices though.The beverage selection is very diverse for an airport. A couple craft beers of which include one from Nashville local, Fat Bottom, are on tap. There are also outlets under the bar so you can charge your mobile device, be sure you turn it off for take-off and landing though...

reviews.name: Allie A.
reviews.review: So, you are early for your flight, through security and have some time on your hands. What do you do? Have a drink of course. It was probably about 11:30 am, so a Bloody Mary was calling my name. They had a specialty on the menu, but were out of the specific vodka, so I just ordered one with Grey Goose and asked for it spicy. It was pretty good! I decided to stay, knock out some work tasks, and have a bite as well. I went for the pulled pork sandwich and fries. Sandwich.... eh, something special. Meat was smoky and decent, but not moist enough and definitely not enough BBQ sauce. Fries were nice, hot and crispy though, and hit the spot. I managed to snag the booth with outlets underneath before it got really packed in here. Service was pleasant and prompt. So, overall A-OK for a airport dining experience, and I think that really says a lot. Funny side note: It seemed like everyone on the plane had a hankering for BBQ, because upon boarding, you were hit in the face by a wall of BBQ essence.... (that would have made me reaaallllly hungry, except I had just eaten. Would totally stop in again for a drink and maybe a side of fries.

reviews.name: Jimmy B.
reviews.review: I never post anything on a website like this, this is my first. However I do use tis site a lot when traveling and check reviews. That being said, This place has absolutely the worst service I have had in a long time. I arrived and there was only 1 other person in the restaurant. Waited forever for the waitress. Waited for the food,  sit waving my glass for 15 min before finally asking a different server for a refill. Then waited forever for a ticket. I had 3 hrs to waste before the flight and barely made it. I hate to base a opinion of a restaurant on 1 employee but everyone seemed to be having the same issue and it is a management problem when the employees just sit around yuking it up and act like nobody's in the place.   Can not recommend and will never be back.

reviews.name: Aaron A.
reviews.review: Who the hell serves dry ribs with sauce on top?  By far the most disgusting thing I've ever tried to choke down. The rub was thick and seemed as if it had been in a steamer for hours. The sauce contradicted the rub. Kraft has more flavor in their mac. The coleslaw was soggy. I love Nashville but this toilet left me with a very, very bad taste in my mouth.

reviews.name: Joshua Y.
reviews.review: Bad service. Not attentive (it was not busy when I was being served). Went to the bar for more consistent service, it was ok... However, I got a dirty martini, the vermouth was poured directly into the shaker, martini was terrible, and $15... I drank it fast anyway, because I hate flying sober.

reviews.name: Jim D.
reviews.review: The service was great and the food was fine.  It seems like some folks had bad experiences, but I'm fortunately not one of them.  I had the pulled pork sandwich and the onion rings.  Have I had better pork?  Sure.  But it wasn't terrible.  The flavor was mild and smokey.  I like a bit more of a vinegar touch, but this wasn't NC style.  The onion rings were large and tender.  By the way, it's attached to Neely's, so it's probably the same food with seating area.

reviews.name: Dave P.
reviews.review: I like the potato skins appetizer and salmon with veggies and salad entry. Very tasty and service was relatively quick.  The red wine (Malbec) was very tasty.  I highly suggest trying it if you get the opportunity.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: For an airport restaurant, this place surprisingly isn't bad at all. I ordered the ribs, and you get about 8 of them. You could definitely tell they were pork ribs because they were so short. The meat was extremely tender, and the sauce had good flavor. The ribs were also served with a couple of moist wet wipes, which is better than many non-airport restaurants.The ribs come with fries (not bad), and I ordered a side of cole slaw. The cole slaw wasn't bad either. I think my bill was about $15, which is pretty much on par with places outside of the airport. The attentive service helps as well. I will probably be back given I visit Nashville pretty often!

reviews.name: Kellie B.
reviews.review: Rude bartender. When I say thank you, you're supposed to say "you're welcome"...or something. Sorry to have disturbed him!

reviews.name: Gary S.
reviews.review: This place sucks, even by airport standards. The menu is very small with about two salads, two soups, a couple sandwiches, and some ribs. I had the southwest salad and it came with a distinct lack of flavor and some nice brown lettuce. The service was slow but friendly. The beer was delicious, but for $8 a pint it damn well better be. It cost nearly $30 for a salad, a beer, and tip. Are you kidding me? I will not be back.

reviews.name: Tony D.
reviews.review: Pretty good food for an airport. If you have the time while in this airport you should eat here. Just keep in mind it is an airport. I got the rib basket with fries. Good but not great. Good selection of beer on draft at a reasonable price.

reviews.name: Clara L.
reviews.review: Delicious option in the airport!  I ordered a Neely's BBQ pork sandwich with beer battered onion rings.  The service was attentive and the food delicious.  Don't succumb to the other places in the terminal.

reviews.name: Julie S.
reviews.review: The smoked chicken wings are a must! Top 5 in wings I've ever had & I try a whole lot because it's my husband's favorite thing.

reviews.name: Derek R.
reviews.review: Pulled pork sandwich, baked beans even the slaw was better than expected. Service gets 5 stars too. Almost missed my flight because I didn't feel like I was at the airport

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: For being an in-airport, overpriced bar "restaurant" they did pretty well.  The staff was very friendly and the food was better than going the fast-food route.  Sitting space was a bit crammed but if you're stuck in BNA on delay then it's one of few decent places to hang out.

reviews.name: Eddie M.
reviews.review: This place is also Neeley's BBQ I really expected more. I had the Ribs with 3 sides. The best part was the cole slaw.  The Baby back ribs were dried out. It was like eating jerky. Very disappointing and would not recommend it to anyone. The fries were ok and the baked beans were mush. You would think that if Restaurant calls them self famous, it would be good, right? It's not and it did not seem they cared. Save your money, you would be better off at McDonalds

reviews.name: Tom B.
reviews.review: Had lunch here on a Wednesday. Got the Neely's BBQ. I can't claim to be an expert on southern BBQ but I certainly liked what I had. The amount of sauce that came with it seemed a little shy so I asked for some extra on the side. Well worth it.  Sweet and tangy and there was none left when I finished. Fries were basic--no complaints. Service was great. Would take the hike down to this concourse to eat here again even if I wasn't flying Delta.
